name: Golf Nut Original
description:
A fun take on the classic game of golf cards. Golf Nut crazy pokes fun at the cast of characters at your local golf course. You don't need to love golf to play, just a sense of humor and a bit of a competitive streak!

Like golf, the payer with the lowest score wins! With nine holes to play, you'll need your wits about you as you battle your opponents. Just watch out for the wild characters that can really throw a wrench in your score.

How to play:

You get one character card and four playing cards for each of the 9 "holes" aka rounds
- Draw a card - keep it or swap it
Reveal one of your four cards
The hole ends when all players reveal their four cards
The lowest score after nine holes wins!


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: StoneFire: Dodo Bird Promo Card
description:
Promo card for StoneFire that came in the game box for Iron Helm, from the same publisher. It is also available in a promo pack called the Gnome Pack #1, from Grey Gnome Games on the Game Crafter.

Card name: DODO BIRD
Card text: "If the Dodo Bird is in your village at the end the of game [sic!], you gain 1vp for every 2 egg cards remaining in the egg deck."
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Fribourg / Freiburg
description:
Monopoly, the world famous land and real estate game, takes you through the beautiful old town of Fribourg. Listening to the two native languages, lingering comfortably in a medieval city or enjoying one of the most beautiful views into the distance from the 74 meter high cathedral tower - this can only be done in Fribourg. But go on a journey of discovery yourself.

You dreamed of owning the Saint-Nicolas cathedral, building a hotel in Courtepin or buying the Dent-de-Broc? Players can buy the St. Nicholas Cathedral, the Poya Bridge or Lake Murten.

Only 3500 editions made and it is in French and German.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Unique Gaming Partners, Winning Moves Germany

name: A.E.G.I.S. Combining Robots: Season 2
description:
Fully funded on Kickstarter, BackerKit Pre-Orders open now!
Return to the wild world of combining robots in AEGIS: Second Ignition (aka Season 2, or just AEGIS2)!
The accessible, content-packed tactics game returns with an all-new box of robots and heroes vying for control of Sigaea in all-out robot fighting tournament!
Choose a Commander, take their team of five robots into combat, and combine them into more powerful forms to defeat your opponents. Choose from dozens of robots across five classes - Assault, Evasive, Guard, Intel, and Support - AEGIS! - and duke it out up to six players! Games take about 15 minutes per player.

This all-new box features:

Dozens of new robots, streamlined for easier learning and more tactical depth!
A roster of new Commanders and prebuilt teams, featuring new luck-mitigating mechanics!
New game mode - Starpoint Arena! Play with respawning robots and rack up points!
SOLO MODE! Face off against powerful boss robots and their customizable armies.
2-Player Draft Rules! Crack the box and have a semi-randomized team in no time!
Three boards with printed terrain! Choose a 2 or 4-player battlefield and jump in with no board setup!
COMBINE BOTH BOXES! This game's contents are 100% cross-compatible with the first AEGIS game.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Variable Player Powers

name: BoxBox Racing Game
description:
Welcome to Paddock! BoxBox it´s a game that allows you to vividly feel the experience of managing a Formula 1 Squad!

Prepare your Formula 1 to race in a variety of tracks and weathers, push your luck by picking up random cards that will set the pace of the race and recharge your tire stack by defeating opponents in duels.
You´ll be in charge of two cars in your squad, remember that you beat this race by earning points and not by finishing first.
Press your luck with a fun and simple mech of roll and move. From 2 to 5 players.

—description from the designer (translated)

Bienvenidos al Paddock! BoxBox es un juego de carreras que te permite vivir la experiencia de dirigir una escudería de Formula 1!
Prepara to formula uno para correr en una variedad de pistas y climas, prueba tu suerte recogiendo cartas aleatorias que marcaran el ritmo de la carrera y recarga tu pila de neumáticos al derrotar a tus oponentes en duelos.
Estarás a cargo de dos autos en tu escuadrón, recuerda que ganas esta carrera consiguiendo mas puntos y no terminando primero.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nations and Empires
description:
Nations and Empires is an expansive historical strategy game, in which you will use some of the worlds most influential and iconic historical leaders and scientists to develop your nations. Collect economy, military, science, and civil liberty tokens, while fighting to conquer your opponents empires! You'll need to strategize and use your leaders unique traits and abilities to outsmart, out-develop, and out-battle your opponents. Develop nukes with science tokens, assassinate leaders with event cards, build iconic structures, sign binding formal agreements with other nations, and more!

will you be a peaceful leader who quietly develops their schools, civil liberty, and science, or a conqueror who invades all other nations, bending the world to your will?
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Somewhere Far Beyond: The Battle of Prairie Grove, December 7, 1862
description:
Somewhere Far Beyond is an historical simulation of the battle fought on December 7, 1862 in the hills of Arkansas, between the Union Army of the Frontier commanded by General John Schofield and the Confederate Army of the Trans-Mississippi led by General Thomas Hindman. The battle at Prairie Grove was the last chance for the Confederacy to turn the tide of the war in that theater to their favor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Core Space: First Born – The Gates of Ry'sa
description:
This expansion adds the ancient Gates of Ry’sa to the game in the form of some new terrain pieces along with some powerful new First Born threats – the Talos and the Cerberosa. It includes everything required to integrate the new miniatures and terrain with the starter set, including dice, equipment tokens, event cards and a mission booklet.

The new narrative campaign in the expansion will see your Traders attempt to secure one of these gates for themselves before passing through it to reach yet more undiscovered treasures in the more distant asteroid bases. New equipment and mining opportunities await amongst the incredible new terrain pieces included in this set. The gates are housed in enormous caverns large enough for all manner of creatures to come through, and the shifting colours in the energy pylons make for an eye-catching centrepiece to your gaming table. New event cards shuffled into the deck will represent the reality-shifting nature of the nearby gate.

There are three Cerberosa included in the set. These vicious beasts are deadly in close-assault and take advantage of the rules for poisoned attacks, further weakening their wounded victims. Cerberosa do not roll the Knowledge Die when they attack, instead coming with their own bespoke die. Its additional effects include crippling strikes that reduce your Skill pegs, frenzied attacks that target multiple opponents, and pure brute strength, adding further poisoned hits to their attacks.

The Gates of Ry’sa includes two Talos. Like the Cerberosa the Talos rolls its own bespoke dice when attacking representing the physical effects of its powerful energy blasts. These include knocking opponents from their feet, instilling panic, and even setting their victims on fire! Talos are also very tough to kill. Getting through their rock-like armour a first time will only make them stumble – you’ll have to hit them again before they recover to permanently power them down.

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: TRIBES（トライブス）
description:
---You are a member of a tribe when humanity was still in its infancy.

We will efficiently collect resources for tribes to live in the harsh natural world and contribute to a rich life..... ---

This game is a resource management and trick-taking card game.

Each players creates several "roles" in the turn and decides the victory by the total of the points given for each "role".

Players use the Elements Cards (Fire, water, soil, wood) to collect resource cards for "Crystal", "Brick", "Apple", and "Charcoal".

After 3 rounds, the player who meets the 8 types of and gets the most "contribution points" wins.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Fired Up: The Agility Expansion
description:
The expansion includes 2 more exciting Fighters that can completely change the game with their speed.

Add Keane the Hurricane and Yabai the Scarlet Fiend, each with a unique ability related to speed.
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sirtet
description:
Sirtet is a little 15 minutes abstract strategy game for 2 players, about harvest, sacrifice ... and colorful tetrominoes!

The game is played with 36 custom tiles. The players discard tiles to harvest new ones from the board, trying to collect the largest number of tiles of the same color.

The Sirtet Solo variant allows you to play the game as a solitaire.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Map Reduction, Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Monopoly: Warszawa dwudziestolecie międzywojenne
description:
The game Monopoly: Warszawa dwudziestolecie międzywojenne ("Monopoly Warsaw interwar period") is a fascinating journey to the city, which, carried with enthusiasm after regaining freedom, changed and became beautiful. Outstanding works of Polish architects - modern and functional - as well as the style and color of the then life of the capital contributed to calling pre-war Warsaw "the Paris of the North".

The game is an attempt to revive the beauty of that Warsaw, a story about a city full of contrasts, with remarkable vitality, using the short time of 20 years between the wars. There are nearly 30 objects on the board representing selected Warsaw office buildings, public buildings, universities and scientific institutions, as well as transport modernized in the 1930s. The center of the board is filled with a map of Warsaw from 1933.

Don't wait, roll the dice, make a move, make transactions and make a fortune in the world's first retro edition of Monopoly!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Trading

name: Подводные города: Ибица промокарта
description:
Grants 3 Credits and 1 VP during the Production phase.

Note: Included in the Spanish edition of Underwater cities. The Russian version of this card is available separately from the base game.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Science Fiction
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Network and Route Building

name: Monopoly: Care Bears
description: Have a rainbow day! Catch some fun as you buy, sell, and trade the Care Bears and their Cousins in MONOPOLY®: Care Bears edition. With each roll of the dice, pick up a beloved friend like Wish Bear, Funshine Bear, or Grumpy Bear, then use Star Buddies to add Hearts and Cloud Castles to your properties. Choose your favorite token like the Hot Air Balloon, Cloud Car or the Rainbow Roller as you travel through Care-a-lot picking up friends. Every day is special when you let the fun shine in.
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Aquifer
description:
Aquifer is a Hex variant which attempts to find a consistent turn protocol to replace the pie rule; the game is balanced despite that each turn consists of the same options. In the spirit of Slither, the designer is proud to present yet another connection game in which movement is utilized to solve a specific design problem while providing unique and puzzling tactics as well. The name Aquifer refers to how each player's initial group is the wellspring from which all their other groups originate. Draws are impossible in Aquifer.

Rules

Materials: Any Hex board size 10x10 or larger and an unlimited supply of stones in two colors.

Objective: Connect your two designated sides, Top and Bottom for Black and Left and Right for White with an unbroken chain of pieces.

Gameplay: Starting with Black, on their turn players alternate either placing a stone of their own color that, if possible, must be adjacent to a like-colored stone already on the board. Or alternatively moving one or more of their stones according to the following conventions:

The player selects a group (connected set of like-colored stones) to move stone/s out of. Other friendly stones within the group are sacrificed, by flipping them to the opponent's color, to give the stone/s sliding movement, each sacrifice adds a particular direction of movement to one of the stones being moved. Any number of stones can be sacrificed from the group (which aren't the moving stones of course) except for 1; the group must still exist at the end of the turn. The stones may move in any combination of their purchased directions. At least one of the stones must land adjacent to no other stones. When moving, stones can move over friendly stones but not over enemy stones.

-description from designer
mechanics: Connections, Hexagon Grid, Resource to Move

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Klingon Faction Pack: Blood Oath
description: The Klingon Faction Pack: Blood Oath is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Klingon faction: a Negh'Var class, 2 K'T'inga classes and a Bird-of-Prey. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Zombicide: Black Plague – Gilbert & Mortimer
description:
And that is why, you see, zombies are just chickens without feathers; we must cut off the head and then keep chopping.”

Sir Gilbert is a loyal knight and a clever one, although some say he has been hit on the head a few times too many. He was fighting battles when he was a young squire, and he’ll continue fighting battles, so he says, even when he is past death himself. In this day and age, with the dead rising all around him, it no longer sounds like such a strange thing to say – even if Sir Gilbert sometimes claims he’ll be fighting as a dead squid and not a dead man.

“We shall quest to slay the zombies. We will not rest until all of them are slain!”

King Mortimer is a mighty lord – or, at least he was. His kingdom was not known for much and his benevolent rule, such as it was, consisted mostly of ignoring his subjects in favor of quests of one sort or another. When the necromancers brought forth their plague of shambling creatures, King Mortimer and his knights were eager to fight this new menace. They will ride – or jog – into battle over and over again, until the last of the zombie menace is dead!

These survivor miniatures were part of the Black Plague Kickstarter.

Contents:
1 Gilbert
1 King Mortimer
Cards
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Dark Domains: Secret Cabal Cards
description: A set of six cards originally available as part of The Secret Cabal's 2020 Kickstarter Campaign. Set includes henchmen: Jamie - Master of Power, Tony - Master of Wisdom, Don - Master of Intellect, Chris - Master of Savagery, Steve - Master of Evil and Brian - Master of Calculation.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: JUNGLA
description:
On the summer solstice, the longest day of the year, on the wild, faraway island of JUNGLA, two fearless packs – the KNIGHTS commanded by the powerful LION CAYDEN and the PIRATES led by the cunning TIGER DHURTA – battle for the TAWA HALLAE, the scepter of power of the animal world.

THERE CAN ONLY be ONE KING! A terrible struggle is underway to reach the enemy hunting squares. Animals fight duels to the bitter end, in which each animal has unique fighting abilities.
Luck won’t decide the outcome of this contest. Let the battle cry ring out: Brave in the melee, loyal to the KING! Only the side with the most courage, strategy, cunning, and speed will emerge victorious.

SUMMARY OF RULES
There are 2 packs, each consisting of 15 animals. Each animal moves in different directions and a specific number of squares depending on its abilities. The direction and number of squares
permitted for each move depends on whether the animal starts from a land or a water square. Hit animals are imprisoned and removed from the board. The aim is to take the animals in your pack from the den squares to the enemy hunting squares, achieving a point. The first pack to score 5 points or to imprison all the enemy animals wins.

—description from designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Template, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Warfighter: Modern Expansion #59 – Hostage Rescue Skyscraper
description:
The FBI’s Hostage Rescue Team (HRT) is one of the world’s foremost elite law enforcement counter-terrorist squads. A group of terrorists have taken over a tall, glittering skyscraper downtown, threatening a number of hostages, and negotiations have broken down. With time running out and the terrorists getting jumpy, it is time for the HRT to apply their special weapons, training and tactics to thwart the terrorists, rescue the hostages and save the day.

Modern Expansion #59 – Hostage Rescue Skyscraper includes new HRT Soldiers, Missions, Skill, Objectives and Locations as well as Civilians and Terrorist Hostiles. This expansion introduces the FBI's Elite Hostage Rescue Team into Modern Warfighter, and adds 56 cards to your Warfighter games.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stigmergy
description:
Stigmergy is a drawless territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of an initially empty hexagonal grid of hexagons. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

Two stones, or a stone and an empty cell, see each other if they lie on the same straight line of adjacent cells and there are no other stones between them along that line. You control a cell if the number of stones of your color it sees is more than half the number of cells (empty or occupied) adjacent to it. To flip a stone is to replace it with a stone of the opposite color.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, perform exactly one of the following actions: a) Pass, provided that there are no empty cells or every empty cell is controlled by some player. b) Place a stone of your color on an empty cell not controlled by your opponent. c) Flip an enemy stone on a cell you control. The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. Your score is the number of stones of your color on the board, plus the number of empty cells you control, plus komi in the case of White. The button is used to avoid ties.

Komi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as compensation for going second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games. The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. It is only used when komi is an odd number. On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button.

Stigmergy is based on Michał Zapała's Tumbleweed.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Setaris Ravagers Enemy Pack
description:
Retail Description
The Setaris Kitewings are a ruthless alien civilization, bent on conquest and devastation. A reptilian species with large leathery wings, they descend from above to rain death upon their foes. Often acting in small bands of space pirates known as Ravager Enclaves, these cunning raiders have mastered Hit-and-Run attacks to strike quickly and without warning. Not known for taking prisoners, it is said that the Setaris have a habit of feeding on the dead.

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add these vicious alien Enemies to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

Contains:
6 x Setaris Ravagers
6 x 30mm Bases
1 x Large Enemy Record Sheet
13 x Game Cards
1 x Die-Cut Counter Sheet

Kickstarter Description
The Setaris Ravagers are a savage group of sinister aliens that descend from the skies on their leathery wings, blasting away at any who would stand before the might of their conquest! Originally introduced in the Conquest of Planet Earth Board Game (similar to their rivals, the Trun), the Setaris Kitewings are a group of raiders that travel from world to world, attacking without warning to collect raw materials and ‘food’ for their nomadic fleet of Kraken Ships. The Setaris Ravagers can be found in several OtherWorlds (Targa, Jargono, Blasted Wastes, Derelict Ship, Trederra, and more). They have vicious talons as well as powerful energy weapons, Snap Firing at Heroes as they make their Hit and Run attacks.

Includes 6 Setaris Ravagers, Cards, and Rules

During the Shadows of Brimstone Adventures Kickstarter campaign, part of the Social Media Stretch Goals with the Feathered Serpents of Kotak.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Hellborn Marauders Enemy Pack
description:
The Hellborn Marauders are barbarians driven by a dark power to lay waste to the villages of the Norse Lands in their ruthless quest for domination!

The Hellborn Marauders are an awesome foil for the Viking Heroes. They are barbarians in the classic style of fantasy, but driven by a dark power. Originally, these guys were slated for just one pose, but we were very inspired when we started working on them and decided that we just had to have a second pose for variety and to add some extra detail to the enemy group. All of the fur detail, armor, and the battered, battle-damaged shields really cement the theme of these ruthless raiders!

Includes 6 Hellborn Marauder Miniatures, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Targa Plateau Artifacts #2 Game Supplement
description:
Otherworld artifact packs add interesting new loot to the game! Includes 15 new Targa Artifact Cards.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

description:
This pack of 15 new cards expands the decks of the Spanish Fort and Swamps of Jargono. Includes Gear, Artifacts, Encounters, and an Adventure Card.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Myraclia: Eternity
description:
Eternal powers...waiting on Myraclia...hidden from the eyes of the mighty...but generously revealed to those who appear feeble

- - - RULES - - -

CONTENT: 16 double-sided Eternity Tokens

SETUP: Just place all Eternity tokens back-side up next to the scoring board.

RULES: At the end of each round (except the last round), the last player on the scoreboard (in case of a tie, tied player who terraformed later in this round) randomly selects one token and places the token on any free Myraclia tile (i.e. not terraformed, not reserved), face-up.

Remember: Myraclia with Eternity token placed on it is available to all players in the subsequent rounds.

Depending on the type of Eternity token, the player who terraforms Myraclia hex with Eternity token (or more tokens) placed on it gains a certain advantage/bonus.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order

name: Far Distant Ships
description:
Far Distant Ships: a quick playing set of rules covering fleet actions in the age of sail where linear tactics were to the fore.

The aim of these rules, which draw upon techniques and concepts from LFG’s Cannon, Cross and Crescent combined with a development span covering some 20 years has been to develop a quick play set that focusses on the command and control aspects of the battle, allowing large battles such as Chesapeake Bay, the Saintes and Trafalgar to be played out in an evening’s gaming.
Signalling is key, and complex plans may fall apart if a vital signal is missed, or an order executed late.

The rules cover the main ship types involved across the period, focussing on ships of the line and rated frigates, in particular in their role as signal repeaters.
Stats are also included for civilian ships, smaller warships and bomb vessels, and shore batteries and fortifications, allowing the full spectrum of naval operations to be played.

The rules have been written with 1/2400 models in mind but will work with models in larger scales.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Simulation

First up are the true masters of evil - a dastardly collection of the most nefarious villains, banded together with a new team affiliation. This set introduces Baron Heinrich Zemo, Radioactive Man, and more!

Contents:
55 Playable Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

name: Dungeons of Infinity: Stonebound Saga
description:
King Armiger has called in his resources and has requested that two heroes from the Stonebound Saga join the team in the Dungeons of Infinity. Watchman Brahms and Prophet Elle will be traveling to Armiger's kingdom to join the fight.

An expansion of two heroes, exclusive to the first Kickstarter for the Dungeons of Infinity.

This was packaged separately from the base game, in a small box with just the player boards, tokens, and cards. No instructions even.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze, Medieval

name: Calling All Knights
description:
Calling all Knights is a 2-5 player trick-taking card game for the whole family.

Players act as potential rulers of the kingdom trying to rid the land of pesky monsters. They do this by hiring Knights to fight on their behalf and claim bounties. There are 54 different unique looking knight characters making up the knight deck. For each monster on the field, players send one of their knights out to battle. The best knight slays the beast and gets points for the player.

Monsters are slain by the knight with the highest number. If the knight matches the color of the monster, they trump the other knights of a different color. Monster point values are based on how impressed the villagers are. For example, dragons are worth the most at 4 points each. However, if you slay the bunny, that's negative 4. They just don't realize that the bunny is the most dangerous of them all.

The game is played in 5 rounds. The game starts with each player having 2 knights per hand, but that amount increases by 2 each round with the final round having 10 cards in each players' hands. Each round players bid on how many monsters they will take. If they guess correctly, they get extra points. Bonus points increase each round as it gets more difficult to predict. At the end of the last round, whoever scored the highest wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval
mechanics: Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Drukhari
description:
The Drukhari are a decadent race of alien tormentors and raiders. Once part of a galaxy-spanning empire, the Drukhari now indulge in every macabre passion their supreme intelligence can conceive. They consider themselves superior to the galaxy’s other races, and suffer a gnawing sickness of the soul which only the suffering of others can fill. The ranks of the Drukhari are filled with fleet and agile warriors, each armed with weaponry designed to inflict maximum pain, and through their innate poise they raise their torturous form of war into a gruesome artform.

Get ready to launch raids with superior anti-grav vehicles, hideous vat-grown cyborgs, and coteries of venom-shooting killers. Whether you prefer the gang-like cartels of Kabalite Warriors, the gladiatorial Wyches from the arenas or the surgical horror of the Haemonculi (or even a mix of all three!) this book is for you. Along with inspirational photographs of stunningly painted models, it features the background and lore of the Drukhari, and the rules that you need to field them in your games of Warhammer 40,000.

Inside this 120-page codex, you will find:

The history and dark origins of the Drukhari, their hideous obsessions and the competing factions that vie for power
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel Miniatures that displays the martial liveries, hedonistic colours and gruesome appearances seen among the varied power blocs of Commorragh
A vast range of datasheets providing tabletop rules for units from the Drukhari army
Army-wide rules and an evocative Crusade section that allow you to transform your collection of Drukhari miniatures into a terrifying force, poised to strike at the galaxy's vulnerable underbelly and reap the spoils
And more!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Playing With Fire
description:
A fun, fast paced, dice and card game of risk and chance where the highest scoring player wins the game. Players roll the dice in an attempt to score points on each roll in order to score a Blaze and earn bonus points. Special cards offer opportunity for additional challenges and surprises that can push you over the top, or you could get burnt and lose it all.
Suitable for in-person or virtual play for 2 or more players.
Optional betting and tournament rules offer additional fun and variety. Will you play it safe, or are you willing to play with fire in order to win?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck

name: iDOL ST@GE BATTLE 765基本セット
description:
Form a unit of three up and coming idols from 765 Production and aim to have as many fans as possible by the time the final stage comes around. Form a deeper bond with your unit as a producer by winning stages and completing jobs. Luck is important in this competitive industry. Stage and job cards require stat check rolls according to the affection of your idols. If you succeed, they are added to your deck and often raise your idols' affection. When their affection reaches its maximum level they become awakened, upgrading to more powerful stats and effects.

Winning stages is a battle between producers attempting to have the most appeal. In turn order, players select one of three stages they would like to participate in for the round. From left to right the stages are resolved, allowing players to play as many cards with the appeal keyword as possible from their hand to gain appeal according to their idols stats. The winner gains affection and fans, while the loser may suffer penalties. The player with the most fans by the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Music, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: The Long Way Home
description:
The Long Way Home is an historical Print & Play solitaire board game based on the true story non-fiction book with the same title. The player must fly their Pan American Clipper the long way home from New Zealand on a westward route due to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor on Dec. 7, 1941. Along the way, the player will face fuel problems and other difficulties on their journey home due to being out of the Pan American support network for more than half of the trip.

Game components include navigation mats, calendar mat, a tables book, and a counter sheet with various counters to location and status of the Clipper along it's route.

The player moves his Clipper aircraft game counter across the various navigation mats during his journey.

The ultimate goal of the game is to safely fly the Clipper back to the United States before February 1, 1942. Will you succeed?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Storytelling

name: De Re BelloLudi: Strategy Game – Ancient and Medieval Warfare
description:
This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 2000 BCE to roughly 1500 CE, the age which includes Empires as Alexander the Great’s Macedonians, Rome, Carthage, Genghis Khan and Charlemagne.

The game is designed as a multiplayer game but will work just as fine with only two players or even solo. It is written for people with no prior wargame experience, but has enough depth to entertain the experienced wargamers as well. The army structure that is presented, can be easily adapted to the number of miniatures that you have available. Albeit that a large army look suitably impressive. Hopefully, playing the game will encourage you to create your own armies. Similarly, the distances are given in inches for use with 28mm scale soldiers. Feel free to adapt to centimeters should you do not have the space or use a smaller scale of miniatures.

In an ideal battlefield situation the enemy was pinned in place by the threat of cavalry or disorganised by the missiles of infantry. Once this was accomplished, other units could deliver the coup de grace. Tactics were therefore based on teamwork between units, or even armies. Every unit would have its own specific task and if they executed their tasks in unison, success was often achieved. The aim in this game, is not to annihilate the enemy’s units to the last man, but to inflict enough damage, indicated by chips, that morale is reduced and the unit will become shaken or will run away in panic and removed from the tabletop. By a clever combination of movement, shooting and dashing cavalry charges, this can be achieved. The tactics are based on teamwork. Not only within a group, but also between groups and as such, the whole army.

Your role will be that of a commander in an ancient or medieval army. Should more than two players per side be available, one of you will play the part of Commander-in Chief or general. Should any disagreement arise concerning the rules, we suggest you roll a dice. The one who rolls the highest number has it right, for now.
So onwards, to glory!

Sequence of Play:

making a plan
roll for initiative
Command (movement, including initiative moves)
shooting
hand-to-hand


An IGo UGo system

Cards or special dice (The dice have 0, 1, 2, 3 and B on them
0-3 dictates how many moves can be made by units in a Command.) are available separately.
Markers and chips can be downloaded in the download section

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: HYKE
description:
HYKE is a poetic communication game in which you create senryū — poems with a 5-7-5 syllable structure, typically about human foibles — in which someone at the table can identify the theme of your creation, but ideally not too easily.

To set up, players submit themes to a central pool, then you draw one of those themes at random, create a senryū based on that theme, and invite others to identify the theme of your creation. Your score is the number of people who guess incorrectly before someone guesses correctly, so you want your poem to be both not too easy to understand and not too difficult to understand.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Monster Capture Race
description:
Travel around monster island capturing monsters and powering them up while playing as 1 of the 11 unique characters.
Each character has two special skill cards and a main ability that helps them gain advantages.

Be careful as some characters move in the opposite direction.
Lastly, do not become too powerful, otherwise the dragon will come for you. Not only making you take huge amounts of damage but also destroying all the equipment you have gained!
The game is won through being the first player to collect 15 victory points or by being the last player standing. Players move around the board capturing monsters for victory points equivalent to that monsters power level. Players will also achieve victory points when one of their monsters deals damage to an opposing player that fails to defend themselves also equal to their monsters level.

Can you withstand the intensity of the obstacles ahead?

Recommended: 4-8 players for the best experience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Civil War – Thunderbolts
description: In this final installment to the Civil War story arc, hero on hero conflict reaches a fevered pitch as Iron Man forges new and questionable alliances with reformed super villains. This unbelievably powerful Thunderbolts team will lead the charge in hunting down and capturing the renegade heroes.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Russia's War: Barbarossa reloaded
description:
Russia's War is a new and innovative game on operation Barbarossa in 1941. The game scale is 25km per hexagon and mostly division level for units.
Volume 1 will cover Army group North and Center areas of operations from June 1941 to February 1942.
This game will better simulate the numerous soviet counter offensives which are often forgotten by other titles at this scale. Also, an innovative game system will provide a better feel of the gradual attrition suffered by the Axis and the needed pause of the german mechanised units also rarely simulated before.
A simplified air and naval system combined with the use of Army level off map display for support assets will make the game a very playable "monster".

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water – Oni Hunters
description:
Cooperative and solo modes for Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water. This expansion allows players to play solo or as a team against a card-controlled Oni opponent. A new deck of reaction cards aids in the execution of the 'AI' opponent and new boar overlays for the corruption track allow for beginner and expert levels of difficulty.

This pack consists of 15 mission cards, 18 adventure cards, 154 reaction cards, 23 activation tokens, 2 board overlays for the oni's corruption track, and a rules book to explain solo and cooperative gameplay.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Greyjoy Starter Set
description:
While the natives of the Iron Islands technically bend the knee to whomever sits the Iron Throne, the Ironborn are taking full advantage of the chaos in Westeros to raid its coastlines and mercantile shipping like never before. The Ironborn are not an army dedicated to protracted engagements, but rather a rapid-moving force built around subduing enemies and inflicting as much damage as possible before fading back into the Sunset Sea from whence they came. In an age of strife and internecine war, the only true victors are those that carry away the greater share of the spoils, and the Ironborn are built to do exactly that.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Medium: Telepathic Tantrum Promo Cards
description:
8 Telepathic Tantrum cards offered through Tantrum House kickstarter campaign

After another team plays their first card, play a card from your hand. Then, that team must attempt to match with the two played cards, without playing their second card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Matching, Team-Based Game

name: Ronin Warrior
description:
Ronin Warrior is inspired by the 47 Ronin and Japan's Sengoku period. In this 2-in-1 board game there are two separate modes of play; Ronin Warrior: Vengeance is a solo, cooperative campaign game, while Ronin Warrior: Rising is a strategic wargame that features various buildings and units that players can construct and train across the map. Both modes of play share the same timeline, game pieces, and characters.

Ronin Warrior: Vengeance is where the story begins, when Kirashi, a greedy warlord, is instigated by the sorcerer Majo to harm Lord Asan to usurp the ancient spirit's power. One thing Kirashi didn't expect, after Asan's death, the spirit temple also collapsed and 5 pieces of the spirit disappeared. According to legend, summoning a spirit requires 5 pieces of a spirit and an eight-headed dragon's claw. From here the battle to collect 5 spirit and dragon claws begins. The Samurai under Asan had become Ronin, lost their master, their honor was damaged, the Ronin once again gathered, they were determined to recover 5 pieces of spirit to end the dark age and avenge, get honor back.

In Ronin Warrior: Vengeance each player takes on a different role, such as Ronin, Samurai, Ninja, Darksoul, Sohei, and Ming. You can play solo or you and up to 5 other players will overcome dangerous traps, assassinate enemies, recover ancient spirit, and obtain rare treasures in this co-op campaign. You'll explore an ever-changing world, with endless possibilities in Ronin Warrior: Vengeance.

Ronin Warrior: Rising continues where Vengeance leaves off. When one clan attempts to usurp the power of the spirit, a great clan war erupts across Japan. You will play as daimyo on your journey to build and consolidate power throughout the nation.

You, along with other Samurai, are gathered for a special occasion. The clans decide to work together in search of the ancient spirit to gain their legendary power. However, in this cooperative mode, players will tentatively work together while their secondary objectives will be hidden from each other. With your sword forward and a knife pointing at your back, up to 6 players explore Japan, fight legendary Yokai, and obtain legendary items such as Muramasa, Kusanagi no Tsurugi, Yata no Kagami. As you explore the map, you will come across villages where you can recruit various units and heroes to bolster your forces or destroy them for personal gain. You can also receive blessings at temples from Yamata no Orochi, the Eight-Headed Dragon. Each Samurai has a unique story, a unique goal, and a clan-specific skillset. You'll discover an ever-changing world, with endless possibilities in Ronin Warrior: Vengeance.

In Ronin Warrior: Rising you are a powerful daimyo, whose goal is to unify Japan. Players can accomplish this either by conquering all the other clans, or by summoning the spirit. To conquer the nation, you will use your townspeople to exploit resources and trade with other players to build your empire alongside legendary figures such as the Samurai Shinsuke and Tameto, shaman queen Himiko, and Seimei the Onmyoji. As you expand your territory across the board, you will encounter neutral villages, and temples dedicated to Yamata no Orochi.

To summon the spirit, you will need to defeat Yokai, collect all 5 spirit shards, and possess the dragon claw. The entire history of Japan's Sengoku period will be written by your hands. Conquer them or befriend them. Worship the eight headed dragon or destroy his temples. Recruit soldiers or raze villages. The choice is yours. Do you fight for victory, justice, revenge, or honor?
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Test of Resolve
description:
Innovative wargame rules for the Wars of the Roses

Delivering period characteristics without undue complexity

High-quality rules, scenario books, PDFs, game cards & digital downloads

Test of Resolve requires only one twelve-sided die (D12) per side – and your figures! The game plays out with a small deck of cards representing the opposing factions. These cards are designed to introduce an innovative, realistic and exciting unpredictability to the game flow — and remind the players that commanders had little control of events when the fighting started!

The historical scenarios are typically completed in 1 to 2 hours, and all are designed to be played on a 180 x 120cm (6’ x 4’) table with 28mm (or smaller) figures.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Mormont She-Bears
description:
Most of the soldiers marching to battle in Westeros’ wars are men. Many people feel that a woman’s place is back home, running things there. But for House Mormont, their She-Bears gladly head to war, taking up arms just like any other soldier. Drawing inspiration in armor and weaponry from legendary warrior Lady Alysane Mormont, they are a rough and rugged fighting force that will stand toe-to-toe with some of the heaviest units other Houses can field.

The Mormont She-Bears Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Stark players a durable unit for their forces. These tough women are outfitted with thick leather and sturdy plate mail, making them able to turn away enemy blows with ease. Offensively, they attack mercilessly with two-handed maces, able to crush enemy armor with a single blow. The more dire the situation, the harder the She-Bears fight, often carrying on in battle past near-fatal wounds.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Gymnastics Gold
description:
Gymnastics Gold is a dice manipulation and card game designed to simulate a high-level gymnastics meet. Players will rotate between Uneven Bars, Balance Beam, Floor Exercise and Vault, drawing cards and choosing which skills they will try to execute. Harder skills yield greater rewards but also carry harsher deductions.

Each event has unique dice mechanisms representing the gymnast's execution of her skills. Players must decide whether to keep rolling (chasing glory at the risk of more deductions) or to take their lumps and call it quits. Smart decisions--and getting an adrenaline boost at the right time--will ultimately make the difference between a gold medal and not even making the podium.

When the meet is over, awards are given to the top-scoring gymnast in each event, with one gymnast being crowned as All Around Champion.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Bone Scorpions XL-Sized Alternate Enemy Duo Pack
description:
Though the massively mutated Dark Stone Scorpions are renowned for their thick shells, potent poison, and razor-edged claws that can snap a man in two with a single powerful pinch, the nightmarish Bone Scorpions that roam the alien desert dunes of the Blasted Wastes and the shadowy groves within the Forest of the Dead are perhaps more terrifying. Equal in size and ferocity with their earthly counterparts, the Bone Scorpions are more agile and quick to enrage, lashing out with the lightning-fast retaliatory strikes of their stinging tails at any that draw too near.

This Alternate Enemy Pack converts the terrifying and poisonous Dark Stone Scorpions into the nightmarish Bone Scorpions for use in the Blasted Wastes and Forest of the Dead OtherWorlds! There are 2 XL Dark Stone Scorpion models included to paint in this alternate color scheme, 1 Blasted Wastes Artifact card, and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Omny
description:
Omny is a drawless connection game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the spaces (cells) of a finite, initially empty patch of a hexagonal tiling. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.



DefinitionsA group is a set of interconnected stones of the same color.

A cut of a group is a set of interconnected cells (empty or occupied by either color) including no stones in that group.



PlayBefore the game starts, some cells on the board are designated as star cells.

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty cell.

You win by making a group of your color such that none of its cuts include more than half of the star cells on the board.



Komi and pie ruleKomi or the pie rule (or both) can be used in order to make the game fair.

The pie rule gives White the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with their opponent instead of making a regular move.

Komi is either a whole number or a whole number plus 0.5. When komi is used, Black wins by making a black group such that none of its cuts include more than half of the star cells on the board minus komi, and White wins by making a white group such that none of its cuts include more than half of the star cells on the board plus komi. Komi works best when the number of star cells is fairly large.

Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games. When komi and the pie rule are used together, Black on their first turn chooses komi and places a black stone on the board, and then White has the option to swap sides with Black instead of making a regular move.



NotesRaces (but not draws) are possible when the sum of the number of star cells and twice the value of komi is an even number.

Different board shapes and star cell configurations result in different games:


Sunder: The perimeter of the board is a regular hexagon. All cells on the board are star cells.



Y: The perimeter of the board is an equilateral triangle. The three corner cells of the board are star cells.



Gyre: The perimeter of the board is a regular hexagon. The center cell and all perimeter cells are star cells.



Free Y: The perimeter of the board is an irregular hexagon with an odd number of cells. All perimeter cells are star cells.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Trench Shock!
description:
Decklaration of War: Trench Shock is a World War I themed game where two players deploy troops, weapons, build fortifications, and strategize to defeat their opponent. Victory is reached in one of two ways: by eliminating all the opponent's troops and weapons in No Man's Land. Or destroying all fortifications and soldiers in the opponent's trench.

A Round includes three phases, performed in the following sequence, Initiative, Action, and Reinforce. The initiative phase determines which play goes first during the Action phase. During the action phase, each player performs 8 steps: deploying weapons, moving soldiers, attacking, building fortifications, and drawing event cards. Once one player completes the action phase, then it is the next player's turn. The final step is to reinforce for the next round.

The game focuses on getting the right dice roll combination to implement your strategy to achieve victory. However, it won't be easy because your opponent is doing the same and taking steps to counteract your plan. Do you have the skill and luck to defeat your opponent? Or will they outwit you and claim victory?
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Symbiotes – Spider-Verse
description:
This powerhouse conclusion to the Symbiotes story arc includes heroes from across the Spider-Verse, all coming together on a collision course with the Symbiotes! Play with your favorite spider-themed characters in an all-out brawl for spider supremacy!

This expansion adds 55 Cards, including various characters throughout the Spiderverse, and 1 Rulesheet.
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Necromunda: House of Faith
description:
From the outside, other Necromundans see House Cawdor as bonepickers, scavengers and beggars, little better than hive rats. But House Cawdor has faith, a faith so strong that it has been saved from extinction where so many other Clan Houses have succumbed to the march of time or other disasters.

Get the ultimate guide to House Cawdor. This 136-page hardback book features the definitive history of the House and rules for fielding the eight different types of fighters available to House Cawdor – Word-Keepers, Priests, Firebrands, Deacons, Cawdor Brethren, Redemptionist Brethren, Bonepickers, and Zealots. It's ideal for fans of House Cawdor or anyone who wants to delve deeper into the dark side of the underhive.

Inside this book you will find:


House Cawdor History and Background: An expansive and extensive background on the origins of House Cawdor and how it went on to become the largest clan on Necromunda.
House Cawdor Gang List: All the rules you need in order to field a Cawdor Gang in games of Necromunda, including rules for using Redemptionists in your gangs or for fielding gangs made entirely of these flaming zealots.
Hangers-on and Brutes: Rules for hiring Hangers-on and Brutes for your Gang, including Cawdor-specific ones and for using them in games of Necromunda.
Hired Guns: Rules for using Bounty Hunters, House Agents, and Hive Scum.
Strong Alliances: Rules for forming alliances with three organisations that House Cawdor has connections with, including the Corpse Guild, Rogue Factoria, and House Ko'iron – the Noble House that backs the House of Faith.
Additional Rules: This section includes new and additional rules usable by House Cawdor gangs in games of Necromunda, providing Cawdor players a variety of options, including Skills, Abilities, and gang-specific terrain.
Weapon Reference Chart: A comprehensive weapons reference chart for all weapons and wargear available to House Cawdor and their Allies.
House Cawdor Gang Tactics: A D66 table of Gang Tactics for use in Scenarios.
Dramatis Personae: Rules for hiring and using four brand-new Dramatis Personae characters in your games of Necromunda.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Volfyirion Guilds: Ploy Expansion
description:
Accomplish your Guild's hidden agenda through low blows and tricky interruptions during the opponent's turn that will increase the complexity and tension of the game.

The Ploy is a new type of card which comes along with its own several abilities.
A Ploy Card, with its asymmetric and secret new strategy, may allow you to beat your opponent, overwriting the rules of the game in specific conditions.

The new Ploy cards provide alternative ways to interact with the opponent, even during their turn, to sabotage their strategies when needed. A Ploy card must remain face down until they are played, but Ploys can also be drawn, forcefully revealed, swapped, or removed by the effect of other abilities during the game.

Volfyirion Guilds Ploy Expansion is not a standalone game.
It can be played either with Volfyirion, or Volfyirion Guilds in 1vs1 mode.
The Ploy Expansion can be combined with Volfyirion, Volfyirion Guilds, or any other expansion, for an even more challenging experience. In any case we do not recommend combining more than two expansions at the same time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Don't Look Back: Supporting Characters Expansion
description:
No horror experience is complete without a solid foundation of supporting characters to lift the main characters or succumb to the terrors of the night. Will they survive the encounter and become a powerful ally in the future; or an insidious nemesis? Only time will tell!

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 6 Supporting Character miniatures and optional rules for using these supporting characters to the base game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Klondike: The Canadian Gold Rush Game
description:
Klondike is a card drafting deck building game set in 1896 during the gold rush in The Yukon.

Play as 1 of 4 player characters. Shop at the mercantile to build your deck and improve your chances at successfully mining a creek in one of the four progressively more challenging mountain passes.

Players can use items they have purchased to impede their opponents or protect themselves from the other prospectors!

Win either by collecting the most gold or by having the best team of assistants. 60 minute average play time with options to shorten the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: The Troubles: Shadow War in Northern Ireland 1964-1998
description:
The Troubles: Shadow War in Northern Ireland 1964-1998 is a two-to-six player, card-driven simulation depicting the Paramilitary and Security Force conflict that gripped Northern Ireland for almost 4 decades between 1964 and 1998.
Equally foregrounded are the national and international political affairs that saw the British Army undertake its longest deployment in its military history – on its own streets.
Each player takes the role of a Faction seeking to guide Northern Irish affairs, whether it is political, paramilitarily or through martial law: the British Forces (including the UDR), the Royal Ulster Constabulary (the RUC was the Government security force), the Provisional Irish Republican Army (IRA), the Loyalist Paramilitaries (LOY), and the Nationalist (NAT) or Unionist (UNI) politicians.

It encompasses the USA’s involvement in the international aid and arms deals that supported the IRA; facilitates the exportation of terror to the streets of Great Britain and Europe; depicts the complex relationship that existed between the Republic of Ireland, Britain and its northern neighbor. And it provides Developments, a feature that mirrors the increasing technological and intelligence-led advancements on both sides.

Each Faction may use Primary and Secondary Actions analogous to its real world counterparts, or may choose from the 259 rich Narrative Cards, divided into eight key epochs in Northern Ireland’s recent history:

1964 1970 Struggle & Reform
1970 1974f The Bloody Years
1974F 1974O Sunningdale
1974O 1979 Talks & H-Blocks
1979 1983 The Thatcher Years #1: Iron and Hunger
1983 1987 The Thatcher Years #2: Target Mainland
1987 1992 The Thatcher Years #3: Anglo-Irish
1992 1997 The Road to Peace


–Description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Omnitron-U Promo Card
description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the of the Multiverse.

Omnitron-U

HP 24

Power - Volatile Wiring: Until the end of your next turn, whenever one of your cards is Destroyed, Omnitron-U deals 1 Target 2 Fire damage. Either Play a card or move 1 Equipment card from your Trash into your Hand.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Ultra Vilelence: Module 2
description:
A fast paced, expandable, random tile, monster generating game with 'questionable' characters and 'vile' enemies. There are multiple ways to play - Deathmatch, Cooperative, Capture the Flag and Solo. Each stand-alone module comes with two unique player characters, monsters and their generators, items, traps and encounters. Includes eight 6.5" x 6.5" tiles for map generation and 162 die cut pieces.

The play area is made up of several randomly drawn floor tiles. Players start at opposite ends of the play area. Players use movement points to move their character through these tiles, defeating monsters and gathering items. Eventually the players' characters will meet and it will be a fight to the death, using the items they gathered along the way. Combat is solved simply with dice (not provided). There are also co-op and solo variant rules available.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Beneath the Surface
description:
A dog wanders up to the front steps of The Will Street Detective Agency. A note has been tucked into his collar. The note is written by a woman named Mary who has been kidnapped and is being held somewhere in town by a maniac who has already killed several other women. Mary has somehow managed to use the dog to carry her request for help, and now it is up to you to find her before it's too late. Retrace the dog's steps, use clues that the dog may have picked up unknowingly, and find the house where Mary is being kept. But beware! There is more to this case than meets the eye. See if you can find what lurks...Beneath the Surface!

Difficulty Rating – 8/10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Swords & Sails: Mercenaries & Privateers
description:
Mercenaries & Privateers is a card expansion for the Epic Board game, Swords & Sails: Rewrite History in 1000 AD.

The new expansion will Feature 100 new cards, including the Mercenary/Privateer, Revolt and Calamity/Prosperity categories of intrigue cards. This will expanded the original deck of 60 intrigue cards and the 4 original categories of Development (Green), Political (Blue), Espionage (Yellow), and War (Red) to 6 Categories adding the Calamity (Grey) and the Prosperity (White) categories. The new Mercenary and Privateer cards are in the War (Red) category. Intrigue cards expand the options which Swords & Sails players have during a game and represent many simulated choices which make the game more realistic and very satisfying to play. Intrigue cards are acquired by players during the intrigue phase of the game, with each player gaining at least one card, each turn.

For more details on the original game Swords & Sails, rules, and components, please see the Rules section below.
mechanics: Negotiation, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: BattleCON: Andrus Dochartaigh Royal Bodyguard
description:
Andrus fights with two swords, each of which gains a special kind of charge that can boost his attacks. These recharge over time, so Andrus must choose when to exert each burst of power for maximum effect.

Draw your blades and strike out to overwhelm your rivals’ defenses!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeoneers: Silver City
description:
This expansion will provide details regarding your heroes visits to Silver City. You can now visit the guilds and buy profession specific equipment, visit the fortune teller, choose a bank to care for your money or take on side quest parallel to you primary quest. There is even more equipment added, including 10 new potions. You can earn money by participating in horse racing, gambling or by fighting in the arena. Finally, you can spend your hard earned money on an estate which you and your party can use as a base. As time goes, you can improve this base to prepare yourself even better for the coming quests.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Multiple Maps, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 1: Veggitoad & Lethydra
description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Veggitoad: Hatched from frogskins, tubers, and swamp fronds, Veggitoad will swarm and destroy your enemies with two unique clay molds!

Lethydra: Lash out with missiles of mutant mosquitos, toad bile, and gator-teeth using Lethydras's deadly triple attack to conquer your foes!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Movement Template, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Parcelmen
description:
Parcelmen is a board game for 1 to 4 players. Here, you can become a delivery driver, planner or a dispatcher – simply anyone involved in delivering a parcel from the sender to recipient. You will be planning routes, organising collections and distributions and doing your best to get your courier company running like clockwork. Whether you succeed will depend on your ability to plan effectively as well as on your ability to improvise and make good use of all your resources!

Players plan to deliver parcel to the right address. A player can choose from 4 actions from drawing new parcels to checking on delayed and undelivered parcels. Players get points for delivering their parcels. The game ends after 5 rounds and the player who scores the most points wins.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Quack Quack: No Take Backs
description:
Quack Quack: No Take Backs is a game great for all ages. Have fun slapping ducks, avoiding swans on ponds, and mixing up cards with a turtle! Illustrated by Fowl Language Comics!

On their turn, each player flips over one card from their hand until an action card is drawn and, causing someone to take the pile of cards. That player starts the next round. The game ends when a player runs out of cards and that player wins.
mechanics: Action/Event, Open Drafting

name: Kiddi
description:
The object of the game is simple, the first person who has no more cards in their hands wins the game. To do this, the player must create a correlation between the card played by the previous participant and one of the cards in their hand. The player must use the magic formula “Kiddi” to relate and explain it. The other players judge whether this link is acceptable or not. During the match, cataclysm cards add variety to the game.

In addition to developing the ability to make connections, several language learning skills are developed with Kiddi: speaking, organizing your speech and stimulating pre-reading habits.
--
Le but du jeu est simple, c’est la première personne qui n’a plus de carte dans ses mains qui gagne la partie. Pour y arriver, le joueur doit faire un lien entre la carte jouée par le participant précédent et l’une des cartes qu’il a en main. Le joueur doit utiliser la formule magique “Kiddi” pour faire son lien et l’expliquer. Les autres joueurs jugent si
ce lien est acceptable ou non. En cours de partie, des cartes cataclysmes viennent dynamiser le jeu.

En plus de développer l’habileté à faire des liens, plusieurs apprentissages au niveau langagier sont développés avec Kiddi: prendre la parole, organiser son discours et stimuler la pré-lecture.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Word Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Voting

name: Mix Tape
description:
As you tune into the hottest radio station’s, you unwrap a new blank cassette tape and position your fingers on the play/record buttons waiting for that perfect song to air. As it plays, you press down and think about how it makes you feel and jot that feeling onto the paper insert hoping to share your emotions to your love. With each song, the tape fills up side A, is ejected, and continues on side B. Once the tape has your hits recorded on it, your slide it back into the case surrounded by the paper insert with your notes on it. Now is off to give your crush the Mix Tape.

Mix Tape is a card game where players draw cards from 3 decks, place a song onto their tableau or activate each song's Play power.

When a player has recorded 10 songs (5 on side A and 5 on side B), victory points are totaled. A player earns victory points from
the matches between the player's crush card and songs recorded, notes written down, each song has a point value, each song has a tempo bonus which depends on the next song recorded), and the mixer levels.

The player with the most victory points, wins.
mechanics: Action/Event, Set Collection

name: The Russian Revolutions: 1914-21
description:
'During the first two months of 1917 Russia was still a Romanov monarchy. Eight months later the Bolsheviks stood at the helm. They were little known to anybody when the year began, and their leaders were still under indictment for state treason when they came to power. You will not find another such sharp turn in history especially if you remember that it involves a nation of 150 million people...'
Leon Trotsky, History of the Russian Revolutions

The Russian Revolutions: 1914-21 is a social-political conflict game for 2 to 5 players. In the game, players take on the role of one of five factions (Monarchists, Octobrists, Cadets (Constitutional Democrats), Left Reformists, or the Revolutionary Left) active in the events of the Russian Revolutions of 1917. Some factions begin the game as Governing factions with state power; others as the opposition. Whatever your factions, you will need to build your political influence, maintain your military power, manage alliances with other factions, and protect Russia from foreign invaders. The winner of the game is the faction that gains state power, and uses that effectively to change Russian society as its ideology dictates.

The game is played on two boards, one depicting the European part of Russia, the other representing St. Petersburg/ Petrograd (Russia's capital city and the 'cradle of the revolution'). Political influence is represented by coloured blocks; a vast range of historical leaders as well as military units (with historical designations) are represented by colourful double-sided chits.

The game uses an innovative system in which player either spend 'action points' to take actions or to buy cards, and thereby gain influence among various significant institutions, organisations, and social groups which can be used in later turns. Historical events are affect play as they are drawn from time-tiered event decks. New cards are added to these decks as certain conditions are met in game play.

Unlike most political games, the Russian Revolutions: 1914-21 is very suitable for solitaire play. There is little hidden information and, while alliances between factions is an important part of play, these alliances are formed and broken automatically as the ideological position of you faction changes through the game. That means there is no need for long breaks in play where players 'negotiate' and scheme - all your scheming will happen on the board.
categories: Civil War, Political, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Events, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Puppet Masters
description:
Puppet Masters is a game where players choose from 27 Masters, powerful characters with differing amounts of health or magical prowess, each with special abilities encouraging a certain style of play. Then the players each pick up to two decks from the 18 different factions ranging from undead to angels to steampunk. All chosen decks by all players are shuffled together into a single draw pile, from which the minions, Puppets, are drawn into the arena. These can be bought and used by the players or hunted for money, money which can be spent on spells of destruction or items to buff Puppets. It is a flexible game, addictive, easy to learn but hard to master and fits up to 4 players in free for all or 2v2 formats.

The single draw pile is to guarantee all players have access to all things in the game. If there is something directly counter to your strategy in the game in play, you can either buy it up so your opponent can’t use it or destroy it before they get it. Players can attack each other, each other’s Puppets, or the Puppets in the arena. The replay value of this game is very high due to the massive amount of combinations in the game of Masters and Puppets, plus the different strategies of gaining many cheap puppets or getting just one or two very strong ones and giving them a lot of items, or anything in between.

There are four phases of each turn, during which Players can perform different actions. In the recovery phase players receive gold and replenish their Puppets' energy, and the maintenance phase they can take turns buying items and spells for the upcoming battle. In the possession phase, players bid on Puppets to control using their Master character's strings (a finite resource moved around throughout the battle to control Puppets), the player with the highest bid on a Puppet gets it as their own. Then, finally, the action phase, where players use spells and Puppets to attack each other. Player turns in each round are infinite as long as you have things to do. This is limited instead by money/strings/Puppet strength to perform actions.

The game ends when there is only one player/team left in the game.

The winner is the last Player/Team remaining on the field. If a player is reduced to 0 hit points, they are out of the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Interrupts, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Spartans & Successors
description:
Spartans & Successors is a simple set of wargame rules for the Golden Age of Greek and Macedonian history, enabling the great battles of antiquity to be played with limited numbers of figures in a small playing area.

Using a standard deck of playing cards per player and a gridded playing surface the rules offer a unique game play experience.
With elements of resource management and planning, bluff and the application of historical tactics players can refight the great battles of antiquity with limited figures - armies are the same size as a DBA army - on the kitchen table with minimal set up.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Simulation

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Ranger vanguards
description: When they have to patrol beyond the Wall, the Night's Guards scout on horseback.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Silenced men
description: The crew of Silence, a ship of the Greyjoy fleet, is made up of mutes with extraordinary martial prowess.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: BrewCards
description:
BrewCards is the ultimate pub game. Designed to be played with a pint, BrewCards is a fast-paced card and dice game where players compete to brew the most and best recipes, and if they are lucky, an Awesome Brew along the way. Collect Hops, Grain, Yeast, and Water cards for a basic brew and add Adjuncts or Barrel Aging for a more complex recipe. Roll the dice to see if your brew is successful and maybe even so good that it earns the honor of being an Awesome Brew!

Players draw cards from the deck and lay them down to complete beer recipes, collecting points. Brew as many successful beer recipes as possible. The player with most points wins. Each successful brew and every Awesome Brew token counts as a point.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Persian Carpet
description:
In Persian Carpet board game, each player plays as a carpet weaver artist, weaving carpets in their workshop and competing against other players to sell more carpets (matching the order cards they receive).

The game plays in several rounds (depending on the number of players), and scores will reveal the winner at the end of the final round. Each round contains four phases: 1- Receiving money; 2- Buying yarns; 3- Weaving carpets; and 4- Selling carpets.

At the start of each round, each player receives money from the bank. Then they go to any of the two available markets to buy the yarns they need. Yarn colors with more demands are more expensive.

Any player who has all their needed yarns can start weaving the carpets by rolling dice to fulfill the order cards. Then, each player who has a completed carpet may sell it for money and victory points.

The game ends after a certain number of rounds, and the player with the highest score is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Market, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Green Deal
description:
Green Deal is a strategic cannabis themed card game, for 2-6 players, where your strategy gets busted anyways. This action-packed game takes you directly into another Universe.
