Build your Green Business by collecting pairs and gain points with every Deal. But be careful, you’ve to watch out for Donut-Cops, Aliens, Thieves. Protect yourself with the help of Skunks, playing Hide or with the good old corrupted Donut-Cop. You think you are winning the Game? Within the Green Universe you should never be too sure.

Gather your most beloved family members, friends, frenemies and strangers for a game full of laughter, rivalry and revenge.

Do you have what it takes to become the Master of the Green Universe?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Blessed D20 Promo Tile
description:
Spiel 2021 promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! Whilst walking the hallways of SPIEL, you hear the D20 roll mysteriously. In exchange for some resources, the Demon possessing the D20 will grant you its powers!”
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #71 – Royal Italian Army
description:
In the division of alliances of World War II which saw nations join with the Allies or the Axis, the Italian army found itself on opposing sides as the war progressed. Face the brunt of the Commonwealth 8th Army in North Africa, defend Sicily from the onslaught of the Allies, or fight to liberate Italy from the German occupiers.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Soldiers and Light Vehicle, Italian Hostiles, Gear and Service Record Cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 Italian Player Soldiers
3 Italian Non-Player Soldiers
3 Italian Squad Soldiers
1 Italian Squad Light Vehicle
1 Skill
11 Weapons and Gear
3 Service Record Cards
30 Italian Hostiles
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #82 – Raid on Saint-Nazaire
description:
The raid on the French Atlantic coastal town of Saint-Nazaire, Operation Chariot, is one of the most audacious operations in the history of warfare. The obsolete destroyer HMS Campbeltown was disguised to resemble a German vessel and rammed the Normandie dry dock gates, blowing it up and putting it out of service until after the war. At the same time, a force of Royal Marines Commandos landed in the town to attack the harbour facilities and other infrastructure, whilst sowing havoc and reaping chaos amongst the enemy garrison. As most of the transports for extraction were destroyed or immobilized, many of the raiding Commando force were killed or captured when their ammunition ran out.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Europe game, including new Royal Marines Commandos Soldiers, Embedded German Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Locations, Gear and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

5 Royal Marine Commando Player Soldiers
4 Royal Marine Commando Non-Player Soldiers
5 Royal Marine Commando Squad Soldiers
6 Missions
7 Objectives
14 Locations
1 Skill
9 Weapons + Gear
3 Hostiles
2 Situation
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: BattleTech: ilClan
description: Experience the tumultuous Battle of Terra, which will shake the very foundations of the Inner Sphere. Then catch a glimpse of how the Great Houses and other major powers will face the outcome of this far-reaching conflict. Tactical maps, Chaos Campaign tracks, and new ’Mechs that debuted during the Battle of Terra all let you jump right into the cockpit and fight in the culmination of over three centuries of Clan history. Do you have what it takes to conquer the birthplace of humankind, or the courage to defend Terra from its enemies?
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: BattleTech: Wolf's Dragoons Assault Star
description:
The Wolf's Dragoons are the most well-known and respected mercenary command in the Inner Sphere and their Mech Warriors are some of the most skilled and feared across hundreds of worlds. Once more, the Inner Sphere is poised for war and the Wolf's Dragoons are on the forefront.

This B&N Exclusive Expansion set includes the new Annihilator, as well as re-posed Timber wolf and Rifleman and new variants of the Archer and Blackjack BattleMechs - no assembly required - along with 10 MechWarrior pilot cards and five Alpha Strike cards! Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Crown Craft
description:
Blacksmiths of Everland rejoice! The royal family of a prosperous kingdom has announced the new successor to the throne. To let the heir shine as bright as possible, the family has promissed a large reward for providing a unique crown. Forges from all over the nation are invited to join this competition. Gather your workers, mine beautiful gemstones and prove your craft skills. Whoever provides the most intriguing crown, is praised by the royals.

Crown Craft is a competitive game for up to 4 players, where every player tries to craft the most fantastic-looking crown. In order to do that they visit the mines, pick their desired gems, and socket them into the crown they have prepared. Gems are mined by rolling dice and pairing the results with the gem values to claim them. Most gems provide special effects, such as dice manipulation abilities and extra income, and of course, Victory Points.

Players may use those gems to complete their crown, to sell them or to gift them to the academy. The latter will in return provide magical tools so they can upgrade their forges! Present the most beautiful crown at the end of the game, and win the royal families favor!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Income, Pattern Building, Re-rolling and Locking, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Eagles over Europe
description:
Recreate the Air War over the European theater of World War II as part of the epic clash between the Allies and Germans in some of the most historic battles of World War II, during the years 1941-1945.
Eagles Over Europe is a historical boardgame where players take the roles of US Army Airforce and the RAF (including the Polish pilots, of course!) to participate in WWII's most famous battles, including Omaha Beach, Pegasus Bridge, Operation Cobra, and the Ardennes (Battle of the Bulge). You'll also deal with the bombing campaign, as Mustangs and Thunderbolts try to protect the B-17s from hordes of Luftwaffe fighters.
Eagles Over Europe includes over 15 battle scenarios, all fought out on a huge, 140 cm x 100 cm game board (55" x 39"). Each scenario recreates the historical objectives of the two sides, and includes special events that impacted the battle's outcome.
Eagles Over Europe is designed to be easy-entry, but the game mechanics require strategic card play and finding skillful combinations between the dice, the symbols on the cards, and pilot abilities. In addition to the huge gameboard, Eagles over Europe includes detailed airplane miniatures, beautifully illustrated Combat cards, Scenario, Event and Pilot cards. Special Terrain tiles and Custom dice complete the "wow" people will feel when they open the box.
Those familiar with the "303 Squadron" game will recognize the core game mechanics but enjoy additions like Flak, RADAR, ground attack, and many more. But you don't have to have 303 Squadron to play Eagles Over Europe-- it is a totally free-standing game.
Eagles Over Europe is designed as a co-operative game for 1 - 4 players. The average game length is between 60 and 90 minutes. Each scenario includes innovative and clever mechanics, dynamic gameplay, and startling surprises...all "normal" for Eagles Over Europe!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: Road Trippin: After Dark Expansion Pack
description: 300+ Adult Only Phrases on cards to use with the Road Tripping board game. Definitely not for kids!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Deduction, Race

name: Inns & Outcasts
description:
Inns & Outcast is a 3-8 player card game set in a high fantasy setting. Players take on the role of adventurers who’ve completed their quest, and now are undergoing the process of divvying up loot scored during their epic undertaking. Characters clash in constant combat for coinage each round. The game is set in the recently rebranded City of Destiny™. A bustling boomtown transformed from the tiny hamlet of Po’Dunk. Where there was once a village on the verge of collapse, now stands a thriving metropolis filled to the brim with hustlers and cons. It has become the go-to place for every Hero, Villain, and Mercenary looking to find their place in the world and is in fact the number one tourist trap. The city’s ever-changing population leaves only its world-famous hospitality service in its wake. The only permanent fixture of the city being its Inns & Outcasts.

Players start each turn by simultaneously placing a card face down, then counting up initiatives from 1-6. Once a card’s initiative is called, all cards of that initiative are revealed. Players make short decisions regarding the specifics of their abilities, then proceed until all cards are shown. When all cards are revealed, special abilities kick in which allows players to add coins to their personal hoard.

Players can make income either through their starting gold (a fixed amount of gold determined by each character card) or through their special abilities. Special abilities can come in the form of reveal effects – which happen instantly, or through loot abilities which compound at the end of each turn. Loot abilities are high-risk, high reward as they can often be blocked by other cards. Once a card is played, it stays out until 5 turns have gone by, allowing all players to refresh their hands. It’s a game about reading your opponents and the situation at hand to make big gains while slowing down your opponents.

The player having the most money at the end of the game being the winner. The game ends once a player crosses a threshold of currency, which is determined by group size – but just because you’re the first over the line doesn’t guarantee a win.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Role Order, Variable Phase Order

name: BattleTech: Racice River Delta/Deployment Zone Battlemat
description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Racice River Delta (Clan Smoke Jaguar) on one side and Deployment Zone on the other side.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat Bundle
description:
Bring Car Wars Sixth Edition to life with these two 36" x 36" custom playmats that can be used separately or combined into one massive combat arena!

This bundle includes:

Playmat #1 - The asphalt combat arena, which comes with 30 game cards and a rule sheet
Playmat #3 - The off-road arena
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Race, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: The Legacy Game
description:
A mystery box filled with puzzles, evidence, and interviews will be delivered to your door. Each box is a standalone mystery that requires no additional boxes to complete.

Hillview Academy is the most elite private school in Valley Falls. Six of Hillview’s finest receive a mysterious invitation in their locker to participate in something called The Legacy Game. The game will begin promptly at midnight in the local cemetery at the gravesite of Jefferson F. Pritchard, which the letter describes as one of Valley Falls' most infamous citizens. The invitation, sent from someone calling themselves The Headmaster, promises a life-changing reward for the winner. However, no one has ever heard of Jefferson F. Pritchard, and Hillview Academy doesn't have a headmaster. What is The Legacy Game, who is The Headmaster, and what is so special about a dead man that doesn't show up in any of the Valley Falls history books? Play The Legacy Game and find out!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Interplanetary: A giant hop for Squeakind
description:
An automata-free solo experience about exploring and settling in one's solar system, with an entirely player-driven gameplay system and very few random elements.

Billions watched the live global broadcast of the first Squeak hopping on the Mun over 50 years ago. Now, the various nations on planet Tree have finally come together as the United Forests and have created a planet-wide space program to peacefully explore their solar system. You have been selected as Head of the Exploratory Branch of that program! Send probes into the void to reach distant moons and comets. Go where no Squeak has gone before and put two adorable little paws on another planet. Design and construct never-before seen spacecraft, purpose-made for your missions in interplanetary space. Peacefully explore the Squeak's solar system and establish research outposts on its many worlds and moons. Maybe, just maybe, make startling discoveries out on the final frontier and herald a new era for all of Squeakind!

This solo-game is an entirely player-driven experience, there are no turns and there is no opponent or random events. In 'Interplanetary', you are tackling a "campaign deck" that presents you with a semi-random list of goals you need to achieve, called "directives".
After the initial setup, play consists of you picking an action from a (rather long) list, executing that action and then paying its cost by moving a cube along a numbered track. This cube tracks the available amount of actions to fulfill your current directive.
Each time the cube reaches the end of its track, the campaign deck gets updated and if you take too long, you might have failed your current directive. When the campaign deck runs out, you tally your score and if that score is better than your previous scores, you can rejoice!

In summary, this is a game of heavy action-economy optimization. You are trying to fulfill your goal with the most optimal sequence of actions while trying to improve your overall situation to have a better chance to also tackle the next directive.

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Contracts, Finale Ending, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Moc Słowa biblijna gra planszowa
description:
The Power of the Word is a board game where you can learn stories about the Lord Jesus and spend a great time with your family or friends.

The game is introduced by a story about people who are looking for treasures. They found the chest with fragments of priceless woven paintings depicting scenes from the Gospel. Now the treasure is in the hands of the players. They have beautiful, multi-colored cards with scenes from the Gospel in front of them, as well as pictures and words from the Bible.

On their turn, they decide which dice to roll and which cards to draw. They should do this in such a way as to create the highest scoring collections.

The winner is the one who scores the most points and reaches the finish line with his pawn the fastest.


Moc Słowa to gra planszowa, dzięki której można poznać opowieści o Panu Jezusie i spędzić doskonały czas z rodziną lub przyjaciółmi.Do gry wprowadza historia o ludziach, którzy poszukują skarbów. Odnaleźli skrzynię, a w niej fragmenty bezcennych, tkanych obrazów, ukazujących sceny z Ewangelii.
Teraz skarb znajduje się w rękach graczy. Mają przed sobą piękne, wielobarwne karty ze scenami z Ewangelii, a także obrazki i słowa z Biblii. W swojej turze decydują, którą kostką rzucić i które dobrać karty. Powinni to zrobić w taki sposób, by utworzyć najwyżej punktowane kolekcje.

Wygra ten, kto zdobędzie najwięcej punktów i najszybciej dotrze swoim pionkiem do mety.

Gra rozwija spostrzegawczość, myślenie strategiczne i przede wszystkim wiedzę biblijną.
Poznaj Biblię. Odkrywaj Moc Biblijnego Słowa.
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 4th Street Basketball
description:
4th Street Basketball recreates the excitement of NBA or collegiate action by maximizing your team's talents against your opponent's. Use the driving, passing, defensive, rebounding, and shooting skills of your individually-rated players to magnify their team's productivity. Concepts include ball movement, defensive play (man-to-man, zone, press) and shooting in 3 different levels.

On their turn, each player rolls five color-coded six-sided dice that can determine a variety of actions: player match-ups, offensive play setups, and even the offensive plays themselves. As per the rules of standard NBA or collegiate basketball, the highest score at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: CARDtographer: Cooperative Storytelling Adventure
description:
Tired of game nights that end with frustration, or staring at boring screens? Introducing CARDtographer, the collaborative storytelling card game for legendary heroes!

Enter a new world of adventure where you and your friends join forces with mighty heroes to create a map exploring the vibrant fantasy world of Terrath! Stand against dastardly villains, and cleanse your corruption, to stop the vile dragon Luxian from destroying the world! Trade cards and tell stories inspired by unique card prompts, but be ready for when Luxian swoops down to raid your lands! Play as 6 unique hero classes with world-saving abilities. Enjoy laughs, intrigue, infinite replay, and story variety! Easy to learn fun to play. Now is your time to fight the dragon, not each other!

Players work together to create a world map (3x3 card square) by telling exploration adventure stories before the evil dragon Luxian destroys the world!

On your turn, draw a card, and then you may choose to do one of the following:

1. Trade - Trade one Story card (Hero, Villain, or Location) for another player’s Story card.
2. Cleanse - Remove a Corruption card from your hand by discarding it and a matching “cleansing” Hero card.
3. Explore - Tell a solo story exploring a land by combining one of each Story card type (Hero, Villain, and Location).
4. Raid - Instantly join forces with all the other players to tell a combined story standing against a random raid attack by the evil dragon Luxian!

The game ends when every player has told at least one solo story, and all 9 “map” slots are filled with cards. Explored Locations, failed Raids, and Corruption cards form a 3x3 grid on the table, completing your map. The group scores (1) victory point for each successfully explored Location card. If the majority of the 9 cards are successfully explored Locations, the heroes are victorious! If all 9 are successfully explored Locations, celebrate a perfect victory as top tier “CARDtographers”!
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Bitecoin Promo Card
description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2021!

Text on the card:

Bitecoin
Prize
Bitecoin counts as a Gold Piece. Whenever a player gains Bitecoin in any way other that winning it in a Round of Gambling, that player loses 1 Fortitude. If Bitecoin would be paid to the Inn, it goes to the Prize Bin instead. If you pass out while you have Bitecoin, it goes to the Prize Bin before you split the rest of your Gold.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Histories of the Empire Volume 1: The Stormcloak Rebellion
description:
Histories of the Empire, Volume 1: The Stormcloak Rebellion is a narrative driven expansion to The Elder Scroll: Call to Arms. Enabling its players to take part in pivotal events such as the search for the Jagged Crown and the Battle for Whiterun, culminating with the final push on the capitals of Solitude or Windhelm.

It includes a three-part campaign detailing the rise or fall of the Stormcloak Rebellion in their fight against the Imperial Legion. The first act details the skirmishes and rising tensions that lead to the Battle for Whiterun. The second places the player in command of their chosen faction, allowing them to tactically decide which holds to attack and gradually push their front lines toward the enemy’s capital. The third and final act entirely focuses on the siege of a faction’s capital, moving from the walls into the city itself and culminating in the hero’s facing each other for a final confrontation that will decide the fate of Skyrim.

Included within this book are new rules for setting your battles within any of the nine Holds of Skyrim. From Haafingar with its soaring peaks to The Rift and its many beast nests. These new Hold rules allow players to further expand on the environment mechanics presented in the core rules and experience more thematic battlefields.

Building and expanding on the existing rules for Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms, this book offers new and exciting experiences for fighting in Tamriel. Adding extra effects to environments, altering what equipment each faction can take and offering thematic bonuses based on the holds the player controls, these expanded rules add a new depth to the game so the player can truly control how their faction handles the war.

Also included are rules for an entirely new faction - Hold Guards. Included are Heroes, Followers and Adversary cards that can be used as allies or enemies in your struggle for dominance.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Vehicle Guide
description:
In this 70 page book are suggested vehicle builds for the 32 miniatures released in the Car Wars Sixth Edition four player core game and four miniature set expansions. There are 32 builds for smaller games, and 32 more for larger games, making a total of 64 unique designs that utilize game cards from the sets listed below:


Core Set
Miniatures Set 1
Miniatures Set 2
Miniatures Set 3
Miniatures Set 4
Armory Pack
Linked Weapons Pack
Crew Pack
Dropped Weapons Pack
Uncle Al's Upgrade Pack


Also included are two scenarios that provide custom arena setups and unique, scenario-specific rules to add even more variety, strategy, and chaos to your duels.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Impulse Movement, Race, Simulation, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Zookeepers: Promo Cards
description:
Expand your "Zookeepers" game with these 10 new special species to save:

Card #1 - American flamingo
Card #2 - One-horned rhinoceros
Card #3 - Manchurian crane
Card #4 - Green aracari
Card #5 - Black-and-white ruffed lemur
Card #6 - Hyacinth macaw
Card #7 - Slender-tailed meerkat
Card #8 - Common Green Iguana
Card #9 - Common Bottlenose Dolphin
Card #10 - Frilled Lizard
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rocket Rescue
description:
The world is a desolate wasteland and you try to evacuate your crew before it is too late. You research rocket technology, build modules and sell them to space companys that fly your crew to far away places. But do the rockets have enough fuel and shielding for this dangerour journey? Whoever manages to rescue their crew first is the winner of this race to outer space.

A fun strategy game with secret action selection, resource management, cards and dice.
In each phase the player with the highest die/dice goes first and the higher the die the better the abilities. But be careful, as the higher the dice the more energy you have to spend. Draft rocket technologies and build them with resources from a market where the availability of the goods depends on the demand. Build rockets by yourself or together and be the first to board them with your crew. Launch the rockets and aim for different planets with various hazards and rewards.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Commodity Speculation, Die Icon Resolution, Market, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Predictive Bid, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Ghosts Love Candy Too: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
description:
Set of four promo cards for the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

The pack includes four new kids that can be mixed into your deck of kids, each with new abilities not found on other cards:


Game Reviewer - Tell everyone your least favorite candy. You may then swap up to 3 of those candies from your stash for any treats in the neighborhood or discard pile.



Dice Tower - Discard a kid from the deck and look at its number. If it is 20 or lower, discard a candy. If it is 80 or higher take a treat from the discard.



Bowl of Cereal - The first player in turn order must haunt the Bowl of Cereal or place a treat on them.



Meeple - You may place a treat from your stash on any other kid in the neighborhood then use their ability if able.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Tricks
description:
A trick-taking card game.

First, draw cards from the deck, or from the face-up card next to it, until you reach the hand size limit.
Then, the player must place at least 1 card from their hand onto the board. During your turn, you may play up to all cards in your hand. If you "Recycle" a card from a captured super trick you also play it, in addition to the cards from your hand.

Eventually you will run out of cards to draw from the deck - then players stop drawing but still must lay down at least 1 card per turn until their hands are empty. At this point, cards on each players side are automatically captured by those players. The cards left in the middle remain neutral. Count up your captured cards, and whoever has more is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Trick-taking

name: Here to Slay: Howl of the Dead mini and promo card
description:
Howl of the Dead: Discard a Hero or Item card.
Card text:
If you Discard a Hero card, Destroy a Hero card.
If you Discard an Item card, add a Hero card from the discard pile to your hand."

Howl of the Dead is a new mini in the Here to Slay Vinyl Mini Series which comes with a promo card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Here to Slay: Reigning King mini and promo card
description:
Reigning King:
Card text: Choose a Class. Destroy all Hero cards of that Class.

Reigning King is a new mini in the Here to Slay Vinyl Mini Series which comes with a promo card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tainted Grail: Item Sets Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of Pack D from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Basic rule:
Whenever you meet the requirements of a set (ie: you have the required cards or attributes), you may take its card and place it next to your items.

At any moment, if you stop meeting the requirements of a set (ie: because you had to discard an item), you must discard its card and the rules of the set stop affecting your character immediately.

Includes 5 cards:
Druid Set
Wyrdprowler Set
Knight Errait Set
Clan Warrior Set
Trapper Set
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing

name: Second World War at Sea: Plan Z – Fleet Air Arm
description:
Golden Journal No. 45: Fleet Air Arm is a Plan Z variant, built around the East of Suez sheet. You get an embiggened version of the usual book plus this time 210 die-cut pieces instead of the usual 20 to 40. That is a lot of ships, including scads of Royal Navy light and escort carriers and of course the airplanes to fly off of them and some escorting cruisers and destroyers and suchlike.

For the Journal, we’ll have a set of Plan Z scenarios that give the Brits lots of flight decks and the planes for them, and go with an oversized book.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel HeroClix: Fantastic Four Future Foundation Booster Brick
description:
Reed Richards assembled the Future Foundation because an entire generation of geniuses would do more good than he ever could. Whether you’re fighting the Heralds of Galactus or Dr. Doom, you’ll be able to build a team of characters that support and LEARN NEW ABILITIES from one another!

The set contains characters from the Fantastic Four and the Marvel Universe. The game is played on a gridded map that is 24x36 inches. the game is played with prepainted miniatures. the goal of the game is to either defeat your opponents entire team or accumulate more points than your opponent in a timed game. Each miniature is allocated a certain number of points printed on the base of the mini.1 vs 1 miniatures collectible game.

The game plays much like a miniatures game. Most of the vital statistical information is directly on the base of the characters, which can be rotated as characters take damage from hits.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Takedown
description:
The FBI is in pursuit of La Famiglia's leader, Vincent Milano. There's a break in the case when gunfire from a warehouse is reported. Upon arrival, law enforcement find several members of Milano's gang deceased from an intense shootout. The warehouse is filled with confusing evidence, and the FBI reaches out to you to help unravel these mysterious events. Can you take down Milano?

The Takedown contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun.

The Takedown is the second game of the Famiglia Series, the sequel to La Famiglia.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 1453 Istanbul 'un Fethi
description: Semi-cooperative game about the Fall of Constantinople 1453. Up to 5 players may play as a Commander of the Ottoman forces. The Byzantines are represented by cards which are played by the Commanders to negate the strengths of the opposing Commanders. Byzantium must fall within 20 turns or the Ottomans will lose; the winning Commander is the Commander with the most fronts conquered when Byzantium Falls.
mechanics: Semi-Cooperative Game

name: I'm Right, You're Wrong: Game-Breaker Expansion Pack
description: Game-Breaker is an expansion pack for I'm Right You're Wrong. It contains 6 mind bending cards that transcend reality and literally BREAK the game. Come back from the dead and completely flip things on your opponents.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Take That

name: Furtivo
description:
Strategy game for two players.

The object of Sneaky is to be the first player to capture all five of your opponent's checkers.

The game has two dice, one of movement (from 1 to 3) and another Furtive dice, empty on five sides and with an eye on the sixth. The player will roll the dice secretly and will be able to lie about the result, being able to play a "bluff".

-------------------------------------------------------------------Juego de estrategia para dos jugadores.
El objetivo de Furtivo es ser el primer jugador en capturar las cinco fichas del oponente.
El juego dispone de dos dados, uno de movimiento (de 1 a 3) y otro dado Furtivo, vacío en cinco caras y con un ojo en la sexta.
El jugador tirará los dados de forma secreta y podrá mentir sobre el resultado, pudiendo jugar un “farol”.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling

name: Escape from Ice Age Park
description:
Two chapters await in this brand new adventure. Your arch-enemy is up to no good again… This time, he has gone back in time and nabbed a bunch of extinct creatures and has opened one of the most exciting theme parks in the world…Ice Age Park. Messing around with time is exactly what you are trying to avoid, so of course you have been sent to the Grand Opening to check it out. After all… who wouldn’t want to play with a baby mammoth? It becomes immediately apparent that some corners were cut with security. Stranded in the middle of a zoo in lockdown, you need to match your wits against mother nature to escape with your very lives! The ice below your feet is cracking, a rhino stampede has taken out the gift shop, and an out of control hot air balloon drifts into the heavens… but nothing compares to the feeling of being hunted. The saber-tooth cats are loose and they are hungry. Fast and cunning, they are hot on your trail and you don’t want to be around when they catch up. Solve the puzzles, crack the codes, and uncover the secrets to get the park back online… and to avoid the jaws of defeat.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Escape the Ripper
description:
For the last few months, the citizens of London have been outraged, appalled, and terrified by the killings of the notorious Jack the Ripper. Stalking the foggy streets of the Whitechapel for fresh victims, the cloaked figure has already killed 5 women and he seems to be ready to murder again. It is up to you to put an end to his reign of terror. Two missions await in this box. The first is a family-friendly mystery in the elegant home of one of the ripper suspects. It is up to you to confirm his identity, uncover hidden passages, and discover his role in this classic escape adventure. The second, however, is a PG-13 adventure that will put you in the dark alleys of London… one step behind the ripper… where you will examine his latest victims and find yourself hot on his trail. Let’s hope that he doesn’t turn his attention on you. It is our scariest mission yet. Can you escape the ripper?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: From the Cellar: Pack 11
description:
This issue includes 10 accompanying ETO scenarios that will take you from Dunkerque to the snow covered Russian winter, Italy or Walcheren island and the replacement countersheet for "The Green Hell of Inor", countersheet # 3.

The following scenarios are included:

FT304 - Loosening the noose: Notre Dame des Neiges, South of
Dunkerque, France, June 3rd 1940
FT305 - Kutrik: Kutrik, Volchov, Russia, April 2nd 1942
FT306 - Stalin’s Orders: Kolsovo, Russia, 28 July 1942
FT307 - Backstabbing Paratroopers: Svidovok, Russia , 13 November 1943
FT308 - Luchs: RudnIaweresnia, Russia, 9 December 1943
FT309 - Smoke on the Water: Acquafondata, Italy, 12 January 1944
FT310 - Back to the River: Dornot bridgehead, France, 8 September 1944
FT311 - Five-Oh-Sink: Outskirts of Eindhoven, Netherlands, 18 September 1944
FT312 - Near Dishoek, Walcheren island, 2 November 1944
FT313 - Sainte Barbe on Fire: Cité Sainte-Barbe, Wittenheim, France, 2 February 1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Neko Harbour: The Card Game – Fishing Boat promo card
description:
Adds 10 extra Fishing Boat cards to the game, with their own ability to score extra points.

The designer added it into the Kickstarter version He also added it to the rulebook in the KS version. It was added after the game was finished.

A mini-expansion included in the first print run! With this expansion, players have more interactions with each other. Also, it increases the Coin's value. Now Coin has became an even more important resource for the game. Well... it's true that travels to Antarctica is expensive!
Includes 10 cards:
- 5 x Period 1 cards
- 5 x Period 2 cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Open Drafting, Resource to Move

name: The Artist
description:
A Deadbolt Mystery Society mini mystery.

Nicolas Polk was a gifted artist. Even as a student enrolled in Valley Falls University’s prestigious art program, his work always stood head and shoulders above the rest. Fittingly enough, Nicolas was announced as the winner of the annual LaBelle Art Show. Imagine everyone's surprise, however, when the young savant was found dead the next morning inside the art gallery. Can you catch the killer before they get away with a picture-perfect crime?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Spelled
description:
Spelled is a deckbuilding word game between two or more magic-wielding witches and wizards. Each of your cards is a letter that can be spelled as a word to deal damage and gain powerful abilities. But each spell can hit just one target – so longer words aren’t always the best bet, giving a fair fight even if your opponent is a loquacious wordsmith...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – RPM – Get in Gear
description:
Pedal to the Metal!
The Venjix computer virus has built armies of robots and taken over the world! The only thing that stands in the way are the Ranger Operators. Faster-than-ever gameplay includes new strategies such as building up RPM to penetrate your foe's defenses or draining their energy to leave them weakened!

This expansion requires the Power Rangers Deck-Building Game Core Set or Zeo – Stronger Than Before to play.

Features:
Over 75 new cards!
Expansion: Requires Power Rangers Deck-Building Core Set or Zeo - Stronger Than Before to play

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game

name: Diabolik: La lama della vendetta
description:
Diabolik Storie - La Lama della Vendetta (The Blade of Vengeance) is a collaborative crime-themed game, in which it is possible to impersonate the well-known comic book character and his partner Eva Kant. Players must work together to complete a heist, interactively reliving the story of the comic book of the same name released in April 2018.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Diabolik Storie – La Lama della Vendetta è un gioco collaborativo a tema crime, in cui è possibile impersonare il noto personaggio dei fumetti e la sua compagna Eva Kant. I giocatori devono collaborare per portare a termine un colpo, rivivendo in modo interattivo la storia dell’omonimo albo a fumetti uscito nell’aprile del 2018, il cui straordinario successo ha dato origine a un sequel. Come? Usando i noti gadget del Re del Terrore come maschere, pugnali e la sua inconfondibile Jaguar, interagendo con i personaggi della storia e stando attenti a evitare la polizia guidata dal commissario Ginko.

Ma Diabolik Storie non è solo un gioco di carte a se stante, ma può essere infatti utilizzato per espandere e approfondire l’esperienza del gioco da tavolo Diabolik Colpi e Crimini, diventando un’espansione a tutti gli effetti.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Programmed Movement

name: Viva La Dungeon!: Level One
description:
People from all over the realm come to the Dungeon with the hopes of winning gold, magic and glory. They are not heroes. They are not trained. They do not have supernatural powers. And only one of them is going to survive.

Viva La Dungeon! is a battle-royal dungeon-crawling game of hidden movement, treasure-looting and player versus player combat for up to 4 players.

Players move around the Dungeon, finding equipment, and finding each other to pick-pocket or fight while the Gelatinous Cubes slowly make the map smaller and smaller.

Based off the live Twitch game show, Viva La Dungeon brings the chaotic fun of the livestream to your family's game table.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement

name: GOOCON Dice Baseball
description:
Baseball dice game with elements of Sun Tzu's Art of War

· Both sides take turns rolling the dice, and the two characters of the dice represent the result.
· Whoever scores the most at the end of nine innings wins, or whoever gets 18 first.

The dice text comes from Sun Tzu's Art of War.

It is as swift as the wind, as slow as the forest, as plundering as fire, as immovable as a mountain, as difficult to know as shadow, as moving as thunder.
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: Goocon CO., LTD (雁隼有限公司)

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Juggernaut
description:
This character pack brings the Juggernaut to life on the tabletop with a beautifully- sculpted Juggernaut miniature, as well as a stat card outlining all of his abilities. If his brute strength isn’t enough, three Team Tactic cards unlock even more ways for him to be a disruptive force on the battlefield.

Cain Marko is the Juggernaut, a human wrecking ball of unstoppable force who lays waste to everything unlucky enough to be in his path. He was once an average human before discovering the Crimson Gem of Cyttorak, a conduit to the power of the deity of the Crimson Cosmos, that transformed Marko into the Juggernaut. Possessing unfathomable strength and durability, he is among the strongest physical beings alive. Juggernaut has endless strength and kinetic power, with the ability to shatter mountains, and a mystical force field makes him impervious to any harm. Once he gains momentum, nothing on Earth can stop his advance.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tributo de Sangre: Annual, 1921
description:
Tributo de Sangre (Tribute of Blood) is an operational game for two players, framed in the colonial conflict that confronted the Spanish Army with the hardened local tribes of the Rif (North of the Moroccan Sultanate) which was administered by Spain as a Protectorate. The game focuses on the peak phase of the conflict, led by the Campaign before and after the so-called "Annual Disaster" (1921), which caused the death in combat of thousands of Spanish soldiers. A tragic episode that would decisively mark the political and military future of Spain during the two incoming decades.

Tribute of Blood is a card driven game, with a map of areas that replicates the domains of the Riffian tribes, and a network of connected spaces that allow a “point to point” movement through a rugged territory, suitable for ambushes and surprise raids The basic mechanics consist of the use of action points to deploy movement, logistics, offensive and diplomatic operations. The events of the cards will serve as drivers of these actions, while providing the necessary "historical flavor". During each game turn, players will be able to launch raids, incursions, charges, sieges, assaults..., as well as pressure their opponent with various diplomatic actions.

In Tribute of Blood, one player represents the Spanish Army and another the Riffian rebels. The game can be summarized in a pendulum movement, with both sides adopting offensive and defensive postures during different phases of the Campaign: the Rif side enjoys the initiative during the first turns and has the chance to cause a disaster similar to the historical one in Spanish lines. Starting on turns 6 and 7, the Spanish reinforcements will even the scales and provide the opportunity to regain control of the territory and avenge their deaths. The game is asymmetrical in many of its mechanics, beginning with the different positional "habitat" of each of the contenders: the Spanish formations move from point to point, through connection lines, while the Riffian rebels (harcas) unfold and move inside and through the areas (Cabilas). This means that there is not a defined combat front, and the Spanish must launch constant incursions to confront Abd-el Krim's warriors. It is a simulation of an irregular and asymmetric warfare, with interesting innovations on mechanics and interactions.

Tribute of Blood consists of the following scenarios, each with an increasing level of depth and complexity:

- 1. Historical Scenario: "Annual's Disaster" (5 turns)
- 2. Alternative Scenario: "Avoiding Disaster" (5 turns)
- 3. Advanced Scenario: “Recapture of the Kert” (11 turns)
- 4. Annual Campaign; 1921: (16 turns)
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Roma aeterna
description:
Roma aeterna is a strategic game for four players aged 14 and over with a historical background.

The game is based on the eventful history of Italy and its peoples in the period from 290 BC to 1140 AD. At the beginning of the game, the players are assigned certain peoples according to their game colour. Some of these peoples are already on the board at the beginning of the game, others are added in the course of the game.

A Roma aeterna game lasts about four to six hours and comprises a total of 16 game rounds.

Within the individual game rounds, the players continuously collect victory points for the successful execution of certain actions and for the possession of certain territories by their peoples. The winner of the game is the player who has scored the most victory points with his or her peoples at the end of game round 16.

Roma aeterna is a game in the so-called Britannia style. So if you like games in this style, you will love Roma aeterna...
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Stat Check Resolution, Voting

name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Penumbral Pack
description: The Penumbral Plane is one of Tanares's signature environments, a dark mirror of reality, where the most horrific Tanarean aberrations dwell, embodying dark emotions and negative thoughts. Face the powerful, huge penumbral dragon in Adventure in the Realms of Madness or join his side on Dragon Collection's Boss v Boss Game Mode. The monsters all come with stat block cards and are tne most powerful villains we've designed for Tanares Adventures, as you'll face them in the new (Epic) campaign arc.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: G.R.I.M. INC.: Gettin' Weird
description:
G.R.I.M. INC. is expanding, with all the morbid mayhem you know and love!

The Gettin’ Weird pack gives you 60 new cards to add to your G.R.I.M. INC. deck! More death, more ridiculousness, more… Pies?

Requires the main game G.R.I.M. INC.

Extra rules exclusive to this deck (funnily enough, they are weird!).

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Storytelling

name: Crimibox: Dossier Oorlog
description:
With the arrival of an enigmatic diary, panic erupts at the C.R.I.M. headquarters. The diary turns out to be old and comes from an ominous period in history. It was the key to untold horror many years ago. Can you bury the hatchet before the blood-curdling past repeats itself?

Dive into the mystery and uncover the shadowy past. Play your cards right and you may single-handedly avoid the bloody future that awaits.

Solve your own murder mystery. With the help of a chat bot you investigate police files, photo's and evidence. Search the internet and use social media to unravel the secrets of your suspects.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Star Wars: Legion – Gar Saxon Commander Expansion
description:
The ruthless Mandalorian warrior Gar Saxon blasts his way into Star Wars: Legion as a commander in Maul’s Shadow Collective! Filled with a desire for power and dominance, Saxon gives players even more options for their Shadow Collective forces with his elite Mandalorian training. What’s more, three command cards represent the brute strength and underhanded tactics he’s willing to use to ensure victory. Finally, seven upgrade cards give players the chance to equip Saxon with an array of deadly weaponry, including his iconic Galar-90 rifle, jetpack rockets, and a ZX flame projector.

Contents:
1 Miniature
1 Unit Card
3 Command Cards
7 Upgrade Cards
13 Assorted Tokens
1 Insert Sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – Dark Age
description: Technical Readout: Dark Age expands on Technical Readout: Succession Wars, Technical Readout: Clan Invasion, and Technical Readout: Jihad by combining the ’Mechs previously found in Technical Readout: 3075, Technical Readout: 3085 (and its Supplemental), Technical Readout: 3145, Technical Readout: Irregulars, Technical Readout: Prototypes, and more. This volume features some of the most common ’Mechs from the Dark Age. Each machine is accompanied by an illustration, a description of its history, capabilities, and game stats.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Clue: Dexter
description:
Miami Metro PD is on the hunt for a homicidal monster, but another unseen threat is at large.

Will following the clues allow law enforcement to protect the city, or will the criminal succumb to a different kind of justice?

Get behind the badges of Debra Morgan, Maria Laguerta, Angel Batista, Vince Masuka, James Doakes, and Joey Quinn to scope out locations around Miami.

You must determine WHICH serial killer is accountable, WHO will apprehend them, and WHERE they’ll be caught!

Contents:
1 Game Board
6 Investigator Movers
6 Personality Cards
21 Rumor Cards
25 Intrigue Cards
6 Killer Tokens
Custom Score Pad
2 Dice
Envelope
Rules

-description from publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: BattleTech: Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance
description: Unleash the Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance on your enemies! Included is the new Sagittaire, as well as a re-posed Banshee, and new variants of the Cyclops and a jumping Thunderbolt—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Taphonomy: Dead or Fossilized
description:
Through competitive play, game players learn about taphonomy (i.e., processes that affect an organism as it fossilizes). They explore how the organism’s biology, the environment it was deposited in, the physical and chemical changes during burial and decomposition, as well as discovery biases, can influence whether or not an organism is collected. Players attempt to preserve the best fossil collection by “time traveling” to the Jurassic; there they protect their specimens from taphonomic factors (either from random environmental events or other players) and learn what processes enhance or diminish preservation. Players then return to the present to recover their specimens and learn that collection issues can also bias sample recovery.

Developed by former Ph.D. student, Anna Weiss, and Dr. Rowan Martindale at The Jackson School of Geosciences at The University of Texas at Austin, play this educational board game at your favorite game night or as an educational tool in your classroom! The game can be played with 2-4 people (or more if you playing teams) and is fun for ages 12+!

Want to use this game in your high school or college classroom? Check out the Activity Description on the SERC "Teach The Earth" webpage; the board game is part of their "Exemplary Activities Collection".
categories: Ancient, Animals, Educational, Environmental, Prehistoric, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: The Board of Regents of The University of Texas System

name: Conqueror of Dune
description:
Conqueror of Dune is a game for 1-5 players based on the books by Frank Herbert about desert planet Arrakis, also known as – Dune. In this game, player will take control of one of 5 houses; house
Atreides, house Harkonnen, house Corriono, house Ordos or Fremen tribes. Objective of the game is to accumulate the highest influence in the Lanssrad and control at least 3 locations on the planet. To do this, players will use Spice and Troops of their house to sway numerous battles to their advantage.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Auction/Bidding, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Negotiation, Tug of War

name: El Rif: Una Guerra Olvidada
description:
The Rif War, also called the Second Moroccan War, was an armed conflict fought from 1911 to 1927 between the Spanish colonial authorities and the French colonial Empire and the Berber tribes of the mountainous Rif region of Northern Morocco.

El Rif: Una Guerra Olvidada ("The Rif, a forgotten war"), is a 2 player card driven wargame which depicts the war in the Rif region of Northern Morocco from 1911-1927.

The Rif includes a deck of strategy cards for conducting campaigns and incorporating the many events and personalities of the war. The Spanish player can build special units 5Legion, regulares, tanks), naval and air units, pacifiy the rebel kabyles, and work towards French intervention. The Rifian player can build up his kabyles, revolt enemy units of the indigenous police and proclame the the Republic of the Rif.

MAP SCALE: Point-to-point system
UNIT SCALE: regiment per counter

Components:
140 1/2” die cut counters
One 22x34" full-color mapsheet showing most of Northern Morocco
54 Strategy Cards
32-page Rule Book including historial background (21 pages of actual rules)

DESIGNER: Ivan Notario
DEVELOPER: Carlos Martin
ART DIRECTOR: Ignacio Notario
MAP ART: Pascal Lapouyade
CARDS & COUNTER ART: Ivan Notario
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Biz
description:
In Biz, you take over a building and play as the owner of an organization. By identifying the market and the available opportunities, you hire people for your organization. These Human Resources make money for the organization in every fiscal year. There are also competitors who are trying to gain a bigger share of the market.
Biz board game is categorized in Reality games. This simulation game is part of the structure and performance of real organizations. The simulated experience of this board game is a fascinating experience that anyone can have fun with. Factors that affect the development process of an organization in the real world, may not be possible to be identified or experienced in the real world. But in this board game, all the exposed factors can be identified and examined, and with each re-play, a new experience and transition can be discovered. There are a variety of situations in the game, opportunities and human resources may change your predetermined goal. The number of players in this game is from one to four people, and you get a different experience of the game with any number of players and even single player.

Game Goal
The goal of the game is for organizations to achieve the popularity of the top brand in the eyes of the audience. This popularity can be achieved in three ways:

Popularity gained through the effects of Activity cards.
The popularity that is formed through Human Resources (Employees) within the organization.
The popularity that is created for players by earning over 40 points Revenue.


Finally, the sum of the popularity point obtained from these three methods determines the brand popularity of an entire organization.

Game End
The game ends when Time marker cube reach number 8 on Organizational Life Cycle Board (i.e. The 8th round of the game that every player completed their turns).
Organizational Life Cycle Board
.Revenue on 5
Salary on 0 Profit on 5
This Board is consisting of 8 fiscal years, meaning there are 8 rounds in the game. After placing the Time Marker on fiscal year 8, the game ends. Each player has to take steps, after all the players have taken their turn, that round ends. At the beginning of the next round, you have to repeat those steps again, then to go to the next round.

Employee Cards
There are 66 Employee cards in the game, each employee has two abilities. By hiring that employee with the ability you choose, you bring him/her into your organization.
At the beginning of the game, Shuffle the 66 cards well and place them face down in the middle of the game area. Then place 6 cards from the employee deck face up next to the deck. When any player picks one employee, a card must be replaced. So until the end of the game, there are always 6 employee cards face up in the game area.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Eastern District Detective
description:
Solo time musical game which is designed based on AGF initiatively to instill a life long passion and understanding of music and its concepts through a fun hands on experience.
Game story
The territory of Parug expanded with technology and high-rise buildings. Next to the territory of Parug, there was the land of Mintras, which, unlike Parug, was far from technology.
The people of Mintras were creatures and human beings who worked in every field of thought. The mayor of Parug built strong gates throughout the territory to keep the distance between the people of Parug and the creatures and humans of Mintras.

Sequential Action method:
A game round consists of a Repeating Action and a Sequential Action. This means that at the beginning of each round you have to select a Repeating Action and after performing it, select a Sequential Action and do it so the round ends.
After you have selected a Sequential Action from a set in the first round of the game, you must use the following sets in the next round, you are not allowed to return to the previous sets. When you reach set 5, you must return to set 1. This process is repeated until the end of the 24 minute soundtrack.
So in each round, you have a Repeating Action that is constant and you can use one of them in each round. After using duplicate operations, select one at the beginning of the game from set 1 of sequential operations. In the next round, when it comes to selecting Sequential Action, you have to choose from set 2 and so on.
End of the Game
There are 3 Endings in the game:

IF the 24 minute soundtrack is finished.
If you cannot detain a creature in 4 rounds.
If Villains or creatures decks runs out.


Scoring
After the 24 minute and the end of the game, you count your points. Every resolved case worth 1 point and every detained creature are 5 points. Count your whole points and record it on the Detective Sheet every time you play the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Crystalline Canyon/Badlands Battlemat
description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: BattleTech: Alien Worlds – Lunar Base/Sand Drifts Battlemat
description: Each map is 34" x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Rebellion: Britannia
description:
Rebellion: Britannia is a game about the Roman military campaigns to suppress the Silures, Brigantes, and Boudica Rebellions (47-61 CE) and the relationships between the key British tribes.

In this game, 1-4 players take control of one of the powerful factions of the time: either Rome or one of the key British tribes—the Iceni, Silures, or Brigantes. Over the course of 12 game rounds (lasting 60-90 minutes), players attempt to gain the most victory points by controlling land, burning Roman infrastructure, and reducing enemy forces.

Rebellion: Britannia is a card-driven wargame. Each player’s available actions are largely dictated by the cards they currently have available to them, and, following a simple Sequence of Play, players use these cards to recruit and move pieces on the board, secure control of regions, engage in diplomacy, form alliances, and battle against their rivals.

Rebellion: Britannia is fast to learn—it’s a low complexity asymmetric game with few rules, a simple sequence of play, and a high quotient of strategic choices. The game depicts a dynamic military and political situation in first-century. Britain, distilled into 60-90 minutes of play time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simulation

name: Seven Waters
description:
Seven Waters | a duel of pools

Anywhere, USA just re-zoned some land, and your dream of building a water park might finally come true! Just your luck, though, that someone else has the exact same idea. Two water parks! What a world. Guess you’ll just have to build a bigger and better one. Welcome to Seven Waters!

Overview
Seven Waters is a two-player card-drafting and placement game that can be played with a traditional deck of cards (jokers included). Snag cards from a shared tableau as you attempt to create the most appealing water park, filled with four slides, a lazy river, and a wave pool!

Each turn, you may either (1) draft an available card from a shared pyramid, or (2) play a card from your hand into your water park. Build water slides by matching the ride value to the rope line value, build a wave pool with matching suits, build a lazy river with straight runs, and theme your park by choosing a bonus value suit. Best park wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Zoo Square
description:
Zoo Square is a corner matching game that is visual challenging and addictively fun. It is designed for kids and adults who love zoo animals and into all kinds of crazy puzzles.

The goal of the game is to be the fastest player to finish a 4-card puzzle. Four cards are randomly drawn from the deck, and you will need to arrange and rotate the 4 square cards into a 2x2 grid, so that the dangerous animals (elephants, lions, and crocodiles) are grouped by their kind, and fenced off from the free-roaming peacocks and the rest of the zoo.

A solution to the puzzle must meet the following two criteria:
1) The center 4 spaces contain the same kind of animals.
2) Each of the edge groups (made out of 2 spaces each) contain the same kind of animals.

There are 2 game modes for beginner and advance level players.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition

name: Community Garden
description:
It’s time to make our Community Garden thrive! Players will use Gardeners to gather resources like water and compost and then will play cards ranging from dill to strawberries to butternut squash. The player who has scored the most points through growing their garden and collecting Harvest cards wins the game. But this is a community garden, so you’ll be helping your fellow players acquire the resources they need to make their plots prosper as well.

Community Garden is played over 7 rounds, in which players are aiming to collect resources - water, compost, trowels, and seedlings - in order to play Garden cards, such as oregano, collard greens, and shishito pepper. On their turn, players will place one Gardener on the board to gain resources, gain Garden cards, or to use Tool cards.

Players will also be collecting Green Thumbs, which are then spent in order to join other players in busy garden spaces. Green Thumbs also have another benefit: they often allow you to activate Tool cards. Each Tool card has a unique effect, and when you place a Gardener on a tool, you use the effect listed on the card. This might help you gain a number of resources at once, take an extra turn, or create other combinations of effects.

Players also use their Gardeners to draw cards from the Garden beds, strategically adding new Garden Cards to their hand that will give them points and helpful bonuses.

On each player's turn, after they've placed a gardener, they'll be able to spend resources they've collected to plant (play) Garden cards from their hand. They'll then place the Garden card they've just played in collections in front of them into plots of the same color. And any time a player completes a pair of the same color of Garden cards (such as two brown Garden cards) or a row of all the colors (brown, pink, silver, and red), they will draw bonus Harvest cards. Each Harvest card is randomly worth anywhere from 1 to 3 points.

After 7 rounds, the player who has scored the most points through planting Garden cards and collecting Harvest cards, wins the game!

-description from designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick
description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick includes the biggest icons of girl power in the DC Comics Universe from classic characters like Wonder Woman to newer characters like Harley Quinn and her hyenas. HeroClix fans will get to enjoy all-new versions of Harley Quinn, DC Bombshell versions of beloved heroines, and extra-dangerous members of the Suicide Squad. Whether you’re in the streets of Gotham, outer space, or Arkham Asylum, Harley and her crew will help you bring action and mayhem to the HeroClix tabletop like never before!

With more than 60 figures to collect, DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Booster Brick is sure to be on many HeroClix players’ wish lists.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Twisted Hoards
description:
Magic and Unusual Treasure Troves for Four against Darkness - this book is a long, random table of mundane, magic and special items for your Four against Darkness adventures.

All items may be used for all levels of play. From food items to kitchen silverware, from explosive pumpkins to wearable werewolf fangs, this book has a little for everyone.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Programme Guide 7TV2: The Argonauts
description:
The Argonauts – the mechanical monsters ruled with an iron fist and cold logic by mad scientist Dr Ulysses Argo. Argo seeks revenge on a world he claims betrayed him. Through the armoured might and superior technology of his mechanical creations, he plots to bring down governments, institutions and individuals and replace them with cold logic and unfeeling machines.

This 40 page printed booklet for the 7TV second edition rules contains:

Background information on the filming and fictional history of the Argonauts.
Information on cast members with tactical tips on how to use them in play.
35 Profiles with full rules for Argonaut stars, co-stars, extras, vehicles and units.
6 new episodes – playable by both Argonauts and any other 2nd edition casts.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Press Tour
description:
The cameras are on and the microphones are hot! Grab a copy of your best-selling book or snag a press badge to take part in the media scrum. Hope you've memorized your talking points, because we are going live in 3... 2... 1!

In Press Tour, players take on the roles of attendees at the press-launch for a new book release, either as the author or one of the interviewers. Direct the interview to meet your personal goals or the requirements of your network to get the scoop of your career!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Stock Monarchy
description:
Within Stock Monarchy you will play as the ruler of a small Kingdom listed on the stock market. The competition will be relentless. To win, players must bring their Kingdom to dominate the stock market with a savvy combination of warfare, technology and trade.

THE STOCK STATES
The Stock States are a rich empire with a bizarre form of government: a stock monarchy. The Supreme Sovereign wields absolute power, but his election and term in office are determined by the satisfaction of the stockholders, the true masters of the Land.

CORONATION CHALLENGE
The time has come to nominate a new Supreme Sovereign. As usual, the Coronation Challenge is issued so as to find the most talented contestant amongst the richest Houses of the Realm. The winner of the Challenge will be crowned Ruler of the Stock States.
The Challenge will take place on one of the peripheral and uncivilized islands of the empire. The Island is inhabited by Mattoks, somewhat obtuse and naïve creatures with a very basic lifestyle. Mattoks can’t quite discern between good and evil and are therefore easy to manipulate or to corrupt. They are not to be entrusted with complex tasks, but they are excellent at following simple instructions and will comply with whatever command in exchange for a few shiny coins.
At the beginning of the Challenge every participant will be assigned a starting region of equal dimension and three months’ time to showcase their strategic skills and – most important of all – to enrich the stockholders.
The management of the Realms on the Island mirrors the stock monarchy of the Stock States: each scion will be free to act as an authentic absolute monarch, but his choices will be evaluated by the stock market. Dominating the market, however, will not be easy: all shareholders ultimately desire to grow richer and see the value of their shares rise, but some of them also have specific preferences on how this should be done. The two most prominent examples are definitely the conqueror and pioneer currents. The conquerors want a Ruler in power who pursues profit through military expansion, while the pioneers prefer one who will enrich them by investing in technological growth. Therefore, whoever wants to sit on the Throne of the Stock States will not only have to effectively administer his own Realm, but will also have to distribute copious dividends and support, at least in part, the interests of conquerors and pioneers. Ultimately, the winner of the Coronation Challenge will be the Ruler who is able to impose himself on the market and make the value of the shares of his Realm soar.

GAME-FLOW
The Game-Flow has 3 stages: Setup, Round and End Game.

SETUP
• Creating the island: the Island is created, depending on the number of Players (in a 2-Player game it is possible to create more
than 2 billion different Map layouts, in a 4 Player game more than a trillion, and that's without counting Resources and Know-How Tokens).
• Auctioning the Starting Territories: Players bid to seize the best possible starting Territory for their Realms.
• Setting up the Realms: every Ruler autonomously chooses the initial Setup of their Realm.

ROUND
• 3 Game Rounds: The 3 Game Rounds is where the real action takes place. The Kings have to plan and implement their strategies by issuing orders to the Spies and Mattoks of their own Realm. This is done through the 14 Command Cards, which let Players move their Spies and carry out Actions with the Mattoks.

END GAME
• Distributing dividends to the shareholders: the Money, Ingots and revenue from the sale of White Whiskey are used to pay
dividends, which drives up the value of the shares of the Realm.
• Announcing the winner: the Player whose shares have reached the highest value is crowned as new Supreme Sovereign of the Stock States.

-description from designer
mechanics: Command Cards, Hidden Victory Points, Loans, Modular Board, Negotiation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Catacombs Big Box Plus
description:
This is the ultimate version of the award winning fantasy, dexterity board game, Catacombs™ that bundles the base game in a big box with several expansions including the Ice Box, Wyldlands, Cavern of Soloth and Resurrection Packs.

This exclusive PLUS version of Catacombs 3E (not available at retail) includes:


Six double-sided neoprene PLAYMATS instead of the game boards in the retail version of Catacombs 3E
The new “Kallax shelf” friendly extra large box and TWO organizing trays instead of the single organizing tray in the retail version
The new wall system including custom plastic stands
The fully revised and updated 36 page Reference manual
The new 40 page Tutorial manual


The six, double-sided playmats included with this set:


Campfire | Stone Altar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Lava Tube | Root Cellar (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Mausoleum | Throne Room (from the Catacombs 3E base game)
Scavewyrm Pit | Forthstron River (the playmat that accompanies the Wyldlands expansion)
Wild Woodlands | Poisonwood Bridge (from the Wyverns of Wylemuir expansion)
Ice Cavern / Quartz Grotto (the playmat that accompanies Resurrection Packs 1 & 2. Note: the game board version is called Resurrection Pack 3)


Includes the components and rulebooks (where applicable) for the following Catacombs expansions, packed inside the PLUS box:

Ice Box (Elzra exclusive)
Cavern of Soloth
Wyldlands (Elzra exclusive)
Resurrection Pack 1 (Elzra exclusive)
Resurrection Pack 2 (Elzra exclusive)
mechanics: Flicking, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Materia Prima: Alchemists and Pets
description:
Alka Sowa needs new heroes. Four undaunted alchemists face the challenge to become the head of the alchemists guild and fight the Inquisition. But they are not alone. Each of them has his own faithful companion. Because pets are man's best friends.

The Alchemists and Pets expansion contains four alchemists and the four associated pets.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Set Collection

name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M4A3E8 Sherman
description:
Wave 7

1:100 Scale

World of Tanks Miniatures Game is an easy to learn, quick play game, where you take command of a unit of tanks, seeking to destroy your opponent and secure victory! All the models in World of Tanks come ASSEMBLED, PAINTED, and BATTLE READY!

The American M4A3E8 Sherman is a favourite tank for all "Furious" commanders. This version is an upgrade over previous Shermans with a Firepower of 5, and 5 Hit Points. Turbocharger and a Ford GAA engine boost the M4A3E8s Initiative to an impressive 10 in the movement phase so you can get the jump on your opponent. Use this tank straight out of the box, or enhance it with a wide variety of upgrades to meet your situational and strategic needs. Additional upgrades include 105mm M4 Gun upgrade (+2 Firepower, -1 Initiative), Eagle Eye (modify 1 Attack die from Hit to Critical), and Gunner Quinn Kennell.

Plastic components.

Contents:
1 Miniature
‣ M4A3E8 Sherman Tank
1 Tank Card
5 Upgrade Cards
Online Bonus Code for New & Existing Players
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Life as an Ant
description:
Life as an Ant is a competitive strategic game in which players compete to establish their colony of ants as the dominant local ant force.

The game consist out of modular boards that can be placed in a number of different ways at the start of the game to create a unique game board for each time you play. Each player has a nest or home base, and a number of starting ants. Resources are evenly distributed over the board. There is also 3 decks of colony cards, each consisting of various different types of ants. Lastly there are a set number of larva tokens set on the game board (dependent on the number of players in the game). The goal of the game is to be the first colony in bringing back 4 larva back to the colony and guaranteeing dominance of your colony over all the ants.

Each round, players take turn to take up to 5 resources from the board, these resources can be used to purchase colony cards from on of three decks. These cards represent one of 6 different ant types and is kept in the players hand. Once per round a player may play a card in their hand and place a matching ant type hexagon tile on the board in a continuous path from their nest towards any of the larva tokens.
