The player who completes a unbroken path towards a larva first, may carry the larva token back to its nest and continue their path towards the next larva. While players with long routes can easily cut off other players from larva and control a large playing area, there are mechanisms that keep all players in the game until close to the end. Players may attack each other with warrior ants and even play a highly valuable flying ant and steal a larva right under the nose of another.

Once a player returns their 4th larva back to the nest, the game ends and the player wins, becoming the queen ant to rule them all!
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Zone of Control

name: Grant: The Western Campaign of 1862
description:
Early in 1862 a little-known general named U.S. Grant led the Union's offensive into West Tennessee. After capturing two river forts and the largest bag of prisoners ever captured by an American army to that time, Grant made a daring advance up the Tennessee River, while supporting armies advanced down the Mississippi and overland through Tennessee. But the Confederate army under A.S. Johnston hit back, staking everything on a furious battle in the woods around Shiloh Church.

GRANT: The Western Campaign of 1862 puts you in charge of the entire Tennessee campaign. As the Union player, you must coordinate three armies, using both naval and land forces to advance along the major rivers, take the important objectives of Nashville and Corinth, and seize the fortress of Island Number Ten to open the Mississippi River. As the Confederate player you are trying to block the Union offensives, choose your moment to counterattack, and if possible, take the war into Kentucky. Movement and combat by river is just as important as land, giving this campaign a unique feel in Civil War history. A chit-based sequence of play makes the game highly variable and models the abilities of Grant and Johnston.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Impulse Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Blood & Plunder: Fire on the Frontier
description:
As the idea of a frontier began to emerge, two wars would erupt which would act as a precedent for much of the Anglo-Indian and Anglo-French conflict over the next one hundred years. King Phillip’s war in 1675 would be the first time the colonies were ever forced to co-operate against a highly mobile indigenous enemy whos tactics of raid and ambush would typify the type of warfare that would terrorize the Frontier life. King William’s war 1689-1697 would be the first in what would become known as the French and Indian wars, and is seen by some as the first truly global war as it was fought between rival European powers from Flanders to the Caribbean and beyond; vicious and combining both western and frontier styles of fighting, King William’s war would start a cycle of violence that would continue until the French cession of Canada to the British in 1763.

This expansion will require the No Peace Beyond the Line Expansion Book.

Softcover, 78 pages
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Partners In Crime
description:
Find your partner in crime without blowing your cover. Your mission is to identify each other by drawing or by writing a single word.

You want your partner to guess who you are, and you will play the detective to work out who else is a partner - but you don't want to be sussed yourself. How subtle can you make your drawing?

The only frustration in this funny game is how hard it is to keep your cover hidden! The rule is easy - don't risk giving the game away by drawing something too obvious.

A game for adults and teens alike, this is a great party game, the best activity for a birthday, hen, stag, house party or any other celebration occasion.

The pack includes 128 cards, 8 scoring boards, 8 drawing boards and 8 washable marker pens. We also include a timer, just to pile on the pressure!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Deduction, Drawing, Hidden Roles, Push Your Luck

name: Ruins of Lamur
description:
You are a world famous adventurer and explorer. The entrance to the buried ruins of the ancient city of Lamur have been discovered, and you’ve rushed to put together an expedition. After long weeks of travel, you crest a mountain pass at the head of your caravan, and look down on the lost valley. As you near the ruins, other groups approach from other directions, and who should be leading them but your greatest rivals! None of you are the type to share glory, so one of you suggests a wager: whoever manages to leave the city with the greatest collection of discoveries will take everything, including all the fame!

You start the game by placing the entrance tile. Each player chooses a Player Piece and places it on the Entrance. Each player gets 5 Discovery cards to start the game, which represent the equipment & supplies you bring with you into the ruin. On each turn, a player can:
– Explore by placing a new Tile card next to the Tile they’re on. If the Tile is a room with a number, you place that number of Discovery cards face-up on the Tile to represent the things occupying the room.
– Move by discarding a card from their hand. You can move a number of tiles up to the value of the discarded card. You then draw a card to represent discoveries you made along the way. Every player should always have 5 cards in their hand.
– Claim the top card from the pile on the Tile they’re on (if there are any). In order to do this, you need to discard a card from your hand that is worth the same or more than the card being claimed. Each type of card is worth double against one other type, and half against another.

The objective is to have the highest-scoring hand when the game ends. The basic scoring system, and a few optional variants, are laid-out in the rules included with the game, but house rules are encouraged! The game ends when the last card is drawn from the Discovery card deck. It’s also possible for a player to deliberately end the game if no more Tiles can be placed, and they can get to the Entrance tile.

-description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Chrysanthemum
description:
A Natural Fantasy Strategy Game

Players are Faeries who compete to plant the most flowers on the World Bloom.

Chrysanthemum's core gameplay involves gathering seeds in the center of the World Bloom then venturing out onto its petal tips to plant the seeds and collect Guild Runes.

Guild Runes enable you to learn spells from the Card Drafting Area. With spells, you can plant and collect seeds at a faster rate, disrupt your opponents, travel across the World Bloom more efficiently, and exchange or enhance your resources. Using spells also increases your chances of finding a Bloom card, which causes the World Bloom to expand, giving you access to many new Guild Runes, spells, and places to plant seeds.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Environmental, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Movement Points, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Leylines
description:
Your ancestors have lived in the forest for generations, surviving by following the Leylines - tangled wisps of magic that weave between the pines and lead to the forest’s most coveted bounties. But you can’t sustain yourself on only moss and berries for long. Every solstice, the fae-markets roll into the forest with their caravans bursting with food and supplies. Gather what you can from the woodland floor and seek out the markets before they move on.

Leylines is a re-imagining/update of the classic game Auf Achse by Wolfgang Kramer set in a brand new world with new rules by Daryl Andrews, featuring beautiful acrylic standees and a circular board filled magical leylines and mystical markets!

To win players must collect resources in the forest and bring them back along the leylines to the markets to sell them. Be aware though the magical merchants pay different amounts depending on what they are interested in!

Each round players will take turns waking up and preparing for the day by placing their dice to program their actions and then adventuring through the forest using their placed dice. Along the way picking up resources and delivering them to the markets for either Gold or Magical items to help them in their journey.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Market, Programmed Movement

name: I Still Dream of My Father
description: I Still Dream of My Father is a single-player, card-based RPG in which you play through the experiences of someone trying to come to terms with the aftermath of a Very Damned Difficult relationship with their father. Choose your own path as you immerse yourself in your characters life, where sometimes it’s hard to tell what’s inside and what’s outside your mind, as you wend your way toward the ultimate moment of contemplation, where you must decide how you want to move forward and what it means about who you are.
mechanics: Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Galactic Jaxx
description:
The classic game of jacks has been reinvented for a new space and time. This is Galactic Jaxx! Work to fill up the empty star spaces on your constellation cards to earn points and abilities. Spin the Drop Zone Spinner for an added challenge to your grab. Bounce the ball and try to grab the correct number of Jaxx.

Each turn players try to complete their Constellation Cards by collecting and placing the correct colors of Jaxx onto their cards. In order to collect Jaxx players have to bounce the Space Ball and grab Jaxx before the ball hits the table a second time. A player's Star Gear will tell them how many Jaxx they need to collect in a turn. Take too many or too few Jaxx and your turn is unsuccessful; drop all of those Jaxx back into the center. The more a player succeeds the higher their Star Gear Tracker will go, but one wrong move and their Star Gear goes back to the start.

Every successfully grabbed Jaxx a player gets goes onto their Constellation Card. Each constellation card requires a certain number and set of colors to complete. Once all those requirements are met, that player scores their card and gets a new Constellation. The first player to get 15 or more points, WINS!

–description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Race, Tile Placement

name: Rogue Mana
description:
In this turn-base strategy game, you and up to three Mage companions savvy in an elemental form of magic work together to ascent the Tower of Rogue Mana. Mages will battle devious enemies and tower chaos magic to find treasures and new spells. As a collective, the Mages work to ascend the Tower and receive the highest marks of wizardry!

Rogue Mana is a classic dungeon-crawler, great for newbies and veteran gamers alike. The growth of power format allows Rogue Mana to be played as a campaign over seven sessions. During each session, the Mages enter a new floor of the Tower that they must conquer until they defeat the 7th and final floor to receive their marks. There are 14 levels for variation and deployability.

During each turn, players collect Mana Crystals which are used to cast spells in your hand. These spells may harm an enemy, allow you to assist a fellow player in need, or manipulate the environment around you. As players draw mana or cast spells, a Rogue Event may be triggered by the Tower, which is known for its chaotic tendencies. Fate (i.e., dice) then decides whether a boon is given the mages, spikes fly out of the wall, or a barrel of fish randomly appears (for example). Once the players turn is done, then the enemies have their turn. They target the mages with unending ambition, though they may have weaknesses that the mages can exploit.

In Rogue Mana, each floor has its own unique layout, enemies, and challenges. Beyond just surviving, the mages can try to collect 3 additional accolades (up to 4 total); two by collecting specific treasures, and one for collecting a magical orb. The more accolades collected upon completing the level, the more talented and powerful wizards they will become once they defeat the tower.

The campaign/game ends once the mages defeat the final level in the tower.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Ranked Choice Voting
description:
You are a candidate trying to become the state's next governor. You will be competing against five other candidates in an election that uses the ranked choice voting election method.

Each turn represents a week of campaigning. You will direct your campaign manager to select 3 actions in the game. You will choose to either court voters in a specific block of voters (by class, by political spectrum, or location within the state), all while increasing your name recognition, raising funds, and trying to maintain your popularity. At the end of four quick weeks of campaigning is election day. You will determine the winner and you will learn how easy it is to conduct a ranked choice voting election count.

This is a very fast paced dynamic game, playing in 30 minutes, with quick set up and take down. It has straight forward rules which produce many deceptively complex interactive decisions, and high replayability.

Will you be the candidate that can balance all the elements of the campaign, out maneuver our opponents, and become the next governor?
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Space Crusade: Renegade
description:
Hermiatus, a Magos Biologus of the Adeptus Mechanicus has disappeared while working on an anti-gene that has the potential to immunise humans against infection by Genestealers. It‘s suspected that in the course of his research he accidentally became infected with the Genestealer plasm and fled in terror.

Renegade is a five-part campaign for Space Crusade which involves the Space Marine players in a desperate search to locate and capture Hermiatus.

Originally published in White Dwarf #145.
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: After the Empire: Treasure House Promo Card
description:
2022 Gen Con promo card from Grey Fox Games for After the Empire. Later available during the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter campaign.

Treasure House is a new building card. It costs 1 wood, 2 Stone, 1 Iron and immediately provides 4 Gold and 2 mercenaries. At the end of the game, it is worth 3 victory points.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Prestige: A City Building Game
description:
Prestige is an asymmetrical, semi-cooperative, city-building, card game in which players must collaborate to build a great ancient city to stand as a testament to their civilization's prestige for generations to come, or fail and be forgotten to time. Players will share economic resources, city-building cards, and defeat. However, if they succeed, only the leader of the tribe most represented in the city will be remembered throughout all of time.

The game can be enjoyed solo, or with up to four players, and is played using city-building cards and economic resource tokens. Each player takes the mantle of a Tribal Leader over one of six unique tribes, each with their own focus and deck of city-building cards. As Tribal Leaders, players must negotiate with one another to play cards from their own tribe, to enhance their dominion over the city, while also ensuring the city doesn't fall to chaos or destruction due to their selfishness.

Pulling from a shared deck of compiled city-building cards, players take turns either placing or discarding cards from their hand. When placed, this card will trigger positive (or negative)effects based on the type(s) of cards adjacent in the play area. However, when a card is discarded, it is considered unplayable for the rest of the game and attracts attention from prowling Invaders who wish to do harm to the city. Each action must be carefully balanced to pursue one's own personal interests while maintaining the health of the shared city.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Events, Open Drafting, Ownership, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Awkward Guests: Companion App
description:
The Awkward Guests companion app has several more cases in addition to the cases included with the game.

The companion app allows players to enter their solution to the case into the app and find out if they are right or wrong.

If one or more players have guessed the correct solution to the case, they win the game.

If a player is incorrect, they cannot guess a solution on their next turn but can continue to play the game - the solution is not revealed.

When playing without the app, players must examine the solution in the rulebook to determine if they are right or wrong, and players who guess the wrong solution are eliminated from the game.

The app is required when playing the game Solo.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tourist
description:
Players will take on the roll of a Transportation planner for a specific Destination.

The game is played through a variable amount of rounds. As the Transportation planner you will be responsible for managing the travel efficiency and income from the tourist to your Destination and have them visit all the locations to obtain the most Vacation Points (VP) before the end of the game.

Tourist is a 2-4 player card action selection game where you will manage your money and wait to attract the most tourist meeples. If you do, you will emerge victorious! Show your family and friends what it takes to be the best Tourist location!

Players will take turns choosing a card from the 4 face up cards. from there they may play any amount of cards one at a time and take the actions on them.

The game ends when the last Tourist meeple is placed on a players board.

The winner is the player with the highest Vacation Points from their Postcard Point Board!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Track Movement

name: Fight the Blight: Dark Past vs Doomed Futures
description:
The Blight has taken many forms throughout history. Can you crawl out from the ashes of the Dark Past, rise up and prevent the Doomed Future?

This expansion for Fight the Blight adds 2 new settings that can be played separately or together, 9 new Characters (including your favorite content creators), 82 new cards, new strategies, and endless replayability.

When the past, present, and future collide… who will be left standing!?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Final Score Football
description:
The deluxe package includes every season from the AFL, every National season from 1929 to the 2014-15 season, and every season from the AAFC, WFL, USFL, XFL and UFL. Everything needed to play is included. There are NO game parts to buy with this set.

As the name implies, this quick play game provides you with a final score for an Pro Football game. Allowing you to rapidly play games and watch standings unfold before your eyes. However, there is more to the game than just generating scores. There is plenty of excitement and drama along the way, keeping the game play exciting and compelling. You will have late in the game touchdowns, field goals and fantastic defensive stands.

The Final Score Football line of games differs from our other quick play line, Ultra Quick, as the games all unfold in a quarter-by-quarter manner.

Each team is rated individually for Offense, Defense, and Home Field Advantage. And while there will surely be some surprises along the way, since this is a game, after all, the accuracy of the game will astound you. We also have a normalization system for every team and league we rate, so you can play across seasons to determine the best team of all-time.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nethermaze – Hexbane's Hunters
description:
Haskel Hexbane and his band of mirthless followers are as ruthless as they are determined. They are members of the Order of Azyr, a Sigmarite organisation dedicated to the rooting out and purging of evil across the Mortal Realms. This clandestine sect has sent Hexbane and his hunters deep within the Nethermaze to bring the burning light of Azyr to the very heart of that foul and unnatural place, that they might scour it in the cleansing fires of justice and Order.

Hexbane's Hunters are fast, deadly, and unrelenting, with a varied roster of warriors. The key to the warband's strength lies in the Price of Victory ability shared by its human fighters, which allows them to gain free upgrades or crusade swiftly across the battlefield when a friendly hunter is taken out of action. This box includes a complete Rivals deck, plus loads of extra cards allowing you to try out a few tricks, as well as universal cards and Grand Alliance cards to use with your other warbands.

This set contains:

6x push-fit Hexbane's Hunters miniatures – no glue required to assemble, cast in solemn grey to stand out even when unpainted.
6x double-sided fighter cards, one for each warrior in the warband – Haskel Hexbane, Brydget Axwold, Aemos Duncarrow, Quiet Pock, Grotbiter, and Ratspike.
A further 66 cards to enhance your fighters and provide new tactics and challenges for your games of Warhammer Underworlds: Nethermaze, including:
12x Hexbane's Hunters objective cards
10x Hexbane's Hunters upgrade cards
10x Hexbane's Hunters gambit cards (includes 1x Domain card)
6x Universal objective cards, usable by any warband
7x Universal upgrade cards, usable by any warband (includes 1x Map card)
7x Universal gambit cards, usable by any warband (includes 2x Domain cards)
12x Grand Alliance cards, usable by any warband belonging to the specified Grand Alliance
1x Hexbane's Hunters Warband Background / Rivals Deck Card
1x cover card


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Alchemist's Apprentice
description:
Put on the robe of an apprentice of the greatest science of all, alchemy, and try your hand at mixing mandrake roots, wyvern wishbones and mermaid scales into potions of strength, invisibility, luck, and anything else your customers desire. Boiling cauldrons, exploding potions, trolls and gnomes, a grumpy old alchemist, a playful narrator, and an ever-happy goat await you!

Alchemist's Apprentice is a solo print-and-play dice-rolling, puzzle-solving narrative adventure brimming with fantasy. Every turn, the player will roll a set of dice representing various alchemical ingredients, and incorporate them into the potion, solving the puzzle of its formula requirements. Each ingredient has special properties, which allow the player to affect other dice and impact the volatility of the potion, bringing logic and deduction to the forefront of the game.

Every chapter of the gamebook advances the story and introduces new mechanics as the master-alchemist trusts the player with new ingredients and more complicated potions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Lobotomy 1 Monsters: Nightmare
description:
These nightmare horror miniatures from Lobotomy 1 are now playable in Lobotomy 2 with the included Daily Nightmare cards and the new monster cards compatible with Lobotomy 2! With this pack, you will be able to play four additional scenarios.

1 Executioner
1 Faceless
1 Venoma
1 Tire

Miniatures in this set are the same as those in the original Lobotomy. If you already own these miniatures, check out the 'Lobotomy 1: Monster Conversion Set' add-on!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Battle's Orphan: The Bay of Pigs Invasion April 17-20, 1961
description:
“Success has many fathers, failure is an orphan.”—Tacitus, Agricola 98 AD.

When newly-elected President Kennedy was inaugurated the CIA’s plans and Cuban exile army were ready to invade Castor's Cuba. However, the new president wanted “plausible deniability” and the CIA invasion plans were extensively modified, with all of the Cuban exile aircraft relocated to Nicaragua airbases, and removing any direct support by US armed forces. What was left was very weakened, yet still powerful Cuban exile invasion force armed with tanks, heavy weapons and well trained for sustained combat operations. All that remained was for the Cuban people to rally to their support once the invasion commenced. Can you do as well or better than your opponents? Learn and enjoy!

The game also includes variant units for use with possible US intervention, as well as a second full-sized map for the CIA's preferred invasion site at Trinidad.

The game uses a standard deck of playing cards to determine which player can activate units and how many activations can be made.

The game ends when 12 turns have been played.

The player that scores the most victory points by the end of the last turn of the game is the winner.

The game is composed of the following:

Four 11 by 17 inch map sheets

Two full and one partial sheet of 194 (total) un-mounted, double-sided counters

One Terrain Effects Chart

Ten pages of rules and 4 pages of variant rules

Players will also need a six-sided and a ten-sided set of dice, as well as a standard deck of playing cards to play the game. A custom card set, that replaces the standard deck of playing cards, is available for purchase separately.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: Robot Please!
description:
The most Influential tech event is about to begin and the launch of MAI-42 is the main event. Programmers have been working on MAI for years to change the landscape of robotics for years to come. There is only one problem. MAI-42 doesn't behave as it should. It seems that some bug or virus is preventing MAI from working properly and resists following simple verbal directions. The show is about to begin, so the programmers will have to manage with simple tasks.

In the game, all players play the role of MAI once and the rest of players play the role of programmers competing to get the highest score by getting MAI to perform the assigned task successfully. Role playing is a very important component of this game, as a robot you can enjoy improvising and applying your ingenuity when executing the instructions. At the same time, as a programmer you should make an effort to try to write specific and detailed instructions to the robot, understanding they can execute them in the most diverse and curious ways.

Each programmer reads aloud their code, line by line, allowing MAI to run the instructions. MAI listens to the instructions and carries them out to the letter as much as possible, while actively looking for ways to "misinterpret" the commands.

The game takes place over as many rounds as players. In each round, a player role plays MAI-42 and the rest of the players are programmers. A round is divided into two phases: Writing and Execution

At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Red Skull & Hydra Troopers
description:
The Red Skull leads HYDRA in its quest for world domination in the Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Red Skull & Hydra Troopers expansion.

Johann Schmidt is a conniving villain whose evil deeds span generations. During this time, he has transformed HYDRA into a globe-spanning terrorist organization that cannot ever truly be destroyed, for "If a head is cut off, two more shall take its place."

The new version of the Red Skull in this pack introduces the HYDRA Affiliation to Marvel: Crisis Protocol while leading a group of HYDRA Troops ready to do his bidding. In addition to these miniatures and their abilities, this pack further enhances the HYDRA Affiliation with seven Team Tactic cards that give Red Skull and his subordinates even more ways to further their plans for world domination.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Everest / Zimbabwe
description:
This is a two map release for Age of Steam 2022. Maps are printed on high quality poster stock front and back.

Age of Steam: Everest is collaboration design by Jarad Hobbs & Kevin McCurdy. This expansion features a race of climbers to reach the summit of Everest and return to base camp first. Climbers have to deal with additional effort to climb the Death Zone and will use the oxygen and resupply special actions to gain on edge on the competitors.

Age of Steam: Zimbabwe is a collaboration design by supershitakeman & Kevin McCurdy. The Zimbabwe expansion will test players ability to overcome difficult events related to the real-world financial crises that have affected the Zimbabwe railways. This is a very tough map where bad things happen.

-description from designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Brides & Bribes: Kickstarter Exclusive Promos
description:
The kickstarter exclusive promos contain two new brides, Demetra and Cesarina, and one new Common Character, Giovanni.

Also included is a magnet and a postcard signed by the authors.

These promos came in a plastic bag taped to the outside of the box of the base game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Murders at Tealwoods Manor
description:
Murders at Tealwoods Manor is a reverse murder mystery worker placement and drafting game.
You already know who the murderer is. You already know who the Investigator is. What you're trying to uncover is which guests become victims during the course of the night!
Draft different characters, and place them into different rooms of the manor to activate those room abilities. If the murderer is left alone with someone they will die!
Help the investigator discover the murderer by collecting clues, or help the murderer kill the investigator!
Score points by having your hidden goals of which characters live or die at the end of the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Materia Prima: The Cult Expansion
description:
From the vaults and drainage shafts one can hear the unholy muttering of ancient ceremonies. The followers of this cult worship a god who is known in the vernacular only as the Unspeakable. His arrival is near.

Dive deeper into the world of Alka Sowa. The expansion "the Cult" contains a mini-campaign, which consists of two full-length scenarios and offers some new gameplay mechanics.

To play the expansion you need both Materia Prima - The Alchemists Guild and Materia Prima - The Inquisition.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Materia Prima: The Hunt Expansion
description:
Something is stirring in the shadows of the woods. There are rumours of a horrible creature that climbs through windows at night and snatches the little ones from their beds.

Dive deeper into the world of Alka Sowa. The expansion "the Hunt" contains a mini-campaign, which consists of two full-length scenarios and offers some new gameplay mechanics.

To play the expansion you need both Materia Prima - The Alchemists Guild and Materia Prima - The Inquisition.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Piotrków 1939
description:
The game simulates one of the biggest battles of the Polish Defensive War of 1939 that took place near the town of Piotrków Trybunalski from 5 to 6 September, 1939. After two-day fierce fighting, the Polish forces suffered a defeat and were forced to retreat.

This is a new edition of the "Piotrków 1939" game that is based on the WB-95 wargaming system developed by Taktyka i Strategia. The previous editions of the game were based on different wargaming systems (e.g. W-39).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Brief Border Wars 2
description:
Brief Border Wars 2 is the second set of four small operational level games on short border conflicts from Compass Games. The game system uses a card-driven system first introduced in Brief Border Wars that models the chaotic, stop-and-start nature of these impromptu wars. Four sets of exclusive rules reflect the peculiar nature of each conflict. Your sense of improvisation will be challenged as you explore four of the more interesting small wars fought in the early 20th century.

The four conflicts include:

1913: Second Balkan War (also known as “The Interallied War”)
1919: The Seven-Day War (also known as “Teschen”)
1939: The Nomonhan Incident (also known as “The Battle of Khalkin Gol”)
1940: The Italo-Greek War (also known as “The Balkan Defiance”)

Here is more background on each border war portrayed.

1913: Second Balkan War
The division of lands given up by the Ottoman Empire at the end of the First Balkan War was soon the subject of squabbles between the allied nations that had defeated the Empire. Bulgaria decided to grab as much of this territory as it could by a surprise attack on June 30, 1913 against Serbia and Greece. The offensive by their more powerful army soon petered out due to poor logistical depth and bad coordination, then in mid-July Romanian and Ottoman forces crossed Bulgaria’s borders. This made Bulgaria sue for peace but if the Bulgarian player has seized enough territory and made significant diplomatic assurances, they will have a better position in the negotiations.

1919: The Seven-Day War
The Duchy of Teschen (Cieszyn in Polish) was part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire until the end of the war. The two new countries of Czechoslovakia and Poland both laid claim to the territory on historic and ethnic grounds; more urgently, both countries desperately needed the land because of its large coal deposits and valuable mines, as well as the important iron and steel works at Trinec. On January 23, 1919, Czechoslovakia invaded to seize control of as much of the region as they could to stop Poland’s efforts to claim sovereignty over it. After seven days of fighting, the Entente nations forced a ceasefire and the two antagonists signed an agreement establishing a border at the Olza River, dividing the city of Cieszyn.

1939: The Nomonhan Incident
Also called the Battle of Khalkin Gol, this border clash between Japanese and Soviet forces in a remote part of the Mongolian grasslands had an impact on the development of the Second World War in the Pacific all out of proportion to the numbers involved. The game covers the early to mid-July 1939 period, the only time frame in which the Japanese Army could have succeeded in overpowering the local Soviet forces and establishing their claim to the zone between the Soviet claimed boundary and the Halha River. The attack provoked extensive reinforcements for the Soviet 57th Corps and their counteroffensive in August under the command of General Georgi Zhukov discouraged the Japanese Empire from contemplating further attacks on Mongolia or the USSR.

1940: The Italo-Greek War
This game covers the first two months of the Italian invasion of Greece in the fall and winter of 1940. Hardly anything went right for the Italians; chaotic logistics and poor communication nullified their great advantage in men and machines and their offensive was halted and then thrown back into Albania by the determined Greek forces. Could you have done better than Mussolini?

These games are ideal short matches to finish off an evening of gaming, or fill a lunch hour. Either way your sense of improvisation will be challenged, and you’ll explore four of the interesting yet obscure small wars of the last 50 years.

Product information

Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 5 out of 10
Time Scale: variable (1 day to 1 week per turn)
Map Scale: variable (area movement)
Unit Scale: variable (paramilitary “groups” to divisions)
Players: 1-2 (best with 2)
Playing Time: 1-2 hours each
Designer: Brian Train
Components

Four maps at 17” by 22”
One countersheet of 176 9/16” counters
One Player Aid Card
One deck of 54 playing cards
One system rules booklet
Four exclusive rules booklets
Two 6-sided dice

-description from publisher's website
categories: Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Turn Order: Random

name: Oh Bleep!
description:
Oh Bleep! is an exciting variation of the game Oh Hell!. Oh Bleep! violates practically all of the rules of traditional card games, including most of the rules of Oh Hell!. Its hilarious affront to traditional card-playing often causes an outburst among the players. You can be courteous to your fellow players or ruthless. You can lose badly through much of the game and still emerge the winner at the very end.

The powerful face cards (kings, queens, and jacks) are always a menace during play. Aces are so vulnerable that often only the powerful face cards can help them.

A good hand will only win if it is played with care. Take too many tricks, and you lose! This is a card game for the cautious card player, the beginning card player, and the flamboyant old pro! All will enjoy the mayhem; and if the name proves too discreet, you may feel compelled at times to use your own favorite expletive. There are no partners, so it's every player for his or her self.

Enjoy the game!

—introduction from the rulebook
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Rome & Roll: Gladiators – Faunus Promo Card
description:
A promo card originally available as part of The Secret Cabal's 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Faunus is a God card. Text on the card says"FAUNUS" After Constructing adjacent to the Tiber river and/or entirely on Marshland: Gain 1 (fish or jewelry), and 1 fish for every constructed buildings you have. All other players gain 1 wood.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zon: Cosmic Warfare
description:
Zon: Cosmic Warfare places you in control of an alien race in a vast political struggle, competing for success with other races. You will explore the Zon cosmos, upgrade your starting deck, and craft spaceships with which to conquer, defend, and fight. There are many different paths you choose to win, so you will need to adapt to any situation that can come your way while exploring the vastness of space.

Zon: Cosmic Warfare is based in Draconem Ignem Comics' Zon Universe with many alien races and political struggles.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Market, Negotiation, Pieces as Map, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 1: Masters of the Universe Faction
description:
The Warrior Goddess Teela and the mysterious Sorceress appear on the battlefield. The magical abilities of the Masters of the Universe are growing in strength!

From now on, the enemies will have to face new spells and force fields set in the arena. By the power of Grayskull! The forces of Evil will be overcome!

EXPANSION PACK INCLUDES:
1x set of additional rules
1x manual
2x character minis
3x terrain accessories
16x cards
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Stat Check Resolution, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Summer Aya Promo Cards
description:
Beta Rules - 2 x new Beta Gameplay Cards, 1 x new gear and 1 x new Strange Resource that were included with the Summer Aya First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

The Summer Aya is packaged in a hand-stamped kraft box and limited to 500. It includes:

-1 x Photoresin Summer Aya
-1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
-2 x Beta Gameplay Cards, gear and Strange Resource
-First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
-Large Matte Art Print
-Character Art Card

Aya travels to the sand dunes below the larval pools that form in the iron clouds overhead. Here the sun never sets and perpetual summer reigns. The metabolic mutation of the skypoles super heats the fluids of the pool, roiling and bubbling over, occasionally disgorging them to the sands below. Massive globs of fluids rain down, creating cryptic glass formations in the sand.
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Spike! Journal #15
description:
This issue’s Guest Editor Meghera Lafes ventures out of the thick and steaming rainforests of Lustria to bring you a Spike! Journal packed with scrimmaging serpents and tropical touchdown gameplay. That’s right, this issue brings the Amazon team to your games of Blood Bowl!

This journal covers the history, rules, and rosters of the Amazon team. As well as stories of mysterious relics, acrobatic antics, and some truly spectacular ritual sacrifice shows at half-time, you'll find all the fantastic fun and essential commentary you've come to expect from Spike! Journal. As such, this magazine is the perfect companion for any jungle-dwelling coach.

This issue includes:
- Warriors of Legend: background on the origins of Amazon teams in Blood Bowl, and how they play on the pitch. Includes information on their team positions, Star Players, and a team roster.
- Famous Amazon Teams: descriptions and background on some of the more famous Norse teams, including the Feathered Jaguars, Patraxi Pythons, Skywatch Sentinels, and Great River Wardens.
- Kara Temple Harpies Team Spotlight: an in-depth article focusing on the Kara Temple Harpies, the most recent Amazon team to have taken the Blood Bowl pitch by storm. Includes details of their history, team profile and colours, honours, Spike! team rating, as well as the roster of their triumphant 2499-2500 squad, and loads more.
- Star Player – Estelle la Veneaux: a profile on the Baroness of the Bayou, said by some to an embodiment of the Amazonian goddess Rigg – and by others to be a half-crazed Amazon covered in frogs – detailing her uncanny powers and vengeful career.
- Dirt from the Dugout: this time Mindy Piewhistle investigates the scandalous rumours surrounding the Genaina Javelins and their new, beautifully-scaled fashion brand.
- Star Player – Glotl Stop: a profile on this infamous Kroxigor Blocker, known to many as the Primordial Nightmare – or the Scaled Slasher. Though he often has trouble distinguishing friend from foe on the pitch, that's only added to the impressive body count Glotl's racked up in his explosive career.
- Amazonian Temple Leagues: brand new rules and advice for running the Amazonian Temple Leagues – a variant on the standard Blood Bowl league season, allowing players to compete in the Jungle Bowl – open to all teams with the usual budget of 1,000,000 gold pieces – for the mysterious Jungle Bowl Cup. Also includes unique tables for Sweltering Jungle Weather, Temple-City Kick-off, Lustrian Locals, and the effects of Ancient Artefacts.
- Overgrown Jungle Blood Bowl Pitch: includes rules for using the Overgrown Jungle Blood Bowl Pitch in your games, including special rules for the Jungle Floor and Torrential Downpour. (These rules are also included with the Amazon Team Double-sided Pitch and Dugouts Set.)
- Coffin Corner: Spike! Journal's obituaries column commemorating those players who are no longer with us, whether trampled on the pitch, torn apart, or possibly eaten.
- Chat with the Rat: ace Skaven reporter Hackspit ‘the Scribbler’ Quillchewer meets with Klara Vytis, Groundswoman for the Obsidian Ocelots, to discuss the many, many challenges of maintaining a game-ready Blood Bowl pitch in the depths of the Lustrian jungle.
- Amazon Balls: includes background and rules for two unique Amazon Balls – the Crystal Skull Ball and the Snake-Swallowed Ball.
- Secrets of the Amazons: a detailed introduction to coaching Amazon teams. Includes an overview of the strengths of their team, positions, tactics, and more.
- Star Player – Boa Kon'ssstriktr: a profile on the 'Scheming Serpent' himself, detailing how this mysterious and hypnotic Snakeman rose to prominence by tripping up enemy teams.
- Dungeon Bowl Update – Amazon Teams: provides a narrative and rules update for players to use their Amazon team miniatures in games of Dungeon Bowl.
- Mighty Blow! – Jungle Fever: a look back on some of the tall tales from the career of Bob Bifford. Includes a comic strip Bob Bifford reminiscing about his time in Lustria.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Hero Brawl
description:
Hero Brawl is a wrestling card game where you compete for the Hero Brawl Title Belt while trying to knock out all the cards in your opponents' hands.

Each player starts with 3 cards in-hand. On each turn, the player will take a card and play a card (taking whatever action is detailed on the card played).

The goal of the game is to force your opponents to discard all their cards, while also collecting the title belt for yourself.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Squirrel Tactics
description:
Squirrel Tactics is a family-friendly hex and counter conflict simulation. You could also call it a tactical level wargame, but without the nasty subject.

In this game two squirrel families try to collect and bury as many nuts as possible, before winter sets in. In the process they have to use the terrain to their advantage, block the opponent from reaching nuts, steal each other's nuts and also throw a nut or two at each other every once in a while. It's mad family-friendly fun, even for the most seasoned Grognard.

Each squirrel has a certain amount of hexes it can move and an amount of nuts it can carry. Then there are special abilities, like burying nuts for points. This way there is no dice rolling apart from figuring out random events and the exact result of throwing nuts at each other (the targeted squirrel might lose the nuts on its hex!).

Squirrel Tactics is available for download on Wargame Vault.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Pieces as Map, Variable Set-up

name: The Fall of Oakhaven
description:
“Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword upon you, and I will destroy your high places. Your altars shall become desolate, and your incense altars shall be broken, and I will cast down your slain before your idols…”

Save a dying land before darkness comes in this kingdom-defense board game.

The Fall of Oakhaven is a fully cooperative, strategy-adventure game for 1 to 4 players. Players will choose one of four Heroes to hide and preserve the Scrolls in a pick-up-and-deliver fashion. However, the land is being filled with horrible creatures during each round, which will eventually make saving the kingdom much harder. Do you fight the creatures or race to hide the Scrolls before time runs out? Defeating the threats gives you experience points in the form of Blessing, Wisdom, Power and Gold tokens. These tokens strengthen your Skills and Armory cards. Playing your hand of Armory Cards and Skills will require strategy once you enter the 6 Stronghold locations, where boss fights will test your endurance. Will you have enough time?

In the spirit of Defenders of the Realm and Legends of Andor, The Fall of Oakhaven pits Heroes against time and creatures of darkness, in an attempt to preserve the kingdom from complete and utter doom.

—description from designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Variable Set-up

name: HeirQuest PockeT
description:
The Lands of Lundor are in grave danger.
A Lich Lord called Ol'zon has been recruiting all kind of Monsters with the help of the ancient "Book of Souls".
The Queen has chosen you Heroes to be the warriors who finally end this madness. The Lich Lord is hidden in the deepest Dungeon inside the "Calodon Mountains".
Are you brave enough to enter the Dungeon and defeat the Lich Lord?

HeirQuest PockeT is a cooperative game for 1 to 4 players in which a group of Heroes will have to explore a dungeon until they complete the chosen Quest. During the adventure, they will have to eliminate all the threats that come their way and claim all the treasures they can. The game is for ages 12+ that plays in 30-60 minutes created by Victor Robles, designed by Lizuren Games and published by The Game Crafter. Each player chooses a Hero (Elf, Wizard, Amazon, Knight) and must complete a Quest. Players explore the dungeon opening doors and fighting Monsters. They will find treasures like armor and weapons to improve their chances to survive. To attack, the player must roll the combat dice. if his toughness points reach zero, the hero dies.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Alphabeasts Attack!: Double-Letter Promo Expansion
description:
Originally distributed at Essen '22 when you bought the base game.

This promo pack consists of 10 double-letter beasts (like II, DD, RR, ...) to make the base game harder.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Shambling Undead Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Shambling Undead Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Nurgle Team Card Pack
description: Full set of reference cards for Nurgle Blood Bowl teams including position players, special play cards, and Star Players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kesselring's War: Decision in Italy 1943-44
description:
Kesselring’s War: Decision in Italy 1943-44 is an operational level two player wargame covering the campaign in Sicily and southern Italy, July 1943 to February 1944. The game covers the months from Operation Husky through the initial landings in the southern peninsula up to the Anzio invasion and first battle of Monte Cassino. This was the time when the Allies could have gained a decisive victory but were stopped when German forces under the command of Field Marshal Albert Kesselring fought a series of delaying actions and then held a line south of Rome. The game system portrays operations across the theater within a framework of logistical and command/control restraints, modeled as Action Points. The objective of the Allied player is to seize major objectives in Italy, while the Germans are trying to stop them or, by judicious counterattacks, turn the tide in the Mediterranean Theater of Operations.

Each hex on the map is approximately 30 kilometers across. Each turn of play represents a month of operations. Ground units represent mostly divisions, independent brigades, and regiments. Air units represent the equivalent of a Luftwaffe Geschwader, USAAF wing or RAF group (9 to 15 squadrons). Naval units represent task forces.

22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters.

World at War #94, December 2023
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Heroes 3
description:
In far-off Essos, Queen Daenerys Targaryen rules over a court rife with intrigue. But while her subjects may involve themselves in plot after plot against each other (and indeed against the Queen herself), they stand united against their enemies in the field. With advisors and councilors such as Mirri Maz Duur, Hizdahr Zo Loraq, the scribe Missandei, and the mysterious Quaithe, the Dragon Queen sows confusion upon her enemies, while her commanders Marselen and Skahaz Mo Kandaq keep their troops in line, both by example and the whip’s bloody lash.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: The Ratcatcher: The Solo Adventure Game – Swag Rat Promo
description:
For a limited time, this peculiar rat hurriedly leaves the safety of its hidden treasure horde in search of not only magic cheese but anything shiny, unique or limited.

A ratcatcher who can snatch a loaded swag rat will find themselves flush with goodies.
So don't miss the chance to catch him.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Quipu
description:
Quipu is a party game where players write words on cards, hoping to have them spread-out on axis' created by another player.

The game involves using a push-pin to stick each answer onto the game board, and a quipu-inspired string for measuring the area surrounded by the players' answers.

The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Insert Coin
description:
An old friend, Simon Newall, owner of Retro Corner Arcade, reaches out to you to help solve a mystery that his father left behind, hidden in secret levels of certain arcade machines. You agree without hesitation, eager to reconnect with one of your childhood buddies. However, your hopes of a reunion are dashed when you arrive at the arcade and learn from his wife that Simon was killed during a burglary gone wrong. As one last favor for an old friend, you decide to do as Simon asked and figure out what secret was worth hiding in such a strange way. Are you ready to play? If so, Insert Coin!

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Unmarked Grave
description:
S.T.A.L.K. is the premiere group of ghost hunters in Valley Falls. You will assume the role of Kristina Noble, a local paranormal investigator who comes from a long line of psychics and clairvoyants. You are being considered for a spot in the group because of your passion for the supernatural and your investigative skills. While on a weekend camping trip in Easthaven Forest, you and the members of S.T.A.L.K. stumble across an unmarked grave deep in the woods. Because opportunities like this don't happen every day, the group decides to try and use paranormal investigation techniques to determine the identity of the body and learn what happened. Investigate The Unmarked Grave and follow wherever the trail leads. But, be warned! Easthaven Forest is known for its multitude of secrets. Who knows what dark truths you will discover once you drag those into the light?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Łamacze szyfrów
description:
In pre-war Poznań, a German spy network operates, transmitting secret information to the Reich. In order to detect the spy, Polish cryptologists and agents of the 'two' try to decipher the intercepted information and determine the meeting place of the agents.
The game takes place on the map of interwar Poznań, in which the training center for Polish codebreakers was located. By visiting special locations, players collect more tokens, attributes and hints helpful in deciphering the message.
The objective of the German part of the game is to make a meeting between an agent and a spy to exchange information and then leave the city without being caught by any Polish agent.
The most important element of the game is breaking an encrypted message prepared on the basis of one of the simplest ciphers - the Caesar cipher. However, without knowing the keyword, it can be quite a challenge.

—user summary
categories: Math, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II
mechanics: Communication Limits, Deduction, Traitor Game

name: Where Is Rip Thunderstone
description:
Rip Thunderstone has raided the podcast again... and he's pretending to be Andy!
Help Chris find the right co-host with this fun 3 player game. The quality of the podcast depends on you (Rip can be a very disruptive influence).

Shuffle the 3 cards and deal one to each player.
Whoever receives the "Chris" card declares themselves by stating, "I am the True Mister Six." Their objective is to successfully find which of the remaining two players has the "Andy" card.
The players who receive the "Andy" and "Rip Thunderstone" cards keep it to themselves. Both of them have the objective of convincing the "Chris" player that they are "Andy" without revealing their card.
If "Chris" identifies the correct "Andy" those two players win. If "Rip Thunderstone" is mis-identified as "Andy" then only the"Rip Thunderstone" player wins.
Will your powers of persuasion win the day and produce a quality podcast, or will the result be an episode filled with bluster and worthless noise?
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battles: North Africa
description:
Battles: North Africa is a 1-2 player tactical skirmish print and play wargame depicting British Army operations against the German Army in North Africa during 1942-1943.

The game features 3 types of missions and 10 battle maps. Campaigns consist of either 5 or 10 random linked skirmish battles, including missions such as Meeting Engagements and Defending Villages. The game features an advanced enemy German Army AI bot opponent which makes calculated decisions based on its current situation. Day/night, weather, line of sight, suppression, and 7 terrain types with movement/cover effects are also included. Players will be able to improve their units' skill levels by doing well on the battlefield.

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with 10 enemy unit types, 10 battle maps, an advanced AI bot opponent, randomized enemy German Army setup, randomized enemy German Army skill levels, moderate table footprint, and quick setup/breakdown times, Battles: North Africa offers an entertaining game for players of all skill levels, plus great replay value.

The player will move his units through hexes on a battle map, while attempting to destroy enemy units.

Game components include a various battle maps, tables book, unit status sheets, campaign log, and counter sheets representing individual units, etc.


The game is available as Print and Play on Wargame Vault.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Boss Dog International
description:
Boss Dog International is a family-friendly-dog-frenzie where players collect, feed and steal each other’s canine criminals to create the ultimate Boss Dog Family. Dominate your opponents and strategically heist their furry little friends as you battle it out for the top dog title.

The game gets more intense with every card you play because the more dogs you recruit, the more there are to steal! Boss Dog International will keep you laughing, is quick to learn, family-friendly and takes 15 to 25 minutes to play. We all know the way to a dog’s heart is through his stomach. So the object of the game is to collect yummy FOOD CARDS to impress the Boss & WIN!

On your turn you can play food cards to recruit dogs to your family, garbage cards that make other players food worthless, action cards to steal dogs, get rid of garbage or cancel your opponents actions.. Once the end-card is played everybody counts their points and the player with the most points wins.

This expansion is a full-sized game that can be played with or without the original Boss Dog base game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Move Through Deck, Take That

name: 姫と騎士：乙女の誓い (Princess and Knight: Maiden's Oath)
description:
Three expansions for 姫と騎士 (Princess and Knight).

Expansion 1: New "Manifest" system brings people's support to your team. And "Episodes" link princess and knight tightly.

Expansion 2: New princess' and knights, two pairs.

Expansion 3: New (selectable) bond actions for all 14 characters.
mechanics: Action/Event, Open Drafting

name: Assault Sicily 43
description:
Mediterranean sea, southwest coast of Sicily island.

It was the early morning of 10 July 1943 when the first landing craft dropped their ramps at Gela and the first units of US Rangers set their boots on Italian soil. Together with the British and Canadian units that had landed further east, the Western Allies launched an unprecedented landing operation to push open the gate to Fortress Europe.

The night before, on 9 July, American and British airborne troops had already dropped into enemy territory behind the planned beach landing zones to occupy important positions. This was to prevent or delay timely counterattacks by Italian and German troops on the day of the landing.

This operation, called Husky, was the beginning of the end of the Italian army as an ally of the German Wehrmacht. It was the additional front, long demanded by Stalin, and thus brought the necessary relief of the Eastern Front.

Assault Sicily 43 is the second volume in a planned series of tactical level wargames in which players lead historical units into battle during the landing and airborne operations around Gela Beachhead in July 1943.

Americans, Italians and Germans fight bitterly for the backdoor Sicily as a launchpad for the invasion of the continent.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simulation
publishers: Assault Games, Sound of Drums GmbH

name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Shiloh
description:
The Battle of Shiloh, or Pittsburg Landing, April 6-7, 1862.
The 9th title in the Last Full Measure series.
250 yards per hex on a 19 x 24 inch map. 5/8 inch counters and 1/2 inch markers. Units are regiments and batteries.

Johnston's Confederate Army of the Mississippi attacks Grant's Army of the Tennessee encamped just inshore of Pittsburg Landing on the Tennessee River with the goal of destroying it before Buell's Army of the Ohio can arrive.

Players receive victory points for eliminating enemy strength points and taking certain geographic objectives; the player with the most points at the conclusion of a scenario wins.

—description from designer
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: In Too Deep: Dice Tower Side Crime Promo Cards
description:
Two new side crime card for In Too Deep, first made available through the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter in pack D.

Dice: You must be in the Parish, with at least one criminal
Tower: You must be alone in the Towers
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Millennium Blades: Destruction Dinosaur Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
Play: Roll three 6-sided dice. For each rolled this way, flip up to one card in a player's tableau with a star number that matches that die's roll.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Five Leagues From The Borderlands: 3rd Edition – The Ancient Land of Dust
description:
Everywhere you turn, you sense the struggle between ancient death and new life. They say a great war was fought here in forgotten times. I don’t think it ever stopped.

Known to those who live here only as “The Dust”, this is one of the least hospitable regions of the world. A land of rocky ground and endless desert, saturated with magic. It is also a land rich with history and a sprawling civilization, making the most of a dangerous and precarious situation. The Dust was not always as it is today. Records tell of an ancient land so green it was known as the Emerald Fields before the rise (and fall) of a great evil. Deep in the sands, the minions of the Warlord are stirring again. Dead soldiers rise, and bands of warriors find themselves stolen across time, knowing that the Warlord calls them to service. Even the spirits that embody the desert itself feel restless, mocking mortals that a great time of war will soon be upon them again.

The Ancient Land of Dust is an adventure expansion for the Five Leagues From the Borderlands solo adventure wargame. Use the new rules, tables, and guidance to bring your characters to The Dust, or create new characters from the region. Fight ancient evils, seek fame and riches, or simply try to make your mark. The Ancient Land of Dust is filled with danger and rewards for all!

This 58-page pdf only expansion includes:

New options for character creation.
Environment and region rules for playing in The Dust.
Undertake a quest to learn the Serpentine Arts - a new form of magic with new spells and mechanics.
Details on joining The Desert Scouts who watch for danger in The Dust.
New settlements, events, and modifications to campaign activities.
Desert encounters, Temples of the Old War, deadly new enemies and Aberrations.
Guidance on preparing your tabletop and terrain. New items, equipment, quests, rewards and riches!
Requires the Five Leagues From the Borderlands core rules
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape From Kabul
description:
Escape from Kabul - Doin’ the Bugout Boogie is a four player game where players represent three allied factions and one opposing faction: The three allies are: The International Security Assistance Force (ISAF), Non Governmental Organizations (NGO), and the Afghanistan Government. They are opposed by a Player representing the Taliban. (For classroom purposes, Players may also be teams instead of individuals.)

The game is based using modified mechanics of the popular game AFTERSHOCK: A Humanitarian Crisis Game, by Rex Brynen, notably with an inverse timeline represented in the game turn sequence.

The allies’ main purpose is to evacuate refugees from Kabul as it falls to the Taliban before the agreed upon withdrawal date of ISAF on 31 August 2021. The Taliban Player’s purpose is to inhibit these evacuations.

Refugee Tokens still on the Kabul map at the end of the game are considered failed evacuations. The game is a win or lose proposition for the allies. Since there is no game mechanic that shows whether an ally did better than another, it is suggested that all allied Players cooperate to the best of their ability.

Refugee evacuation is regulated by the Perceived Threat Urgency Index (PTUI). As the PTUI increases, refugee tokens can be evacuated quicker.

In fixed Player order 1) Taliban, 2) Afghan Gov't, 3) NGO, & 4) ISAF; players may draw Coordination cards, then a mandatory Event Card, move their tokens in the TAD phase, perform two actions (e.g. move refugees to airport, eliminate other player tokens, or media outreach, & evacuate refugees from airport), then get or take supplies. Too many hostile acts may raise the Public Affairs Tracy and the game may be lost early. There are more actions than can be mentioned here. 8 pages of rules.
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Area Movement, Command Cards, Finale Ending, Multiple Maps, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: 学校へ行こう! (Go To The School!)
description:
学校へ行こう! (Go To The School!) is a card game from Japan. The Japanese title translates more correctly as 'Let's Go To School!', but the box title is given as above.

In this game, five schoolgirls are late for school. The players must help them get to school on time. The cards are double-side, and the players sit facing each other. A player can see the back-side of the cards in their hand, and the front-side of the other player's cards. Working together, they place the cards into a tableau, to bring the children to school on time.

The side facing away from the player helps them draw more cards to hand, but also makes the children later for school. Players must deduce which cards they are holding, and which to play face-up or face-down.

If they can get the children to school on time, the players win.

The original game is for 2 players, but a later expansion pack allows 3 or 4 players.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management
publishers: Hangom Games, Oppo Games (おっぽゲームズ)

name: Win Win Winter
description:
Winter is getting a little closer every day. The squirrels rush to gather the last acorns before the cold makes the last fruits fall from the trees.
In this game the family of squirrels that collects the most acorns is the winner. Played in turns, each player rolls the dice and moves the squirrel family along the path. We have to make simple calculations to work out the most effective strategy. As usual, the dice indicates the number of squares that we can advance, however, we must be careful. The number on the dice gets deducted by the total number of acrons we are carrying, thus reducing the number of squares that we can advance.
The game ends when all the acorns are gone. Winter has arrived and it's time to count....
It is a game for two to four players. It includes two game boards, which can be substituted depending on the number of players.
In this strategy game, the family of squirrels that manages to bring the most acorns to their burrow will be the winner. A sustainable and proximity game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Adventuring Letty
description:
Every day's an adventure in this hand management game about Letty, a rescue pup from Chicago. In this game players compete for Letty's attention through everyday adventures. From cuddles & treats to car rides & walks in the park, explore all things Letty and gain her attention. The player who has Letty's attention when any player runs out of cards wins the game!

Come join in Letty's adventures in this easy to learn, difficult to master card game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato

name: MiniMancala
description:
MiniMancala is one of the smallest non-trivial mancala games in existence, although Nano-Wari is smaller and Micro-Wari (played on a board of the same size) needs fewer seeds.

Each hole of the 2x2 board starts with 2 seeds. On his turn, a player distributes the contents of one of their holes, one by one, in a counterclockwise direction over the following holes. Seeds are never removed, so there are always 8 seeds in play.

If a player cannot do their turn because both their holes are empty, they lose.

Perfect play is a non-terminating draw, but imperfect humans often lose quickly against perfect play, even though you have at most 2 possible moves each turn!
mechanics: Mancala

name: Unyielding Universe
description:
In Unyielding Universe, 2-4 players attempt to make long and beautiful lifelines. They achieve this by drawing "Year" cards and then placing them within their lifeline chronologically, either by adding them at the end or replacing them. All the while the Universe will try to make their lives more challenging and complex. "Universe" cards that add a scoring adjustment or a gameplay modifier will be drawn, or "Life Complete" cards will be drawn and wreak havoc on your lifeline, not allowing you to play cards past a certain age.
The goal is to score the most points at the end of the round. Scoring factors in the length of your lifeline as well as the quality of your lifeline.
Life is challenging and it is up to us to try and make the best of it, even if we must spite the Universe to do so.
mechanics: Ordering, Push Your Luck

name: The Cruelest Month: Air War over Arras, April 1917
description:
When T.S. Eliot penned, "April is the cruelest month", he was talking about seasonal and life stages, not about a dreadful offensive on the Western Front that would be called the "Battle of Arras" but remembered far better for what the Royal Flying Corps called it-- "Bloody April." Still flying mostly outdated aircraft, General "Boom" Trenchard insisted on constant offensive actions and round-the-clock missions for recon, artillery spotting, mapping, etc. With the most common plane involved in this work being the dreadfully vulnerable Be2C, facing up against the likes of Baron von Richthofen's Jasta 11, the results were woeful losses. To the RFC's credit, they continually fulfilled the missions, despite the losses.

Now, Paul Rohrbaugh's The Cruelest Month looks at this struggle, with the focus primarily on air operations and ground battle abstracted (something like he did in Chennault's First Fight.) As the British player, you will marshal your limited numbers of fighters to help secure the skies for 2-seaters that would be better suited to training planes. As the German player, you will employ your well-armed modern fighters against waves of RFC planes that simply keep coming, regardless of how many you shoot down.

—description from the publisher

Against the Odds ANNUAL 2020 issue
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: OPPIDUM
description:
OPPIDUM is a Tactical level skirmish board wargame that takes place during the 50s BC, when Julius Caesar successively attacked the various Celtic and Germanic peoples in Western Europe and (future Great) Britain.

The game uses the concepts and scale of the Cry Havoc series. The different scenarios will allow you to simulate ambushes, attempts by the defenders of Alesia to break the siege or the landing of Roman legionnaires on a Britannia beach defended by warriors on chariots.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Black Tie
description:
The game of strategy, sabotage, and espionage. In Black Tie you take on the role of director of intelligence for your own agency. You will have to manage and increase you assets, misguide and disrupt opponents, and most of all protect and collect secret data.

Black Tie is a twist on deck builders where players are competing to gain the most points. Players earn points by procuring cards, called assets, and by stealing data cards from other players.

On their turn players can play cards to perform a variety of actions including building security systems, activating agents, sabotaging other players, and stealing assets.

Black Tie takes hand management to a whole new level with mechanics such as card storage, partial hand retention, and the ability to increase hand size. Careful hand management is more important than ever thanks to Black Tie's unique card stacking mechanism where players may play multiple identical cards as one move in order to pull off more and more powerful actions.

The game ends immediately when all of the double agent cards have been purchased and played.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Dueling Princesses
description:
The duel is on to build the greatest castle! Each turn, players simultaneously roll their dice and select 1 or 2 for placement on each player's 6 tower castle card in their bid to claim the Crown but be careful in your use of the Curse dice. As towers rise, players may take on additional dice but they affect scoring differently and may allow your opponent to complete their build first for a bonus. We hope the simple rules and fast pace will bring your family joy upon the throne for many games to come!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Garden of the Queen of Hearts
description:
The Queen of Hearts told Trump soldiers to decorate the garden! Which trump card soldier will be able to decorate the garden most beautifully!

Players turn over 3 playing cards, select 2 cards, and complete them in the prettiest way in ascending and descending order on a 25 square grid!

[Scoring]
1 point for each ♤ in the largest group of horizontal lines (rows) of ♤, +5 points if all horizontal lines (rows) are filled with only ♤

1 point for each ♧ in the largest group of vertical lines (columns) of ♧, +5 points if all vertical lines (columns) are filled with only ♧

2 points for each ♡ in the largest group of ♡ squares (1, 4, 9, etc.)

2 points for each ◇ in the largest group of diagonals of ◇

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Square Grid

name: Here To Slay: The Illusive Trickster Promo Card
description:
Convention Promo card for 2023

Card Text
At the beginning of your turn, you may switch The Illusive Trickster between Wizard and Thief.
Once per turn on your turn you may DISCARD a Magic card, then DRAW 3 cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Interrupts, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Emma Frost & Psylocke
description:
Two powerful psychic mutants await in Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Emma Frost & Psylocke.
