First is Emma Frost, a powerful telepath with the ability to turn her body into organic diamond. Joining her is Psylocke, who can manifest the focused force of telepathic power as a "psychic blade". This pack adds these characters to their collections with three beautifully sculpted miniatures and three stat cards: one for Psylocke and one for both Emma Frost's normal and diamond form. Beyond their basic abilities, this pack invites players to unlock even more potential in these characters with six Team Tactics cards, including one that gives Emma Frost a leadership ability for the new Hellfire Club Affiliation!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Normandie: War Stories #02 – Colombelles Castle
description:
Castle Of Blood

Behind the metallurgical factories of Colombelles is the castle of the same name. The building, subjected to heavy bombardment, miraculously escaped destruction. Elements of the 16. Luftwaffen Feld Division and the 21. Panzer Division were entrenched inside and slowed down the advance of the 3rd Canadian Infantry Division. The Régiment de la Chaudière, supported by tanks of the 1st Hussars were sent to dislodge the Germans. Almost 80% of the city of Colombelles was destroyed. On November 11, 1948 it was awarded the Croix de Guerre with a silver star.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Centurion: Roman Generals
description:
An optional add-on.

4 new tiles for Centurion:

Alaric the Goth
Gaius Julius Caesar
Hannibal Barca
Scipio Africanus

These tiles replace existing the following tiles in Centurion: Scipio Africanus = Funditores; Gaius Julius Caesar = Tribunus; Hannibal Barca = Exploratores; Alaric the Goth = Velites.

There are two ways to incorporate these tiles into the rules (both players should agree which rule they'll use before the start of play).

1. Players randomly determine who will choose first. The first player selects one of the four tiles from this expansion pack. The second players selects the next tile, then the first player selects the next tile and finally the second player selects the last tile. Both players remove the tiles corresponding to the tiles they've chosen (as noted above), place the new tiles in their bags and the game proceeds as normal.

2. For a more challenging game, players lay the four tiles from this expansion pack on the side of the board, then start a standard game. Whenever a players pulls one of the four (base) tiles noted above, they can choose at that moment to replace the drawn tile with the appropriate tile form this expansion pack. If the player decides not to replace the tile, he cannot replace the tile at any future time. Yes, this means a single player could have all four tiles on their side.

WEAKNESS (NEW MOVEMENT ICON)
If an enemy tile enters the indicated square, Gaius Julius Caesar is immediately captured.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Power Rangers Deck-Building Game: Shattered Grid
description:
Lord Drakkon is on the loose and seeks to destroy the Power Rangers, no matter where they exist in the multiverse! Rangers from across the eras must team up to stop him.

Power Rangers Deck-Building Game: Shattered Grid explores the storyline of the same name involving alternate universes, strange visitors, and time travel. Now is your chance to use all of your Power Rangers sets and expansions in one all-inclusive battle for the ages!

This expansion requires the Power Rangers Deck-Building Game Core Set or Zeo – Stronger Than Before to play.

Features:

Allows you to use all your Power Rangers Deck-Building Game cards in an epic crossover experience!
Team up with Rangers from across the eras to defeat Lord Drakkon!
Take advantage of a temporary Secondary Grid using your previous sets!


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game

name: Up & Down: The Ski Slope
description:
The players are rolling dices and following a Dice Result Table to make their way up the mountain, gathering information about the condition of the slopes. The more information they have gathered, the faster they can move. When they've reached the top, they start making their way down along the Piste, unlocking a new Dice Table. The player who first has reached the Goal at the bottom right corner of the Ski Slope has won the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Map Deformation

name: Diversión con Animales
description:
Diversión con (Fun With) is a trivia game system played in 12 rounds.
In each round, a question card related to three randomly drawn knowledge cards is read.
Simultaneously, everyone at once chooses an answer, getting a point if the answer is correct.
Whoever at the end of round 12 has scored the most points wins the game.

In Diversión con animales (Fun with Animals) questions are related to the name, weight, height and origin of worldwide animals.
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Questions and Answers

name: YOLO!
description:
YOLO! is a fast-paced, strategy card game built around winning the stock market and going “to the moon”. Experience the absurd world of stonks, get filthy rich, and have fun messing with your opponents using hilarious meme cards. It takes a bunch of stonks and tendies to go to the Moon, so get out there and start earning!

HOW IT WORKS:
- Take Turns
- Collect stonks to win
- Receive gains to get filthy rich
- Strategize with Options & Memes

HOW TO WIN:
Collect 3 Moon Tickets (completed sets of Stonks) and take your crew to the Moon.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: Gloria Dei: Biblijna gra planszowa
description:
The Temple of the Holy Family was built for decades. We did it - God's House inspires admiration. Only the stained glass windows are missing. They will appear soon. The dark, Gothic windows will be illuminated with countless colors, and the paintings and inscriptions will remind you of extraordinary events from the Bible. Each stained-glass window will tell the story of a different character, and the wonderful work will be crowned with the Latin words GLORIA DEI, because everything is for the Glory of God.
In GLORIA DEI, each player takes on the role of a stained glass maker. He receives his own boards with windows, which during the game he will fill with pictures showing fragments of stained glass.
The winner will be the one who will make thoughtful, logical decisions, who will be lucky and who will show perceptiveness.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Biblijni Wędrowcy: rodzinna gra planszowa
description:
Wanderers discover events from the Old and New Testaments, and with them interesting, often surprising tasks.
The texts on the cards of this game are arranged in such a way as to simultaneously refer to the Bible and to the everyday life of the players: the talents they received, creative ideas, interesting passions, great, important events, as well as everyday matters that may seem it's trivial.

Players travel through the biblical land together discovering new cards. They always win together by reaching the end of the expedition, but they try to make their result as high as possible.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Events

name: Przyjaciele Święci
description:
The game brings the figures of saints closer. It shows their images, presents important events and curiosities from their lives.
The goal of the game is to collect as many pictures and cards about saints as possible, from which you can also create the highest scoring combinations.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Combat Commander: Europe/Med. Master Edition
description:
This Master Edition combines both CC: Europe and CC: Mediterranean into one package and includes the new Minor Nations Battle Pack material as well. This version is how the game was originally conceived and designed.

Combat Commander is a card-driven board game covering tactical infantry combat in the European Theater of World War II. One player takes the role of the Axis forces while another player commands the Allied forces. These two players will take turns playing one or more “Fate” cards from their hands in order to activate his units on the mapboard for various military functions.

Players attempt to achieve victory by moving their combat units across the game map to attack their opponent’s combat units and occupy as many objectives as possible. The degree to which a player succeeds or fails is measured by a scenario’s specific “Objective” chits, the destruction of enemy units, and the exiting of friendly units off the opponent’s board edge.

A game of Combat Commander is divided into several measures of Game Time. There is no sequence of play to follow, however: each Time segment is divided into a variable number of Player Turns, each of which may consist of one or more Fate Card "Orders" conducted by the active player. Fate Card "Actions" may generally be conducted by either player at any time. "Events" — both good and bad — will occur at random intervals to add a bit of chaos and uncertainty to each player’s perfect plan.

SCALE: Each hex of a Combat Commander map is roughly 100 feet of distance (about 30 meters). Each complete Player Phase abstractly represents several seconds of real time. Each complete measure of Game Time abstractly represents several minutes of real time.

Each unit in the game is approximated as either a single Leader, a 5-man Team, or a 10-man Squad. Radios — and individual weapons larger than a pistol, rifle or BAR — are represented by their own counters.

Components:
6½ countersheets
One 24-page Rulebook
One 52-page Playbook
Eight PAC sheets (6 two-sided nationality cards, one Terrain chart, one misc. play aids chart)
439 Cards (6 decks of 72 cards each, 1 Fate card, 6 nationality reference cards)
24 Maps on 12 double-sided 17" x 22" sheets
One 8½" x 22" Track Display
mechanics: Advantage Token, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Cathood
description:
Cathood means: "the state or time of being a cat".

In this game, you’ll be one of eight lovely cats, each with its own personality, that move around this neighbourhood in order to search for resources. And what’s the goal? Set your territory by visiting parks, meeting humans and collecting toys to win prestige points and become the most beloved cat in the neighbourhood.

This is an area control, pick-up and deliver and set collection game where managing the right resources is essential to succeed. The modular neighbourhood, constantly changing, brings an innovative puzzly vibe to the decisions, tests the orientation skills on a map and encourages players to think and interact as a cat. Are they going to walk in the streets or jump through the roofs? Stop in a cat café to exchange resources or hiss to another player to steal from its personal supply? Learn new tricks and complete secret objectives or be the first to visit important places and expand their influence? Since players might activate a limited number of actions per turn, according to the number of discs in front of them, creating the right synergy is key for a winning strategy. Are you ready? Puuuuurfect!

It was one of the five finalists of the "I Concurso de creación de juegos Zacatrus"

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Stoic
description:
Stoic is a placement game with simple rules. There are many abstract games in which you capture your opponent's pieces by sandwiching them between your pieces, but in this game, you cannot place a piece in a position where one of your opponent's pieces is sandwiched between two of yours. The player who cannot place a piece in their turn loses.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal" set.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Stride
description:
One of the attainment games where you try to reach the other side of the board.

You start the game with a fixed initial placement, and each turn you move one of your pieces, which must jump over exactly one other piece. The piece jumped over can be either color.

You win if your piece reaches the farthest end of the board, but you lose if you run out of pieces to move.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal" set.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Static Capture

name: Skirt
description:
A game in which the object is to connect opposing edges of the board with your pieces, like Hex.

On each turn, the player places their piece in the outer area, and then another piece in the inner area as if it launches from the outer one just placed. Only if the piece placed in the outer area is adjacent to other pieces or their rows, the second piece can be placed by jumping over them.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal" set.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Relative Movement

name: Sanduíche
description:
Conde Col launched a challenge: assemble a card sandwich without having ingredients in hand. Let's go! Call the gang and devour this game several times.

—description from the designer

O Conde Col lançou um desafio: monte um sanduíche de cartas sem ficar com ingredientes na mão. Vamos lá! Chame a turma e devore este jogo várias vezes.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Party Game
mechanics: Command Cards, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Pick-up and Deliver, Programmed Movement, Take That

name: Eagles in the Sky
description:
Silk scarves. Leather helmets. The sound of the wind in the wires as you cruise over No Man's Land searching for enemy aircraft. Suddenly you see one, and put your plane into a dive from out of the sun...

Eagles in the Sky is a 2-player card-based game on plane to plane warfare during the last year and a half of the First World War. Players each command a "flight" of 1 to 6 aircraft during any of several types of missions, including patrols, photo recon and even balloon busting.

The game includes all of the major types of aircraft active on the Western Front in that period, including the Fokker triplane, Sopwith Camel, SPAD XIII and Fokker DVII.

Eagles in the Sky may be played in one of two ways: individual engagements or campaigns, in which the players control "squadrons" and complete 5 days of missions, taking into account losses, pilot fatigue and the requirements of higher headquarters.

Each engagement is 8 turns long, and each turn except for the first begins with a random event. These can add or subtract aircraft from the engagement, cause flak fire or other effects. The players then determine who has the initiative and draw a hand of cards based on the number of scouts (fighters) in their flight and the ratings of the flight leader. They then (beginning with the player with initiative) alternate playing cards to activate their aircraft. Activations can be Targeted against another plane or ground target or Untargeted (things like clearing gun jams). When targeting another aircraft the target can play a card in response. Depending on the planes' ratings and the cards played one aircraft may gain Position over another, which allows it to attack. Attacks are resolved by drawing a card and checking the combat portion of that card to see if the attack succeeds and how much damage it does.

In a campaign each day begins with one player drawing cards to see which particular missions will occur that day. Players then resolve each mission in turn, starting by assigning aircraft and pilots to it. A given pilot can fly as many times per day as the player wishes, but each flight incurs fatigue, which will eventually exhaust that pilot.

Missions are resolved as engagements (using the base rules) or encounters, where each side's aircraft meet a non-player opposing force. At the end of each day, players reduce fatigue of their pilots, repair damaged aircraft and attempt to get replacements for any planes or pilots that have been lost.

The game plays quickly; a one on one dogfight can take as little as 15 minutes, and even a campaign can be completed in a long evening. Components include a play mat, 140 1" square aircraft counters, 176 5/8” square markers, 110 cards and numerous play aids and record sheets.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Command Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Case of the Blinded Birder
description:
Bockerly, England. 1955. Near the sleepy English village of Bockerley, a reclusive birder is shot in the woods. The police declare it a hunting accident and no suspects are brought to trial. The case goes cold until a sparky spinster with a lace umbrella and gossip’s ear finds proof that it was murder. Was it his overbearing mother? His dead wife’s violent brother? A poacher on the run from his past? And why are the police saying less than they know? Help her and her bibliophilic friends solve this classic cozy mystery.

This case folder contains the following components:

‘Personal & Confidential’ envelope with Introductory letter from Cecily Miller
Investigator details
Section of the Bockerly Chronicle, featuring reporting on the murder
Full-color 12 x18″ map: “The Village of Bockerly and Surrounds”
A 12-page city directory with hundreds of residential and business locations
Log sheets for tracking investigator movements
Sealed ‘Solve Envelope’ with questions for the end of the investigation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Expansion: Sellswords 1
description:
The Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught Expansion - Sellswords 1 bolsters your games with exciting new characters for hire! Four new mercenaries apply their skills and offer up new options, abilities and tactics when assembling your party. Kick in the door with Dralm the Tortle Fighter or manipulate the very flow of battle with Molly Farhill, the Gnome Cleric! Hangaku the Human Monk brings forth mobility and expert swordsmanship and Kithra Coldforge the Dwarven Paladin hurls hammers of righteous force!

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Critical Hits and Failures, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 5: Masters of the Universe Faction
description:
Might and Honour

The palace guards are always on watch. They are elite soldiers trained to protect the royal palace and keep the peace in Eternia, but even they may need help when the forces of evil make their move. Fortunately, Fisto – a powerful warrior – is not afraid to use his brute strength to defend the kingdom. His massive fists can take down any enemy, making him an invaluable ally in every battle. Add these new characters to your forces, and watch battles become more epic and exciting!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Zombicide: Divine Beasts
description:
The Divine Beasts set contains 4 different Abominations based on mythical creatures that bring a new level of challenge to your Zombicide games.

It contains:

4 Abominations
1 Abomination Card
12 Divine Beast Action Cards
4 Skill Cards
1 Rules Leaflet

Aside from their passive abilities, each Divine Beast has 3 special Action cards. When a Divine Beast would activate during the Zombie phase, it draws from its deck of Action cards instead. Then it performs the legendary actions described on the card, heralding in waves of chaos across the board! Once a Divine Beast runs out of action cards in its deck, it vanishes from the board, signaling the spawn of the next Divine Beast.

Defeating a Divine beast grants the Survivor with a blessing of a Skill card.

—description from the publihser
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Made Up Movies + Deluxe Expansion
description:
100 extra cards to keep the fun times rolling with even more combos and EVEN MORE FUN! This deluxe deck will fit in the base Made Up Movies game box (sold separately).

INCLUDES: Made Up Movies Base Game + 100 ADDITIONAL CARDS (30 Movie, Cards, 25 Star Cards, 15 Genre Cards, 15 Setting Cards, 15 Studio Executive Cards)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rival Panels: Weapon X Program
description:
The famous rivalry between two of the deadliest weapons to emerge from the Weapon X Program hits the tabletop with this new pack for Marvel: Crisis Protocol! Logan once counted Sabretooth among his few friends as the pair fought beside one another on a covert team, but Sabretooth’s unshakeable bloodlust tore the team apart, and now they face off as bitter rivals. Featuring beautifully sculpted new miniatures of Logan and Sabretooth, this pack adds new versions of these iconic characters to players’ rosters and introduces the new Weapon X Program Affiliation to Marvel: Crisis Protocol. Additionally, players will also find 6 Team Tactic cards that further enhance Logan and Sabretooth’s abilities as well as several props that allow players to customise their bases.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Merchants of Culture
description:
Players take the role of a new book publishing house, seeking to sign quality authors and publish their best works. By publishing best sellers and creating a diverse library of works they not only make money, but achieve the trust and confidence of the bookreading public.

Each turn begins with a die roll. Where this roll matches the dice players have placed, they activate, bringing in authors, books and money, or moving books further along the publishing pipeline, earning sales along the way.

Activated dice always reduce their value by one, and are eventually removed, so the player's holdings and situation are always in flux. Players must constantly evaluate where they stand and decide how best to place their new dice, not only with respect to their own tableaus, but also those of the opponents.

Players interact, not merely competing to create the best selling books, but also by signing away others' authors, and even their books.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Income, Loans, Random Production, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Set-up

name: Seabound Board Game
description:
Seabound is a 3-6 player casual board game of sea exploration, discovery, and battle that requires wits and the luck of the dice to win. Set sail into unknown waters to discover new lands, recruit daring crew, and amass your fortune.

Seabound is an action economy dice game set on a flower tile hex map. After rolling a d6 dice to determine how many different actions you can take on your turn, you can then spend those on a number of different action types:
1. DISCOVER: The primary mechanic of the game. You can use your actions to roll to discover new lands that you have reached to uncover lost treasure.
2. ATTACK: You can spend your actions to attack other players which will cause them to be SHIPWRECKED!, leading them to drop their plunder, available for you to scoop up.
3. MOVE: You can spend your actions to move over water and land, costing different amounts depending on the type of terrain.
4. BUY: You can spend your actions and gold to buy crew, which give you special and unique abilities that can help you with all the different actions you can take.

The goal of the game is to have the most gold and discovery tokens, each worth 1 point, after all the undiscovered tiles have been discovered.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Nautical, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Action/Event, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Multi-Use Cards, Resource to Move, Take That

name: 9th Circle
description:
In 9th Circle, players assume the role of Demon Lords. Using Minions to take control of various Realms of Hell, these Demon Lords seek to gain favor with Malacoda. The more Favor a player has with Malacoda, the more powerful they will become. When any Demon Lord reaches 25 Favor, Malacoda is pleased, and the one with the most Favor at the end of the round wins the game.

Gameplay is divided into rounds consisting of four phases. The first phase involves sending minions to the board and influencing their movement. In the second phase, realm dominance is determined for each of the 8th Circle realms. The third phase requires players to exercise powers in a clockwise order from Malacoda. Finally, in phase four, the players score and award favor for the 9th Circle sacrifices and 8th Circle shades.

The game concludes at the end of the round when one Player attains at least 25 Favor OR immediately upon Malacoda returning back to the Realm he started in, his patience having run out. The Player with the most Favor wins the game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hidden Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Bitoku: Promo 5
description: This is a promo Bitoku (Meijo) card.After moving player's marker on the promo card at the Bitoku Path, you could get an Iwakura stone and place it in the Iwakura Rock area of your player board or place a pilgrim with it its sleeping side face up on any empty space on the Rock Path of your player board that is next to at least one Iwakura Rock(the Pilgrim cannot be used again).
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Linkee: Booster Pack
description: Adds 200 new cards for Linkee!.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Global War 1985
description:
Global War 1985 is a game of global conflict in the 1980s. Designed for 2 to 7 players, it has 3 scenarios:

1. Pacific Typhoon: a three player scenario between the Soviet Far East Command, the US Pacific Command, and China.
2. Red Thunder: a two to four player scenario between the Warsaw Pact, NATO, Soviet Global Command, and US Global Command.
3. Global ThermoNuclear War: a three to seven player including the entire global conflict and all seven playable factions.

Global War 1985 has several unique features. First, it represents a global, hypothetical conflict in the 1980s. Second, it allows player to utilize nuclear weapons, and execute possible 1980s nuclear attack options, as an integral part of a combatant’s strategy and planning, without ending the game automatically. Third, it showcases the Chinese economy and military in the 1980s, including relevant unit types and theorized strategies like People’s War. Finally, it is the only Global War series game, to date, that includes multiple scenarios.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Birth of the Roman Republic
description:
This is a prequel expansion for The Republic of Carthage. You will need a copy of The Republic of Rome to play it.

The expansion depicts politics in Rome from the expulsion of Tarquinius Superbus, the last Roman king, and the establishment of the Roman Republic up to the First Punic War.

-description from publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Bribery, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Income, Negotiation, Ownership, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Voting

name: Carson City: Solo Pack
description:
This Solo mode expansion pack contains 20 cards and offers you all the Cards you need to play solo against Standisch, a fierce adversary that will offer you a pretty serious challenge.

This pack comes with a link to a digital copy of the rules only.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Однажды в Чикаго: Ограбление поезда (Once upon a time in Chicago: Train Robbery)
description:
John Fitzpatrick's new investigation: at night, a gang of miscreants stopped and robbed an express train carrying a large sum of money for the city treasury at the entrance to Chicago Station.

In addition to the familiar newspaper articles, ciphers and clues, there are new, additional gameplay mechanics in this mission. For example, players now need to pay attention to the time of day, as the result of visiting some locations will depend on it.
mechanics: Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wormhole Bounty Hunters
description:
Objective:
Be the first of two players to capture three bounties by navigating through the galaxy, exploring wormholes, and overcoming challenges based on die rolls.

Wormhole Bounty Hunters, including the rules and tokens, is an A.I. (GPT-4) generated game for pen, paper, or printer, 2 dice and 2 players. (tokens were generated by OpenAi GPT-4 as .svg code)

Expanded description of the game Wormhole Bounty Hunters:
Wormhole Bounty Hunters is a thrilling two-player board game that takes place in the far reaches of the galaxy. Your objective as a player is to outsmart and outmaneuver your opponent to be the first to capture three bounties. The bounties represent (for instance) notorious criminals on the run, hiding in the vast expanse of space, waiting to be captured.

The game unfolds on a 6x6 matrix board, representing the galactic expanse with 36 possible locations. These locations can be empty space, have a bounty value from 1 to 6, or contain a wormhole.

Each player takes turns navigating through the galaxy, moving their spaceship from one location to another based on die rolls. The players begin the game at an xy-dice values based location and from there, they explore the galaxy, by rolling with their die and moving horizontally and or vertically, but not diagonally, the corresponding number of steps to a new (or same) location.

Exploring a location reveals what's hidden in that sector of space. If it's a bounty, the player captures it by trying to throw the corresponding die value, add the bounty to their collection and place a space station (offering the possibilities for upgrade and shield tokens).
If it's a wormhole, the player's spaceship is sucked in and spat out at a new xy location on the board, offering an unpredictable twist.
If a bounty hunter arrives on a location where another bounty hunter is located, either by moving there, or via a wormhole, they can try to steal one of the opponents bounties by rolling a 6.

The first player to capture three bounties and return safely to one of its own Space Stations wins the game.

Wormhole Bounty Hunters is a game of strategy, luck, and exploration, filled with anticipation and surprises. Whether you're traversing through open space, capturing bounties, or tumbling through wormholes, every turn brings a new challenge.

Generated by GPT-4, Wormhole Bounty Hunters is more than just a game; it's an adventure waiting to unfold. So gather your dice, draw or print your tokens, and embark on a thrilling hunt across the galaxy!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Munchkin Cows
description:
Here's the latest 15-card set of monsters and Treasures for any Munchkin game. Steak your claim to this expansion before it's gone, because you'll veal sad if you miss it . . . and that's no bull.

This is an expansion for Munchkin. It is not a stand-alone game. These cards originally appeared in Munchkin Unicorns and Friends.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Doblón
description:
Set in the Age of Piracy, the European kingdoms are fighting each others for the possession of the richest ports in the Antilles. Their best preferred weapons are the guns of their fleets, the gold of their governors, the force of local militias, the power of the Church and the cunning of their spies. They will try to overcome the enemy governors and seize their gold.
Doblòn is a card game with easy rules and fast play, with a fixed number of turns.
At the end of the last round, the player who earned or seized the most doubloons is the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Set-up

name: Witch Market
description:
You are a witch in the stock market and you must use your magic and ingenuity to obtain more money than your opponents.

Witch Market is a no language dependent, family-friendly filler where players must buy or sell ingredients from the market at the most opportune times.

Buy: To take all the ingredients of the same color from the market for Free! You know... using magic.

Sell: Discard from your hand all the Ingredientes of the same color and get coins for them! This is how you win!

The value of each sold Ingredient will be equal to the number of ingredients of the same type sold on the Market! So plan your sales wisely.

Get rewards for being one of the fastest sellers! Sometimes selling first is better than selling a lot, so time your sales to get coin rewards.

But don't be greedy! At the end of the game, each ingredient that is still in your hand will subtract 2 coins! So try to take the necessary Ingredients and sell them in time.

Witch Market is a game of 20 minutes, where each movement will modify the Market and the decisions of all the witches.
Can you be the wealthiest witch? Or will your greed win you over?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Market, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Finta
description:
Finta is a drawless connection game for two players: Red and Blue. It is played on a square grid of dots arranged in rows and columns. The dots on the first and last rows are connected to their neighbors on the same row with horizontal red lines, and the dots on the first and last columns are connected to their neighbors on the same column with vertical blue lines.

Red plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, connect with a straight line of your color two orthogonally or diagonally adjacent dots that are not yet connected with a straight line. Lines and chains of lines of different colors may touch but must not intersect. A chain of lines of the same color may intersect itself, on a dot or elsewhere.

You win by completing a chain of lines of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, Blue will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Red instead of making a regular move.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid

name: Cablink
description:
Cablink is a drawless connection game for two players: Red and Blue. It is played on a square grid of dots arranged in rows and columns. The dots on the first and last rows are connected to their neighbors on the same row with horizontal red lines, and the dots on the first and last columns are connected to their neighbors on the same column with vertical blue lines.

Red plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, you may connect with a straight line of your color two orthogonally adjacent dots that are not yet connected with a straight line.

Alternatively, if two parallel red lines and two parallel blue lines form a minimal square with dots as vertices, you may connect the midpoints of your two lines in the set with a straight line of your color, as long as the two enemy lines in the set are not yet connected with such a line.

Chains of lines of different colors may touch but must not intersect. A chain of lines of the same color may intersect itself.

You win by completing a chain of lines of your color touching the two opposite board edges of your color.

To make the game fair, Blue will have the option, on their first turn only, to swap sides with Red instead of making a regular move.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Scenario Kit: The Benefactor
description:
Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught: Scenario Kit – The Benefactor is a companion to the Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught Harpers vs. Zhentarim core game, featuring six new scenarios and cards to use existing miniatures in the new scenarios. It’s a great way for players with a large number of D&D minis to quickly expand their Onslaught collection, for new players to try out our other miniature lines, and for painters to customize their Onslaught experience.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Expansion: Red Wizards 1
description:
Welcome four new fierce Red Wizard characters with Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught: Expansion – Red Wizards 1! Devise new strategies to tactically take out the opposition. Expand your collection of characters for your magocratic Red Wizard faction. Shoot your poison phrases at your enemies as Zhaleshah the Bard. Harness the destructive and restoring power of fire and torch the competition with Stagharr the Druid and their Wildfire Spirit. Weave your web to outmaneuver your rivals with Vendrah Regalle the Ranger and their spiders. No time for cool downs with Jalana Stalos the Paladin. Instead, gain and spend divine charges to smite your foes. Whether you are coming in hot with some fierce front-line forces or stealthily crawling and slashing your way through enemies, the Red Wizards 1 Expansion offers new exciting ways to add to the onslaught.

Contents:

4 fully-detailed, pre-painted miniatures
4 Combat Dial Cards
8 Level Up Cards
1 Summon Card
Gameplay tokens
Rules sheet

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Expansion: Many-Arrows 1
description:
Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught Many-Arrows expansion brings four new characters to your game, offering new, tactical advantages over each scenario. The specialist and support characters are an area-control and melee focused faction that can buff allies, debuff opponents, and add new tactical options. Utilize each character's individual abilities to battle opponents and foes, in order to conquer each scenario in a whole new way.

Diarmuid the Fairy Nature Cleric finds hidden foes scattered across the battlefield and heals the party. Sarzumina the Half-Elf Phantom Rogue poisons her foes and moves easily across treacherous terrain. Falenyn the Triton Abjuration Wizard protects companions with powerful wards and dispels magical effects. Thurkear the Wise is a Lizardfolk Archfey Warlock, who makes friendly characters invisible and uses magical spells to avoid attacks.

Contents:

4 fully-detailed, pre-painted miniatures
4 Combat Dial Cards
8 Level Up Cards
Gameplay tokens
Rules sheet

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Expansion: Zhentarim 1
description:
The Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught Expansion – Zhentarim 1 brings four new characters, each with their own unique strategies to your games! Vonkar Zzod the Hobgoblin Cleric wades into battle supported by his spiritual weapon, and “Ruby Eye” Doireann the Dwarf Barbarian dares you to engage. Sha’Bel, Life-Sever the Goliath Fighter excels in the front lines while Daiyu Tseng, the Human Bard hides in shadows, lashing out with psychic blades and malevolent whispers.

Expansion Packs are a perfect way to expand your collection with exciting new characters that ensure you have the right tools for any scenario or opponent you may face. This product adds four new characters options to the Zhentarim faction.

Contents

4 highly-detailed, pre-painted miniatures
4 Combat Dial Cards
8 Level Up Cards
gameplay tokens
rules sheet

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Topper Knocker
description:
Topper Knocker is a competitive, turn-based board game where players build the map as they go, and work to slow down their opponents as they race to victory.

2-6 players start out with towers on hex tiles in the center of the map. On their turns, they can choose to either discover new tiles to place adjacent to their towers, grow their existing towers, spread out and build new towers, or draw cards that can have powerful effects that can either benefit or harm them. The first player to reach 5 level 3 towers wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cube Tower, Map Addition, Tile Placement

name: Katmandu: Age of Artifacts
description:
Duel across the hidden realms in a unique face-paced trading card game!

The Age of Artifacts Collectible Trading Card Game is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn battle between two Champions across three lanes of combat.
The first starter kit contains two 40 card decks, Boro and Eldred, which each boast a different play style to try.

The goal of the game is to use your champion, units, and spells to reduce the opposing player's life total to 0.

The game is played in a series of rounds where you play powerful creatures and spells in a series of three lanes. Once you or your opponent can't play anymore cards a combat round is initiated. This causes your creatures to attack which in turn can deal direct damage to your hero if they are not well protected. Spells can create sudden twists in the game causing opponents to loose creatures or initiating early combat when your opponent might not be ready. Are you ready to take on the fight for the Age of Artifacts?
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Turn Order: Pass Order
publishers: Cryptozoic Entertainment, Falcon's Beyond Licensing, LLC

name: The Battle of Dulcimer Strait
description:
The Battle of Dulcimer Strait is a 2 player sci-fi tactical wargame where players go head-to-head in battle using 7 ships, skill cards and dice rolls. Games can last between 30 to 60 min depending on game play options. Each ship uses specific movements and rules letting the player develop different strategies for different situations.

Two factions had been at peace for over a century. New leadership has lead to strained relations between the two. War had been looming for many years. It would take only one small spark to begin a war known as the Broken Alliance War. On May, 24th 2463 a small squadron of the United Planets of Earth fighter ships and bombers were escorting the USS Zumwalt 3 DDG(X)1011 Battleship through the small corridor of space known as the Dulcimer Strait. They met the Villtarian Federation Battleship, The Grawling. It was flanked by fighter ships and bombers of the royal Villtarian military. Both sides were fairly matched and as for who fired the first shot is still up to debate.

Number of Players: 2
Ages: 14 and up
Playing Time: 30 - 60 min
Complexity: 5.5 on a 9 scale

Game Components:
• One 16-page, color instructions booklet
• One 14" x 22" game board
• 2 Player control boards
• 1 Militia control board
• 7 United Planets of Earth ships
• 7 Villtarian Federation ships
• 1 Militia ship
• 2 six sided dice
• 67 red cubes
• 36 Yellow cubes
• 6 Blue cubes
• 36 Skill Cards
• 4 wingman stands
• 1 player sequence reference sheet

Game art, design and concept: Justin Wade Gibson
Watch for Kickstarter soon

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Power Rangers: Deck-Building Game – Card Storage Box
description:
Organize your entire Power Rangers Deck-Building Game collection with the Power Rangers Deck-Building Game Card Storage Box. But that’s not all! Included are 10 cards for solo play so you can defend or conquer the world on your own!

Contents & Features:

10 cards for solo play
1 set of rules for solo play
52 Standard Card Dividers
13 Oversized Card Dividers
2 Tuckboxes to hold Oversized Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Team-Based Game

name: Piratas!: Navegar é Preciso
description:
First expansion to Piratas, only for its 2nd edition.
9 ship cards, ghost pirates and cursed pirates.

"Primeira expansão para o Piratas!, só compatível com sua 2ª Edição.

Nesta expansão são inseridas embarcações, um novo tipo de carta que tem efeitos especiais que ajudam o seu dono a vencer. Além das embarcações (são 9 cartas), também são inseridas novas cartas de tripulação, o Pirata Fantasma e o Pirata Amaldiçoado.

Essa expansão é modular e você pode jogar com as embarcações e os novos Piratas, como pode jogar só com um deles."
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Imperial Fever: Great Power Competition in the Late 19th Century
description:
Imperial Fever is a deckbuilding game for three to four players that recreates the period between 1881 and 1915. Players will vie for world dominance as they take on the roles of the United Kingdom, France, the Central Empires (Germany and Austria-Hungary) and the Emergent Powers (the USA and Japan). The game features a unique approach to this complex and important period of world history, including the following innovative aspects:


A deckbuilding mechanism that will allow players to pursue different strategies.
A variety of other mechanics, including area majority, push your luck, tug of war, technology tracks, and set collection.
Competition between players in different areas: national prestige, military power, naval dominance, colonial expansion, and key strategic areas.
International tensions that may culminate in the outbreak of the First World War.
A wide range of political agendas that will allow players to choose among different paths to victory.
A rich Event deck that poses additional challenges to players, ranging from international conflicts to political mishaps at home.
The influence of non-player powers such as Russia, China, Holland, Belgium, Spain, and Portugal.
The full game is playable in under four hours, once players are reasonably familiar with the rules.


—description from the publihser
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Post-Napoleonic, World War I
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Market, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: Galileo Galilei
description:
"And yet it moves", he said.

Galileo Galilei is a Euro-style game in which you take on the role of an astronomer who will discover new planets, find unknown star systems, develop their telescope, and make a scientific breakthrough in the difficult ages of obscurantism.

Use your telescope to select one of the five actions available, with you being able to evolve these actions into better ones. Collect cards of different planets and star systems. Collect lenses of the three main colors to make a discovery. Be wary of inquisitors as they might arrive unwelcomed and ruin your fame in no time. Better find a way to profit from their visit instead...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Rebirth – One-Shot Pack 1: Cry for Justice
description:
Each Rebirth One-Shot Pack features 2 new playable Characters and their Signature cards to unlock during the Rebirth campaign. These packs also each contain a new Scenario that can be played between the normal Scenarios of the campaign, allowing you to unlock even more cards for that Campaign, or as a standalone game with special rules.

Each One-Shot Pack includes:


2 Oversized Character Cards
2 Character Standees
6 Signature Cards
9 Standard Cards
1 Oversized Scenario Rules Card
1 One-Shot Rules Card


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Rebirth – One-Shot Pack 2: Time Heist
description:
Each Rebirth One-Shot Pack features 2 new playable Characters and their Signature cards to unlock during the Rebirth campaign. These packs also each contain a new Scenario that can be played between the normal Scenarios of the campaign, allowing you to unlock even more cards for that Campaign, or as a standalone game with special rules.

Each One-Shot Pack includes:


2 Oversized Character Cards
2 Character Standees
6 Signature Cards
9 Standard Cards
1 Oversized Scenario Rules Card
1 One-Shot Rules Card


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Hojo Helmet
description:
A promo Forbidden Fortress Artifact card first given out to Dicefest 2022 attendees, but later available as part of the 2023 Roll to Move webstore sale for orders over $100.

Forbidden Fortress Artifact - Clothing - Hat

Once per fight, prevent up to D6 wounds you are about to take. For each use, roll a D6 - Discard on the roll of a 1.

1 Weight, 1 upgrade slot, $350.

Promo 456
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Road Behind
description:
As the nuclear winter spreads through all the continents, obliterating the planet’s ecology, you realize that it’s not safe to be by yourself, raising a toddler.

You pack what little food you have left, a few clothes, and open the hidden entrance of the complex for the first time in... has it been 5 years already?

Road Behind is a survival, risk management solitaire game, in which you and your child travel south along a winding road, avoiding dangerous people and inhospitable places, rummaging for food and shelter among disaster, looking for a latitude where the disaster hasn’t reached, on which you, and especially the kid, can start a new life.

Managing the risk of events along the road is a critical part of the game. The other is choosing wisely between comfort and progress, when to hide, when to rest, and when to push forward towards the end of the road... and safety.

[GAMEPLAY]

Each turn, you will:

Perform actions.
Draw new action cards.
Consume food.
Update weather.
Affect morale.
Reset shelter.
Review inventory.


Additionally, whenever an Event is triggered, it must be resolved immediately, before continuing the turn.

You use actions to move on the road, use an item, rest, or perform special actions like rummaging, taking shelter or hiding.

You win the game if you reach the last card in the road deck, and after applying all its icons you have at least 1 KID action card left on your action deck, hand or spent pile.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Events, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Coco Loco
description: Meet our friends: Coco the Monkey, Loco the Giraffe and Tuko the Toucan. They all live on a sunny island. They love to play together and pick coconuts. Today, they want you to play with them. But what is that? Oh no, a huge wave is coming! Can you help Coco, Loco and Tuko move all coconuts to the mainland before all of the islands get flooded? Players roll dice and move into islands to collect coconuts. You need to complete 8 coconuts to win. Do it before all islands are gone!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: StatYou: Rude Deck
description:
Does your humour know no bounds? Imagine a pole-dancing dictator or keelhauled metalhead. Does a sneaky smile appear on your face? Then expand the StatYou base game with these Rude Deck cards and bring out the laughing sadist in you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Race, Voting

name: Tomorrow: Promo Pack 1
description: First promo pack, distributed by board game stores. It contains 4 cards (2 Dragonflies and 2 Government) to add to the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Take That

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Royalty Pack 1
description: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Royalty Pack 1 features 23 cards that immortalize each winner from a "Prince of the City" tournament.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: AxianQuest: Weapon Artifacts
description:
Can’t have enough HeroQuest?

Boost your game of heroes and quests with the fully compatible AXIANQUEST Weapon Artifacts deck!

What kind of artifacts are in the deck? Here’s the full list!

Axe of the Executioner
Axe of Frenzy
Great Axe of Frenzy
Bow of the Wild Hunt
Demon Crossbow
Sword of the Bloodied
Sword of the Sun
Soul Eater Sword
Sword of the Hurricane
Crystal Blade Dagger
Soul Eater Dagger
Holy Morningstar
Flanged Mace of the Wild Hunt
Singing Blade
Staff of Bones
Staff of Wizardry
Charged Staff
Staff of the Geomancer
Sword of the Flame
Murderous Sword
Ok, so what’s in the deck?

20 different artifact weapons that you can use as random loot (just draw a card!) or as special, selected treasure in your home-brew quests

Rules for the Arcane Emporium of the Axian Witch where heroes can try their luck to find the artifact of their dreams
The Astral Hunter monster card, a new monster that feeds on the raw energy of the most powerful artifacts

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Three Dice Cricket
description:
Three Dice Cricket is a solo sports replay game of test cricket. It uses real-life batting and bowling averages to rate players with a match playing out as batting partnerships until ten wickets have been taken, ending the innings. Each team has two innings with the higher aggregate score over both innings winning or, after five-days' worth of play has occurred without a result, the match being declared a draw.

Each batsman rolls the dice once and references a scoring chart to determine how many runs they score, with higher-rated batsmen likely to reach higher run totals. The game also includes ways of incorporating weather and pitch conditions as well as the important aspect of determining how each batsman was out and the bowler/fielder involved in the dismissal.

A full match can be played to completion in 90-120 minutes.

There is also a refinement of the charts to utilise percentage dice (2 x D10) which the designer refers to as "Percentage Cricket." The gameplay is the same, the charts just give slightly different results.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 0-100 Familj
description:
A trivia game where you have to answer with a number ranging from 0 to 100. Answers can be in length, width, height, temperature, speed, size, age and given in units like centimeters, years, hours, crowns etc. The game differs from other trivia games which are often limited by given answer options.

The game is played in three rounds, consisting of seven questions each. The player with the lowest score at the end of the game is the winner.

There are more than 1000 unique questions.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Temporal War
description:
The Temporal War is fought in an arena built at the beginning/end of time itself. Warriors from across time and space are gathered to battle in the arena. Their reward is a brief moment of near infinite power. With this power, the winner can grant almost any wish imaginable.

This is a collectable card game for 2-6 players. You can play a free-for-all rumble or form teams of two or three.

Each player begins with one summoner in the arena, a deck of cards which represent their summoner's memories, and various warrior pieces and tiles to put into the arena.

The game ends after a certain number of rounds have been completed (4 or 6). If a winner hasn't already been decided through combat, the player who controls the most energy sources claims victory for themself or for their team.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Map Reduction, Movement Points, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Second World War at Sea Midway: Aftermath
description:
We know what happened after the American victory at Midway. What might have happened had the Japanese won instead? We pick up the story after the mutually destructive Battle of Midway. SNLF troops have taken Midway in days of bitter fighting and the Japanese must decide what to do next.

Midway: Aftermath is a Campaign Study, with eleven scenarios depicting Japanese operations in the Hawaiian Islands against a diminished but not eliminated U.S. Pacific Fleet built around the carriers Saratoga and Wasp plus the battleships of Task Force One.

You’ll need Midway Deluxe Edition (just Midway Deluxe) to play the scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Minimap Resolution, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Heroes of Stalingrad: Battlefield Stories #01 – All Quiet on the Eastern Front
description:
This expansion allows you to play in two new environments, a fiercely contested Kolkhoz on the outskirts of Stalingrad, as well as the docks on the west bank of the Volga. With this, you can relive the dangerous crossing of the river by the soldiers of the Red Army.

Battlefield Stories are new products containing Terrain Boards (Brand New) and Scenarios (Brand New).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Yonder
description:
A cataclysm in the old world sends refugee ships teeming to the new world. Elves, goblins, ogres, dwarves and skeletons from beyond the great ocean set up sawmills, wharfs, workshops and homes on the plains outside a great city. They bring with them arcana - magical crystals native to their lost continent that hold great value in these new lands.

Yonder is a worker-placement and engine-building game from the designer & illustrator of Villagers, Streets, and Moon.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Market, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Lunar Rush: Plasma Thrusters Promo Card
description:
Plasma Thrusters is a promotional card first included with purchases of Lunar Rush at GenCon 2023, and also available to Kickstarter backers. The publisher provides the following card description:

For this card, you may "boost" your ship that is in the final Medium or Slow route, whether it's Up (to the Moon) or Down (to Earth), forward and immediately arrive to the destination. You can do this for the Fast route too, but it generally doesn't help as much. Some clarifications below:

You may only use this card once per Turn, and must spend an Ore and Shard to do it.
You may use this card any time during the Moon Phase, except in the Game End Final Scoring period, you may use the card ONCE just before moving the ships to the market.
When used on the Up route, you may immediately get the resources from the ship you "boosted." The resources for this ship may be used to build Gold Modules.
When used on the Down route, the ship that is "boosted" sells FIRST in the Market Sale Order, ahead of any other ships.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Market, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: Monarchs of Camelot
description:
"The Battle of Camlann dealt a permanent wound to the kingdom of Camelot. Arthur, emperor of Britain, is dead. Without the wisdom of the lamented king, and lacking a legitimate successor, the empire is slowly shattering, while enemies old and new prepare to pick apart its corpse.

Will you earn the trust and respect of the functions with your deeds and lead Camelot into a new era? Or will you let it all be destroyed, burned to the ground as primordial foes stir from their slumber?"

Monarchs of Camelot is an Arthurian themed, storytelling, decision making, and resource management game for 2 to 4 players. In this game, you will take on the role of a Legendary Monarch and by playing your Hero's unique deck you will use your resources or special abilities to support (or contest) non-player characters (Speakers), take advantage of opponent's perils, journey to different places, and choose which story path to follow.

Every time you play a card your Hero evolves as new options become available and you get closer to achieving your personal goal.

Choose between Queen Guinevere, Sir Lancelot, Lord Oberon, and Lady Nimue and try to prove your worth by wisely using your Knights, Advisors, Spies, Magic and Gold to tackle your own personal goals and earn Prestige points. Reach 10 Prestige and Camelot’s throne is yours.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling, Voting

name: Žižka: Reformation and Crusade in Hussite Bohemia, 1420-1421
description:
Bohemia, 1420. The King was dead. Less and less able to resist the encroachments of higher nobility and ever more prone to leaving the matters of state in the hands of others, Wenceslas IV of Bohemia had passed away that previous August. Allegedly, a stroke killed him upon hearing the news of the defenestration in Prague of anti-Reformation councillors. Wenceslas’s brother Sigmund (or Sigismund) of Luxembourg, King of the Romans, expected to succeed to the Bohemian throne.
Enter the Hussites. By early 1420, the Bohemian adherents of early-Reformation scholar and preacher Jan Hus, who died a martyr’s death in 1415, had grown in number and confidence. Radical Hussites even founded communes, awaiting the Second Coming of Christ.
Sigmund, frustrated by his stalled succession and obligated to the Catholic Church, organized a crusade against the Bohemian heretics, supported by his Catholic loyalists. The Hussite factions rallied, fought the crusaders, and in June 1420 soundly defeated them before the gates of Prague. When Sigmund’s rivals in the Holy Roman Empire launched a second crusade, the Hussites beat them again in late 1421. In the first two years of the Hussite Wars, the one-eyed haytman Jan Žižka and other Hussite leaders had managed to secure two great strongholds—Prague and Thabor—along with most of Bohemia, making the Hussites a power which would soon threaten all of neighboring Europe.
In Žižka, designer Petr Mojžíš (The Bell of Treason) brings Volko's Levy & Campaign series to the heart of late Middle-Ages Europe. The iron Lords of the Holy Roman Empire can withstand even crossbow bolts, and gunpowder is in its infancy. A new army emerges to collide with the seemingly invincible knights: peasants with no training but fanatical religious faith and therefore no mercy.

The Hussites start with almost no Strongholds, cannot obtain Coin from the populace, and are slowed by the vulnerable flock of women and children accompanying their flailmen. They must build their capabilities step by step and use unorthodox tactics and weapons like war wagons and various firearms. Or perhaps their religious songs can even scare away the crusaders!
The seemingly strong Catholics have challenges too. The number of crusaders joining the cause as well as the timing of the crusade are uncertain and the logistics daunting. Two mighty fortresses and a fortified hill complicate the struggle for control of Praha (Prague).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Hedbanz Lightspeed
description:
The quick question game of “What am I?” is back with Hedbanz Lightspeed! From Spin Master Games, Hedbanz is fun for the whole family. Play your favorite quick question game at lightspeed! Rules change in a flash as your electronic headband lights up one of three colors. Guess as many cards as you can before your headband sings, signaling your time has run out! The player with the most points wins! When it turns GREEN, act out a scene! At lightspeed ORANGE will flash, answer the questions fast! When you see BLUE, give 3 clues!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Questions and Answers

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Echoes of Death 4
description:
Echoes of Death 4 includes 4 new survivors that embody memories from another world. These memories can be unlocked by reaching unique milestones in the story of your campaign.

This set includes prototypes of Strain System mechanics. Add your Strain Milestone cards to your game, if you reach their unique conditions, your gameplay changes forever. A new fighting art borne from distant dreams is permanently added to your game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: NICE TRY: Team Edition
description:
NICE TRY: Team Edition is a competitive party game in which teams of at least 2 people face fast, crazy and funny challenges in the areas of cleverness, skill and physical awareness.

The special thing about it is that at least 2 people per team compete together in each challenge. With simple household objects such as spoons, coins or toilet paper, everyone can show what he or she is capable of.

In the bidding phase before the game, each team bets on how well they will do. The players have to assess their own skills as well as those of their teammates in order to earn points.
Each team that succeeds in its bid earns points. Those who overestimate themselves earn minus points.
Special games and jokers bring additional elements into the game.

The team that has earned the most points after 8 rounds wins.
Do you earn the respect of your fellow players,
or do you just get a gleeful "NICE TRY!"?

—description from the designer

NICE TRY: Team Edition ist ein kompetitives Partyspiel, in dem sich Teams aus mindestens 2 Personen schnellen, verrückten und witzigen Herausforderungen aus den Bereichen Cleverness, Geschick und Körpergefühl stellen.

Das Besondere dabei: in jeder Challenge treten mind. 2 Personen pro Team gemeinsam an. Mit einfachen Haushaltsgegenständen wie Löffeln, Münzen oder Klopapier kann jeder zeigen, was sie oder er drauf hat.

In der Gebotsphase vor dem Spiel wettet jedes Team darauf, wie gut es abschneiden wird. Die Spieler müssen dabei ihre eigenen aber auch die Fähigkeiten der Mitspieler gut einschätzen, um Punkte zu verdienen.
Jedes Team, das sein Gebot schafft, bekommt Punkte. Wer sich überschätzt, sammelt Minuspunkte.
Sonderspiele und Joker bringen zusätzliche Elemente ins Spiel.
Das Team, das nach 8 Runden die meisten Punkte erspielt hat gewinnt.

Verdient ihr euch den Respekt der Mitspieler,
oder kassiert ihr nur ein schadenfrohes „NICE TRY!“?

—description from the designer (German)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: A caccia di conchiglie
description:
A Caccia di Conchiglie is a game based on the mechanics of remembering and matching the same shapes and colours: the shells are defined by a unique double code of shape and colour to facilitate their recognition.
Throw the shells on the beach, memorise them and then hide them. And now roll the die: do you remember where the corresponding shell is? Whoever collects the most wins!
The frustration of failing to match images, a typical problem in classic memory games, is replaced here with the amusing uncertainty of what the consequence of the error will be, while still rewarding the right behaviour.
mechanics: Matching, Memory

name: Colour Crazy
description:
Colour Crazy is a mind-bending game of brilliant colours. Race against your opponents to connect colours and claim victory. Colour Crazy will twist your mind, test your reflexes and leave you craving for just one more game.

To begin, set up enough matching piles on the table for the player count and then deal out each player's cards face down. Once the dealer shouts "Start," each player quickly grabs their top seven cards and must match them with the cards on the table. Matches can be made by pairing the word on one card with the colour of another. Once you place all the cards in your pile you win the round. Everyone else keeps the remaining cards in their hand for the next round. After three rounds whoever gets rid of all their cards is the winner!

In what seems like a simple matching task will split your brain in a mad rush to the finish. Use wild and block cards at opportune times to break up your opponents rhythm or string together a run of matches to grab the victory.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Matching, Speed Matching

name: Black Powder Epic Battles: The Waterloo Campaign – Bonaparte's French Army Starter Set
description:
Sunday, 18 June 1815; on an unassuming rain-soaked field in Belgium; two great generals of the age finally met in battle; ending fifteen years of continuous warfare on the continent, and bringing to an end the reign of Napoleon. The Battle of Waterloo, arguable the most famous battle in all military history, provides more than a fitting subject for our second foray into the 'Epic' scale of wargaming. Black Powder Epic Battles: Waterloo is upon us.

Bonaparte's French Army starter set provides a solid core of a French army fighting in the Hundred Days campaign - 10 units of line/light infantry, 3 units of skirmishing voltigeurs, units of each type of heavy cavalry (Cuirassiers, Dragoons and Carabiniers) and light cavalry (Hussars, Chasseurs a Cheval and Lancers), supported by 16 pieces of artillery and brigade commanders. Also included is an MDF building of the Decoster House and a bespoke A5 softback rulebook with Napoleonic specific content.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Worminators Inside Job
description:
Welcome to the Big Apple, a city rotten to its core. A high-profile politician has just been murdered, and only the Worminators can solve the case. You’re one of the hotshot detectives that have earned the title of Worminator, and you’ve been ordered by the chief to investigate this murder. If the media frenzy around the case weren’t enough to throw you off your game, the mayor’s office seems to be blocking you at every turn. Rumors run rampant that this might be… an inside job.

Worminators: Inside Job is a game Born at PAX. What does “Born at PAX” mean? We at Lynnvander Studios teamed up with the PAX team to run a panel called Design a Board Game Live. Worminators: Inside Job was conceived by the crowd at PAX West 2022. They came up with the combination of buddy cop worms, and we refined their ideas into the board game you’re holding now!

In Worminators: Inside Job, each player is a worm detective assigned to the case. You will build your own deck of Detective cards as the game advances, using them to gather evidence and bring it to the courthouse. Will you be able to assemble the clues and solve the murder before the city becomes overrun with corruption or drowns in criminal activity? Get your badge and let’s find out.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Events, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Chupito!
description:
AKA The Original Six-Shooter Challenge Game

Chupito! is a party game for 3-12 players that takes less than a minute to learn, less than an hour to play, and is endlessly repeatable. Players draw challenge cards, wager bullets against one another, and try not to get shot!

Each player starts with an equal number of bullet cards and 3 bomb cards (these are single-use and can affect the outcome of a round). On their go, a player enters a bullet card and draws a challenge card from the pile, which they read aloud. Other players can challenge them by entering their own bullet cards.

The challenge is then played out and the winner gets to fire all the bullets at the losers by flipping the cards over and dishing them out. The player with the least bullet holes at the end of the game is the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Lose a Turn, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Singing

name: Booster Brat
description:
Anything and everything can and should be collected.

In the Booster Brat TCG, you will use a carefully curated deck of cards to steal your rival's collection and build up you own. Play as either Spark or Captain, two brothers beginning their journey into the cutthroat world of Card Collecting.

Each 2-Player set includes:
(1) 20 Card Spark Deck (with orientation cards to get you started)
(1) 20 Card Captain Deck (with orientation cards)
(1) 14 Card Bonus Pack - Includes intermediate level cards, 1 Holo Promo and 3 Randomly Inserted Holos (From a Pool of 12)
(2) Build Your Own Playmat Packs
(1) Full color rulebook

Print Run of 500 Starter Sets.
This lot is for 10 2-Player Sets.
mechanics: Trading

name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – YT-2400 Light Freighter Expansion Pack
description:
A classic light freighter returns to Star Wars: X-Wing in this pack! A fast and resilient light freighter, the YT-2400 features a variety of weapon emplacement points, making it an attractive vessel for smugglers who favor a heavily armed “transport.” This pack adds one of these ships to players’ collections along with new ship cards for Rebel hero Dash Rendar and his droid companion Leebo. Joining these two pilots are two standard loadout cards that give players everything they need to jump into action and reprints of 8 upgrade cards that invite players to outfit their YT-2400 to their specifications.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Bluffing, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon's Fury
description:
INTRODUCTION:
Dragons abound brave adventurer! Pull out your trusty pips of weaponry and mayhem and search the skies for sharp-toothed dragons. Keep you quick wits about you as you roll for success!

DESCRIPTION:
Dragon’s Fury is a quick dice-based fame (VP) system where 2-6 players attempt to complete different challenge cards to end with the most fame.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Score the highest fame points by completing variable difficulty challenge cards

GAME PLAY:
Players will take turns rolling their favorite set of polyhedral dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, and d20) to complete sets of varying difficulty. Each turn, players will receive an additional challenge card from the draft pool, increasing their scoring potential.

GAME ELEMENTS:
Use your own favorite DND dice set
Easy to setup, learn, and play
Travel size - bring it with you anywhere

NOTE: You will need to provide a set of d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, and d20 dice for each player. They are *not* included with the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Animal Fair
description: We are enterprising animals who trade apples, lemons and pineapples, but above all, buy shares in guilds. Every three turns, what they produce is divided among the shareholders. Anyone can add cards to the mentioned guilds that influence their operation. Purchasing and selling goods/shares dynamically changes their prices. We can hire helpers for the goods we have - they not only give you points, but also unique abilities. At the end of the game, we turn every five money we have into a victory point.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Market, Stock Holding, Zone of Control

name: Schlau wie ein Rabe
description:
In this fun quiz game, you have to reduce spans on a number scale or challenge your fellow players. From geography to history to everyday knowledge, there is something for everyone. And if you don't know anything, you can always question the answer of the others. In this way, the guessing game provides lots of fun and laughs, and you learn interesting facts along the way.
The quiz game with 333 questions about animals, geography, everyday life, pop culture and sport.
Riveting in the Eiffel Tower, distance you can smell a skunk and duration of a Martian year - who can place the ravens correctly and thus narrow down the range of numbers? And who is completely off the mark and therefore doubted? Knowledge, bluffing and a portion of luck are required in this varied quiz game. Grab the ravens and let's go!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Crime & Dine: Das Krimi-Dinner-Set – Mord in Asgard
description:
Invite your guests to an exciting dinner evening on the occasion of the Midsummer Festival in the Asgard theme park. But be warned: murder is on the menu today! As the game's end, you are the main suspects in a mysterious death: The aging amusement park Asgard offers a variety of attractions that thrill young and old alike, but on the evening of this year's Midsummer Festival, the fun comes to an abrupt end as park owner Jare Sandström is suddenly found dead and all the guests are asking themselves the same question: Who did it? Together you take on the roles of the guests and employees of the amusement park and try to find the murderer. Who will think creatively enough and uncover the truth? In the end, will you succeed in solving the case or will you let the perpetrator get away scot-free?

This set contains all the materials you need for an unforgettable mystery party with 5-8 people. With the additional recipes, costume suggestions, decoration ideas and the accompanying playlist, the evening is guaranteed to be a complete success. The mystery game is ideal for a murderously fun evening with family and friends or as an event gift for a birthday.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Combat! Volume 3: Arnhem
description:
Combat! is a Tactical level Solitaire-Only board-wargame f man-to-man combat in World War Two. This is the third game in the series of Combat! games that use the same system. This game introduces the British Armed Forces into the system. The game will focus on one of the most well-told moments in the long history of Britain. The fight for Arnhem Bridge.
