Players will use the actual British army forces that fought at the famed bridge and most hold at all costs. This is a stand-alone game.

The game system uses a unique AI to make for intense combat situations as well as unlimited replayability. You will stand on the defense against a relentless foe. Can you hold on?

There are multiple scenarios covering several stages of the attack on the Arnhem Bridgehead. The results from each scenario will influence the following scenario if you wish to play a campaign game – or play any battle as a stand-alone experience.

Product Information:
Complexity: Medium
Solitaire Suitability: 10 out of 10 – Designed specifically for solitaire play
Time Scale: 30-90 seconds per turn
Map Scale: 10 yards per hex
Unit Scale: Single man per counter; man-to-man combat
Players: One
Playing Time: Three to five hours per scenario

Game Components:
Three 24” by 38” game maps (a historically accurate map of the Arnhem Bridge), One 11” by 17” map
Six counter sheets (1-inch playing pieces)
Two Decks of Playing Cards (52 cards for Allied, 50 cards for German)
One Display Mat
One Impulse/Turn Track
One Player Aid Card
One Rulebook
Two 10-sided and one 6-sided dice
Box and Lid set

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Catan: Das Duell – Sonderkarte 2023: Klaus, Hüter von Catan
description:
Klaus Hüter von Catan is a special Action card for Catan: Das Duell (The Rivals For Catan).

This card was given out at the SPIEL' 23 in Essen.

Ability of the card (German):
Ist Klaus im Spiel, sorgt er für Frieden auf Catan. Die Stärkepunkte des stärksten Helden des Mitspielers zählen als Geschickpunkte, solange Klaus in Ihrem Fürstentum ausliegt.

Ability of the card (translated to English):
When Klaus has been played, he creates peace in Catan. As long as Klaus is in your principality, the strength points of the strongest hero of your opponent count as skill points.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Death By Sketch!
description:
Death By Sketch is a drawing-battle game where you try to destroy your opponents base, and defend your own, by drawing monsters.

Players will generate monsters and determine their strength using dice, as well rolling to see the effectiveness of their attacks against other monsters and bases. Cards are also included which have varying effects, from either strengthening or weakening monsters to damaging bases directly, among others.

When players successfully destroy a monster or base they get to draw what happens to it. The last player with a base remaining wins the game.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Player Elimination

name: AI Space Puzzle Bonus Pack: Extreme Scenarios
description: A small booklet containing 10 extra hard setups.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: AxianQuest Infinite Dungeon
description:
The AxianQuest Infinite Dungeon unofficial expansion for HeroQuest is a deck of 77 mini cards that will launch you on endless, always new, Zargonless adventures!

11 Quest cards

11 Side Quest cards

48 Dungeon cards

7 Evil Mastermind cards

One page rulesheet (free download)

HOW DOES IT WORK? In a nutshell:


Draw a quest card and a side quest card
Place the dungeon cards on the board
Start playing!


FEATURES:

Printed on minicards (1.625” x 2.5”) for optimal use on the game board

No app and no Zargon player needed

Play solo or with your friends

Self-adjusting difficulty for 1 to 5 heroes

Built-in campaign system with boss dungeons and epic rewards, and increased difficulty for veteran heroes

Also compatible with most dungeon battlemats, boards and tiles you may have from other games

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Melvyn vs. Marah
description:
The Greyport Mages' Collegium is the premiere school of magic in all the land. But what happens when one of its professors goes rogue? Well, then, it's up to our heroes to stop her!

This new two-character expansion includes the friendly Collegium librarian, Melvyn, as well as the turncoat teacher of defensive magic, Marah!

This mod shows off the work in progress decks for both Melvyn and Marah, as well as select other characters from other expansions. Try out the new characters in classic free for all play, or with the Pub Crawl or Boss Battle mechanics!

—description from the publisher

There is also a Kickstarter Edition that, alongside alternate box printing, has the bonus drink card Thirsty Thirsty Dragons! and three bonus prize cards:


Arcane MacGuffin
Certificate of Guffin
Zot's Lucky Dice
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Kerygma!
description:
A game to relive the birth and development of the early Christian communities as told in the Acts of the Apostles and the New Testament letters. In the first century, the Apostles travel through the cities of the Roman Empire to proclaim the Gospel to Jews and Pagans, encountering diverse environments, dealing with conflict situations and serving the poor.
The goal of the game is to spread the Christian message more and sooner than others in the cities and regions around the Mediterranean. The proposed actions, character names and events that influence the game are faithful to the biblical narrative and historical sources of the time, offering an interactive experience that also covers little-known aspects of the Apostles' preaching.
A map-based majorities game with a hidden action selection mechanism that allows up to 12 players to sit around the table.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Events, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Stealing Scenes: Action!
description:
Stealing Scenes: Action is a fast-playing limited resource management card game where you play an actor’s stunt double that is trying to be noticed by the director. You do this by stealing scenes using the resources in your hand, as well as the resource your actor possesses. Once you have stolen enough scenes, you win.

The game consists of 156 cards, broken into three decks: Actor Deck (10), Resource Deck (84), and Scene Deck (50). The are also 8 double-sided Reference cards and 4 Rules cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Matching, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trick-taking

name: What The Flock?!
description:
Put on your shepherd's hat and grab your staff! It's time to show your worth in What The Flock?! You compete for the largest flock of sheep, but watch out for the sly wolves! Every move counts, so plan your route strategically and collect more woolly friends than your opponents. Don't be fooled by their innocent look; some sheep are not as friendly as they seem! Are you ready to embark on the baa-rilliant adventure of a lifetime? Let’s herd 'em up!

In this take-that card game designed for 2-6 players, the objective is to capture as many sheep as possible before your rivals do. During each turn, players move from one card to an adjacent one and collect it, gradually shrinking the playing field and reducing opportunities to outmaneuver opponents. Players can also use special action cards to leap over cards, traverse from one side of the field to the other, or block an opponent's move. The game concludes when only one player remains in the meadow. Can you strategically think ahead and predict your opponents' moves?

The size of the playing field varies based on the number of participants, ranging from a 6x6 to a 9x9 grid of cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Map Reduction, Take That

name: Tainted Grail: Kings of Ruin – Treasure Seeker Promo Cards
description:
Originally available in Pack Cleric from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Requires Tainted Grail: Kings of Ruin and is compatible with all other Tainted Grail: Kings of Ruin expansions. It introduces new secret cards called Treasure Seeker Cards that can be obtained during the game.

There is a legend about a treasure hidden by a sly and slightly mad scholar. It is said that to find it, you must gather all pieces of a puzzle guided only by the unclear, twisted visions of Avalon places. Only an adventurer of unmatched courage and wit will be able to do so.

To add this mini-expansion to the game, find Secret card 501 in this deck and place it face up in the play area. Then take all remaining parts of Treasure seeker cards and add them to the Secret deck. While playing the game, pay close attention to both the Location cards and the revealed Treasure Seeker Secret card, as you may find some resemblance between them.

When you are certain that you are in a Location that matches your Treasure Seeker card, you may perform the Search for Treasure Action visible on the revealed Treasure Seeker card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dinosaur Island: Rawr 'n Write – Dice Wrangler Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Pack Cleric from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Dice Wrangler

Cost: 5 Coins
Instant Bonus: Re-roll any die on the game board. You get the resources rolled and the original action associated with the die.
Run Park Ability: Re-roll any die on the game board. Take only the result rolled.
Victory Points: 3
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Clank! Catacombs: Breakout! Promo Card
description:
Originally available in Pack Cleric from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Breakout!

Cost: 3 skill
VP: 1
Effect: 1 Skill, 1 Swords, 1 Boots, If you freed any prisoners this turn, 3 Gold and +1 Clank!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Trekking Through History: 2023 Spellenspektakel Experience Promo Card
description:
Free Dutch promo card for Trekking Through History.

If you visited the "Trekking Through History Experience" during Spellenspektakel 2023 (4-5 Nov.) in Utrecht, The Netherlands, you got this promocard.

It consists of 1 card, dated 2023, that can be added tho deck III of the base game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Astro Knights: Promo Pack
description:
Includes 3 new cards

Homeworld

Silarix


Weapon Card

Distortion Guantlet


Tech Card

Plasmoid Stims
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Black Stories: V.I.P. Fails
description:
What Justin, Britney & Co. would have preferred to hide from the public… Stupid mishaps, incredible misfortunes, absurd types of death: Even V.I.P.s such as movie stars and pop stars, athletes, politicians, writers and artists are not immune to this! And that's exactly what these black stories are made of! Who manages to solve the cases around embarrassing celebrity mishaps?

They are black, enigmatic and thoroughly evil: black stories - This is THE cult series at moses. The morbid, creepy, frightening and sometimes entertaining puzzles are about death and accidents that can't be more gruesono. By guessing, exactly these stories are to be found out behind it. Not always so easy...
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Storytelling

name: Gachijo: Four Ninja and the Castle of Treasures
description:
Control the Castle and Slide the Walls! Create New Paths for your Ninja!
An exciting Japanese Castle Exploration game using wits and ninjutsu in a castle that moves!

Embark on an adventure as the Four Ninja, sent on a mission by the warlords.
Collect Treasures, Crystals, and Items in the mysterious moving castle, and complete the mission.
Slide the Maze Walls and create pathways for the Ninja. Use ninja tools and weapons to navigate the dangerous castle. Call upon and control ancient spirits. The Gachijo castle is full of supernatural powers which may help you in your quest.
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection
publishers: Banana Moon Studio Sapporo (バナナムーン･ステュディオ)

name: Cégépítők
description:
Would you like to try yourself as an entrepreneur? Are you interested in what it's like to be the first person in a company? With the Cégépítok board game, you can put yourself in the shoes of the hottest entrepreneurs for a few hours! Are you able to make good decisions to make yours the most successful company? Plan smartly, use your resources judiciously and use tactics boldly!

Cégépítok is a board game based on simple game rules, but with many twists and surprises, in which you can become a full-fledged entrepreneur step by step.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Kipróbálnád magad vállalkozóként? Érdekel, milyen lehet egy cég első emberének lenni? A Cégépítők társasjátékkal néhány órára a legmenőbb vállalkozók bőrébe bújhatsz! Képes vagy jó döntéseket hozni, hogy a tiéd legyen a legsikeresebb cég? Tervezz okosan, használd megfontoltan az erőforrásaidat és taktikázz bátran!

A Cégépítők egyszerű játékszabályra épülő, mégis számos csavart és meglepetést tartogató társasjáték, amiben lépésről lépésre válhatsz vérbeli vállalkozóvá.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hammer and Sickle: Hunger and Utopia in the Russian Civil War, 1918-1921
description:
Hammer and Sickle is a fast-paced, four-player asymmetric game covering one of the most desperate and world-shaping conflicts of the 20th century, in which four competing ideologies battled for supremacy over the former Russian Empire. Each season, players will alternate using Action and Commander cards to rally their forces, spread or clamp down on Agitation and Nationalism, and launch offensives into enemy territory. An event card played by each player at the start of the season will determine initiative order and have a unique effect on the game, while at the end of each season players must gather Food from the countryside (Sickles) to feed their factories (Hammers) and generate Firepower, or else risk rising Agitation and eventual Anarchist uprisings! After six seasons the player who has completed the most objectives and whose alliance is most successful will be victorious, determining the fate of Russia.

Components:
One 22” x 25 ½” Mounted Game Board
153 Regular-sized Playing Cards
160 Wooden Pieces
One and a half Full-color Countersheets
Four Player Screens
Two Custom 6-sided Dice (for non-player system)
One Non-player Faction Foldout
One Rulebook
One Non-player Rulebook
One Playbook
One 3” Box

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Negotiation, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Alpina
description:
In Alpina, you explore the Swiss National Park with a camera around your neck to photograph animals in their natural habitat. The spotted nutcracker, grass frogs, and more are waiting for you and offer you a unique opportunity to collect points in an original way that is related to the landscape and interaction with your neighbors.

Do you play a card to score more points, or do you use the opportunity to deceive your opponents? Find the card that allows you to strike a balance between these two objectives, and victory will be yours!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: White Christmas: The Fall of Saigon, April 1975
description:
I’m Dreaming of a White Christmas, sung by Tennessee Ernie Ford. –Song played on Radio Saigon to signal Americans to assemble for an evacuation of South Vietnam.

After President Nixon’s sudden resignation in August 1974 the leaders of North Vietnam realized that the timetable and “Blooming Lotus” plan set for late 1976 or early 1977 for invading South Vietnam to reunite all of Vietnam could be advanced. The invasion began with a series of Communist attacks in the Central Highlands on March 8th, 1975. This led to the capture of several ARVN positions that prompted South Vietnamese President, Nguyen Van Thieu to order an evacuation, which was soon counter-manded and then reordered again. The South Vietnamese command indecision led to confusion and then panic when Communist forces crossed the DMZ (de-militarized zone) that separated North and South Vietnam a week later with a massive conventional invasion bolstered by tanks, artillery and mobile anti-aircraft batteries. The northern-most city in South Vietnam of Quang Tri fell quickly in a night time assault with Communist troops and tanks, with head lights blazing, herded more than attacked their foes into flight and captivity. The Imperial City of Hue was soon cut off from direct communications with Saigon to the south, and this prompted a complete breakdown of ARVN troops in I Corps (northern most command in South Vietnam) with many fleeing to Danang and any other ports or roads south to escape the Communist onslaught.

Viewing their foe’s growing collapse, the North Vietnamese High Command issued new orders to capture Saigon, the capital of South Vietnam, by the anniversary of Ho Chi Minh’s birth on May 9th. The final battle of the thirty-year long war was now set. White Christmas is moderate level complexity game on the battle for Saigon in April 1975. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of White Christmas? is composed of the following:

• Two 11 by 17 inch maps with game tracks and tables.
• 168 double-sided counters
• This set of rules

Players will need an opaque container (mug, envelope or anything similar) to play the game. Players will also need one six-sided (D6) and one ten-sided (D10) set of dice.

-description from designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: HeroQuest: Double Skulls Tavern Tales – Book 1
description:
The Double Skulls Tavern Tales unofficial expansion for Heroquest is a deck of 16 large 8x10" cards

9 Double sided dungeon cards
6 Quests - also printed on the cards to look like an old book.

Each quest details the card placements to make up the quest board and details enemy placement along with any other scenario based elements or enemy upgrades that may be in that quest.

These dungeon cards can be used to make up your own adventures and the lack of the one width corridors really opens up exploration and team placement when heading into unexplored areas.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Punish
description:
A tiny card game with a fifteen-card dueling deck numbered 0-4, for two players, the goal being to annihilate one's opponent by removing their three life points. Players start by choosing one of the nine characters provided, each offering a unique advantage (get an extra life point, do extra damage, etc.), then draw five cards from the dueling deck and over four rounds play one card to either inflict 1-3 damage or block 1-3 damage.

If both characters are still alive after four rounds, the used cards are shuffled back into the deck and players replenish their hands of five cards, and heal one life point if needed, and duel again.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Striking Flint
description:
Striking Flint is a co-operative game that recreates the 1937 United Auto Workers (UAW) strike in Flint, Michigan.

John du Bois ... recreates a pivotal episode in American Labor History in Striking Flint. The 1937 sit-down strike in Flint, Michigan forced General Motors to address the abysmal working and living conditions of their employees, and to recognize the newly-formed United Auto Workers union.

In this cooperative game, players control five committees each with their own advantages, disadvantages, and prerogatives. GM has considerable resources at their disposal, including city authorities, deep pockets, hired thugs, and the sympathies of the press. To force them to make concessions, you’ll need to work together to weather the forces arrayed against you – fending off attempts at eviction, the effects of exhaustion, and the presence of strikebreakers – while occupying factories in the plant complex. Here, the game cleverly subverts the worker placement paradigm: by placing workers, you do not cause actions to take place, but prevent them.

With a deck of events each based on a real headline from contemporary reporting, this game for one to five players is both a compelling co-op gaming experience and a meditation on protest and solidarity – themes that are more resonant and important today than they were nearly eighty years ago.

– from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Dreams of Yesterday: Breakthrough
description:
Originally available during the Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign as part of the Weird Giraffe Games Promo Pack 2023.

Includes 6 cards.

Mix in the expansion with the base game cards before starting the base game setup.
Shuffle and remove three urn cards from the game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hockey Blast Express
description:
Hockey Blast Express uses the same cards and concepts as the full-play version (Hockey Blast). The fun and excitement of hard-hitting hockey action, in about ten minutes of game time.

This is primarily meant as a solitaire game, but has options for 2 players. 5 stacks of players are lined up against each other and dice determine the interactions between the players. Results are based on scoring charts and/or symbols on the player's card. Goalies come into play with save ratings to possibly stop goal opportunities.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Gettysburg Campaign: June-July 1863
description:
The Gettysburg Campaign is a game that recreates the Battle of Gettysburg, which was the de facto decisive battle of the American Civil War, at a strategic level.

Riding on the momentum of winning the Battle of Chancellorsville, Confederate General Lee planned a further offensive in the North. The targets were Baltimore and Philadelphia, and by capturing them, they were trying to discourage the North from continuing the war. Skirmishes began in June, and on July 6, the two armies entered into full-scale fighting at Gettysburg, where railroads and major roads converge.

Confederate players will lead three legions, while Union players will lead seven legions in the most intense battle of the Civil War.

Note: This game is the same as Gettysburg Campaign, which was announced in Command Magazine issue 7 and is now available as a PnP game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Perfil Express: Música
description:
ENGLISH DESCRIPTION

PERFIL EXPRESS MÚSICA: a new way to play this Grow classic in a themed version that exclusively encompasses the world of music.

The game features five fun categories that will test everyone's knowledge: MUSICAL GENRE, BRAZILIAN MUSICIANS, INTERNATIONAL MUSICIANS, BRAZILIAN BANDS AND INTERNATIONAL BANDS.

Each card has 10 tips worth up to 10 points. The first tip is less revealing, and the following ones, progressively, increase the chances of getting it right.

Who has never wanted to challenge their musical expertise with friends in a quick and exciting way?

Get into the rhythm and get the crowd together to make the most of this rich content from PERFIL EXPRESS MÚSICA.



PORTUGUESE DESCRIPTION

Perfil Express Música: uma nova forma de jogar este clássico da Grow em uma versão com temática que engloba exclusivamente o mundo da música.

O jogo trás cinco divertidas categorias que vão testar o conhecimento da galera: GÊNERO MUSICAL, MÚSICOS NACIONAIS, MÚSICOS INTERNACIONAIS, BANDAS NACIONAIS E BANDAS INTERNACIONAIS.

Cada cartela possui 10 dicas que valem até 10 pontos. A primeira dica é menos reveladora, e as seguintes, de maneira progressiva, aumentam mais as chances de acerto.

Quem nunca quis desafiar sua expertise musical com os amigos de uma maneira rápida e emocionante?

Entre no ritmo e reúna a galera para aproveitar ao máximo esse rico conteúdo do PERFIL EXPRESS MÚSICA
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Paw of Duty
description:
Paw of Duty is a two player non-collectible card game of tactical kitty warfare, where each player commands a kitty squad to regain control of a war-torn city.

Players will choose and deploy feline Huntress, Pilot, and Tank units into the battlezone each turn. Commands are issued to units using Tactic Cards, allowing players to control key spaces and capture enemy kitties with clever use of the position-based combo system.

Win the game through superior unit placement, or focus on capturing the enemy's units to amass end-game victory points.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Command Cards, Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Zone of Control

name: Memorfe
description:
Memorfe is a board game with universal accessibility that seeks to enhance your memory through the use of strategies. In this Memorfe, having the memory of an elephant is not necessary to win, but using you memory strategically is.

And the best thing... is that there are three games in one!


Kermorfe: a memory race where not everything is speed.
Domemorfe: Connect the cards with a mechanic similar to dominoes.
Dismorfe: A strategic auction of shapes and textures.


Do you dare to play it?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Memory

name: É Top!?: Mais Variedades
description:
Animals most used as emojis?
Most populous cities in the world?
Body areas that feel the most ticklish?

In É Top!?, a new Top 10 category is revealed in each round, and you have to guess something that appears on the list. However, you don't win the game by knowing the answers! Challenge guesses that you consider wrong so that you have the chance to earn points. Just be careful, as if you challenge incorrectly, you'll be the one losing...

É Top!? More Varieties can be played alone as a base game or combined with other boxes to expand the challenges and fun!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction

name: Monstros & Tesouros
description:
Monstros & Tesouros is a Brazilian, independent game, born from decades of fantasy RPG campaigns and the author’s desire to simplify the tabletop RPG experience just with cards and a pair of dice.
In the “Adventure” mode, each player assembles a party of three unique, preconstructed heroes, each with a different set of abilities, from a pool of 35. Players take turns revealing Terrain cards (from a total of 65), which pit a different set of enemies against the heroes. During their turn, the player controls their heroes, while the monsters are controlled by another player, reducing downtime. In a two-player game, you will never be idle, as you’re either playing with your heroes or controlling the monsters against your opponent.

The game features a total of 100 unique monsters to face. During combat, players use their action cards (from a pool of 100), which have stat prerequisites that correlate to the heroes/monster stats: hand management is a key aspect of the game. Dice, in combination with various stats, are used to determine the result of some actions and the winner of successive rounds. Once monsters are defeated, the heroes gain treasure (from a total of 100 unique treasure cards) and experience, becoming stronger and able to use more powerful action cards. The game continues until one player reaches a predefined goal.

There are other gameplay modes, including “Arena” - a free-for-all single combat between two parties, “Bestial Arena” - where monsters face off against each other in quick combat, and solo play. The game is highly customizable with many optional rules and is open to house rules as well. One box contains 400 cards, a pair of dice and the rulebook.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Смерть ворогам (Death to Enemies)
description:
Cooperative game in which players protect Ukrainian houses from invaders.

The basis of the game consists of three decks of cards: the infantry deck, the tank deck and the aircraft deck.
The back of each of the cards in these decks shows an enemy (infantry, tank or plane). The front side of the map represents the Ukrainian forces and is divided into two zones that are played separately.

Before the start of the game, players hide one enemy's bunker card under each of the enemy's decks. The goal of the game is to find the bunker that will lead to victory.

Players also take cards of Ukrainian houses, the protection of which will be the goal of the game.

The game consists of two cyclically repeating stages:
draw phase and battle phase.
In draw phase player draws two cards, then put one card face down, thus forming enemy forces, and keep one for themselves.
In battle phase all players open all the cards and jointly decide which properties of cards and in what order to use them in order to defeat all the enemy cards. If some enemy cards cannot be destroyed, they capture or destroy Ukrainian houses.

Phases repeat until either the "Victory" bunker is found or all the houses are captured or destroyed.

There are 2 modes in the game:
Open: in all phases of the game, players are not limited in communication and can decide together which of the two cards just taken from the deck to keep in their hands.

Closed: the decision of which deck to take cards from and which card to keep is made by each player independently without knowing which cards his partners have left for himself.

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Divinity Original Sin: Nemesis Expansion
description:
Aboard the prison ship headed to Fort Joy, an archdemon offers near limitless power to the prisoners. Taking up the offer ensures survivability but terms of the deal are vague.

In a game where actions have consequences, Origins must outwit Adramahlihk herself or pay a steep price. This ever-escalating pact with an archdemon grants many boons, the cost of which may be worse than eternal damnation.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bouquet
description:
A game of bees, blossoms and bluffing, Bouquet is a strategic and dynamic area control game where competition blooms into beauty!

On their turn, players will either PLACE petals in the bouquet, PLUCK their opponents petals, or DRAW more petals into their hand.

Petals may be placed either face up, which gives certain abilities to particular petals, or face down, which allows you to ignore placing requirements at the cost of having those abilities active.

With multiple petal types to choose from, each with their own point value and abilities, players have to carefully consider how to place each petal into the bouquet.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tile Placement

name: Urbanizing the Card
description:
Urbanizing the Card is a print-and-play game that aims to be a city-building game base. The game is meant to be part of a business card, an example of a minimalist serious game about urban planning.

General rules:

Roll a D6 die (Start).
Choose the building (B, the row (R), or the column (C). The die result must match one of these (B, R or C).
Fill the circle of the selected building and draw the number of respective icons in the map (same number of previously filled circles)
Transport infrastructures have special rules (they must be adjacent and can overlay/erase other structures)
If you can draw a new building, do it and then go to the Start; otherwise, do the scoring.


There is a solo and a multiplayer version of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bingo, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: War of the Ring: The Seeing Stones
description:
Promotional Mini-Expansion given out with pre-orders of Kings of Middle-earth.

Includes two Kings of Middle-earth Event cards for use with the War of the Ring boardgame.

Knowledge of the Seeing Stones: Choose one of the Shadow Even decks and draw the top three cards. Choose one to discard and one to reshuffle into the deck, then place the third one back on top. Then, draw one Event card from one your decks.
The King's Bannner: Play if Aragorn or an Awaken Sovereign is in the the battle. Before rolling the dice for your Leader re-reroll, forfeit Aragorn's or the Sovereign's Leadership to cancel the Leader re-reoll of the Shadow player.

The Palantir of Minas Tirith: Play if you control Minas Tirith or Denethor, Corrupted Ruler, is in player. Look at the Event cards in the hand of one Free Peoples player and choose one of them. Place that card back into the matching deck and shuffle it, or discard that card if "The Palantir of Barad-dur" is in play. Then if "The Palantir of Orthanc" is in play, draw on Event card from one of your decks.
Battle is Vain: Play if the total Nazgul Leadership is 1 or more. Forfeit up to 5 points of Nazgul Leadership to reduce the Free Peoples Leadership by the same amount.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Game That Song
description: Game That Song is the ultimate party game for music lovers! First, pick a music related topic from your cards. Next, each player plays a different song from a music app on their phone to go with the card. You pick the winner of the round!
mechanics: Player Judge

name: Thornbright Mansion: Chapter 2
description:
This is the second part of a trilogy.

You and your party of property investors are eager to view the illustrious Thornbright Mansion that has just gone up for sale, but not everything is as it seems. Strange damages, missing documents, and cryptic notes alert you to something far more sinister inside this home.

Envelescape brings together the immersive nature of pop-up books with the puzzling mysteries of escape rooms. Explore a miniature 3D room by finding clues and solving puzzles. By utilizing intricate pop-up engineering, our rooms and clues fold down to fit into a single envelope.

Each Envelescape game (also known as a Chapter) includes a pop-up room to explore, papercraft and digital clues, and a thrilling mystery to uncover! By solving puzzles in the pop-up room you will unlock clues that will help you progress even further - just like a real escape room!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Clans and Glory
description:
In Clans and Glory, you take part in an ancient ritual: the free people of the Scottish Highlands have come from near and far to the meeting place to join a clan chief. Can you win over the best followers?

Assemble the strongest Scottish clan – through clever map reading and skillful planning!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nemesis: Retaliation – Stretch Goals
description:
Nemesis: Retaliation - Stretch Goals contains all of the Gamefound Stretch Goals from the Nemesis: Retaliation crowdfunding campaign.

Expected to include:

New Alien Race - Neoflesh: 50+ Minis/Standees﹡ (9 Delver Shield Robots, 9 Delver Exploders, 9 Delver Ranged Shooters, 9 Melee Delvers, 10 Twitchlings, 5 Cultists, 1 Cult Queen), 20 Event cards, 20 Attack cards, 10 Queen health cards, 12 Exploration cards, 5 Cultist tokens, 5 Dead body tokens, 9 Computer tokens, 30 Intruder tokens, 1 Intruder bag help card.
Medical Support Character Packs (1 Mini/Standee﹡, 1 Character tile, 1 Plastic ring, 10 Action cards, 1 Personal item)
Insider mini-expansion (1 Mini/Standee﹡, Event cards, Exploration cards, Objective cards
15 new Gear cards
5 Malfunction markers
1 Lucky burst die
Space Platypus first Player Marker Mini/Standee﹡


Gamefound campaign exclusive:

Bioenhancement Expert Character Packs (1 Mini/Standee﹡, 1 Character tile, 1 Plastic ring, 10 Action cards, 1 Personal item, 15 Medpack tactical belt items)


﹡: Minis only with the Special Edition; Standees only with the Standard Edition.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rats of Wistar: Dice Tower 2024 Promo Card
description:
A new special invention card, originally available in Doppler Pack from the Dice Tower 2024 Kickstarter campaign.

Cost: 5 Wood
Immediate: Take one Objective Card from the deck, and immediately take the bonus effect on it!
End-game: 4 VPs
mechanics: Unspecified

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Martell Heroes II
description:
In southern Westeros, in the unbearable heat and harshness of the deserts and badlands, House Martell waits patiently like a coiled viper, observing and calculating moves in the game of thrones until they find the optimal moment to strike. As such, Arianne and Quentyn Martell look to forward their House's goals with the patience of a snake settled in for a long hunt. House Dayne, led by Edric Dayne, has pledged to do all they can to see a Martell on the Iron Throne. With capable commanders such as Arys Oakheart, Gerold Dayne, and Daemon Sand, House Martell can be sure of many victories to come.

Plastic components.

Approximate Height:
Daemon Sand: 38mm
Arys Oakheart: 39mm
Edric Dayne: 32mm
Arianne Martell: 35mm
Quentyn Martell: 37mm
Gerold Dayne: 45mm

Contents:
6 Miniatures
‣ Daemon Sand
‣ Arys Oakheart
‣ Edric Dayne
‣ Arianne Martell
‣ Quentyn Martell
‣ Gerold Dayne
7 Attachment Cards2 NCU Cards
12 Tactics Cards

Miniatures are supplied unpainted and pre-assembled.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: La Città
description:
Set in the Italian countryside, La Città features various city-states vying for population. Each player starts with two cities and is charged with expanding the different aspects of those cities to attract larger populations.

Players build farms to feed their people, quarries to finance their expansions, marketplaces to allow growth in their cities, and bathhouses to keep their people clean and healthy. Additionally, structures can be built that give the city influence in one of three categories; superiority in one of these categories causes population to shift from other nearby cities when the "Voice of the People" is decided at the end of each turn.

At the end of six turns, the player with the most points — which are distributed for well-rounded cities, well-fed populations, and the overall size of population — wins.

This game, a reimplementation of the original La Città, contains a new expansion that includes new buildings, new politics cards, and new terrain tiles.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Civilization, Renaissance, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: A Town Called Despair
description:
A Town Called Despair is a Wild West miniature game set in a small town in the late 1800's. The game comes with six multi-level buildings, wagons, cacti, barrels, crates, gallows, etc. to set up your town on a 3' x 3' neoprene playmat. Miniatures can be placed inside buildings with detailed floor plans and move up/down levels, even onto the roofs.

From 2-4 players construct outlaw gangs armed with a variety of pistols, shotguns, and rifles, name their characters, and assign random skills. After deploying on the edge of town, each player is dealt a hand of 5 cards that are used to determine turn initiative, outdraw opponents in a gun fight, and engage in brawls. Each player takes up to three actions on their turn moving, aiming, shooting, reloading, recovering, or healing.

Hitting and wounding opponents is determined by dice rolls with customized dice and players keep track of their gang members' wounds and rounds expended on specially designed cards.

Gold coins are awarded for wounding and killing opponents, carrying money bags to the edge of town, or completing objectives.

Each game normally ends with a bloody showdown on main street, with gold awarded to the last man standing. The player that has collected the most gold wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hexagon Grid, Ladder Climbing, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Random, Variable Set-up

name: Lairen: La historia – Trono Compartido
description: This expansion contains 121 new cards. It adds new unit types: monks, demons, dragons and insects.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts

name: Однажды в Чикаго Спецвыпуск 2: Кинодрама (Once upon a time in Chicago: Movie Drama)
description: Addon №2 for base game. А new case to investigate.
mechanics: Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Сталеві кулі (Steel Bullets)
description: A deck is formed from six revolver cards. They are laid out in a circle, reproducing the drum of a revolver. Players take turns opening revolver cards while trying to avoid the "Bang!" cards using situation cards. If the player drew a card "Bang!" and could not avoid its effect, he is out of the game. The game continues until only one player remains in the game, he is the winner.
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: 13 Wooden Boards
description:
A puzzle-ly 13 cards solitaire game about building a garden fence.
The game provides a win condition. Additionally you may add up points at the end to see how well you did.

Choose which boards to put vertical and with horizontal to meet as many objectives as you can. Though there are also impossible ones or do you expect any UFOs to land on your fence??!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Layer Puzzle
description:
Flip and Writing Puzzle Game. Memory game and various game modes are provided. 1 to 4 player can play and +8 years old possible for playing game.

During the 5 rounds, players mark the shapes on the transparent layer card with an “X” according to certain conditions.
After the game ends, the goal is to minimize the number of empty cells when all layer cards are overlapped.
mechanics: Drawing, Layering, Open Drafting

name: Goko
description:
Goko is a card game that's fun and helps you learn Korean. It's friendly for everyone, whether you know Korean or not. Take turns collecting letter cards to match your word cards. Watch out for bombs, trade wisely, and form alliances to win with strategy.

Whether you're aiming to learn Korean as a New Year's resolution or looking for the perfect gift for a K-Pop enthusiast, join us in making this game a reality. We're excited to share our game with you and we hope you'll love it as much as we do.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Matching, Trading

name: Pokémon TCG: Scarlet & Violet – Paldean Fates
description:
The spotlight glistens on Shiny Pokémon making their fated return to the Pokémon TCG! Shiny Pikachu blazes the path forward as Tinkaton, Ceruledge, Dondozo, and more than 100 other Shiny Pokémon follow. Meanwhile, Great Tusk and Iron Treads appear as Ancient and Future Pokémon ex, and Charizard, Forretress, and Espathra show off their own unique skills as Shiny Tera Pokémon ex. Shed some light and discover sparkling wonders in the Scarlet & Violet—Paldean Fates expansion!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Sakana Stack
description:
Sakana Stack is a climbing/shedding card game where players are playing Stacks of seafood from their hand with the aim of having the most valuable Stack in play. Stacks can be played of matching numbers, but they must match the last played card by suit or number. Players score the top card from their Stack if the next player passes, so the bigger the Stack the higher the scoring opportunity. Play continues until a player sheds all cards in their hand, or the draw pile runs out twice and all cards scored are counted and recorded. Play a number of rounds equal to the number of players to determine the most successful Market Vendor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Ladder Climbing, Trick-taking

name: The Upgrades: A Market Expansion
description:
A mysterious smith has begun to appear in the marketplace providing unique and mystical wares, created from resources laid down by the locals. In times past, staffs, shadows and rags have seemingly been imbued with a similar ancient Power. But, these objects hold no Power in and of themselves. No, the Power comes from another source, and the Power provides witness. Is it the Hard Fire, or is it something more? The locals have taken to suggesting that the smith is selling his wares. But, this smith cannot be bought. Nevertheless, he doesn't offer the provision only to those who see him rightly. He offers freely to all who approach.

The Upgrades | A Market Expansion expands on The Market | A Pocket Game with a number of exciting features.

In The Upgrades, you no longer simply trade Temporary Resources for more Permanent Resources. You will now sacrifice your only source of sustenance for hope that you might find power to change everything.

What's new?

Hard Fire (a new resource building card)
Upgrades (new wares to be purchased that can be leveled up)
Power (a new potential win condition)


In a temporary world, even permanence is fleeting.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action/Event, Market, Push Your Luck

name: D-Day Dice: Codebreakers
description:
A mini expansion for D-Day Dice 1st and 2nd edition and the upcoming D-Day Dice: Pacific.

A homage to the great minds that worked on cracking enemy codes and decoding enemy transmissions, this mini expansion offers a new type of Servicemen that allow you to replace d6 results with your own! You can learn more about the Codebreakers here.

This set of 14 cards includes the GC&CS Legendary Unit, 5 Servicemen with unique abilities, 2 War Stories and a Rulecard
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gnomistic: The Goblin's Track
description:
The very first expansions of Gnomistic adds new challenges and layers for strategy and fun.

This extension adds a new module of cards called "The Pot Cards" that awards coin bonuses at the end of the game. It also adds new special cards with power immediate and permanent effects, minigames and a new gnomeeple to control powerful habilities during the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses

name: Tortuga 2199: Status Cards
description:
Exclusive Status Cards that were available only during Kickstarter campaign and Russian crowdfunding campaign.
These cards add more variety by granting special abilities to players. During the game each player can buy only one status card to add to his/her deck.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: LCR Wild
description: Similar to the original LCR dice game from the 1980s, players roll 3 specially marked dice to determine where chips are distributed on the table. Players start with a set of chips then compete to keep them. However, this version has a twist, if you roll a Wild die, you can steal chips from other players. Whoever is remaining at the end wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Тортуга 2199: Фантом (Tortuga 2199: Phantom Starpirate Ship)
description:
Exclusive Starpirate Ship (card + miniature) that was available only during Kickstarter campaign and Russian crowdfunding campaign.
Phantom allows to take one more card from your deck or from your discard pile (during your turn).
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Battle of Sedan Game
description:
The Battle of Sedan is a 1-2 player tactical war game that covers France's biggest military blunder during the Franco-Prussian War. Can you reverse France's bad fortune? Or will the Prussians hand them the ultimate defeat? The stage is set...

1870 - French Emperor Napoleon III has dreams of expanding his empire and aspires to be like his more famous uncle. He believes that with his French army's zeal and his leadership, his nation will be able to annihilate the Upstart Prussian Empire. Meanwhile, the Prussians have been preparing for war. They have convinced many of the German States, including the Kingdom of Bavaria, to join their cause. The respective armies are destined to clash at Sedan. Both factions expect victory and to become a dominant force in Europe. The stage is set.

The Battle of Sedan is a low to moderate complexity tactical game of the French disaster at Sedan during the Franco-Prussian War. One player commands the combined Prussian-Bavarian forces while the other player commands the French army.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: Avatar: The Journey of Aang
description:
In Avatar: Journey of Aang, 1-4 players join forces, taking on the role of Aang's companions. Each player will guide Aang in his journey to master fire, air, earth, and water, and restore balance to the world. If they hope to succeed, players will have to help Aang master the four elements by drawing cards and putting them into his practice tableau, learn powerful new techniques, confront dangerous adversaries, and use the environment to their full advantage. With Sozin's Comet drawing near, Aang's companions must race along a track either to confront Ozai, or risk fighting him with the full power of the comet. See if you have what it takes to guide Aang to success in Avatar: Journey of Aang!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Tortuga 2199: Flying Dutchman Starpirate Ship
description:
Exclusive Starpirate Ship (card + miniature) that was available only during Kickstarter campaign and Russian crowdfunding campaign.
Flying Dutchman allows to attack your opponents more effectively.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: RuneScape Kingdoms: Kalphite Queen Expansion
description:
RuneScape Kingdoms: Kalphite Queen Expansion enhances your RuneScape Kingdoms: Shadow of Elvarg experience with a new skill, campaign, area and boss. Supplement your abilities with the unique Summoning skill, track down the elusive Osman, explore the desert city Al Kharid and face down the Kalhpite Swarm, directed by their venomous Queen.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: RuneScape Kingdoms: TzKal-Zuk Expansion
description:
RuneScape Kingdoms: TzKal-Zuk Expansion enhances your RuneScape Kingdoms: Shadow of Elvarg experience with a new skill, campaign, area and boss. Supplement your abilities with the unique Runecrafting skill, work with the Wise Old Man to delve into TzHaar City and face down the demi-god TzKal-Zuk.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Agros Tarraco
description:
Agros Tarraco is an abstract strategy game, with puzzle mechanics and tile placement for 2 players from 9 years old, with games lasting between 10 and 15 minutes.

Year 45 BC. C., we are in Tarraco, capital of the Roman province of Hispania Citerior. The demand for wine, oil and bread grows as their population and power increases. Will you contribute to the glory of the urbs?

In Agros Tarraco we will be Roman settlers and we will exploit the fertile fields that feed the city of eternal spring. We must deploy our ingenuity and strategic vision to cultivate and irrigate the greatest number of fertile lands.
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #15: ASL Scenario Pack for Winter Offensive 2024
description:
ASL Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #15 (2024) features four new scenario designs (two by by Pete Shelling and one each by Kevin Meyer and Tom Morin) and three new Deluxe ASL boards (p/q/r). MMP has an ulterior motive, however, for the manufacture and sale of this particular product. Proceeds from the sales of each WO Bonus Pack #15 are donated to the WWII Foundation.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Path of Civilization: Reunion Tower Promo Card
description:
A level 2 wonder: Immediately gain two population and two sages to the yellow tray.

W-44
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Vossa Excelência: O Jogo Político (2nd edition)
description:
This is the Second Edition of Vossa Excelência - O Jogo Político.

In Vossa Excelência (Your Excellency), each player takes on the role of a newly elected congress-person who, in order to stay in power, must use their four-year term to ensure re-election. They must seize every opportunity, utilizing allies, privileges, and all their influence to gain voters and (a lot of) money.

The new base box has several cards replaced, modified, or rebalanced. In addition to the 130 "basic" game cards, the box includes the second edition of the Power Project expansion, completely revamped with 60 cards that bring new possibilities and mechanics. The second edition also features a rewritten, more educational manual and a larger box with more storage space for the game's content and expansions.

It is compatible with the previously released Nova Era (New Era) expansion, as well as the recent Calamidade Pública (Public Calamity) and the mini-expansions Marcação Cerrada (Tight Marking) and Centrão do Brazil (Brazil's Centrists).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Events, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Scenario Kit: Grasp of the Mind Flayer
description:
You have received a letter of unknown provenance, offering a hefty reward for clearing a pack of kobolds from a local dungeon. But who is this mysterious benefactor—and can they be trusted?

Dungeons & Dragons Onslaught: Scenario Kit – Grasp of the Mind Flayer features six new scenarios that can be played individually or as an interlinked story adding value and replayability to your collection of D&D Onslaught and D&D Miniatures!

It also features new monster cards, adding iconic enemies like Mind Flayers, Ropers and more! You can use minis from your collection or recommended products, and the pack also includes tokens to represent them if you don’t have the miniatures at hand.

This pack adds even more to your skirmish experience, with new legendary items, swamp items, terrain tokens, and the new Terror deck!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Critical Hits and Failures, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: 6 Nimmt: The Jumping Cow
description:
Promo Card for 30th birthday of '6 Nimmt'

The Jumping Cow doesn’t have a value of its own. When you place a card in the row with the Jumping Cow, use the card to the left of the Jumping Cow as your reference.

When you place your card in the Jumping Cow’s row, it jumps to one of the other three rows – to the one that has the lowest value as its last (rightmost) card.


The Jumping Cow may not have a value, but it counts towards the row’s card limit. A row counts as full if it has four number cards and the Jumping Cow in it.

If you take the row with the Jumping Cow in it, it jumps. First, take the number cards (but not the Cow) as usual, put them in your bull pile, and make the card you played the first card of the row. Then, the Cow jumps to another row as described above.
mechanics: Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: INYO
description: In INYO, you will demonstrate your mastery of balance and unbalancing by knocking your opponent out of the arena or forcing them into submission. To do so, take steps with your dice as if they were your feet. Manage your footwork effectively, striking a calculated balance between gentle agility and explosive power. Engage in measured collisions to throw and grapple your opponent.
mechanics: Advantage Token, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid

name: Skeleton Stories: Geister in den Wänden
description:
Sarah's world collapses after the death of her mother. Her father tries to suppress the loss of his wife and flees with his daughter to the small town of Radenau, where she gradually loses herself in the world of necromancy in order to make contact with her mother. Three months later, Sarah is found dead in the woods. Was she in contact with more spirits than just her mother? Or is there an earthly cause behind it all?

With the help of parapsychologist Dr Corvus, embark on a search for the truth about the eerie events. Examine the documents and evidence, investigate paranormal events and shed light on the darkness.

The aim of the game is to solve the murder and put the paranormal events to the test.

Can you successfully communicate with the ghosts?

ARE YOU READY TO WORK WITH DR. CORVUS? ARE YOU SUITABLE AS A MEDIUM?
As an experienced medium and doctor of parapsychology, Dr Corvus is contacted by people from all over the world to investigate unexplained occurrences, allegedly cursed sites or demonic possession. Become part of his team and investigate exciting criminal cases whose victims usually had contact with the afterlife before they died.

Skeleton Stories is a modern crime game in which you not only have to solve the murder case, but also investigate the case for paranormal events using interactive and multimedia research. The physical case file is accompanied by a digital companion app.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Nach dem Tod ihrer Mutter bricht für Sarah eine Welt zusammen. Ihr Vater versucht, den Verlust seiner Frau zu verdrängen und zieht mit ihr in die Kleinstadt Radenau, wo sie sich nach und nach in die Welt der Geisterbeschwörung und des Übernatürlichen verliert, um Kontakt mit ihrer Mutter aufnehmen zu können. Drei Monate später wird Sarah tot in einem Waldstück aufgefunden. Wurde ihr der Kontakt in die Geisterwelt zum Verhängnis? Oder steckt am Ende eine irdische Ursache dahinter?

BIST DU BEREIT FÜR DIE ARBEIT MIT DR. CORVUS? BIST DU ALS MEDIUM GEEIGNET?
Als erfahrenes Medium und Doktor der Parapsychologie wird Dr. Corvus von Menschen aus der ganzen Welt kontaktiert, um unerklärliche Vorkommnisse, angeblich Verfluchte Stätten oder Dämonische Besessenheit zu prüfen und zu erforschen. Werdet Teil seines Teams und ermittelt in spannenden Kriminalfällen, dessen Opfer meist schon vor Ihrem Ableben Kontakt mit dem Jenseits hatten.

Skeleton Stories ist ein modernes Krimispiel, bei dem es nicht nur gilt den Mordfall zu lösen, sondern dabei auch durch interaktive und multimediale Forschungen den Fall auf paranormale Ereignisse hin zu untersuchen. Begleitet wird die physische Fallakte mit einer digitalen Begleitapp.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Events, Storytelling

name: Coast Watchers: Allied Field Intelligence in the South Pacific, 1942-1943
description:
Coast Watchers takes you into the World War II South Pacific’s struggle between Allied intelligence teams and Japanese security forces. Standup blocks hide coastwatching stations, guerrillas, refugees, and stranded Allied crew. Facedown counters hide the buildup of Japanese forces, which the coastwatchers seek to observe and report to headquarters. Other counters show where Japanese patrols are searching for coastwatchers or go into and get drawn from cups to run Japanese searches and Allied delivery missions.

Each side has Mission cards. Allied Missions assign side tasks to the coastwatchers. Japanese Missions lay out secret military objectives for victory points, including air and sea operations against which the coastwatchers are to warn Allied forces. By hunting coastwatchers while building up military readiness and guiding operations, the Japanese player seeks to slip through the enemy intelligence net. Players also draw Asset cards: special abilities to augment actions and perhaps add victory points.

Coast Watchers offers 15 standalone “Situations” plus 4 campaigns to tie them together. The Situations span the early-1942 Japanese incursion into the South Pacific to the neutralization of their great base at Rabaul by the end of 1943. Solitaire rules are in development.

—description from the publisher
categories: Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Deduction, Hidden Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Set-up

name: Fall
description:
Autumn has arrived, and the fall flowers color the forest. The robin announces the imminent cold and the hoopoe, almost ready for the great nocturnal migration, feeds itself with the last available food. The fox grows its winter coat and toads swarm the most humid areas of the grove, thriving with mushrooms and deciduous leaves.

In Fall you create, together with your opponent, an autumn ecosystem. You both place leaves tiles in the same environment to grow the forest and host its flora, fauna, and funga. However, each player scores points for different objectives, and only at the end of the game the opponent's scoring conditions will be revealed, thanks to the Fox, Bird, and Flower scoring cards, which are different for each player in each game.

During the game, try to understand your opponent's strategy, to counteract it and make it turn in your favor.

Single tableau for both players, with variable scoring opportunities for each player.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Babylon
description:
In the 6th century BCE, Nebuchadnezzar II, king of Babylon, wanted to honor his young wife, Amytis of Media, with magnificent gardens featuring a multitude of beautifully scented flowers, so he called on the most eminent architects in his kingdom to test their ingenuity and realize his vision of creating what would become one of the seven wonders of the ancient world.

In Babylon, you take on the role of an eminent architect. Dig the quarry for the best materials, and use them wisely to build your gardens. At the end of the game, the player who unveils the most impressive design before the king will be declared the winner and crowned the greatest architect in the kingdom.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Three Dimensional Movement, Tile Placement

name: Hanamikoji: Mini Expansions
description:
Win the favor of the Geishas with all new tiles and tactics!

Your favorite Geishas are back with more talent and graceful performances! With the "Mini Expansions", you may play this award-winning 2-player game with even more tactics! The "Mini Expansions" regroup the 7 mini expansions (#1 to #7) of the kickstarter for the retail market. The material is different from the kickstarter version : you have only 2 sets of 4 Action Markers (4 for each player) numbered #1 to #4, and 7 cards - each card give a different combination for the Action Markers #1 to #4.

Mini Expansions may only be played with "Hanamikoji".

Use the base gameplay rules with the Action Markers.

Changes to Setup: When playing with an expansion, each player take a set of 4 markers and play with the following modifications:
- At the start of a round, you no longer remove a card from the Item Card Deck.
- Put discarded cards face down in the game box and keep hidden throughout the round.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Force Commitment, Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Race

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Certified Guild Squad Pack
description:
The members of the Bounty Hunters Guild are very diverse, and each of them has their own concept of honor. Born Din Djarin and raised by Mandalorian warriors, he makes a living in the galaxy as a bounty hunter after the fall of the Empire. Hired by a suspicious individual to recover a supposedly vulnerable asset and deliver it to him, he decided instead to risk his life to protect what turned out to be an orphan.

Among those affected by this decision were Greef Karga, the Guild representative who had contacted the Mandalorian, and the skilled assassin droid turned hired gun called IG-11. The careers of both would be disrupted by the Mandalorian's actions and the subsequent consequences of his confrontation with the Guild...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Wicked Cribbage
description:
Wicked Cribbage is a card game that overlays the game of cribbage. All of the rules of regular cribbage apply to Wicked Cribbage. Same standard 52-card deck and hole-riddled piece of wood. What has been added are two new types of cards intended to provide additional strategy and to enhance existing elements of chance.

These two new cards consist of those that you play immediately when drawn and those that you hold until you decide to use them. The Wicked Cribbage cards have been given fittingly descriptive cribbage names.

TWINKLER: This card must be played immediately, and is drawn when count reaches 15 or 31 during The Play.

LUGGER: This card is held until ready to play, and is drawn during The Show by pegging at an exact multiple of 5. That is, when a player's peg lands directly on a 5, 10, 15, 20, etc.

Draw the Wicked Cribbage card per the above and obey its instructions. Victory is achieved in the same way as cribbage: when one player reaches 121 points.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Legacy Game, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Mega Jackpot
description:
Mega Jackpot is a card game crafted to capture the electric atmosphere of a casino slot machine.


Turn over cards to align three matching symbols to hit the Jackpot!
But the excitement doesn't stop there – gamble your winnings and flip a tile for a shot at the elusive Mega Jackpot.
For the true thrill-seekers, push your luck to the limits and go all-in for the Super Mega Jackpot.


Victory is just a flip away!

Embark on an adrenaline-pumping journey into the heart of the casino world, where every player can taste the thrill of risk from the comfort of their home. Mega Jackpot is a rollercoaster of emotions, testing your nerve while filling the room with laughter and cheers.

Highlights of Mega Jackpot:
Simple: Dive in effortlessly, thanks to a theme everyone knows.
Modular: Engage with the core game or amp up the excitement with the Mega Jackpot tiles.
Brain Boost: Sharpen your mathematical thinking by weighing the odds.
Captivating: Each card turn builds suspense, delivering the casino's thrill without the risk.

Transform any night into a lively casino adventure with Mega Jackpot – where fortune favors the brave, and laughter is the ultimate jackpot.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bingo, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending

name: Kanastic: Worlds of Mythology
description:
Kanastic is a mythology theme game for 2-4 players where you score points by making melds or golden suits in four progressive stages.

Gameplay Features
– A interactive game for 2-4 players in two partnerships.
- The game consists of several rounds, usually 3 to 4,in which players take turns clockwise, drawing, melding, and discarding the cards in their hands to score points.
- The gameplay will keep you focused, constantly engaging your reasoning, memory and intuition in intense psychological moments and extreme overturnings.

Art Features
– Hand-drawn digital artwork.
– 108 playing cards, each featuring a unique mythology – themed illustration.
– Includes all major mythologies including Arabian, Greek, Persian, European, Japanese, Norse, Irish, English, Scandianavian, North American, Jewish, and African.
– 88 „natural” cards divided into 11 ranks, 8 cards forming one puzzle realm: Necromancy fours, Inferno fives, Sea sixes, Lake sevens, Haunted Woods eights, Swamp nines, Desert tens, Ice World Jacks, Magic Forest Queens, Cave Kings, Heaven Aces.
– There are 8 cards in each rank. Every single one of these 88 cards features a different mythical creature.
– The deck also contains: mythical Swords, Shield, Artifacts and Treasure Pot bonus cards.
mechanics: Melding and Splaying

name: Gnome Pack #1
description:
A Promo Pack of 60+ cards for multiple games published by Grey Gnome Games.

This Promo Pack includes previously released promo cards, but it also includes an astounding 50+ all-new promo cards for all of most popular solo games.

The list of old and new promo cards this pack includes are:
Desolate (2 old cards and 8 all-new cards)
Dustrunner (3 old card & 5 all-new cards)
Gate/Gates (7 all-new cards)
Iron Helm (1 old card & 20 all-new cards)
StoneFire (1 old card)
Tin Helm/Tin Realm (6 old cards & 7 all-new cards)

Additionally, the following items are included:
Dungeon Oracle (6 double-sided oracle cards)
Instruction Cards (Pack includes 2 instruction cards)
Tracking Cubes (7 tracking cubes)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: SOLKRIG: Wojna o Układ Słoneczny
description:
SOLKRIG: Wojna o Układ Słoneczny ("SOLKRIG - War for the solar system") is a game about a brutal war for dominance, power and resources in a politically divided Solar System!

Every turn players draw cards into their hand, cards which have special abilities, but which are also currency to develop the scope of their faction (through the technology tree and the abilities derived from the players' boards). Among these cards are also technology cards which, when played, allow new actions to be discovered. Each turn, players also send out their workers to carry out various tasks (e.g. extracting natural resources and energy, building military units, carrying out research, etc.). The main part of the game takes place on a board consisting of 17 rocky worlds in the Solar System, which are controlled by 5 factions, with the players at the helm. The aim of the game is to gain dominance in the Solar System, scoring points by creating new outposts and taking over more areas, building citadels, military units, winning battles with other players, carrying out research, etc. The game ends when players have fulfilled a certain proportion of the requirements on the end-of-game conditions list.

—description from the designer
categories: Fighting, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Contracts, Events, Hand Management, Income, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Order Counters, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Sudden Death Ending, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Worker Placement

name: Naéco
description:
Explore the abyss to observe species, each more surprising than the last.
Naéco is a tactical and easy-to-access game that invites you to the bottom of the ocean. It offers an original system of game objectives, allowing all parts to be different... and the player to adapt! To win, you will need to advance your scientific research, explore balanced biodiversity and prioritize certain species to observe.

The game is developed in partnership with the NGO Sea Shepherd France.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Environmental, Exploration, Nautical
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building

name: Earth: Weather Module
description:
Adapt your strategy to the dynamic weather of each round. All players may capitalize on limited-time effects such as activating abilities twice, earning bonus resources, or making more efficient resource conversions.

This module features 12 double-sided cards with 24 unique weather effects.
categories: Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Unspecified
publishers: Inside Up Games, Lucky Duck Games

name: Monster Voices
description:
Can you say "Mom, can I have another bowl of spaghetti?" in the voice of a were-octopus? Can you become a monster? Monster Voices is a party guessing game where you have to successfully imitate the voice of a monster!

Each round, one player becomes the Monster Spotter and lays out nine cards on the table. Each card has a drawing of a goofy monster: A scary skeleton, a goofy globman, a wiggly werewolf, etc. Each other player draws a card that tells them which of those monsters they must become for the round.

The Monster Spotter draws a Words of Wisdom card, which tells all other players what phrase they need to say in their monster's voice. In turn, each player says the Words of Wisdom in their best impression of their monster. If the Monster Spotter successfully spots them, both players get a point!
mechanics: Deduction, Player Judge, Role Playing

name: Castle Duel
description:
Castle Duel is a two player versus light strategy game, with hidden information, tactical elements and a bit of bluffing. Place your troops on the field using your most mischievous strategies to outsmart your opponent before the battle begins.

Take calculated risks by attacking the enemy troops on the frontline and conquer the enemy castle to be the winner in this 15 minutes tactical memory battle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Nidavellir: Royal Deluxe Treasure
description:
Open The Royal Deluxe Treasure box, and behold the wonder of Nidavellir coins! Featuring a bevelled opening, a thermoformed display case to hold the coins, and closed by a transparent plastic lid, this treasure box is majestic!

The display neatly organizes the uniquely designed Royal Treasure pieces, providing dedicated compartments for the 5 Elvalands starting pieces, and a designated area for discarding pieces during gameplay. The Royal Deluxe Treasure box measures at: 9.5"x8.5"x4".

Additionally, a game variant with an asymmetrical start is included: this means that at the start of the game, you'll get different coins from the other Elvalands, according to the gem drawn at random. This will result in a modification of the Royal Treasure with the addition of an 18, 23 and 25 coin (also included in this Deluxe Royal Treasure).

The Royal Deluxe Treasure contains 69 specially designed poker chips, 40 mm in diameter and 3.3 mm thick, with a weight of 13.5 gr.
mechanics: Chaining, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Auction

name: Godtear: Grimgut, The Vile & Retchlings
description:
"A wicked sight enough to trouble the bravest of souls, Grimgut is a lumbering mass of spoilt flesh, truly earning the alias of the Vile. Unlike others who seek to attract a band of followers, Grimgut instead creates the Retchlings, the remains of those unfortunate enough to find their way into his gullet."

This set includes Grimgut, 5 Retchlings, Grimgut's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: D&D Icons: Gargantuan  Blue Dragon
description:
Product Description
The blue dragon is a vain and territorial juggernaut of claws, scales, and beating wings, with a powerful breath weapon of crackling lightning! The third release in the D&D Icons line, this Gargantuan Blue Dragon miniature comes complete with a full-color battle map, a scenario sheet, and an oversized, double-sided stat card.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Depth Track Accessory + Card Mini-Expansion
description:
The Deluxe Depth Track Expansion is a great way to add a bit of extra flair and theme to your Shadows of Brimstone adventures! This set includes 1 large high-detail plastic Depth Track for use while adventuring down in the dusty Mines of the Old West, as well as 1 textured plastic Hero Posse marker ring and 1 textured plastic Darkness marker ring.

This set also includes 15 new cards for the game (4 Gear, 3 Mine Encounters, 4 Darkness, and 4 Growing Dread). They are themed for racing against time to hold the darkness at bay!

-description from publisher's website
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Old West Item Upgrades Pack #1 Game Supplement
description:
Time to enhance your weapons and items with upgrades like Fur Lining, a Ghost Eagle Feather, or a Mark of Frontier Justice!

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of upgrades to enhance your items from Shadows of Brimstone.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing

name: EOS: Island of Angels – Deluxe Upgrade
description: The Deluxe Upgrade expands the base game with additional material such as more epic deeds and journey cards. It also includes upgraded game materials such as individual wooden ships, wooden Angel and Demon Lord pawns, new glory markers, shield markers, and recessed nation boards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Nautical
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Worker Placement

name: Mouse Maze
description:
Your application for ZooLabs has been accepted! You are now one of the candidates to work on a revolutionary study that, through labyrinth experiments, will teach mice to help people escape from natural disasters. On your first day at the lab, you are introduced to your new little friend, and together, you will discover new possibilities for rat intelligence.

In Mouse Maze, players represent young scientists working on various experiments, building the best mouse maze to maximize the mouse's path, trying to get through the most cheese and candy (positive points) while avoiding or closing the mousetraps (negative points).

It’s a flip and write game in which the players draw the walls of the maze, but it's the opponent who will trace the path (and of course, he’ll make the worst route possible). In each turn, one card is flipped to determine which kind of walls the players can draw, some of them including more cheese, candies, or new mousetraps.

The game has a campaign with 30 exciting episodes (split into 10 chapters) that can be played by 1 to 4 players. New rules, objectives and game elements are introduced with each episode, giving players new choices and strategies (without destroying any components). For players who do not want to experience the campaign, each episode can also be played independently of the campaign and out of order, as well as increasing the number of possible players.

That's 30 games in one, and you can choose the best one for you!
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Enclosure, Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Silver: Cleaner Promo Pack
