name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Abraham
description:
Web-exclusive alternate miniature

Ex-military, with a short temper and skill with firearms, Abraham appears violent and cold to others. He is actually as scared as any of the other survivors, and eventually comes to rely on them to survive the walkers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Opération Commando 2: Sainte-Mère-Eglise
description:
After the British Airborne of the first opus, Operation Commando comes back with the 101th and the 82th American Airborne jumping on Sainte-Mère-Eglise and Utah Beach.
The game includes three scenarios in the Cotentin. It uses the same mechanisms as the first game "Pegasus Bridge" (with a deck of cards and a choice to play or not a card in order to progress) but also declines this system in variants depending on the scenario chosen.
The game includes a lot of cards with original illustrations and also helps for the two "Operation commando" games.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Open Drafting

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – RAF SE.5
description:
The RAF SE.5 fighter (quickly becoming the SE.5a) was one of the aircraft that turned the air war around for the Allies. Both fast and maneuverable, it was easy to fly and an excellent gun platform, as demonstrated by the many aces who scored most of their victories in the airplane. Though engine problems inhibited its early success, once they were solved, it became one of the best fighters of the entire War, able to match or beat anything the Germans flew. Over 5000 aircraft were produced.

Raf SE.5 (Bishop)
The Canadian ace “Billy” Bishop was one of the top scoring pilots of the World War I (72 victories), including 25 in one 10-day period. He was awarded the Victoria Cross and several other decorations.

Raf SE.5a (Dallas)
Roderic Dallas was one of the top–scoring pilots from Australia shooting down 32 enemies, nine victories flying on SE.5a, before being shot down by members of Jasta 14 on 1 June 1918 above Liévin, in France.

Raf SE.5a (McCudden)
James McCudden began the war as an observer and became the most highly decorated Allied airman, a precise and patient pilot that achieved 57 victories, most of which came flying in the glorious SE.5a.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Football Fortunes
description:
A unique concept in football manager gaming, Football Fortunes is a board game that allows you to manage your club, playing squad, finances and tactics against your friends and also computer controlled teams while the companion apps take care of the fixtures, league tables, points earned, chance cards and more.

In the game you'll encounter all of the ups and downs of football management. React to various crises. Stave off bankruptcy. Sign the best players from the current Premier League crop of superstars. Out-think your opponents tactically. Improve your coach and youth team to become world beaters.

The skillset required to succeed will be varied and the hurdles challenging, just like they are in the real world! Can you conquer the Football Fortunes league and cups before storming the giants of European football?

The game includes:

176 Premier League player cards
A Classic 1980s player card pack featuring players from the original Brian Clough's Football Fortunes game
The game board
The free Football Fortunes companion app
Upgrade and bung tokens
Pointers for use on the game's deluxe Player Mats
In the game managers must:

Sign players to build a world class squad of players
Manage your clubs finances, avoiding bankruptcy!
Survive crises that will inevitably hit your club at some point through the game
Improve your Coach and bring through Youth Players from your Academy
Build up your staff so that you can go on Scouting Trips and more
Employ winning tactics in multiple competitions against different opponents. Are you a park the bus manager or an all out attacker? Do you adapt?
The manager who wins will be the one to have filled their cabinet with silverware. Go for glory!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Auction: Sealed Bid, Closed Economy Auction, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Gloomhaven: Assault on the Morning Star (Promo Scenario)
description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven.

The scenario was made available as a reward for backing the Dice Tower Kickstarter 2020 campaign.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Push Up Poppies
description:
The unpredictable world of Push Up Poppies offers rewards and inflicts pain. Plantation owners in Afghanistan have devilish tricks and creative tools to grow and harvest their poppies.

In this card game, each player has their own poppy plantation and their goal is to harvest the most poppies by maximizing their plantation's productivity and stifling the opposition.

There are four types of card:

The Field cards, which are the cards the players can harvest. Most of these are poppy cards, which have a value from 1 to 8.
The Infrastructure cards, which permanently affect the player's plantation in various ways.
The Action cards, which boost poppy production or sabotage the competition. These cards are discarded immediately after being played.
The Wild cards, which behave differently depending on what the player chooses them to be.


Each player must have five cards in their hand at the start of their turn. During their turn, the player must draw one card from the common stack and then play one card, either by placing it in front of them in their plantation (Field or Infrastructure cards) or by resolving its action (Action cards). They can also simply discard a card. If they so choose, they can play a second one and if they do, they have to draw a second card from the stack afterwards.

As soon as a player has five Field cards in their plantation, they must harvest it. The harvest is worth the combined value of the poppy cards harvested. The first player reaching 69 points wins!

Note: One deck allows to play with up to six players, but one can combine several decks together to play with many more people.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Sugar Ponies and the Quest for the Cotton Corns
description:
Are you ready for a jaunt around the Rainblove Funtasy Furry Forest? Well, golly gee, you better be! The most fun you can have going in a circle and collecting things is just a hop, skip, and a half-gallop away!

In this ridiculous follow-up to the Sugar Ponies card game, you’ll compete against your pals in a race to the finish to acquire “Lil’ Happies” (aka Cottoncorns)! But remember: It’s not about who wins; it’s about the buddies you make along the way! And we all know you can’t spell “win” without “friends”!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Menagerie
description:
During a mission into enemy territory, the rangers are ambushed by a strange assortment of wild beasts, pursued by their Shadow Deep handlers. Can the rangers survive the onslaught, and then turn the tables on their attackers? And can they discover the secrets of the enemy wagon train before it escapes back into the darkness?

Rangers of Shadow Deep: Menagerie is a mini-supplement featuring one mission with two scenarios. Also included are nine new animal companions that rangers can recruit to join them on their adventures.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Virtue Signal: Celebrity NPC Pack
description:
16 additional NPCs that look like people you might recognize. Or you might not.

Requires Virtue Signal base game to play.

Includes: Goolagle, Commie Barney Sanderson, Jill-ette, the Skeeze, Sonichu Fan, Ayahuasca Joe, The Best Card in the Universe, The Enigmatic Madam Wu, Fashbook, Definitely Not the CIA, Guðbjorg Þunberp, The Hunger that Dooms Worlds, Dropkicker, American Pravda, Sportzball, and Jenk.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Chute: La Perla United
description:
All hands on deck! is heard at full volume through a large megaphone in “Laguna Carnada” on match days. Accustomed to the harsh life on the high seas, the “La Perla United” squad brings a powerful maritime strategy to the “Chutemundo”. Ready your cannons and ignite the gunpowder of this team full of ruffians and mercenaries ready for battle.

La Perla United is distinguished by its tricks of skilled pirates and wise sailors. Their time at sea has made them rough, and they have discovered how to control the most powerful creature in the depths… the Kraken!!! use it to score and destroy your rivals with his unique skills. It is not an easy task, but the reward of summoning him is gigantic.

—description from the publisher (translated)

¡Todos a sus puestos! se escucha a todo volumen por un gran megáfono en Laguna Carnada los días de partido. Acostumbrados a la dura vida en alta mar, el plantel de La Perla United trae al Chutemundo una estrategia marítima potente, alista tus cañones y enciende la pólvora de este equipo lleno de rufianes y mercenarios listos para la batalla.

La Perla United se distingue por sus trucos de piratas hábiles y sabios navegantes. Su tiempo en el mar los ha convertido en discípulos de éste y han descubierto como controlar a la criatura mas poderosa de las profundidades, descubre al “Kraken” y úsalo para destruir a tu rival. No es tarea fácil, pero la recompensa es gigantezca.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Muskets & Tomahawks: Shakos & Bayonets
description: Shakos & Bayonets is the supplement for Muskets & Tomahawks, dealing with the Napoleonic period.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Chaos Rift
description:
A kingdom on the crossroads gets invaded by its greedy neighbours. On the brink of defeat, its wizards launch the final retaliation - they open a rift to the realms of chaos. Mighty demons with their servants swarm the land, turning it into waste. The invading kingdoms face an opponent they are not ready for. Regular armies are helpless against horrors of wraiths, turning people into possessed who fight against their own kind. Only elite units, heroes and battle mages dare to face the dark forces. The goal is to buy time for the archmages to prepare a spell that would close the rift. The help might come too late - if the destruction of the lands is too severe, people will abandon hope and wait defenceless for the doom.

Players - alone or in 2-player teams - take the role of chaos forces and the defending kingdoms. The chaos has the upper hand - they decide which kingdom will be invaded and with which forces. The defenders have to predict the attack directions and send their forces there. They are not completely blind - their scouts and clairvoyants can detect enemy’s movements. Chaos forces crave resources that are spread across the land - this also gives hints where they would like to strike. Some kingdoms are more vulnerable - or resistant - against some types of attacks, but the best strike is often the most obvious one. Both sides have to raise new armies - their starting forces need reinforcements as the units need rest after every battle. Both sides have also to deal with casualties that come with every war.

Chaos forces need resources taken from the lands to raise new armies and launch the attacks. As their domain gets bigger, the conquered sources of resources get depleted. Chaos armies can pillage the lands for additional resources but this comes at the cost of precious time.

This is where the game starts - chaos leaders have seven rounds of time to destroy the most vital parts of the kingdoms, so that any help from the archmages comes too late. They have to find a way to plan successful attacks deceiving the defenders. Defending players have to deduct chaos assaults and counter them. Wrong guess of direction gives an opportunity to fortify the borders against future attack. Wrong choice of the defending unit still slows the opponent down. Right unit at the right border will stop the invasion - at least once.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Dawn of Iron: The American Civil War at Sea – 1861-1865
description:
Dawn of Iron: The American Civil War at Sea, is a game of naval combat, set during American Civil War (1861-1865). While many think of the war’s naval campaigns as a static blockade, the truth is that it was actually just as desperate and bloody as other aspects of the conflict. From the coastal regions of Virginia and the muddy rivers of the Mississippi Valley to the far flung freezing waters of Alaska’s Bering Strait, Union and Confederate navies fought for dominance.

Dawn of Iron puts you in command of a Civil War-era vessel, or a full squadron of them. Assemble your fleet, engage the enemy, and send them to the bottom!

The 24-page Dawn of Iron rulebook includes all the rules you'll need to play in a concise 15-pages with diagrams and illustrations. There's also a few pages dedicated to open sea and coastal battlefields that you will fight on (riverine coming soon!) and four general play missions that should get you sailing in no time!
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Special Weapon Tiles
description:
Part of an add-on (Treasure Chest Promos) during the Robinson Crusoe Collector's edition Gamefound campaign. The promo was also available for backers of the Secret Cabal 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Special weapon tiles introduce additional usage of your weapons when you hunt for certain animals.

SPECIAL WEAPON TILES:

Someone once told you that there was more than one way to skin a cut.. you're beg ning to understand the meaning of that phrase. Weapons are always as straightforward as a knife or a gun-sometimes they're mor subtle. If nothing else, this island has at least taught you the importance of innovation.

During Setup, place the Special Weapon tiles Invention side faceup nearthe Board.

During the Action Phase, you may use a Build Action in order to build a Special Weapon. When you successfully resolve the Build Action, flip the tile and place it on the corresponding space on the board. Once Built, the Special Weapon may be used for every Hunt Action with the indi cated animal type.

You may have only 1 Special Weapon Built at a time. If you want to Build a different Special Weapon, you must remove the current Special Weap on tile from the board. Then place the newly Built Special Weapon on the corresponding space on the board.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: Tactical Operations – Advanced Rules
description:
Take your warfare to a whole new level of excitement! Deploy under cover of exotic weather and severe planetary conditions. Surprise your enemy with your mastery of new battlefield tactics—from artillery to command-level comms to minefields! A daring commander can take advantage of any or all of these….if he’s brave enough to seize the moment!

Tactical Operations:Advanced Rules is the one-source reference for advanced rules that apply to on-world operations. It includes new movement and combat options.

Note: Together with Tactical Operations: Advanced Units & Equipment, the content of Tactical Operations: Advanced Rules made up the book, Tactical Operations. But in June of 2020 it was split in two, because it was deemed to be too long with over 400 pages.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Nick Fury & S.H.I.E.L.D. Agents
description:
Nicholas Fury, Junior is the son of famed S.H.I.E.L.D. Director Nick Fury.
A veteran Army Ranger who served overseas, Nick Fury returned to the United States following the murder of his mother. He tracked down and neutralized the killer with the help of the Avengers and S.H.I.E.L.D., after which he became one of the top operatives of the Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement, and Logistics Division.
In addition to his high level strategic and tactical skills, Nick Fury has inherited the Infinity Formula in his blood, giving him faster healing and peak physical capabilities.

Accompanying Fury on operations is an elite fireteam of S.H.I.E.L.D. operatives.
Outfitted with the latest in advanced weaponry and equipment, these agents support Fury in the field and secure vital assets in a crisis. Each is a highly-skilled, dedicated agent trained in both covert operations and full-scale crisis containment.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hero Realms: Pay Off Promo Card
description:
Name = Pay Off
Type = Action
Cost = 4 gold
Action = You may pay double a target champion's cost to gain control of it (permanently)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Shrooms: Mycology ~ The Game
description:
Welcome to the Kingdom of Mushrooms! You will begin the game with a set of mushrooms tokens and cards. You choose which cards to place in ecosystems to grow and eventually forage into your shroom basket. Strategize to gain more mushrooms, water droplets from the waterfall, and more. Strive to become a “Master Mycologist” and learn more about the fungi kingdom with true-to-life images and extraordinary facts. Mushroom facts and features are scientifically accurate. Players compete for the basket with the highest points, earning “mycochievements” (™ pending) along the way! You and your friends will become immersed in unique gameplay that blends science and fun in this remarkable world of fungi.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Potions & Spells
description:
Potions & Spells is a recipe-building card game where 2-6 players cast spells to hinder an opponent’s progress or gain advantages, while collecting ingredients to create powerful potions.

Potions & Spells start the game with 3 random ingredients and 3 random spells (action cards) in their hand. On the active player's turn they can choose between 3 different options:

Option 1 - Cast & Collect: Player may choose to cast a spell or not. Spells can attack players, gain advantages or defend against other spells. Next, they can collect two ingredients from the market. Then to end their turn, as spell card is drawn from the deck into their hand.

Option 2 - Brew a Potion: Brewing a potion has a unique ingredient recipe requirement. Recipe requirements must be met with an ingredients value exactly (No more, No less) the player then discards the ingredients and scores the potion in front of them, performs the action on the potion and gains the points indicated on the potion.

Option 3 - Activate: A Dragon Crystal doesn’t carry any power on its own, but collect 3 and activate them by placing them face up during the Activate option on your turn. Activated Dragon Crystals are worth 3 points but also may be boosted by a potion action.

To Win: The first player to get 25 points or more
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That

name: HackGuard:InfiniteStrategies
description:
HackGuard is a hacking game that tests your area building power and logic. In a 6x6 board, each player becomes a hacker, and they must set up patches on the public network to hinder their opponent's actions and accelerate their own invasion, with the goal of getting into and taking control of their opponent's private network as quickly as possible.

—description from the publisher

kickstarterLink
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/kakumarug/hackguard?ref...

If you like:

・Head-to-head games for two players
・Quick play sessions that last just 15 minutes with simple rules
・A design rooted in cognitive psychology to stimulate deep thinking
・Ever-changing boards and gameplay elements for endless replayability in a roguelite fashion
・A game that's easy for beginners to pick up but offers infinite strategic depth for advanced players

Then Hack Guard: Infinite Strategies is perfect for you!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Programmed Movement, Race, Tile Placement

name: G.I. JOE Mission Critical: Vehicle Pack #3
description:
Four new Vehicle cards bring more firepower in the fight against Cobra.

Includes: Conquest X-30, Hammer, Mauler MBT, and Rolling Thunder.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Pasaron Cosas
description:
You are a member of a political party and you are starting your electoral campaign to become President. The dispute over the vote in the provinces of the national territory should be your main priority to win the elections, although your actions will not be the only thing you should take into account. Public opinion has often weighed on people's decisions and actions; some have even called it the fourth estate. You will have to find a way to make friends with opinion leaders who may not respect your ideology, but do serve to improve your approval in society, for example. Or maybe you decide to join a very prestigious media that shares your ideals, which will be your ally throughout the campaign to provide you with its services.

Nowadays, unpredictability can reign in the country, so chance can play tricks on you or be beneficial for your campaign. But be careful because the economy here is fragile, and your budget funds will be limited. The key to managing them can be decisive in reaching the last week of the campaign with a chance, and not losing the possibility of increasing your cultural capital by multiplying your chances of victory. Sometimes it is not the one who has the most money who wins, but the one who best represents the culture of his country, or who has the political skills to influence his adversaries; But above all, the most important thing is that they don't put you in prison. At least until now we do not know of any ruler who has run while behind bars.

Enjoy a fun game of strategy, planning and financial intelligence to enjoy for hours with friends and/or family. And let whoever is the best politician win.

Clarification: The game will not be responsible for fights and/or discussions that may cause or possible deepening of the crack. Or yes... we talked about it in Segurola and Havana.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Intergalactic Space Trader
description:
Greetings Galactic Citizens,

This is a solo player game where you take on the role of an Intergalactic Space Trader. You have a freighter which you will use to fly from planet to planet selling your trade goods in the hope of making a profit. You can upgrade your ship, buy bigger ships, make investments and trade goods. Along the way you might do some mining, find a derelict ship, fend off space pirates or head into the entertainment sector. Who knows whom you might meet there.

It is important to understand this game is the following:


Free (with a pay what you want option, any contributions are appreciated)
A print and play game
A solo player game
Designed for economy printing, with minimal colour
A portable tabletop game


IST is a game you can play on the move, as you do not have to use dice although a set of polyhedral dice is handy. You can instead, close your eyes and place a pen on a chart and generate a result that way.

Format

IST is designed to be portable, being in an A6 format. Each page is A6 but can be printed A5 also. Using a PDF reader you can set the files to print as booklets if you have A5 paper, and you can always tear in half A4 pages in half. The game was always designed to be carried in a pocket.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Investment, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Dino Dynasty
description:
In Dino Dynasty, players represent dinosaur species from the Cretaceous period that compete in various aspects of survival. Which aspects are important vary from game to game. Each game features a scenario with specific starting conditions and a set of random challenges. The player who completes the most of these challenges wins.

The map, called the territory, is created by the players placing territory tiles. These tiles create biomes can span several tiles. It is not specified where in the world the game takes place, but the biomes are based on the ones that existed during the Cretaceous period. The map is mostly unknown at the start of the game and is gradually revealed as players spread and explore it.

There are alternative ways to play using different map set-ups called scenarios, playing in teams and even playing several games as a campaign. In addition, a "legendary" part of the game gives players the ability to change between species inside a dynasty and save their current development over several games. This can be used to get suitable dinosaur variants to manage harder scenarios; it can also be used to get a specific dinosaur or combination of dinosaurs to best counter opponents.

The foundation for this game is facts, what is known and theorized by the latest scientific discoveries regarding different dinosaur species, but in Dino Dynasty, the players can explore the fantasy of what could have been. What would have happened if a dinosaur had developed in an evolutionary direction other than it did? These possible changes are still within reasonable limits and are based on the real physical characteristics of the dinosaurs.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Infinity CodeOne: Operation Kaldstrøm
description:
Operation: Kaldstrøm is the official way to introduce yourself to the Infinity CodeOne ruleset, as it includes a full-color rulebook with 5 tutorial missions to teach you how to play, making it easy to understand the Infinity CodeOne core mechanics.

In addition to this, Operation: Kaldstrøm is a box containing 14 miniatures belonging to two different armies, an introductory ruleset, cardboard scenery, dice—everything you need to start collecting Infinity CodeOne or just to complete your collection.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Spells of Doom: Alternative Art Promo Cards
description:
This is a special promo pack with alternative artwork for cards included in the base game of Spells of Doom.

These cards are:
2 copies of Summoning (Magie's skill card)
2 copies of Summoning (Hypnor's skill card)
2 copies of Fast Attack (Magies's skill card)
2 copies of Fast Attack (Oakheart's skill card)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Night of the Ninja
description:
Night of the Ninja is a blue-black deck built around Ninjas and ninjutsu, from Betrayers of Kamigawa.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. When the game begins, the player going first reveals the top of his or her planar deck (or the shared planar deck), which is the plane the game starts on. Each plane card has a name, a type, one ability that applies at all times (either to all players or to whoever is the turn player at the time), and one "Chaos" ability.

Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." Each Planechase pre-constructed deck comes with a "planar die" that has four blank faces, one "Planeswalk" face with the "Planeswalker" symbol, and one "Chaos" face with its own symbol unique to Planechase. During a player's main phase, that player can roll the planar die, with three possible outcomes. A blank roll of the planar die does nothing. If "Chaos" is rolled, the "Chaos" ability of the current plane card triggers. If the "Planeswalk" symbol is rolled, the player "planeswalks away" from the current plane (put it on the bottom of its owner's planar deck) and he or she reveals the top card of his or her planar deck, which becomes the new plane that has been "planeswalked to." A player can roll the planar die as many times as he or she likes, but successive rolls cost an additional one mana for each time the planar die has been rolled this turn.

Other than the above, the normal rules of the game are followed, and Planechase can be adapted to any multiplayer variant.

Planechase 2012 introduced the "phenomenon" card type. A player may have up to two different phenomenon cards in his or her planar deck, which cannot have the same name. When a player planeswalks to a phenomenon, he or she follows the instructions on the card, then immediately planeswalks away from it.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Table Air Combat: Lancaster
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of four bombers, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set is a self-contained rulebook that includes miniatures for the British heavy bomber Lancaster.
In addition to the Lancaster bombers, this set also includes:

ground targets for the city of Augsburg, Valentin U-boat factory, Mohne Dam, and Battleship Tirpitz.
Spotlight templates as part of of the new night-fighting rules.
Bomb hit and illumination markers.
Flak templates.


This set contains five scenarios.
Operation Millennium: A mass of Lancasters brave spotlights and flak to attack Cologne at night.
Augsburg: Unescorted Lancasters attack a German city. The Luftwaffe defends the city with Bf-109F fighters.
Dambusters: In this low-level, night mission, Lancasters drop a special “skip bomb” to breach a dam in Germany’s Ruhr Valley.
Tirpitz: The German battleship Tirpitz sits crippled in a Norwegian fjord. Lancasters drop 12,000lb Tallboy bombs to sink her.
Grand Slam: The 22,000lb “earthquake bomb” is used against the hardened Valentin U-boat factory.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: No Peace for Thirty Years! The German Wars of Religion 1618-1648
description:
In 1618, three men were tossed out of a window in Prague Castle in an act of protest against the catholic king of Bohemia, a defenestration beginning the Thirty Years’ War. Encompassing all of Germany and featuring soldiers and generals from all over Europe, the Thirty Years’ War was the last and greatest of the European Wars of Religion.

No Peace for Thirty Years is a two player stand alone game using the No Peace Without Spain system. It contains two scenarios, the Winter King scenario (from 1618 to 1629) and the Lion of the North scenario (from 1630 to 1648), as well as the full No Peace for Thirty Years scenario (from 1618 to 1648).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mischief at the Museum
description:
In the cooperative setup, you take on the role of museum creators, working together to put together a grid of museum rooms for a museum of whatever theme you decide as a group. Picking a theme has no mechanical purpose, but the game encourages light roleplaying, so knowing whether you’re making a bacon or donut museum helps encourage that. Rooms are things like the gift shop, special exhibit, hands-on exhibit, bathroom, etc…

Then you get dealt one of 6 characters: three museum employees (Docent, Janitor, Volunteer) and 3 family members (Grandparent, Parent, Teen). The mechanic involved is age; players and NPC visitors in the museum are either Youth, Adult, or Senior. Of course there are roleplaying opportunities here too.

Then you get dealt Attribute Cards, basically sets to collect by moving around collecting memory tokens (Education, Bonding, Romance, and Mischief). You’ll get to manage your cards by drawing and discarding as the game goes on. It’s played over 7 turns, or the 7 hours the museum is open.

Each turn you have 5 Actions you can do, kept track of by cards you flip over. One Action, the Hour Action, changes each hour to keep things fresh. There are certain conditions that have to be met, involving the number of people in a room and their ages, to collect the memory tokens. The roleplaying charm comes from describing these actions, including what mischievous things you do, as you do them.

At the end you complete the best sets you can with the tokens you’ve collected and add up the points.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Hidden Victory Points, Interrupts, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: TSWW: Singapore
description:
Singapore is the first game of The Second World War Series (TSWW) from Diffraction Entertainment for the Pacific Theater of War.

It covers the campaigns in Malaya, Singapore, Burma and the Dutch East Indies (except Biak/New Guinea) for the entire Second World War.

The game includes 22 18″ x 26″ Map segments (plus a 1/8 map for northwestern Burma), 10 countersheets (2800 counters) plus the usual Rules, Charts, Orders of Battle for 23 scenarios and campaigns, and a pair of D10 Dice.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Freedom Five Promo Cards
description:
These are variant cards of 5 of the heroes.

Freedom Five: Tachyon - Blitz: Tachyon deals 1 Target 1 melee damage. You may move a Burst card from your Trash to the bottom of your deck. IF you do, use this Power again now.

Freedom Five: Wraith - Clandestine Funding: Draw a card. Until the end of your next turn, whenever you Draw a card, you may Discard a card. If you do, another Player Draws a card.

Freedom Five: Absolute Zero - Pilot Light: Absolute Zero deals himself 2 Fire Damage. If he takes Damage this way, search your Deck for an Ongoing Card and put it into play. Shuffle your Deck.

Freedom Five: Bunker - Tactical Uplink: Reveal then replace the top Card of each Hero Deck. If you reveal a Mode, put it into Play. One Player may put the top Card of their Deck into Play.

Freedom Five: Legacy - Overwatch: You may either move an Environment card in Play to the bottom of the Environment deck, or one Player may play a card.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Villain Pack
description: Tanares is home to powerful monsters and intelligent villains who have been executing their nefarious plans for centuries. Find several of them and their gold-sized Villain/Overlord Cards, containing instructions, abilities, and Stats related to the missions from Arena: the Contest’s Epic Campaign, in this pack.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: G.I. JOE Mission Critical: Sgt Slaughter Figure Pack
description:
Sgt Slaughter, reporting for duty! The famous Drill Sergeant is ready to slam Cobra into the ground and make your squad the best it can be!

Features:

Special Hero Figure expansion!
Add Sgt Slaughter’s signature vehicle, the Triple T, to your team’s arsenal!
Unique combat cards to help drive Cobra into submission or whip your team into fine fighting force!


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dino Gardens
description:
In Dino Gardens, dinos compete to grow the largest, most delicious garden they can before the meteor strike and the end of the world.

Dino Gardens is a strategy game where you must grow and eat plants while forming alliances, battling other dinos, and protecting your garden from Terrible T-Rex. To help in growing their garden, each dino has a unique skill that may allow them to fly, run, swim, or have access to unique seeds.

In the Planting stage, dinos move freely around the land planting their seeds. In the Growing stage, dinos must tend to their seeds and grow them into mature plants by revisiting them. And finally, in the Eating stage, dinos must try to eat all the plants they can for precious dino calories. At the end of the three stages, the dino who has consumed the most dino calories is the winner!

In each stage dinos must make important choices. Planting in the wetlands will yield higher results, but other dinos may try and steal your plants. Visiting dino hot springs has restorative health benefits, but will take time away from gardening. In addition, Terrible T-rex is roaming the land looking for his lucky top hat, and if he finds it hidden in your garden, he will attack!

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Farming, Humor, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Victory by Any Means: Campaign Moderator's Companion
description:
Expand your Victory by Any Means (VBAM) campaign with
this book of advanced rules and options for use with the VBAM Campaign System! This companion includes rules for high-detail star system generation, non-player entities and diplomacy, ground combat, exploration, and much more. Perhaps more importantly, the CAMPAIGN MODERATOR’S COMPANION includes all of the rules a player needs to play a solo campaign.

Expands:

Victory by Any Means: Campaign Guide


Expanded by:

Stars Divided: Terran Civil War (Victory by Any Means: Campaign Guide and Victory by Any Means: The Starmada Edition also required)

name: Legendary: A James Bond Deck Building Game – No Time to Die
description:
The third expansion to Legendary: A James Bond Deck Building Game!

This expansion comes with 120 playable cards featuring images from the James Bond movie, No Time To Die!

This expansion will continue to expand on Legendary one classic movie at a time. James Bond will be accompanied by new allies as he attempts to disrupt the nefarious plans of Safin.

Is James Bond up for this new challenge?

—description from the publisher

name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Genryu/Shakiko Hero Pack
description:
Additional hero for Ancient Chronicles that can also be played with Immortal Souls.
—user summary
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: 1821: Αγώνας για Λευτεριά
description:
After 400 years under Ottoman occupation, the Greeks decide to rebel and claim their freedom. Will they manage to prevail or will they get squashed by the Ottoman empire?

1821: Fight for Freedom is a strategy card game that puts the players in the role of the rebellion's main characters. By playing cards from their hands, the players try to gain control of large areas of Greece and minimize their opponent's potential. Whoever manages to gain control of these areas, is the game's winner!

In the game, the players have cards in their hands with the main characters from Greece's War of Independence. They also have 3 cards in front of them, representing 3 large areas of Greece. Each player, on their turn, may place more units in those areas or discard cards to move the existing units. When units of opposite sides end up next to each other, battles occur which are determined by the units' strength and cards played for support. If a player ends up having a total of 10 or more power in one area, at the beginning of their turn, they gain a control marker in that area. The first player to place a control marker in each area or 5 markers in total, is the winner!

The game is also played with 4 players in teams - 2 vs 2. In this case, the player fight for the control of 4 areas in total and the winning team is the one that either places a control marker in all 4 areas or places 7 control markers in total.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Μετά από 400 χρόνια σκλαβιάς οι Έλληνες αποφασίζουν να ξεσηκωθούν και να διεκδικήσουν την ελευθερία τους. Θα τα καταφέρουν ή θα τους σταματήσουν οι δυνάμεις των Οθωμανών κατακτητών;

Το 1821: Αγώνας για Λευτεριά είναι ένα παιχνίδι στρατηγικής με κάρτες, που βάζει τους παίκτες στον ρόλο των πρωταγωνιστών της Επανάστασης. Παίζοντας τις κάρτες που κρατούν στο χέρι τους, οι παίκτες προσπαθούν να κερδίσουν τον έλεγχο μεγάλων περιοχών της Ελλάδας και να περιορίσουν τη δύναμη του αντιπάλου τους. Όποιος καταφέρει να πάρει τον έλεγχο στις περιοχές αυτές, θα είναι και ο νικητής!

Στο παιχνίδι οι παίκτες έχουν κάρτες στα χέρια τους με τους πρωταγωνιστές της Επανάστασης. Μπροστά τους υπάρχουν 3 κάρτες που αναπαριστούν 3 μεγάλες περιοχές της Ελλάδας. Κάθε παίκτης στη σειρά του μπορεί είτε να κατεβάσει κι άλλες κάρτες στις περιοχές αυτές, είτε να κάψει κάρτες από το χέρι του για να μετακινήσει τις υπάρχουσες μονάδες του. Όταν οι μονάδες του βρεθούν δίπλα απο μονάδες του αντιπάλου, γίνεται μάχη η οποία καθορίζεται από τη δύναμη των μονάδων και τις κάρτες που θα παίξουν οι παίκτες για ενίσχυση. Αν ένας παίκτης, στην αρχή του γύρου του, έχει αθροιστική δύναμη 10 σε μια περιοχή (και μεγαλύτερη από τον αντίπαλο του) τότε τοποθετεί μια μάρκα Νίκης στην περιοχή αυτή. Όποιος τοποθετήσει 1 μάρκα Νίκης σε κάθε περιοχή ή 5 συνολικά, είναι ο νικητής!

Το παιχνίδι παίζεται και με 4 παίκτες σε ομάδες - 2 εναντίον 2. Στην περίπτωση αυτή οι παίκτες μάχονται για τον έλεγχο 4 περιοχών και κερδίζει όποια ομάδα τοποθετήσει μάρκα Νίκης και στις 4 περιοχές ή συνολικά 7.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management

name: Coiffeur-Jass
description:
A trick taking for 3 players or two partnerships played with Jass cards. The game is probably influenced by Barbu. Each player plays a number (8, 10, or more) of different contracts during the course of the game. The biggest difference between Barbu and Coiffeur-Jass is that players are trying to win as many valuable cards by capturing them in tricks. Typical contracts include:


Acorns, Shields, Bells, Flowers: Play with the specified suit as trumps.
Obenabe: Play with no trumps.
Undenufe: Play with no trumps, but the ranks of the cards are reversed.
Slalom: Play with no trumps, but tricks are played alternately with the Obenabe and Undenufe rankings.
Gustav: Play with no trumps; either the first six tricks are played with the suits in Obenabe order and the next six tricks in Undenufe order, or vice versa.
Joker: Declarer chooses any of the above contracts.


In Switzerland, you can purchase blackboards that have a Coiffeur-Jass scoring table printed on it.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Lil' Guys
description:
In Lil' Guys, players compete to collect matching types of guys for their Lil' Guy party. The more of any given type of guy that they have at the end of the game, the more points they score.

Each round a bunch of Lil' Guys go up for grabs in a line at the center of the table. One player, the Party Planner, is tasked with splitting the line of guys into groups for each player without rearranging them. The Party Planner chooses their group of guys last, so they have to think strategically about what other players are looking for and how not to get stuck with the worst group of guys themselves.

Players may also choose to collect powerful items from the Party Store each round to make their parties more bodacious, supplement their score, and give themselves strategies to build toward.

The game ends when all 80 guys have been invited to the player's parties. Players then count up each stack of guys at their party, as well as their Party Store cards to determine their final scores. The player with the highest score wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection

name: Ostia: Patronus Expansion
description:
Like the saying "Manus manum lavat" (washing hands with hands/mutual relationship), connections were of the utmost importance in Ancient Rome. Especially when it comes to starting a new business.

You will utilise your network by seeking protection from influential people and having them be your "patron (Patronus)". A patron (Patronus) can set up a banquet and introduce you to others who are likely to invest in your business.

Observe the trade route conditions, movement of your rivals, and examine carefully which person you should interact with. The connections you built here will be the cornerstone of your business.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Gangs of The Underhive
description:
Gangs of the Underhive is your complete guide to the House Gangs of Necromunda. Inside, you'll find everything you need to found a killer gang of your own, whether you're building a crack squad of Delaque infiltrators or a brutal pack of Goliath killers. Inside, you'll find:


A brief guide to the background and lore of each of the House Gangs battling for control of the underhive
Rules for founding a gang for House Escher, Goliath, Orlock, Van Saar, Cawdor and - for the first time - Delaque, each with their own equipment lists, skill tables and fighter characteristics
A choice of Hired Guns to add to your gang - design your own, or choose from 14 named Bounty Hunters
Options for adding a host of Hangers-on, Brutes and Exotic Beasts to your gang - from Sloppers to Sumpkrocs.
A complete and updated Trading Post, allowing you to add all manner of wargear, bionics and even pets to your gang during campaigns
8 Skill lists for upgrading and specialising your fighters
A quick reference sheet for checking out your key information at a glance
A miniatures showcase, with beautifully painted examples of each of the six House Gangs as well as a selection of Hired Guns


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Aquarian Age
description: One on one collectible card game with a strong emphasis on cute girls drawn by a variety of artists. The theme goes all over the place (fantasy, science fiction, etc). Was very popular, spawning a ton of expansions, multiple art books, a sequel game( Aquarian Age 2), drama CDs, anime, and misc. other merchandise.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Where's The Beef Card Game
description:
At the beginning of a round, the First Out card is set aside for later use and players are dealt the remaining cards. Players place face-up on the table all the food pairs found in their hands. On their turn, players draw a random card from the player on their left. If the card matches a card in their hand, they place the matching pair face-up on the table. Play continues until a player has matched all the cards in his hand. The first player to do so takes the First Out card. After the first player goes out, play continues until all pairs are matched and a single player holds The Beef card. Each matching pair is worth either 1, 2, or 3 points. The pair of Clara Peller cards is worth 5 points, the First Out card is worth 8 points and The Beef card is worth 10 points.

The player who scores the most points at the end of 3 rounds wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Plan West
description:
Plan West™

- While Poland mobilizes and the diplomats try to find a peaceful solution to the Danzig situation, Hitler launches a back-stabbing attack without a formal declaration of war. Although England and France support Poland and on September the 3rd declare war on Germany, the Poles are left to fight alone….

Game components:
- Book-case box
- 70 x 50 cm map (28 x 20 in)
- 264 die-cut counters
- Game rules
- 1 die

In the late 1930s, Polish generals Berbecki, Bortnowski, Kasprzycki, Kutrzeba and Rómmel designed Plan West (Plan Zachód) for the defence against a German invasion. The planners had predicted the direction of most of the German thrusts, with the exception of the intensity of the flanking movement via Prussia and Slovakia. Although the Polish Army had already started their mobilization during mid-August, the final part was postponed until August the 30th due to the political situation and the work to find a diplomatic solution. However, on the German side, a general mobilization had already been completed under the cover of a military exercise, and the German army was deployed around the Polish border according to the German strategic invasion plan, Case White (Fall Weiß), originally developed by generals Blumentritt and von Manstein.
Plan West™ is an attempt to create a fun and fast-paced board game on one of the most decisive campaigns during World War II. The game is based around a chit-pull system and a Victory Point time track that forces the Germans to operate at a historical tempo during the game. Plan West™ covers the first 10 days of the campaign and is played on a coffee table sized map.

It is built around the same system of rules that shaped Stargard Solstice, Plan West and Army Group Narwa and utilizes a Command chit-pull system to activate HQ, which in turn allow their controlled combat units to move and attack.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: From the Cellar: Pack 6
description:
Ten Scenarios for ASL that are quite short. All Scenarios are presented in full color (even the map depiction).

The Scenarios included are:
Close Encounter of the Bad Kind [FT160]
French Civil War in Gabon [FT161]
Assault on District Rovno [FT162]
Price of Persia [FT163]
Guts are Not Enough [FT164]
Shopino Struggle [FT165]
Heroes at Leros [FT166]
Wasp Sting [FT167]
By Dawn's Early Light [FT168]
Daring Parafroggers [FT169]
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Star Fleet Battles: Stellar Shadow Journal #1
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Exciting new magazine of everything that never happened in SFB but was fun so we printed it anyway. 64 pages. Heavy PFs. Fed CVA. Kzinti Long Mean Carrier. Maesron Battleship. Klingon D17. Lyran QuadCat. Andorian Early DN. Olivette Roche unveils a ship that can copy your weapons. Mad Scientist's workshop produces warp gyroscope, black hole asteroid gun, and more. WWII bombers attack your battle station with photons. Kommander Katak gains promotion through assassination. New race: the Peladine.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Malifaux: Toshiro – The Daimyo
description: Toshiro is an Ancestor of the Katanaka Clan, an old Daimyo of times past. As his title would make one think, he is a general that supports minions to tremendous levels while also being a pretty competent fighter on his own. With his personal upgrade he can also bring some summoning into any crew, allowing him to summon Ashigaru and Komainu who also happen to work great with him. Also, his Feudal Ties ability lets him hire Punk Zombies in any crew he is in, giving more access to Ten Thunder crews to Undead models.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Anarchs
description: Anarchs was the fifth card set for Vampire: The Eternal Struggle to be published by White Wolf, and the first expansion to be published after the new Camarilla Edition core set. The set spotlights the Anarchs.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

description:
Card Name: Excess Mass
Type: Setback

Place a Super Creep on the Evacuation Pod. Until it is killed Colonists cannot cannot be loaded onto the Evacuation Pod and it cannot be launched. No Colonists in the Pod are converted by this Super Creep.

description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination

description:
Michonne, Vengeful Hunter Booster

Plastic Michonne and Tom Miniatures
Plastic Walker Miniature
Michonne, Vengeful Hunter and Tom Character Cards
Bandoleer, IMI Uzi, Riot Shield, and Tire Iron Equipment Cards
Mantic Points

—description from the publisher

description:
CHAOS PACK 1

EXPANDS: CAVE EVIL & WARCULTS

18 new cards to add to Conjuration and other Decks

1 Mini Map. 11" x 17" map that can be played on its own, added on top of other maps, or can extend maps.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Mature / Adult, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Pfalz D.III
description:
The Pfalz D.III began front–line service in August, 1917. Though its construction techniques gave it a light air frame, the Pfalz was known for being both sturdy and a little slow on the controls. Poor in climbing, it was an excellent diving airplane and popular to use for balloon attacks. The D.IIIa version solved many of the problems, with guns repositioned to assist pilot in clearing weapons of jams, and made up the majority of the 1100 airplanes built by war’s end, with most of them flown by Bavarian Jastas.

Pfalz D.IIIa (Berthold)
Rudolf Berthold (44 victories) flew missions from the very beginning of the war until nearly the end, even after having suffered serious injuries in addition to having lost the use of his right arm.

Pfalz D.IIIa (Holtzem)
Max Holtzem was a German test pilot, flight instructor and member of a Bavarian pursuit squadron. He received the Iron Cross 2nd Class and the Bavarian Military Merit Order with Swords.

Pfalz D.III (Voss)
Werner Voss was a very remarkable pilot that deserved many awards for his numerous enemies shot down in combat (48 victories), and a good friend of Manfred Von Richtofen.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Soulaween: The Little Girl
description:
2020 promo

Do you still remember the cute little girl from the short animation “Deathigner”? To answer the wish of many of her fans, the Little Girl finally dresses up herself and has her very first debut in Soulaween! Her coming would no doubt enlighten the festival of the Death School even more. Don’t just standing and staring, come in and enjoy Soulaween with the Little Girl!

This is an expansion pack of Soulaween and cannot be played without the game.

－－－－－－

還記得《死神訓練班》中那位害羞又可愛的小女孩嗎？為了回應廣大粉絲們的千呼萬喚、經過眾死神們的精心打扮，小女孩終於可以美美的登場亮相囉！她的到來，勢必能讓死神學校的祭典《蒐靈祭》更加熱鬧有趣！別在門外觀望，快進來與我們同樂吧！

本產品為《蒐靈祭》的擴充包，需與《蒐靈祭》合併遊玩。
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Religious
mechanics: Variable Player Powers
publishers: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)

name: Corridors of Power
description:
Corridors of Power is a game of rich social strategy in a world of dirty, take-no-prisoners politics. Players are invited to debate ridiculous policies, serve unscrupulous interest groups and wheel-and-deal to win power!

Players try to convince each other to support policies and contribute influence in a 'vote'. But be careful, players don't have to do what they say, and can even smear a policy to ensure it doesn't pass!

While players may need to lie from time to time, they can build and rebuild trust dozens of times over the course of a game. This creates a wonderful cadence of shifting alliances and social dynamics that will keep you coming back time and time again.

There are also interesting strategic dimensions to the game-play. Players receive secret mission cards in the form of 'Special Interest' groups. They need to shape the policy agenda to ensure that the right policies come up at the right time, all the while trying not to reveal their allegiances!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Negotiation, Voting

name: More Mountainous Mayhem: Crags Adventures and Classes for Four Against Darkness
description:
More Mountainous Mayhem: Crag adventures and classes for Four Against Darkness, for characters level 4+

Here Be Mountain Adventures!
Had enough of dank dungeons?
Or are you looking to generate the world outside of them?
Explore the mountain wilderness with this new supplement for Four Against Darkness.

Featuring new rules, floor tiles and lots of options:
• Rules for aging, firearms, mining, climbing and swimming
• Crags tables for treasure, events, locations and magic items
• New mounts, quests, milestones, reactions, retainers, expert skills
• New character classes: bear folk, chronomancer, dark elf, fish people, night elf, half-orc, moose folk, owl folk and tree folk
• Over 50 new monsters native to the mountains! Cloak monsters, wyverns, specters, weremoles, perytons, stalactite monsters, fire-throwing zeppelins, wildcats, storm giants, fire elf gypsies, cave trolls, hostile dwarves, horrid hares, dark elf dominatrixes and the undead dwarf-thralls of the Lich King!
• Six new Temporal spells
• Rules for clerics of three new deities
• Nine special narrative missions and much more!
Requires only the core Four Against Darkness book.
Fully compatible with the woodlands exploration rules from the Crucible of Classic Critters, for expanded wilderness exploration!

Contains adult humor and mature content.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Nevermind The Distraction
description:
The Mind is a Terrible Thing to Chase…

We spend so much time inside our heads, we often fail to see the world around us clearly. Only by slowing down, noticing our minds have distracted us and letting go can we truly experience life in its purest form.

Nevermind The Distraction is a short, fast-paced, yet surprisingly relaxing abstract solitaire card game inspired by the principles of mindfulness and beginning meditation. Take on the role of The Watcher and engage your own mind in a contest of wills to determine the ultimate fate of your wandering thoughts. Breathe, and try not to get too distracted!

Setup begins by preparing the meditating consciousness using small decks called Distraction Packs. These themed packs contain beautiful and evocative imagery depicting various occurring thoughts. Three packs are combined each game based on your mood, thoughts, or plans for the day, creating a unique visual tableau every session.

Each round starts with the Mind revealing a new thought - or intensifying an existing one - ultimately trying to turn them into Distractions. Distractions cause time to pass more quickly, and when the Timer deck is empty, the mediation is over! The Mind’s ultimate goal is to waste time keeping us distracted as long as possible.

During the Watcher phase, players choose one of these thoughts and take an action to calm or quiet it, pulling it one step back from becoming a Distraction. Do this enough times and a thought is eventually Let Go, releasing it completely and blocking the Mind’s ability to manipulate it. The player’s goal is to Let Go of as many thoughts as possible before the Timer deck runs out.

What follows is an engaging, fast-paced yet relaxing 8-way Tug of War that, when combined with the beautiful minimalist aesthetic, create the perfect conditions for the player to enter a flow state, not unlike that of meditation.

Regular practice will eventually result in a perfect score. These “Zen Master” wins unlock additional levels of game play and introduce new challenges, mechanics and strategies letting the game grow with you.

The short play time, small box and limited table space needed make this an excellent addition to any daily self-care routine regardless of whether or not you practice meditation!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tug of War, Variable Set-up

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Mother of Dragons
description:
The Targaryen faction is almost defined by their unique relationship with dragons as both living war machines and companions. This miniatures set brings the Mother of Dragons, Daenerys Targaryen, to the battlefield accompanied by her young dragons. The dragon units will feature the unique ability to fly over other units as well as breathe fire onto their enemies.

The game box includes a Daenerys Targaryen miniature, 3 juvenile dragon miniatures, and character and tactics cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement

name: Prokhorovka!
description: Simulate the legendary tank battle of Prokhorovka for the first time in a 1 to 1 fashion (every single tank, every single squad ...) on the real terrain, obtained from the original Lutwaffe air recon images! This Advancing Fire game is also playable with the simple Starter Kit rules! The game has been revised by historian Cristopher A. Lawrence, author of Kursk: The Battle of Prokhorovka.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Chute: Sportivo La Polpetta
description:
Directly from the province of Bigoli, the “Chutemundo” welcomes the darkest and most rude characters seen so far in the league. From practices that border on the illegal, they bring with them a defensive, treacherous and threatening strategy. While their link to the mob is unconfirmed, they don't go out of their way to prove their innocence.

Sportivo La Polpetta presents you with a series of new special actions and items that you can use to gain advantages over the rival team. With an emphasis on defense, you can tailor your strategy to contain your opponent's attack and score at the right time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Directamente desde la provincia de Bigoli, se unen al Chutemundo los personajes mas sombríos y rudos vistos hasta el momento en la liga. De prácticas que bordean lo ilegal traen consigo una estrategia defensiva, traicionera y amenazante. Si bien su vínculo a la mafia no está confirmado, no se esfuerzan por demostrar su inocencia.

Sportivo La Polpetta te presenta una seria de nuevas acciones especiales y objetos que puedes utilizar para ganar ventajas sobre el equipo rival. Con un énfasis en el aspecto defensivo, puedes adaptar tu estrategia para contener el ataque del adversario y atacar en el momento preciso. A continuación te damos a conocer el funcionamiento dealgunas de las nuevas cartas.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Gates of Valhalla – Draugar Undead Vikings Enemy Pack
description:
The Draugar are Undead creatures spoken of in Norse lore - Undead Vikings, risen back to hateful life to feed on darkness and destroy the living! We made sure that they are recognizable as Vikings based on clothing, armor, hair, and weapons. The details in the battle-damaged weapons and armor really looks like they lived and died (and lived again!) in battle! These turned out great and we cannot wait to paint them!

Includes 6 Draugar Miniatures, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Game Set Match
description:
Each player represents a tennis player at the height of their career and will have to defeat their opponents using well-researched plays and keen intuition. In this intense game of attack and counterattack, to execute the perfect shot, players must be able to respond to the opponent's.

Game Set Match is the result of CODEC, a Portuguese card game contest organized by the publisher Art and Games, board game café "A jogar é que a gente se entende" and the project "Board Game Friendly".

Players receives 7 stroke cards
The court card and the cards that define the “Game Flow” are placed in the center of the table.

The serving player receives the service card he places on the table, visible to everyone, and receives an extra card for his hand. It then chooses a beat from among the cards in his hand and places it on the table (player play line), advancing one position in Game Flow.

To respond, the opponent will have to place on the table a card or set of cards with reactions that correspond to the opponent's hit. Each of the three symbols to the left of a card are reactions: the ball's effect, the type of hit, and the field zone. After choosing the reaction cards, the player must move the Game Flow according to the number of reactions that matched the opponent's hit.
The last card placed on the play line (rightmost card) is considered his hit to be reacted by the opponent.

Players continue to alternately Match the opponent's hits until one of the players manages to reveal the number 4 in Game Flow, thus ending the Point.

The first player to reach the 4th point (15-30-40-game) wins the game, the set and the match.

Cada jogador representa um tenista no auge da sua carreira e terá que derrotar os seus oponentes com recurso a jogadas bem estudadas e uma intuição apurada. Neste jogo intenso de ataque e contra-ataque, para executar a pancada perfeita os jogadores têm de conseguir responder à do adversário.

Game Set Match é o resultado do CODEC, concurso de jogo de cartas Português organizado pela editora Art and Games, board game café "A jogar é que a gente se entende" e o projecto "Board Game Friendly".

Os jogadores recebem 7 cartas de batidas
A carta court e a as cartas que definem o Game Flow são colocadas no centro da mesa.

Cada Ponto começa com um Serviço:
Serviço
O jogador que serve recebe a carta serviço que coloca na mesa, visível para todos, e recebe uma carta extra para a sua mão. Em seguida, escolhe uma batida de entre as cartas da sua mão e coloca na mesa (a sua linha de jogo), avançando uma posição no Game Flow.

Para responder, o adversário terá que colocar na mesa uma carta ou conjunto de cartas com reações que correspondem à batida do adversário. Cada um dos três símbolos à esquerda de uma carta são as reações: o efeito da bola, o tipo de pancada e a zona do campo. Após escolha das cartas de reação, o jogador deve mover o Game Flow de acordo com o número de reações que fizeram match com a batida do adversário.
A última carta colocada na Linha de Jogo (carta mais à direita) é considerada a sua batida para ser respondida pelo adversário.

Os jogadores continuam a fazer Match alternadamente às batidas do adversário até que um dos jogadores consiga revelar o número 4 no Game Flow, assim terminando o Ponto.

O primeiro jogador a atingir o 4º ponto, vence o jogo, o set e o match.
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Earthenwar
description:
Earthenwar is a two-player combat strategy game.

You have been recruited to control a huge Golem on a battlefield of the Great War. Using your magic Control Grid, you will remotely determine the actions of your Golem from far behind the Front Lines, attempting to destroy the enemy before they can destroy you.

You change and affect your Golem's movement and attack skills by simply placing, upgrading and using dice on your 8-directional Control Grid.

The game ends when you damage 3 squares in any direction on your opponent's Control Grid.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Puzzle, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Programmed Movement, Take That

name: That Time You Killed Me: Consumption promo pack
description:
A promo envelope full of secrets for That Time You Killed Me.
Directions on when to open the envelope and what to do with the contents will be revealed to players when they reach the Coda of the campaign.

The envelope contains 5 cards - 1 flavor text card (P.1) and 4 Temporal Powers (P.2, P.3, P.4 and P.5)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kalandozoo Marci az állatkertben
description:
In this game you visit the zoo with the class. The teacher aunt gives the task of looking at what animals during the trip. The player in his turn can spend 3 actions to move on a board, observe animals, or buy. Observed animals (collect token) and expected items can score points at the end of the game. After 16 rounds, the zoo closes and the game is over. Whoever collects the most points wins.

In addition to the basic game, the toy box also contains 5 additional modules - The Lost Baby, Animal Feeding, Aunt Teacher, Shower, Bus
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: 形棋 (Shape Chess)
description:
Shape Chess is a combinatorial game for 2 players, which can be played with a Renju set.

During the game, players’ goal is to build up reflectional symmetric shapes with his/her own stones. To achieve this goal, players can either Drop a own-stone on a empty point, Jump a own-stone to another empty point, or Push an opponent's stone to an adajcent empty point by droping an own-stone. Points are given according to the size of the symmetric shape, and the winner will be the player who reach 4 points first.
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: Zone Wars: Robots & Psionics
description:
In the Robots & Psionics expansion set for Zone Wars two new factions are introduced: the robotic Mechatron Hive and the Nova Cult psionics. With these you can now play three- or four-player games, turning the fun and mayhem up to a new level!

The Robots & Psionics expansion also includes new terrain pieces, additional Zone and artifact cards, and a further ten beautifully sundropped miniatures, ready to be used right away.


Mechatron Hive: A collective of robots having recently awoken to become self-aware, seeking their place in the post-apocalyptic world.
Nova Cult: A secretive cult of human mutants with powerful psionic mutations and unknown ambitions.
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Újrajátszott Trianon
description: Újrajátszott Trianon ("Trianon Replayed") is a fully cooperative game in which players are members of an imaginary government from a hundred years ago - it can also be played alone - and must simultaneously face all the challenges of the post-Great War era: enemy troops are constantly attacking the country, the amount of coal and grain limited and constantly decreasing as we lose more and more regions, and events follow each other according to the real historical situation."
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Events

name: Marvel United: Annihilation
description:
Crossing over from the Negative Zone came the Annihilation Wave, a vast army commanded by Annihilus, bent on conquering the positive matter universe. Trying to hold off the invasion, the Nova Corps was destroyed, with Richard Rider remaining as the only surviving Nova. Rescued by Quasar and aided by Moondragon and Phyla-Vell, these cosmic champions must stand united against the Annihilation Wave!

This expansion brings a deadly cosmic conflict to Marvel United. Annihilus launches his forces against our universe and a powerful band of galactic Heroes must stand against his onslaught. A tough battle can get even harder with the addition of the Complication Challenge introduced by this expansion, as well as the relentless Harvester of Sorrow Location.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Marvel United: World War Hulk
description:
Hulk was banished from Earth to the planet Sakaar, where he became a gladiator. Now he is stronger than ever before and blinded by rage over the death of his family. With the support of his Warbound, Hulk returns to Earth, bent on exacting revenge on those who wronged him, and anybody else who dare stand in his way! New York becomes a gladiatorial arena as the mightiest heroes must test themselves against World Breaker Hulk.

This expansion brings an epic war between the strongest characters in the world. Consumed by anger, Gladiator Hulk is ready to smash anyone who comes his way. When even the Olympian Hercules and Ares falter, Iron Man will don his massive Hulkbuster armor to try to stop Bruce Banner. The Sentry may be our last hope, as long as he can resist being consumed by The Void.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Connnect
description:
Connnect is an abstract roll-and-write game. The players try to write numbers in the right zones, and claim as many Connnects as they can to get points. Whoever do their best and get the most point win the game.

The game is played over twelve rounds. Each round has three phases: Roll Phase, Fill Phase and Claim Connect Phase.

Roll phase : Active Player rolls all three dice and choose one of those dice to be the Zone Die, another two dice will be called the Number Dice.

Fill Phase : Each player MUST simultaneously write two numbers depicted on the Number Dice in the indicated zone from the Zone Die.

Claim Connnect Phase : Players simultaneously claim “Connect 3”, “Connect 4” or “Connect 5”; draw the outline of the connected shape by using the numbers in play area in ascending order, descending order, or all same numbers.

Claiming Connnects give players bonuses and points. These bonuses help player to claim the next Connnects easier or even create combos to claim multiple Connnects at a time. The more claiming Connnect, the more points and bonuses.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Busca Bichos
description:
Let's save the bugs!

My goodness, how many bugs and fruits there are in the garden! With so much mess, someone can step on a bug and not even realize it. That can't happen!

At Busca Bichos our goal will be to keep all the bugs in the garden safe. In addition, we will have to feed them (so that they are strong and healthy!) but not all bugs eat the same... Give each bug the corresponding fruit according to its color.

Do you think you will be able to save all the bugs? Come on, the garden is not going to take care of itself!

---

¡Salvemos a los bichos!

Madre mía, ¡cuántos bichos y frutas hay en el jardín! Con tanto desorden, alguien puede pisar un bicho y no darse ni cuenta. ¡Eso no puede pasar!

En Busca Bichos nuestro objetivo será poner a salvo todos los bichos del jardín. Además, tendremos que darles de comer (¡para que estén fuertes y sanos!) pero no todos los bichos comen lo mismo… Dale a cada bicho la fruta que le corresponde según su color.

¿Crees que serás capaz de salvar a todos los bichos? Vamos, ¡que el jardín no se va a ordenar solo!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Lord of the Rings: Duel for Middle-earth
description:
A dark rumour rises from Mordor. The Eye turns to Middle-earth. The hour has come. The Fellowship is reunited. The Heroes prepare for battle. In Duel for Middle-earth, you’ll have to choose sides. Play as the Fellowship of the Ring, prevent the Enemy from gaining ground and destroy the One Ring. Or play as Sauron and send your Nazgûls after Sam and Frodo, spreading your hordes over enemy cities. The fate of Middle-earth is in your hands!

—description from the publisher

The Lord of the Rings: Duel for Middle-Earth is a spin off of 7 Wonders - Duel, one player playing the evil forces of Sauron and another the free people of middle earth
mechanics: Unspecified

name: BattleTech: ComStar Battle Level II
description: The ComStar Battle Level II is a collection of six plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides four dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and four new Clan Pilot Cards. The six 'Mechs available in the lance pack are the Crab, Crockett, Flashman, Guillotine, Lancelot and Mongoose.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 異世界ラブレター Love Letter
description:
The legendary board game that has sold over 3 million units worldwide has been reborn in another world. Featuring 16 unique characters and new rules with increased strategy!

Key differences from normal Love Letter:


One copy each of cards 1-16 (including new effects upon being played)
Players start with a "Love Letter" which can be used to protect against being knocked out once per game. Can be considered a "one time shield". Some card effects directly target it.
With only one copy of each card guessing is more difficult, but there is the potential to earn an extra victory point as a reward for guessing correctly.
When the world is "lit up" highest numbers are best as per normal. When the world is "dark" lower numbers win any comparisons.
mechanics: Score-and-Reset Game, Take That

name: Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum – The Cursed Fjord
description:
This expansion includes new Heroes, new Creatures and Minions, and a previously unseen Witch, Skriga, and her Werewolf familiar Accalia. Comes complete with 4 new double sided map tiles that add water barriers to the game as well as 5 new Encounters for this new land.

Skriga paddled her boat idly. Life at sea suited her fine. Sure, there were no stupid minions to kick, but no Demons to kick her either. And plenty of fish!
