In addition to the rules, Strength & Honour includes twenty army lists covering the Ancient world from the island of Britannia in the west to the mystic East beyond the Mediterranean; Germania’s forests in the north and the deserts and mountains of north Africa in the south.

Battles focus on large units so for example a legion is the basic unit building block of a Roman army.

While the rules were designed for 2mm figures they are playable with any sized figures, or indeed printable top down units which are also available.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Measurement Movement, Movement Points, Variable Phase Order, Zone of Control

name: Au Contact
description:
Au Contact is a miniature ruleset for modern day combat, using 15mm or 28mm miniatures primarily. It depicts the harsh realties of modern warfare at the skirmish level.

The rules are of medium-complexity, and can be adapted to solitaire play. There are two phases in one turn, an action phase (where platoons, squad and fireteams will shoot, move, use or repair equipments, etc), and management phase (where the players will heal their wounded, check morale, etc).

Troops are divided in different based on their preparation, and their willingness to fight. In today's war, stress level is an important component, which the game takes into account successfully. Night combat, fog of war, and civilian presence can also be added for more realism!

With 14 scenarios and 11 army lists (7 modern : American, British, French, Russian, different types of insurgents, and 4 Vietnam war lists), players have a wide variety of themes they can play with.
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Great War: Short Bomber
description:
The Great War: Short Bomber is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire print and play wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the British RNAS nighttime bombing campaign against Germany during 1916-1917.

As the pilot of a Short bomber serving with the No.7 Squadron of the Royal Navy Air Service, your ultimate goal is to survive a 30-mission tour of duty during 1916-1917. Based in Petite-Synthe (Dunkirk), France, you and your observer will be assigned with taking part in nightly solo bombing and strafing raids against various German targets in occupied Belgium. But it won’t certainly be a cake walk, as your bomber will frequently encounter deadly FLAK, not to mention nighttime navigation challenges, petrol management, mechanical failures, and even wing icing. And of course, you and your crewmen are not allowed to wear parachutes, so forget about bailing out when things go wrong!

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with detailed damage modeling, fuel management, numerous crewmen skills, mission weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, The Great War: Short Bomber offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you up to the challenge of surviving a 30-mission tour of duty?

The player will move his bomber through various travel boxes on a map during each mission on his way to the target zone, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mat, strategic map mat, tables book, crewmen status sheet, campaign log sheet, and counter sheet representing individual bombers, enemy units, etc.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Solo / Solitaire Game

name: HEXplore It: The Forests of Adrimon – Fall of the Ancients
description:
This choose-your-own-path, board game/novel hybrid, offers a wondrous new way to experience the world of the Greenflame Forest amidst the return of the goddess Adrimon. Play through the Forests of Adrimon (Volume II) in an entirely new way and drive the unfolding of a complex and epic story with the heroes you choose at the story's core. Your heroes will be pulled into the narrative and their decisions will guide how the story unfolds.

You will only experience a fraction of the content during each play-through, which means your games can unfold differently each time you play. Gain epic gear, unique campaign-only equipment and statuses, and power level your heroes throughout the entire length of the story. You will find that the allies you make, and the statuses and campaign items you gain may affect the story in completely different and unforeseeable ways in the future.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Novel-based, Puzzle, Travel
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Storytelling

name: A Brilliant Little Affair: The Battle of Chrysler's Farm, November 11, 1813
description:
“Come on lads! Let us see how you will deal with these militiamen!” –US Brigadier General Leonard Covington’s last words to his men during the attack at Chrysler’s Farm.

A Brilliant Affair is an easy to learn/teach game on the battle of Chrysler's Farm. Outnumbered nearly by nearly two to one, the British, Canadian and First Nations force inflicted a stunning defeat upon the invading US force led by General James Wilkenson, one of the most inept and corrupt military leaders in US history.

Players use cards to activate their units/formations and six sided die to play the very interactive and competitive game. A Brilliant Little Affair is the debut title in a series of games on battles fought over control of Canada during the War if 1812.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Novice Novice TRPG Magic
description:
The newest editions of the Novice Novice ("Nobi Nobi") TRPG series are Sword and Magic. The Magic set focuses on characters that fight with magic, such as Wizard, Priest, Hermit and Necromancer, but a with a few more unique additions like Clown and Demon King.

Novice Novice TRPG Magic may be played by itself, or integrated with Sword for a more exciting Sword and Sorcery themed Fantasy RPG. It's also possible to integrate with other games in the Nobi Nobi series.

Compared to the previous iteration of the game, Steampunk, there are no new mechanics, but the box has been made smaller for more ease of portability.
mechanics: Role Playing

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Immortal Hulk
description:
Players can take destruction to the next level with Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Immortal Hulk. This alternate version of a fan-favorite character harkens to his incarnation in the smash-hit Immortal Hulk comic book run. With an all-new miniature, new Team Tactic Cards, and new Stat Card abilities, the Immortal Hulk has eternal staying power on the tabletop.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Vs. System 2PCG: House of X
description:
Introducing our newest 200-card Giant-Sized Starter! House of X is the first issue of the three-part Heroes of Krakoa Story Arc. Professor Charles Xavier reveals his master plan to build a nation for mutants on the living island of Krakoa, beyond the reach of any human leaders who would dare threaten mutantkind!

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kiwi Chow Down: Gooey Dessert Expansion and 5th Player Extension
description:
Gooey expansion and 5th player extension are add-ons that were unlocked during the Kiwi Chow Down Kickstarter campaign.

The contents of the add-ons are:
1 paper rules sheet
1 plastic miniature
1 cardstock player board
5 plastic snap bases
20 wooden kiwi tokens
36 cards: 2 leader cards, 9 action cards, 14 power cards, 10 goal cards
1 reference card
1 cardboard punchboard with: 1 island section, 6 victory points, 6 nest tokens, 1 turn order nest
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Income, Map Reduction

name: CoraQuest: Carson Promo
description:
A new hero for CoraQuest drawn by artist John Kovalic.

Special ability - Draw three treasure cards when searching a chest. choose one and discard the other two.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Square Grid

name: Heroes of Normandie: War Stories #04 – The Black Baron
description:
“Medals do not make soldiers“. At only 23 years of age, Kurt Knispel, a Sudeten German, became the most successful tanker of the whole Second World War. He was working in the automobile industry before being drafted and taught to handle a Tiger I. He was assigned to the then 13. Panzer-Division and sent to Russia. Later he commanded a Königstiger in the now 12. Panzer-Division in Normandy.

In October 1944, he left for Hungary to take part in Operation Debrecen. On April 28, 1945, one day after his promotion to Feldwebel, Knispel was seriously wounded in the head. He died two hours later in a military hospital near Vrbovec.

Kurt managed to destroy 168 tanks! Nicknamed “The Black Baron“, he truly became the ace of aces of the Wehrmacht tankers. But then, why didn’t he have the recognition of a Wittman, or an Otto Carius? Because Kurt didn’t give a damn about Nazism, nor its honors or medals. That, combined with his unkempt appearance and modified uniform brought about the tale that he never received the Eisernes Kreuz and was thus dubbed “knight without a cross“.

This is pure myth, as he received the Eiserne Kreuz I. Klasse in 1943 and the Deutsche Kreuz in Gold in May 1944.

This War Story requires the Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Core Box and Battle Pack #02 – Battle for Caen: Epsom, Charnwood, Goodwood.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Second Great War at Sea: Sword of the Sea
description:
The Second Great War at Sea alternative-history story arc looks at naval campaigns in a world where the First Great War ended in late 1916, allowing the great empires to survive for another generation and clash again in 1940.
Sword of the Sea brings the naval action to the Red Sea, Gulf and Aden and Persian Gulf as the Ottoman Turkish fleet and its German allies face the Imperial Persian Fleet with Indian (!) and Italian support.

You get 180 new silky smooth, die-cut playing pieces: 100 of them double-sized “long” pieces depicting major warships and the remaining 80 normal-sized square ones representing small warships, transports, aircraft and some markers needed for play. Ships and aircraft bring the Ottoman Turkish and Imperial Persian navies that never existed to your game table.

Sword of the Sea includes 33 new scenarios telling the story of this alternative Second Great War in Middle Eastern waters. Sword of the Sea is not a complete game and is not playable by itself; you’ll need Horn of Africa (and only Horn of Africa).

The Second Great War at Sea is an exercise in world-building never seen in wargame publishing; our Second Great War background book tells the full story of this history that never happened.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Effortless: Prepping for Adventure
description:
From an early age, you gazed in awe as intrepid warriors journeyed through your quaint, slumbering hamlet. Against your parents' instruction, you stealthily observed them, acquiring a few clandestine skills during their fleeting visits. Now, the moment has arrived to transcend your abilities and forge the path of a legendary adventurer, leaving your mark on places far and wide throughout the realm.

Effortless is a lightweight worker placement game with elements of set-collection and a dash of take-that for 1-5 players. On your turn, you will place an effort at one of the 6 locations randomly selected during set up and add a card to your growing hand. Once all players have exhausted their effort, they will gain Greatness, based on the cards in their hand and where they have applied their efforts.

Due to a randomized setup, no two games will be the same! From a Hidden Coliseum to an Eerie Market, where will your next adventure take you?

Can you make becoming the greatest feel Effortless?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: Smart 10 Family: Neue Fragen 2.0
description:
Smart 10 Family: Neue Fragen 2.0 contains 200 new questions with 2,000 new answers, with the questions covering a wide variety of subject areas appropriate for the whole family: Is the black Mamba poisonous? Do young people like to wear "long kicks"? Is "foyer" a type of cheese? And what color are Asterix's pants?

This expansion can be used with any of the base games in the Smart 10 series.
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Cyber Shield
description:
The goal of the two-player game (1 against 1) is to safely increase the size of one's networks.
The more robustly a player's networks are designed, the more points their networks are worth. Numerous and insidious cyber threats can be used to weaken the opponent's networks and reduce the point value. The first player to reach a score of 10 or more points at any time wins the game immediately. A player who cannot draw a card or whose score at any time has a total value of -10 or less loses the game immediately.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Simulation

name: Battle of Gods: Odin Expansion
description:
In Battle of Gods, the fate of the world hangs in the balance as champions of Norse mythology clash in a fast-paced arena battle game for 2-4 players. Whether you prefer all-against-all or team-based showdowns, the choice is yours.

Take command of legendary figure Odin, God of War, and battle your way to claim the title as the most glorious champion or the last one standing.

This is a character expansion for Battle of Gods.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SAW: The Jigsaw Trials
description:
Do you want to play a game?

Collect tools and try to keep hold of your limbs in this trap-building fight for survival. Jigsaw’s time is coming to an end. In his search for a successor, he has captured you in his workshop with everything you need to create his traps, and everything you need to break them!

The game is simple: build the best traps to challenge your opponents, while preparing to escape those set against you. The last player left alive will be worthy of taking the Jigsaw name.

Let the game begin!

Each turn starts by drawing new cards from the deck. These include tools, search items, trap parts, and more. You must combine your trap parts to create traps for your opponents. Each trap has a unique story and challenge, and there are over 2000 possible combinations in the game.

When you have a complete trap, and a Billy card, you can say the iconic phrase "I want to play a game" and then challenge your opponent to try to escape your creation!

Your opponent has a choice: they can either take the sacrifice - a set amount of damage - or they can try to escape the trap using tool cards and search items. If they're prepared, they could get away without harm! However, if they get it wrong, things could get much worse...

SAW: The Jigsaw Trials has a unique jigsaw damage system. Each player has a character jigsaw, and they must swap their legs and arms for broken x-ray limbs as they take damage. Take too much, and they could lose the limb completely. When that happens, the player will lose blood each turn, and when all their blood is gone they are out!

The last player left standing is worthy of taking the name JIGSAW!

-description from designer
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Stargrave: Bold Endeavour
description:
A Stargrave supplement of exploration and adventure, full of strange and wonderful alien worlds, species, and technologies.

Just beyond the rim of what was once ‘civilized space’ lies the vast, colourful expanse of the Crokoan Nebula. Seeking their fortunes, bold independent crews press deep into this largely unexplored sector. But the Ravaged Galaxy is a dangerous place, and the threats that crews face are not limited to those found on a planet’s surface. In fact, more independent crews meet their ends in the dark void of space than are wiped out in gunfights. Black holes, asteroid fields, and even the legendary space kraken can all destroy a ship and its crew. It takes a deft hand on the controls, a sharp eye on navigation, and a bit of wizardry with the engines to fly between the stars.

This supplement for­ Stargrave focuses on the ships that serve as the crews’ transports, strategic headquarters, and homes, including new upgrades, a damage system, and rules for crew assignments such as piloting, gunnery, and navigation. New powers, soldiers, technology, and backgrounds for captains and first mates help reinforce crews, while rules for space encounters – dangerous, interesting, and potentially profitable incidents – and five new scenarios bring them face to face with strange alien species and other terrifying dangers in weird and wonderful locations, from unexplored planets to the depths of space.­
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mythical Menagerie
description:
Match cards by colour and creature to score points. Each of the 5 creatures has a special power to give you more control over your hand and card sets.

Strategic Choices:


Curate your hand by drawing from either the deck or discard piles.
Be careful which cards you discard, because other players may pick them up.
Select which creatures to play based on their powers and the sets you are trying to build.




How to PlayYour primary objective is to score points by building sets of creatures. A set is 3, 4, or 5 cards of matching colour or creature type. Each card may contribute to both a colour set and a creature set (e.g. Red Rabbit scores for both the Red and the Rabbit sets).



Your TurnYou have a hand of cards. Play cards to the table to form sets. These sets score at the end of the game.

On your turn:


Draw 2 cards from any piles (deck and/or discards).
Play 1 card to your sets.
Discard 1 card to your personal discard pile.


When you play a card to a set, you may optionally use the creature's power.



Creature Powers
Rabbit: draw another card.
Dragon: score +1 for a set of Dragons.
Qilin: play another card. You need to discard a card to use this power.
Fox: snag a matching colour card from another player.
Tortoise: protect yourself from foxes.


The Tortoise has an additional special power: you may play it out of turn if you have it in your hand when someone plays a matching Fox!



End Game & ScoringThe first time the deck runs out, shuffle all discards into a new deck, and then play until the deck runs out again. (The game includes a Phase Card which helps keep track of the deck running out the first time). You then finish the round and everyone counts up their scores:


3-card set: 1 point
4-card set: 2 points
5-card set: 3 points
+1 point if you have a set of Dragons
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Hitmen Hotel
description:
Hitmen Hotel is a competitive logical deduction game for 2 to 4 players. Players are Spymasters, leading a team of secret agents to assassinate their target, which is the player on their left. Each player has a location within the hotel that is secret to other players. On your turn, play a card and ask one of the two questions about your target's location, receiving a Yes or No reply. However, other players may glean information from the colour and number of the card you played, so be careful in choosing your cards. The first player who successfully deduces their target's location and carries out the assassination action wins the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Math, Number, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Race

name: Hidden Games Tatort: Tödliche Überfahrt
description:
Investigate a real criminal case together.
A crime adventure awaits you that blurs reality and fiction...
A corpse, a burnt painting and numerous intrigues await you.
What happened on the private yacht during the crossing to London?
Inspector Hahnke needs your help! Can you solve the events?

—description from the publisher (translated)

Ermittelt gemeinsam in einem echten Kriminalfall.
Euch erwartet ein Krimiabenteuer, das Realität und Fiktion verschwimmen lässt...
Eine Leiche, ein verbranntes Gemälde und zahlreiche Intrigen erwarten euch.
Was geschah auf der Privatjacht während der Überfahrt nach London?
Kommissar Hahnke benötigt eure Hilfe! Könnt ihr die Ereignisse aufklären?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Coffee Rush: Piece of Cake
description:
Welcome back! Your cafe is expanding, and drinks are no longer enough. Thankfully, you can now serve cakes to keep your customers happy. Hire staff, and use their skills to survive the rush!

The Coffee Rush: Piece of Cake expansion has players fulfill new orders with the help of cake cards. It adds new player boards, new order cards, beautiful 3D cakes, and new upgrades.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Grid Movement

name: Crimson Skies: Behind the Crimson Veil
description: A supplement to FASA's 1998 Crimson Skies, Behind the Crimson Veil adds information about the 4 successful pirate gangs - including the Black Swans - with various scenarios. It also new airplanes, like the fiery GM-1 Tempest. The supplement include the "school of engineering"; manufacturers share their construction secrets, and details on new components with special characteristics and limits. More detailed information is provided on boarding parties with zepplins, in this supplement.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Core Space: Wanted – Dead or Alive
description:
Lurking in the grey area between good and evil are the Bounty Hunters, powerful new NPCs tasked with hunting people, for a price! If your name is on their list you’d better beware, or at least have the cash to pay them off! This expansion adds these new characters to the game along with a range of auxiliary companions. They’re not just NPCs either – they are all fully playable as a part of your crew!

The new narrative campaign will see you trying to stay alive while there’s a bounty on your head, and new Event Cards, character boards and equipment will integrate these characters into the game.

Requires the Core Space Starter Set to play.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Robo Rally: Wet & Wild
description:
The Wet & Wild expansion drenches your Robo Rally games with three new double-sided game boards featuring new elements like water spaces, ledges and ramps, and crushers! Also includes 5 brand new Upgrade cards! Contains 3 updated game boards from the out of print Armed & Dangerous (1995) expansion, and 3 brand new game boards!



Features:
Water: Slows down robot movement
Ledges and Ramps: Different levels to race on
Crushers: Dangerous to robots, only in certain registers
5 new upgrade cards




Contains:
3 Double-Sided Factory Game Boards
5 Upgrade Cards


-description from publisher's website



Boards
Transition / Coliseum*
Trench Run / Flood Zone*
Water Park / Circuit Trap*


* Originally in RoboRally: Armed and Dangerous



Upgrade Cards
Turbo
Edge Guard
Diffuser
Calculated Odds
Bunny Hop
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Happy Nation
description:
Happy Nation is a game where players try to become the happiest player by deciding each turn on how to spend their time and money. In this game, happiness is the collection of all your joyful experiences.

Each of the 5 characters produces unique items, which the other players can buy to achieve their goals. In addition to time and money management for actions, the setting of prices and convincing other players to buy your items or to work more is an important element.

Players identify quickly with the real-life theme and one of the 5 characters: Builder, Farmer, Entertainer, Banker or Doctor.

The game brings all elements for a 1-2 hour playing experience, with the right mix of strategy, luck and interaction.

As a bonus you might learn how bank loans function in our societies.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Market, Ownership

name: Dust Tactics: SSU Close Combat Squad – "Fakyeli"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The SSU Close Combat Squad provides versatile new soldiers for your Dust Tactics army. After fighting in many intense close-quarter situations, the soldiers of the SSU have become experts at this type of combat.

Well-known for their ability to craft makeshift weapons like Molotov Cocktails, the SSU Close Combat Squads form a large part of the SSU forces. These grizzled squads carry Shotguns and a Flamethrower for maximum damage at close range, and to increase their effectiveness, they have learned how to scout out prime locations on the battlefield.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients – Alt Gender Hero Pack
description:
In desperate times, there is a call for Heroes! A new group of Adventurers gear up and head into the mines and beyond, ready to fight back the darkness and save the day!

Every Hero Character Sheet in Shadows of Brimstone has a Male Portrait on one side and a Female Portrait on the other. This set contains the Miniatures for the Alternate Gender version of the Heroes that come as part of the City of the Ancients Core Set. This set also includes all of the Cards, Counters, Character Sheets, and Upgrade Charts needed to use these as additional Heroes in your games of Shadows of Brimstone. Each hero in the alt gender set has their own rule sheet which includes any rules that are specific to that character.

Contents:
Rulesheet
1 Female Gunslinger
1 Female U.S. Marshal
1 Female Bandida
1 Piano Player (Male Saloon Girl)
4 30 mm Bases
4 Large Hero Character Sheets (195×130 mm)
21 Game Cards (63.5×89 mm)
4 Hero Upgrade Charts
1 Die-Cut Counter Sheet
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Pure Land: Ōnin War in Muromachi Japan, 1465-1477
description:
The Pure Land: Ōnin War in Muromachi Japan, 1465-1477 is Volume XIV of the COIN Series originally designed by Volko Ruhnke. It depicts a devastating civil war in 15th century Japan that reduced Kyoto to a smoldering ruin and precipitated the century-long warring states period—the Sengoku Jidai. Against the backdrop of this civil war between coalitions led by the Hosokawa and Yamana clan, the game also features peasant revolts led by the Jizamurai and religious unrest involving the Ikkō-ikki, the militant wing of the emerging Jōdo Shinshū (or True Pure Land) Buddhist sect.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Beyond the Horizon
description:
Beyond the Horizon is a massive expansion for Waste Knights: Second Edition, a postapocalyptic game of adventure and survival. Now is the time to leave the continent, embark upon a ship and sail to places you only know from legends and myths.

Explore a new map enabling you to visit Tasmania, Solomon Islands or New Zealand altered by the Apocalypse. Learn the truth behind the infamous Project X, while battling deadly sea monsters and experiencing strange weather phenomena.
Seek for fresh water – a new resource that will make the game even more realistic and challenging both for sea-farers and continent dwellers.

Play as one of new Knights armed with unique abilities and expand your base game using tens of new cards, tokens, and adventures to experience a setting of enormous proportions however you like – solo, cooperatively or competitively.

Choose your ship, set the course and see where the winds shall take you!

-description from publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: Expansion #54 – Blackhawk Down: Operation Gothic Serpent
description:
Black Hawk Down: Operation Gothic Serpent was a military operation in 1993 conducted by the US Special Forces during the Somali Civil War. The Operation objective was to arrest two of the faction leaders’ top advisors. Our brave US soldiers prepared for a quick 90-minute mission to fast-rope in, arrest the two advisors, and quickly get out. The mission was a success, as the two advisors were arrested. However, upon completion of this mission, the first Black Hawk Helicopter was shot out of the skies by an RPG. Shortly after, a 2nd Black Hawk was shot down by another RPG and what was supposed to be a 90-minute mission, turned into a 17-hour struggle.

This expansion shows how the men were not prepared for 17 hours of combat and the difficult situations they encountered in that time. This expansion will do its best to honor those who lost their lives in this Operation by representing them as Soldier cards, and including the Medals they earned.

This expansion offers 112 cards including:


10 Player Soldiers
6 Non-Player Soldiers
4 Squad Soldiers
13 Weapons
6 Eqiupment
4 Missions
5 Objectives
14 Locations
12 Skills
9 Medals
29 Hostiles


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Tacticum Invictus
description:
You are a Centurion candidate. Before you will be entrusted to lead any of Rome's legionnaires you need to be trained in tactics from small units to campaign size formations. Tacticum is designed to present different scenarios for you to work through versus an opponent, who could be another centurion candidate or one of the pesky trainers.

—description from the publisher

Main changes from Tacticum:

additional 17x11 Invictus board for Advanced Training
new formation: The Line
new maneuver options: Rally on me!, Disperse
new units: Cavalry, Skirmishers
19x19x9mm acrylic tiles
4 complete armies
Terrain options: swamp, lakes, coast.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Square One
description:
Square One is a fast-paced, engine-building strategy game for 1-4 players. Just like its predecessor, its easy-to-learn yet hard-to-master mechanics offer high replayability for the whole family. Complete sequences with beautifully designed tactile pieces and unleash satisfying combos in a game that's more than just a sequel — it's a whole new challenge. 

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Open Drafting, Resource Queue, Tile Placement

name: Second World War at Sea: The Habsburg Fleet
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

After just over two years of terrible warfare, the Great War came to an end with the Christmas Armistice of 1916, thanks to the mediation of American President Woodrow Wilson. But after some twenty years of peace, in 1940 the storm clouds gather once more.

The Habsburg Fleet is the second book in our alternative history series, The Second Great War. In the first book, The Kaiser’s Navy, we looked at the High Seas Fleet of 1940 and its campaigns in the North Sea and Atlantic. In this new book, the Imperial and Royal Austro-Hungarian Navy, alongside its Turkish allies, wages war in the Mediterranean Sea.

There are 210 die-cut and mounted playing pieces from the old, out-of-print Imperial & Royal Navy booklet, and 75 brand-new laser-cut pieces (scorchless and sootless!) for 285 total: 135 double-sized "long" ship pieces and 150 standard-sized ones representing task forces, aircraft and smaller warships. The Austro-Hungarian fleet that never was is present, along with French, British, Greek, Italian, German and Turkish ships, aircraft and airships.

There are also thirty new scenarios based on the battles that might have been waged on the Mediterranean Sea in this alternate world, plus more of the story of the Second Great War first begun in The Kaiser's Navy. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Bomb Alley and Black Sea Fleets to enjoy all of the scenarios.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: La Muerte
description:
La Muerte has a job: kill people that has finished their time on Earth.

But not everyone wants to die. Some people try to run. But La Muerte don't give up.

La Muerte starts the game with Wrath value 1. Every card has a "Run" and "Wrath" values. In your turn, you can play until 3 cards and sum the Run value to be equal or greater than La Muerte's Wrath. If you run, La Muerte get's more anger and its Wrath value is increased, according with the played cards. If you can't, you died. As ghost, you only increment La Muerte's Wrath, and helps it to kill!

When only one player is alive, he/she has one turn to stay alive and win! But if La Muerte, with the ghosts' help, kills this last player, nobody wins, except La Muerte!!
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Snowdonia: Puffing Billy
description:
A limited edition train card, released as part of a postcard of which 100 were printed and signed by designer Tony Boydell, with all proceeds going to Asthma UK.

The card depicts Puffing Billy, the world's oldest steam engine, currently on display in the Science Museum in London. When the owner user of the train uses it to get their third worker from the pub, they must nominate another player who can also retrieve their third worker from the pub for free.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Red Poppies Campaigns: Volume 3 – Assault Artillery: La Malmaison
description:
Assault Artillery (AA) recounts the Battle of La Malmaison, 23-27 October 1917, in which the French employed their Artillerie Spéciale (tank force) and creeping barrage to capture Pinon, Vaudesson, and the coveted Chemin des Dames ridge. The French victory confirmed their recovery from the mutinies spawned by the disastrous Nivelle Offensive fought over some of the same ground six months earlier.

In a six-day preliminary bombardment, French guns, with a three to one advantage, silenced most of their German counterparts and smothered German rear areas with dense gas to impeded German reinforcements. At 0515 on October 23, (zero hour) six divisions of the French XI, XIV, and XXI corps attacked on a 7.5-mile wide front. French infantry advanced in the predawn twilight behind an elaborate creeping barrage with 63 Schneider and Saint-Chamond tanks in support. Twenty-seven of the 63 tanks bogged before reaching the front line. A combination of German fire and mud stopped 15 more in no man's land. Twenty-one French tanks (1/3rd of the starting total) actually made it to the German second position. The French 38th Division captured Fort de Malmaison and XXI Corps took Allemant and Vaudesson. From 24 to 25 October, XXI and XIV corps advanced while I Cavalry Corps came forward to exploit a hoped-for German collapse.

With specialized “eingreif” companies sprinkled all along the front, the Germans launched numerous local counterattacks. However, the French wave was inexorable. Still, the German 7thArmy retired from the Chemin-des-Dames to the north bank of the Ailette in good order.

By October 26, the French had gained 3.5 miles in some places at a cost of only 12,000 casualties, far fewer than Germany’s 38,000 and a significant improvement over the 30,000 French losses suffered in the same area during April’s Nivelle Offensive. The French also bagged about 11,500 German prisoners. The Artillerie Spéciale proved its worth by smothering numerous German machine gun posts.

AA is the third volume in the Red Poppies Campaign (RPC) system for gaming World War I battles. Ownership of previous volumes, The Battles for Ypres and/or Last Laurels at Limanowa, is NOT required to play AA; everything you need to play AA is in this box. AA offers the same rules as The Battles for Ypres and Last Laurels at Limanowa except that sections 12 and 13, the scenarios and campaigns for volumes I and II, are intentionally left blank while section 14, the AA scenarios and campaigns, has been added.

Product Information

Complexity: 6 out of 10
Solitaire suitability: 8 out of 10
Time Scale: 10 minutes per turn
Map Scale: 200 yards per hex
Unit Scale: Companies, squadrons, sections

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Doomtown: Hell's Comin' With Me
description:
Gomorra is a boomtown on the edge of California’s Great Maze, that part of the coast that sunk into the water in 1863, creating a labyrinth of rock riddled with the super fuel known as ghost rock. Over the years, the town was destroyed time and again: by outlaws, demons, cultist fanatics, and more. Most recently, it was ravaged by the Fourth Ring Circus and the Sloane Gang.

In the aftermath, the deputies Xiong “Wendy” Cheng and Lucinda “Lucy” Clover left for greener pastures. Unfortunately, the pastures they chose were Tombstone, Arizona. They arrived just in time to see the conflict between the Cowboys and Earps reach its fever pitch.

On top of that, the mysterious Bayou Vermilion Railroad had also set up shop in town, and Tombstone’s been suffering its own supernatural problems.

And back in Gomorra, a familiar figure rides northward: Jonah Essex, a mysterious huckster associated with the worst events in Gomorra’s recent years. He rides toward Deadwood, Dakota, and if the town knew what was good for them, they would fear his coming.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Sky-Scraper Extremists Promo Cards
description:
3 promo card for the game Sentinels of the of the Multiverse.

Huge

HP: 32

Power - Upheaval: Destroy an Environment Card. If it was a Target, Sky-Scraper deals 1 Target 3 Projectile damage. If not, Sky Scraper deals each Target 2 Sonic Damage and switches to her Normal Character Card.

Normal

HP: 32

Power - Improvise: You may either Play a Link or move a Link from your Trash to your hand. Play the bottom card of your deck.

Tiny

HP: 32

Power - Intravenous Assault: Sky-Scraper deals 1 Target X Irreducible Toxic damage, where X is the number of Links on that Target plus 1. Either Destroy a Link or switch to your Normal Character Card.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Factions of Sol
description:
In Factions of Sol, humanity launched an early space-age in 1927, spearheaded by Mark Megacore, CEO of MegaCore Inc. In the years following, factions grew their power in various regions of the solar system, establishing a tense but stable status quo–until Mark Megacore announced his retirement. Now, the mega-billionaire’s entire fortune is at stake, and everyone in Sol is racing to earn it. You will take command of one of these 8 factions and do your best to bring them to victory. The path you choose is up to you–and could lead to unimaginable riches.

But like all things, accomplishing your mission is easier said than done. To impress Megacore, your ship must travel from planet to planet by spending energy onto the board. But moving into a sector costs energy equal to the amount already in the sector, plus one. Because the energy cost is exponential, the board locks down fast. And your ship can only recharge on one planet: Mercury. So while you may need to travel all the way to Neptune, you also need to make sure you can make it back.

Each player only gets one movement and action per turn. Actions include using Mars to upgrade your ship, obtaining explorers at Venus, picking up secret objectives at Saturn, and more. But many actions cost resources, which can only be mined from asteroids. Each round, a limited amount of asteroids are placed on the board. Getting to them before your competitors is key. When a player can’t take a movement or an action, they must pass. When all players pass, the board is cleared of energy and the race to planets and resources begins again.

At the end of the third round, the game ends and you total up your victory points from machine upgrades, explored exoplanets, secret objectives, and resources. Knowing this, you may want to come up with a plan and stick to it. But just when you think you have your strategy figured out, a number of things might stand in your way– or help you cross the finish line.

Gameplay highights.

-Stellar events: Each round, players can vote between two game-changing options, each of which break the game in a new way. Make sure your favored event is chosen, or you may be left behind when it takes effect.
-Orbiting planets: Throughout the game, the planets will orbit, mimicking the actual movement of planets in our solar system. Players can use them to perform well-planned slingshot maneuvers.
-Faction abilities and machines: Each faction has a special ability and machine that changes the way they interact with the game. When used well, your faction ability and machine can give you a much-needed boost.
mechanics: Chaining, Income, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Voting

name: Gnome Liberation Army
description:
The Gnome Liberation Army (GNA) is an international organization with the sole mission of freeing garden gnomes from captivity for later release into forests far from the human threat. As a member of this organization, your goal is to recover gnomes from ugly patios and place them in the best possible location around the world.

The player who best locate their released gnomes will win the game. In a turn, players must swap, push or rotate tiles to get a pattern of tiles in the patio. Doing so, they free a gnome and get a new objective card which indicates where to locate the gnomes in postcards of beautiful locations of the world.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, King of the Hill, Pattern Building

name: The Outsiders Expansion (fan expansion for Root)
description:
THE OUTSIDERS EXPANSION 
”Step outside the norm…”

See an unseen side of Root with the Outsiders Expansion, a collection of free fanmade content adding six new factions, a vagabond variant, a double-sided map board including varying modes of play and even an all-new deck of cards to the world of Root. In fact, there’s never been so many outrageous and totally unorthodox ways to play this game in one box before!

  — 6 Factions of Varying Complexity!  —
BONE PATROL!  A brash bunch of bullies with only one thing on the brain. Bones! Bones! Bones! Bones! Patrol the board, dig up those bones and get ‘em back to your stash, pronto! Good dog! (Moderate)
WINGED MENACE:  Agents of chaos which infest the board, swarm into clearings with strong numbers and make an absolute mess of the place (yuck) reveling in the screams of a terrorized Woodland. (Moderate)
ORDER of the FOREST:  An ancient sect of altruists, this faction of all factions is only looking to help. Can they help if witnessing their faith brings others to their cause, adding them into their own ranks? (High)
CROAKERS COVEN : Beware the abominous amphibians and their dark, board-warping magic. First, they turn your warriors to stone. Then they collect power from those statues for more insidious spells! (High)
THE TWELVE COLONIES : A two-party system of Libertarian reptiles, these snakes and turtles work together towards instituting a new form of goverment for every creature across all twelve clearings. (Very High)
OLD MAN TINKER: This bearded old beaver, a complete nutjob, bustles about the forest with his powerful trio of robots like a total mad man. Madder yet, he claims to have come from the future! (Very High)

 — A Vagabond Variant!  —
THE GROUCH! A sour and ill-tempered crow who’d just as soon sit at home in his trash can with his precious collection of fish heads as he would tell you to take a hike. Yikes! What a grouch!

 — A NeW Double-Sided Map!  —
DEEP WOODS MAP: Experience the harsh beginnings of your favourite Woodland by taking a trip into the distant past. This frontier themed map features a Settler mechanic that will force you into new, unexplored strategies. It also serves as a modular map for more everyday play!
WASTELANDS MAP: Experience the war-torn future of the Woodland, ravaged by generations of moving and battling and moving and battling. Every warrior and pawn on this board will be thirsty for action and, if you play it right, you’ll have just the Water you need to make it happen! Actions tied to Water Rations intensifies the clash on this barren wasteland of tomorrow.

 — A NeW Shared Deck of Cards!  —
UPSTARTS & RENEGADES DECK : 54 Cards with 22 New Craftable Improvements and 3 Unique Components for use with certain cards!

 (description from the gamebox)
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Action Retrieval, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Race, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 3: Masters of the Universe Faction
description:
Mysterious Duo

The most heroic of the spies joins forces with the most mysterious warrior. Is there anything that such a duo cannot achieve? There is only one way to find out – on the battleground, facing armies of the evilest villains to walk Eternia! It's good that our heroes bring a new weapon strong enough to turn walls into smoking craters.

Expansion pack includes:
1x Additional rules booklet
1x Manual
2x Character minis (Man-E-Faces & Buzz-Off)
1x Terrain accessory
18x Cards

-description from publisher's website
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Stat Check Resolution, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: King of the Valley: The Festival
description:
The Festival is the first expansion to the game King of the Valley. This game introduces several commoners wandering around the valley seeking entertainment, a few new specialists and several interesting festivities (locations) where the players can gain gold, actions or reputation.

Players can pick up commoners for free, during their quest to form Kingdoms and to claim subjects for their goals. As soon as they pick up the commoners, they must send them to one of the five active locations to generate income, reputation or to activate an executioner or a fortune teller.

Still excellent for 2 players, but now there is more fun (flesh and bones) to the game for 3 & 4 players. Due to the mini-games created by the workerplacement system with the commoners, there will be much more dilemmas.

Players have to decide if they send a commoner to drink beer in the Bierstube to gain gold, or contribute to culture by sending them to the theatre. They can also be sent to the Jousting Field, influence the outcome and the King has more knowledge about the income. He can bet on the knight he expects to be the winner of the tournament. Plenty to choose from, but the interaction between the players is strong, since they influence the revenues for each other.

The specialists of the basic game, King of the Valley, have more up their sleeves, since the Priest can also brew and serve beer. The Wizard is able to use his magic to make the show at the theatre truly magnificent. And the Tax Collectors get a chance to compete with each other in the Treasury Room. A place where kings can show in a "majority-game" to get additional taxes.

The game play is extended with 15 minutes on average, for all number of players. 2 players: 45 minutes, 3&4: 60 minutes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Admiral's Order: Naval Tactics in the Age of Sail – All Hands!
description:
Admiral's Order: Naval Tactics in the Age of Sail – All Hands! is a simulation of naval engagements between ships-of-the-line and frigates in the Age of Fighting Sail. The focus of the game lies on the wars between Britain and France and her allies in the years 1775 to 1815. Each player takes on the role of an admiral, commander or captain whose command could include a single ship or a fleet of several vessels. The core game ("All Hands!") has five scenarios to choose from, everything from a small, fast and furious encounter between two frigates to a strategic action involving a total of 16 ships-of–the-line.

A game turn equates to a ½-hour watch on the day of battle. In each turn, players will play cards to execute sailing maneuvers such as tacking, wearing, or changing sail configuration in order to put their ships into position for devastating broadsides or even rakes on the enemy vessels.

In larger engagements, ships are grouped together in squadrons and usually form a "Line of Battle", a formation that provides the commander with the most control over his fleet. Using Admiral's Order cards players signal general commands to their squadrons ranging from "Form a Keel Line" and "Wearing in succession" to "Prepare for Close Action". Keeping the ships in formation and effectively deploying the fleet in the heat of battle while also retaining the initiative is the main challenge for a commander.

Occasionally, ships will engage each other in brutally destructive Close Quarter combat. In such situations, the game "zooms" into the action: Using a set of "Close Action" cards, players can employ grapeshot, grenades, carronades, and sharpshooters to wreak destruction on the opposing vessel's upper deck. Through a clever use of grappling hooks and boarding crews it is possible to overcome the enemy's defenses to take the ship as the ultimate prize.

All scenarios can be played by two players, but most also provide the option to split command between two players per side. Playing time depends on the scenario. While an engagement between two frigates should last no more than 1-2 hours, fighting the Battle of Cape Henry will take four hours or longer.

The game is produced in a small edition and comes in a beautiful box, designed with a picture from Thomas Whitcombe. It has a wooden presentation box with 36 hand-crafted, wooden ship models. Each ship comes with removable masts and ship names burned into each side.
categories: Age of Reason, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Criminalita
description:
This is a Mafia/Werewolf variant with a number of twists that change the game dynamics. Players are dealt a number of cards per round that affect powers, enhance capabilities etc.
Further twist lies in the fact that players "lynched" or "murdered" still take part due to ability to re-enter game. This increases player retention after multiple game sessions.
So far it's published only in Greek but there are plans for a German version.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Mafia, Memory, Party Game, Political, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Memory, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Napoleon's Battles (Third Edition)
description:
A set of miniatures rules to allow players to recreate the great battles of the Age of Napoleon. Infantry, cavalry, and artillery all clash on the tabletop, under the command of historical military personalities with individual ratings.

Scale is set to about 120 men per figure. 1" is 100 yards. Figures are grouped to represent brigades and regiments.

"Napoleon's Battles" (third edition) has been upgraded to a 100 page rules book, 56 page reference book, 12 scenarios and over 180 status cubes and markers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #54 – Enigma Machine
description:
As World War II rages on, the battle continues above and under the seas. When a damaged U-Boat is forced to surface and set to scuttle, Royal Marines boarding parties have to race against time and obstacles to secure the vessel and seize the precious Enigma cipher machine and radio code-books, before the stricken vessel sinks beneath the waves!

This expansion pays tribute to, and features, Royal Marines of the Commando Brigade with raiding missions and incursion skills, reflecting the high-intensity, close-quarters warfighting aboard a sinking ship.

Warfighter: WWII Expansion #54 – Enigma Machine adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a battlepack with new German Hostiles, UK Royal Marines Soldiers, Locations, Missions, Objectives and Skills:

4 x Player Soldiers
3 x Non-Player Soldiers
2 x Squad Soldiers
4 x Weapons and Equipment
1 x Skill
5 x Missions
5 x Objectives
12 x Locations
18 x Hostiles
2 x Events

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mystique & Beast
description:
Mystique is a peerless shapeshifter, able to alter her physical appearance and voice to match another person’s as a perfect mimic. Little is known about her early life, though she has claimed to be over 100 years old. During her life, she has assassinated several significant figures involved in mutant affairs, imitated high-ranking generals and politicians, and clashed with the X-Men on numerous occasions.

Dr. Hank McCoy is a founding member of the X-Men who possesses enhanced agility and genius-level intellect. McCoy has undergone progressive mutations that have increasingly given him a feral, bestial appearance, including fangs, claws, and superhuman senses. Though his visage is animalistic, Beast retains his intelligence and is a global authority on matters of mutant kind, a top-tier geneticist, and a fierce advocate for mutant rights.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Blocks in the East: Chrome Expansion
description:
The Blocks in the East: Chrome Expansion is an expansion for Blocks in the East and includes:


1 card deck, with 12 Special Events cards (400g, double laminated, UV matted, 3d)
31 new units (wooden counters plus stickers)
8 Axis Minor Factories with dedicated flags
18 Production Trackers (1 Yellow, 1 Red and 1 Blue for 6 powers: Soviet Union, Germany, Finland, Romania, Hungary and Ukraine)
20 Black Plastic OIL DRUMS
10 White Plastic Out of Supply Marker


The Second Edition has a new packaging and includes a set of NATO Stickers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Fleet Action Imminent! General Quarters WWI Rules
description:
Fleet Action Imminent! General Quarters WWI Rules is a set of tabletop miniatures rules covering WWI naval combat.

It is based on the General Quarters (Third Edition) rules, tweaked to more appropriately fit the World War One timeframe instead of General Quarters' World War Two emphasis.

Miniatures scale is flexible.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Battle of the Bulge
description: The Ardennes, 1944. Driven back by the Allies since D-Day, Germany launches a surprise offensive on the Western Front. This assault against the unprepared Allied lines is the opening move in one of the largest battles of World War II. This new Campaign Book for Bolt Action allows players to take command of both armies in this desperate battle, fighting it as they believe it should have been fought. New, linked scenarios, rules, troop types and Theatre Selectors provide plenty of options for novice and veteran players alike.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: İnkılâp
description:
İnkılâp (Turkish for 'Reform') is a 2-5 player economic strategy Euro game, based on modern Turkey's industrialization era in the early 20th century, after the end of World War I. Players will manage existing state institutions or private industries. They will benefit from reforms made by the new republican government, and can also pressure the government to make additional reforms to help their economic sector.

In the game, players contribute to the industrialization process of their country by establishing workshops, factories and developing technologies. The economy will transition from raw materials production to that of more developed industrial products. Technology & profits drive further economic development and expansion, and success in a given economic field will grant advantages in the path to victory.
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Godtear: Rangosh, Scourge of the Broken Plains & Red Bandits
description:
"The Scourge of the Broken Plains is known far and wide, tales of violence and brutality preceding him. A tyrant characterised by his brutal lash, Rangosh is a terrifying opponent to face. Leading not by heroic example, his only followers are cold-hearted Red Bandits, their loyalty to coin rather than faith."

This set includes Rangosh, 5 Red Bandits, Rangosh's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles – Gang of Robin
description:
This expansion adds the Gang of Robin to the game.

Season 2 expansion
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Echoes of Death 3
description:
The Echoes of Death 3 custom box includes:

1 x Knight Survivor with scenic base insert
1 x Sniper Survivor with scenic base insert
1 x Monk Survivor with scenic base insert
1 x Dark Paladin Survivor
1 x Hard plastic 30mm insert
4 x Hard plastic 30mm bases
4 x Large matte print of the original concept artwork on heavy card stock
1 x prototype Strain Card rules sheet for adding to your campaign
4 x Strain Milestone cards
4 x Strain Fighting Arts
1 x Vermin Card
1 x Strain Fighting Arts card divider
1 x Strain Milestone card divider

Echoes of Death 3 includes 4 new survivors that embody memories from another world. These memories can be unlocked by reaching unique milestones in the story of your campaign.

This set includes prototypes of Strain System mechanics. Add your Strain Milestone cards to your game, if you reach their unique conditions, your gameplay changes forever. A new fighting art borne from distant dreams is permanently added to your game.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Storytelling

name: Escape from New York
description:
"You go in, find the President, bring him out in less than 24 hours, and you're a free man."

In Escape from New York, an adaptation of the John Carpenter movie of the same name, you play as Snake, Brain, Maggie, or Cabbie and attempt to rescue the president and his precious tape and bring them to safety, while dealing with the gangs of the most dangerous prison in the world – all of Manhattan.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Take That, Tile Placement
publishers: Hobby World, Matagot, Pendragon Game Studio

name: Clank!: Promo Pack 1
description:
The 15 game cards in this Promo Pack were originally released from 2016 through 2020, through a variety of methods.

These cards can be shuffled into your Dungeon Deck during setup. It is not recommended to include more than one copy of each card in your game - if you already have a copy of a given card from its original release, you should play with only one of them in the Dungeon Deck.

Some of the promo cards in this pack were designed to work with specific CLANK! expansions. If you are not playing with the related expansion, it is recommended that you don't include these cards in your Dungeon Deck. (Or, when they appear during the game, ignore them and set them aside.)


Mummy Hunters - This card works well with The Mummy's Curse.
Trailblazer - This card works well with Sunken Treasures, The Mummy's Curse, and Expeditions: Gold and Silk.
Lightning Reflexes - This card works well with Adventuring Party.


Included Cards:


Dire Wolf
Brawn vs. Boots
Enchanted Dice
Magic Spectacles
Snack Table
Siren
Wishing Wall
Friendly Watcher
Mummy Hunters
Wand of Time
Expedition Leader
Trailblazer
Opal Apestone
Door to Before
Lightning Reflexes
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Four Against Mars
description:
Four Against Mars is an atomic-age, science-fiction, pen-and-paper game. Using the Four Against Darkness popular system, you will play solo or coop missions against alien invaders in a small town. Battle Martians, Venusians, Reptilians, Zeta-Reticulans and their monsters. Available characters include scientists, survivalists, combat specialists, criminals, espers, medics, and civilians. You just need pencil, paper, polyhedral dice, and plenty of imagination. This is a complete, stand-alone game. No other books are required.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Hell's Vengeance Character Deck 1
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Depths of Evil!

The Pathfinder Adventure Card Game Hell's Vengeance Character Deck 1 features three new evil characters from the popular Adventure Path: the Hellknight Linxia; the dwarf antipaladin Urgraz; and Lazzero, cleric of Asmodeus! This 109-card accessory for the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game lets you plunge your adventure into darkness. These characters can be played in any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game Base Set or in the Pathfinder Society Adventure Card Guild organized play campaign!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 303 Squadron: Luftwaffe Forces
description:
The Battle of Britain saw the German Luftwaffe use virtually every type of plane in their arsenal.

For the "Big” days, they put almost every available plane into the air. Now you can capture this epic struggle.

This box gives you three each of the Ju 87 ("Stuka”),the Ju 88, the Dornier 17, and the He 111.

You can use them to add more diversity to your scenarios, or add them to build greater challenges. Ideal for making your own scenarios too!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Anarchy
description:
The Anarchy is the name given to the civil war over the succession to the throne of Henry I Beauclerc, King of England and Duke of Normandy, from 1135 to 1154. This war opposed Stephen of Blois and the Empress Matilda, wife of Geoffrey Plantagenet. Numerous castle sieges took place during this period, so this was the perfect opportunity to update all the siege rules of the various games of the Game: Cry Havoc System. The tactical game includes various siege engines including a new, bigger battering ram that is more realistic than the one that was included with Siege.

THE ANARCHY is an extension to Guiscard and Diex Aïe and needs the rules of one of these two games (available as a free download) to be played.

Box Contents:

> (3) full-color tactical maps, giving a possibility of many different terrains;
> (3) sheets of overlays with siege engines, hoarding and scaffolding;
> (2) sheets of tactical counters printed in full color;
> (1) full-color campaign map ;
> (2) sheets of counters for the campaign game printed in full color;
> (1) 36-page rule booklet;
> (1) 36-page booklet including the historical background, a guide to the playing pieces and both tactical and campaign scenarios;
> (8) play sheets for handy reference;
> (1) 10-sided die;

An optional counter tray is available in the Shoppe of Cry Havoc Fan.

The game is available in 2 versions:
> English (Both booklets and play sheets in English)
> French (Both booklets and play sheets in French)
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Battlestations: Second Edition – Advanced Rule Book
description:
You and your friends are crewmates on a starship on amazing voyages where you will fight enemy ships and space monsters, explore strange secrets, make daring rescues and escapes, solve mysteries, and save the galaxy.

This book contains the definitive complete second edition rules, compatible with all original game pieces or with the new second edition boxed set.

Includes:

60 missions including 35 inspired or designed by famous designers

30 species

140+ special abilities

12 modules

120+ pieces of personal equipment

50+ cargo bay items

150+ treasure items

100+ starship layouts
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion – Removable Sticker Set and Map
description: Reset, replay, or resell your copy of Gloomhaven: Jaws of the Lion with this set of high quality removable vinyl stickers and city map board from Cephalofair. Featuring non-transferring adhesive, these stickers can be removed without damaging or tearing components.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: ATS: Axis Legion – Spanish Division Azul on the Eastern Front
description: Using the Advanced Tobruk: Tank Battles in North Africa 1940-43 System, this installment depicts the efforts of the 250th Infantry "Blue" Division, made up of Spaniards sympathetic to the Nazi cause. Specifically, the scenarios here deal with small-unit actions around the area of the Volkhov River in northwest Russia.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: The WitchBorn: Enter Perdition
description:
Enter a Dark Fantasy where Perdition is overrun by demonic WitchBorn returned from the dead. WitchBorn tear their brothers and sisters apart with an insatiable blood lust. You number among a few roaming bands of survivors—maybe all that is left of your kind! Build your own war clan of eight survivors to recover lost cargo in WitchBorn infested plains.

Enter Perdition is a story-driven miniatures skirmish. Use the supplied standup figures, your own miniatures, or expansion sets including Reaper Bones minis. The ever-changing stories are told by free web apps so no GM is needed.

Play with one to six war clans and battle to take your world back.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Multiple Maps, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mittlere Jass
description: Mittlere is an interesting Jass point-trick taking game for three players. What makes this Jass stand out is that players attempt to avoid having the middle score.
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Coast to Coast: Travelers
description:
After planning a memorable vacation for your first client, word of your travel agency has spread far and wide. As a result, many new Travelers are lining up outside your door, each one looking for the trip of a lifetime!

This expansion offers variable scoring cards to replace the fixed bonuses attached to each type of location in the base game. With over 500 different combinations, no two games of Coast to Coast will ever be the same!

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Number, Print & Play, Travel
mechanics: Bingo, End Game Bonuses, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection

name: Marvel United: Civil War
description:
Following a tragic Super Hero operation that resulted in many casualties, the Superhuman Registration Act was ratified, forcing heroes to reveal their secret identities and subject themselves to government oversight. Iron Man agreed with the policy and gathered a team of Pro-Registration heroes around him to enforce it. Captain America, on the other hand, felt heroes needed to be above direct government control. Other Anti-Registration heroes joined him, becoming outlaws and forming the Secret Avengers. Inevitably a violent conflict broke out between the two sides and now the villains sit by the sidelines as once-allied heroes clash against each other in an all-out Civil War!

This expansion brings an entirely new way of playing Marvel United! The Civil War play modes make it a true Player vs Player game, in which two teams of Heroes clash against each other, with no Villain in sight. Featuring a roster of Heroes from both sides of the Registration conflict, this expansion brings two ways for players to fight each other: either the more casual Clash of Heroes, or the more competitive, asymmetrical, and thematic Registration Clash! Which team will you choose?
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: With Hostile Intent
description:
From the designer:

With Hostile Intent is a table-top starship combat game where players using fleets of starships, ranging from a few vessels to large squadrons, battle each other using strategy and tactics.

The game uses an inertia/vector based movement system and is hex-less - meaning ship placement and movement is not constrained to a location on a hex map or other specific playing surface. Movement and orientation are kept track of in three dimensions using a simple and intuitive (math-less) method of dealing with line of sight, along with easily understood indicators on the ship control sheets. Range determination is performed simply by measuring distance with a tape measure and checking a chart, to take into account altitude.

Damage is tracked through a common damage-box method with damageable systems individually represented, along with hit location charts on the ship control sheets. Weapon information is likewise available on the ship control sheets.

Aside from the 3D aspects of the game, here are some features in development which are not commonly found in starship combat games:

Computer Warfare - the ability for ships to infect enemy vessels with computer viruses, jam missile guidance systems, or even steal control of enemy weapons or systems.

Crew Levels - A ship may drop out of a fight if it takes too many losses to its crew.

Damage Control - Ships can make limited battlefield repairs, things like bringing a damaged weapon back online or getting a thruster to work again.

Fires - Ships can catch fire, fires can spread, and crew members can be sacrificed when fires are vented to space.

Fuel and cargo - Makes for a wider range of possible scenarios as well as a seamless tie-in to campaign games.

Adaptable Game System - While the game will provide its own exciting universe, from the ground up it is being designed with the intent that others can adapt it to their favorite universe with relative ease. Having this foundation will also give the game and its setting the ability to grow without the system falling apart or failing in some regard.

WHI will be consistent and predictable with its ability to simulate movement in space, but it will not be a rigid simulation or necessarily be mathmatically accurate. It will be relatively quick and easy to play but will not be simplistic. It will have a lot of detail suitable for a wide range of battle sizes as well as adaptation to other gaming applications (roleplaying, campaigns, etc), but will avoid being tedious or micromanagerial.

The goal is for the game to be fun to play, first and foremost.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Finnish Trilogy 1939-1945: Lapland War 1944-1945 (vol. 3)
description:
(from Mikugames website:)

Officially the Lapland War started with the Finnish naval landing at Tornio (at the Swedish border) October 1st, 1944. This was a bold surprise attack in the Germans back, the former brother in arms. Since September 4th, 1944, Finland was no longer at war with the Red Army, as the so called Continuation War had ended. One tough part of the peace terms was, that all German units were to be handed over to the Soviet Union. Because this was impossible, due to the fact that there was over 210.000 Germans in the northern Finland, the former brothers in arms had to fight each other under the supervision of the Soviet control commission. In the Barents Sea region, in an attempt to crush the German “20.Gebirgs-Armee” once and for all, the Soviet Army launched a large-scale attack called the Petsamo-Kirkenes Operation. The last Germans left the Finnish soil in April, 1945.

The Game
The final volume of the trilogy is an expansion, also loaded with a lot of extra features for the complete trilogy. In other words, to be able to fully use this package, ownership of both the earlier volumes is a requirement. The Lapland War game includes also the German operations "Tanne West" and "Tanne Ost" as well as the "Birke" and "Nordlicht" plans. The Lapland War game is divided in two separate battles, the one between the retreating Germans and Finnish units and the one between the German Mountain Corps and the Red Army north of the polar circle.

Unit Counters
The game will include one countersheet in a total of 266 die-cut unit counters. Ground units are written in standard Nato symbols, while Air and Naval units have correct silhouettes.

The Mapboard
No map is included in the Lapland War expansion.

The Rules
A 8-page coloured rule booklet includes special rules for the Lapland War expansion.

Order of Battle (OOB)
The three full-colour OOBs (Finnish, German and Soviet) include a Main Campaign and two Small Scenarios: (1) Tornio-Kemi '44, and (2) Petsamo-Kirkkenes '44. See further in the Beta News menu. A lot of sources have been used to make them as historically correct as possible. For added feeling, the OOB's are written in their native language (Soviet with Cyrillic) with usually the correct unit abbreviation and then translated into English in parenthesis.!

Production Volume
300 boxed copies and 40 ziplock copies were produced.


Scenarios:

Main Campaign
2 Small Scenarios (#1 Petsamo-Kirkenes '44 and #2 Kemi-Tornio '44 [FIN vs. GER])
2 Special Scenarios (Tanne West and Tanne Ost '44)
Special feature to link Vol. 2 with Vol. 3.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Rally Point Volume 4
description:
Ruins of the Reich - Special Study: May 1945

A collection of late war European theater scenarios featuring German, Russian, American, French, Czech, and Yugoslav forces. Scenario RPT31: Able Was I Ere I Saw Elba is designed to be a three player scenario.

This is a 3rd party expansion for Advanced Squad Leader, it is not stand-alone.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: BattleTech: Wolf's Dragoons
description:
From the back of the book:

"Who Are Those Guys?"

No mercenary regiment is more well known, nor as universally respected. Indeed, other units of the Inner Sphere validate their prowess by surviving an encounter with the Dragoons. Among their ranks is Natasha Kerensky, known as the Black Widow, and perhaps the most romanticized MechWarrior in history.

The strategic and tactical knowledge of Jaime Wolf, the heart and soul of the Dragoons, is beyond reproach.

The unit's supplies and equipment are of the finest quality. Their 'Mechs never want for repair parts. Their ranks are closed and private.

Since appearing in the Inner Sphere in 3005, the Dragoons have been employed in turn by every house of the Successor States. No amount of money, political power, or threats have coerced them to renew a contract. Speculation and conjecture over their motives and origin are commonplace and wildly varied. Governmental intelligence and security networks have expended countless man-hours and C-bills trying to learn their secrets.

Now war consumes the Inner Sphere, and the Dragoons' contract with House Kurita has expired. Where they throw their support could determine the outcome of the war.

This ComStar document is the most accurate, up-to-date assemblage of information ever compiled about the Dragoons. Their history, organization, and unique membership are exposed in great detail. Find out the who, what, where, when and why(s) of the most powerful regiment in the Inner Sphere today.

User comment:

The true identity of Wolf's Dragoons is perhaps the biggest open secret in modern BattleTech, but at the time of writing this sourcebook was a detailed look at one of the biggest mysteries of the BattleTech game. One of the largest sourcebooks produced by FASA at the time of release, this book is packed with background detail on the history of the Dragoons in the Inner Sphere, their tactics and training, and details on a range of their equipment. This included a number of 'Mech designs which were unique to the Dragoon's at this point, such as the Imp and the Annihilator,

This sourcebook hasn't been reprinted to date, and the current licence holder for BattleTech hasn't announced any intention to do a reprint as at Jan 2011, making this something of a collector's item.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Lemming Renascence
description:
