"Lemmings Renascence" is a fun game for the company from 2 to 5 players. Each player is responsible for the resettlement of one swarm of lemmings (with the game on two players - two). Phases of the game are divided into several stages: a common event, reproduction(placing lemming on the territory of your choice),playing and drawing instinct cards(which are usually affect all lemmings on a single territory), the definition of the strongest swarm. The key game mechanics are the avalanche of migration of lemmings that players often can not control (when number of lemmings reach critical max for a territory, they're starting to run all directions randomly). Well, usually, lemmings fall off a cliff, but not all die ...some fly away :)

There are 3 ways to win the game:
1. When instinct deck ends, player who has the biggest and widest swarm wins.
2. When all of your lemmings situated on the game board you win instantly
3. When you have 7 flying lemmings you win instantly.

^_^
mechanics: Unspecified

name: White Beach One: Peleliu
description:
PELELIU - WHITE BEACH ONE

Welcome to PELELIU - White Beach One is an ASL historical module designed by Larry Winslow which depicts part of the landing of the 1st Marine Division on the island of Peleliu in September 1944.

There are 6 pages of special rules and 8 scenarios. Several sheets of new counters are also included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Panzer-Kampfläufer III – "Flamm-Luther / Wotan / Wotan-AR"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Supporting three different builds, the Panzer-Kampfläufer III adds destructive weapons and extra toughness to your Axis armies in Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare. The Flamm-Luther uses massive flamethrowers to incinerate opposing troops and vehicles. Meanwhile, the Wotan fires explosive lasers from afar, punching holes in anything in its path. With the same laser cannons as the Wotan, the Wotan-AR features heavier armor for added protection. Reinforce your army with the Panzer-Kampfäufer III expansion and devastate your enemies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: USMC Heavy Weapons Teams – "The Choppers / Leathernecks"
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the alternate-reality 1940s of Dust Tactics and Dust Warfare, the United States Marine Corps have come to value the ability to move quickly over terrain, and a small team carrying heavy weaponry is sometimes the best option for getting fire support into position. The two squads of the Dust Tactics: USMC Heavy Weapons Teams are veterans of many campaigns, men who remain fearless even when heavily outnumbered.

With their .50 cal machine gun, The Choppers serve primarily as defensive support for allied units. When placed in cover, or inside a building, The Choppers can work wonders!

The Leathernecks weapon team has traded its .50 cal. for a 120mm heavy mortar, one of the most reliable weapons you can find for harsh environments. The mortar never jams, is easy to clean, and can be quickly moved from place to place. It also delivers quite a punch!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Nuclear War: Fold in Space
description:
"FOLD IN SPACE: Allows you to have additional 'special' cards in your hand."

Flying Buffalo, Inc. created this card to be able to have a bonus to sell at conventions and give away as prizes. It is compatible with all games of the Nuclear War series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Damage Report: Backer Crew
description:
These two promotional characters (Maria and Zephyr) were only available to backers of the Damage Report Kickstarter campaign.
Each will have his unique special ability.

Science officer Maria Vasquez. Her special ability allows players to work on 2 repairs for one system at the same time!

Logistics expert Zephyr Brandt. His ability is to do a "Grab/Drop" action as part of any turn option, not just Relay.

- 2 Character Dashboards
- 2 Character cardboard tokens
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Perfect Earth Explorer
description:
Perfect Earth Explorer is a card game in which 2 players (ages 7+) get to introduce a rich variety of animals to their own Rainforest, which they first have to grow from a diversity of habitats.

At the start of each game, every player draws an explorer card with a unique mission. Players take turns, which typically consist of drawing a card and playing a card. Players will have to play Rainforest habitat cards before they can start to introduce animals to their Rainforest.

Certain habitat cards allow only certain animal categories to be introduced, whereas other habitat cards will allow any animal to be placed.

That brings us to the animal cards. We have included 36 animal cards in the game. There are 6 animal categories, each of which feature 6 animal cards. The category is specified with the help of a small icon.

12 of the 36 animals are in fact threatened animal species, indicated by the red circle behind the animal. Each animal card is worth a certain amount of points. Threatened species typically generate more points than common species. But placing an animal in its favorite habitat will also trigger bonus points, etc. To add some charm, we have included short facts on every animal card.

There is one more card type we have to introduce to you. We have included 12 event cards to make the game less predictable and to help balancing of the game. We believe the event cards are also a great way to add some extra emotion to the game.

The game ends when one of the players introduces a 10th species to his or her rainforest, at which time the point total of both players is calculated.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Territory Building
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: World of Twilight: Chronicles of Anyaral
description: A unique fantasy skirmish game set on the continent of Anyaral. Choose your side between the Fubarnii Empire, Devanu packs or the religious zealots of the Delgon. Using an innovative combat system set against a one of a kind backdrop two players fight it out through wits and bluffing to win the day and survive.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Turn Order: Random

name: EndGame
description: EndGame is a small strategy game of cube collecting with an ever-fluctuating point tracker. Choosing the right colors and keeping your cubes in the positive is a fun and light challenge, especially when everything can change at the drop of a card.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Brändi Colorado
description:
The players place number tiles on their own and the shared game
board and try to gain the most points possible as a result. They get points on their own game board for horizontal and vertical rows with tiles in four different colours. Equally, the get points for rows with tiles with four identical numbers and tiles of their own colour.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Chronomancer
description:
"My code name is Chronos, and now you are my Agents. The threads of the time have been torn and mysterious artifacts suddenly appeared in the world. The most dangerous areas of the metropolis are in turmoil. The Chronomancer is destroying the Reality, it is your task to defeat her!"

A team of fighters and experts is looking for OOPART - Out Of Place ARTifacts, and is ready to clash with the worst criminals of the Planet. That group of agents has dared defy the Chronomancer to restore the Reality and Time's order".

Chronomancer is a cooperative board game, for 2-6 players with a 1-3 hrs/game duration, set in metropolitan areas in hot-spot countries all around the world. Each player controls an Agent of the Chrono Team and has to complete the Mission of the game by recovering weapons, valuables and ancient artifacts. Moving through a scenario that simulates a dangerous city, Agents will fight against mercenaries, evil bosses, powerful creatures that came from the past, and sometimes with the Chronomancer too.

Different kinds of action are available for each Agent, such as melee, fire-arm attacks, technological tools and bombing raids.

The main feature of Chronomancer is the modular design of the board that allows creating countless environments and collision situations, offering a new game experience at every time.

Depending on the missions and on the related objective to be achieved, Chronomancer also suggests a multiple level game structure and an evolving plot. All the Agents get involved in the main quest that must be completed for the final Victory. Each Agent can earn honor points during the fulfillment of the mission, but will also have his/her own agenda of personal goals to be reached. If the main quest has been resolved, the Agent with the greater amount of honor points wins over everyone. Moreover, by following the numerical order of the main missions (Mission 1, Mission 2, etc.), you will discover the Chronomacer's plans, living a long adventure game by game. But you can also pick missions at random and play them on their own, with different sets and enemies every time.

A modular board, 10 mission, 8 characters, 4 bosses an several time themed creature and characters from the past grant an always new gaming experience and great longevity.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Revolution & Empire
description:
From the publisher:

Authored by three of the world’s leading rules designers and Napoleonic historians, Revolution & Empire marks an exciting new approach to grand-tactical miniatures gaming in the Age of the French Revolution and Napoleon (1792-1815). Refight the legendary battles of the period–Castiglione, Rivoli, Marengo, Austerlitz, Friedland, Borodino, Salamanca, Ligny, Waterloo–with this meticulously researched rules manual.

In Revolution & Empire players take the role of the great commanders of the period such as Napoleon, Wellington, Blucher, Charles, Suvorov, Masséna, and Lannes. Draw up your preliminary battle-plans in hopes of achieving your own decisive victory and watch as subordinates carry it to fruition. Revolution & Empire reflects the intense friction of war during this era, as billowing smoke and thunderous cannonades obscured the battlefield and increased the intense confusion and pressures of battle, and even the best plans can go awry by the accidents of war. Skillful management of reserves plays a decisive role in determining the outcome, as fresh troops must be carefully preserved to respond to the inevitable crisis of the battle.

At the tactical level, players performing as division and corps commanders are faced with mastering the interaction of combined arms. No other period of history presents such a balance, as each arm’s strengths and weaknesses are dramatically highlighted. Perhaps as no system before, Revolution & Empire demonstrates the evolution of tactics throughout the entire period, from the demise Frederick the Great’s linear style of warfare to the development of a new tactical system for a new age. With Revolution & Empire, players will also foster a new appreciation for the brilliant tactics of generals like Wellington and Davout, men who won astonishing victories against staggering odds.

Revolution & Empire is also a valuable historical reference, as hundreds of generals and units are rated on their performance during the period in order to reflect their historical capabilities. Comprehensive rules reflect the many salient aspects of Napoleonic and Revolutionary combat, including massed skirmishers, grand batteries, fatigue, savage town fighting, bridge assaults, weather, and ammunition supply. Whether re-fighting the famous battles, or recreating the scores of smaller actions from the period, Revolution & Empire elegantly reflects warfare in this fascinating and turbulent period of military history.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Hack: The Dice Game
description:
Synopsis:
“You are a party of stalwart adventures looking for riches and glory albeit you’ve never actually explored a dungeon or fought monsters. You’ve been traveling the roads for days, haggard and worn, you find yourself in a small quite town that seems almost abandoned. You make your way to the local inn and settle down for a nice hot meal when suddenly the door to the inn bursts open and what looks to be the local blacksmith calls out, “Derek’s farm on the outskirts of town has been attacked and the entire family has been slaughtered!” Never one to shy away from danger you walk over to the distraught blacksmith and ask about the family and what happened. He tells you of a giant Red Dragon that has been terrorizing the town; sending out his minions to attack the town folk and raid for supplies. These monsters seem to be coming from a dungeon just outside of town and there’s nothing the town folk can do about it. The blacksmith tells you that he has heard of riches beyond imagination within the dungeon but also monsters of unspeakable evil. After getting the location of the dungeon entrance you return to your party and talk excitedly about the current situation of the town and the Red Dragon. Again, never one to walk away from a good adventure, although this would be considered your first, your party agrees to find this dungeon, destroy the dragon and all its minions forever!
With everyone in agreement you procure a room for the night and settle in with visions of hundreds of screaming villagers chanting your name and praising your heroisms for killing the mighty red dragon and saving the town. Yet it doesn’t take long for a slight chill to run down your spine as your vision turns dark and terrifying with the sight of a massive red dragon and it’s all-consuming, breath of molten fire engulfing the entire party and turning everyone to ash! You quickly shake off the nightmarish vision and tightly close your eyes because tomorrow the adventure of your life begins!”

Dungeon Hack – The Dice Game: is a Solo Dice chucking, Dungeon crawling, Dice Placement, character advancing, card game. You’ll take [4] first-time adventurers’ [Fighter, Cleric, Thief, and Wizard] through a randomly generated dungeon with Rooms, Junction Rooms, Corridor Rooms and Corridors. You’ll have to organize your party with two characters in front and two in back just how you would normally travel in a 10’ wide dungeon corridor. The [4] “Multi-level” Character cards allow YOU to decide your party’s order. This creates Front Line attackers/defenders as well as second line defenders. Your characters will advance to the next level once they’ve accumulated enough experience killing monsters.
You’ll explore dungeon corridors and rooms, fight monsters, try to avoid and disarm traps, discover gold and magical items, and complete quests. Each turn you will roll the dice, evaluate your choices and perform your actions; destroying monsters, resolving traps and traveling deeper and deeper into the depths of the dungeon till you finally reach the ultimate goal – The Giant Red Dragon.
If you can stay alive and escape the dungeon with at least three of your party members, you earn the right to live as heroes; enjoying the spoils of victory.
Lose two or more of your party and you lose the game; becoming the next tragic story told at the local inn of a group of intrepid heroes seeking adventure and glory who never returned from the Red Dragon dungeon.

NOTE: I would like to thank Tony Go for creating his game Deep Space D6 which not only inspired me to create Dungeon Hack but has help in some of the game play mechanics. I have been given the ok from Tony Go to use some of the game mechanics within Dungeon Hack: The Dice Game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Gruff: Shepherd Update Pack
description:
This is an optional update pack which brings the shepherds from the original Gruff game into alignment with the rules changes that were part of Gruff: Clash of the Battle Goats.

These 7 shepherds all gain a Break Point value, making them follow the deck building rules introduced in Gruff: Clash of the the Battle Goats, and update them to make them more balanced. They take of the place of the shepherd cards from the original Gruff but retain their values and individual powers.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Wargame The Roman Invasion, AD 43
description:
A series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures for miniatures battles.

Each book tackles a specific time period of history. This book covers the Roman Invasion of Britain in the First Century. Simple rules are provided written by Andy Callan, noted designer. The rules can be used with other miniatures.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Fallen Land: Gen Con 2017 Promo Cards
description:
Set of 4 promo cards given out at Gen Con 2017.

Mission card - "Tanked"
Mountain card - "Outrider's Trading Post"
Spoils card - "Cosplay Regalia"
Action card - "Convention or Bust"
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ferengi Faction Pack
description: The Independent Faction Pack is a pre-built fleet of four ships for the Independent faction: two Ferengi D'kora class marauders, a Ferengi-comandeered B'rel class bird-of-prey, and a Ferengi shuttlecraft. Included are ships, tokens, dials, bases and 27 cards. Everything needed to fly the ships straight out of the box.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Deadpool & Friends
description:
In Vs System 2PCG, players choose a main character, build a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempt to KO the other player's main character in a game of superhero battles.

Vs System 2PCG: Deadpool & Friends showcases 55 new cards that are Deadpool and Deadpool-related. Like his friends. Including Main Characters, Supporting Characters, Plot Twists, and Locations. Vs System 2PCG: Deadpool & Friends can be combined with any other Vs System 2PCG sets.

This is not a stand-alone game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Frostgrave: The Wizard's Conclave
description:
In this new supplement for Frostgrave, some of the biggest names in gaming turn their creative powers towards the Frozen City, each contributing a scenario and adding their own flair to the game. Featuring scenarios by Alessio Cavatore, Alex Buchel, Andy Chambers, Gav Thorpe, Chris Pramas, Daniel Mersey, Andrea Sfiligoi, and many more, this tome provides a collection of adventures that will pit players against unimaginable foes and challenges, pushing their wizards and warbands to new limits.

Wizards tend to be solitary, keeping to themselves and associating with a select few apprentices, followers, and henchmen. It is rare that they spend time in the company of other spellcasters, and rarer still that they work together. Now, however, something is about to take place that has not occurred since the great days of Felstad -- a gathering of wizards.
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – The Western Desert
description:
One of the most popular and enduring campaigns of World War II is that of the Western Desert, where Allied armies beat back the hard-pressed German and Italian forces under the gruelling African sun. Covering crucial operations such as Crusader, Lightfoot, and Supercharge, and the great battles of Tobruk, El Alamein, and Gazala, this book brings the unforgiving battlefields of North Africa to the tabletop. In-depth information on the forces involved, linked scenarios, and new Theatre Selectors make this an ideal resource for any Bolt Action player with an interest in the Desert War.

-From the publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Five Parsecs from Home: 2nd Edition
description:
Five Parsecs From Home is back, leaner and meaner than ever before!

Create a crew of randomly generated personalities and see if you can make a profit on the fringes of space. Look for patrons, get into gun-battles and build up your squad.

Five Parsecs is aimed specifically at the solo gamer (though you can play with a friend just fine) and lets you build a crew, take them through missions, gain new equipment and level them up.

Watch your men, women and bug-eyed aliens improve, grow (or die horribly) as you play.

Experience random events and unforeseen circumstances.


* * * *


Who is this game for?

If you have wanted a Necromunda style campaign experience to play solo.

If you want to play a miniatures campaign in the style of Traveller, Trigun or Borderlands.

If you want a game that is written with solo gamers in mind.


* * * *


This is a second edition of the original Five parsecs rules. It includes the following changes:


Completely stand-alone game based on an original, ultra-simple system.



Stream-lined to make it far more manageable for a single player.



Solo advice for running enemy forces is included right in the combat rules.



The game has been condensed to focus on the results that matter. That meant pruning some random tables down.



Far fewer exceptions and special rules to keep track of.



We added more optional rules and difficulty settings, allowing the game system to be customized to your liking.



An economic system allowing you to earn and spend cash.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Black Powder: A Clash of Eagles
description:
A Clash Of Eagles is a glorious work of passion from the author Adrian McWalter. 200 pages of full-colour text, maps, and figures plus art from renowned artist Peter Dennis & Johnny Shumate. A must have for any collectors and gamers of the Napoleonic Black Powder period!

Re-create epic moments of the 1812 campaign: the battles of Smolensk and Borodino, the numerous smaller affairs involving Napoleon’s allies and the long, protracted retreat from Russia culminating in the crossing of the Berezina, all of which left the Grand Armée reduced to a shadow of its former self.

Within the pages you will discover how Napoleonic armies fought differently from preceding Black Powder armies; including background detail focusing on the campaign, the numerous nations that took part in the campaign, as well as their armies and statistics on over a hundred different troop types.

You will find information on how to reflect Napoleonic battles using the Black Powder rules as well as a few new rules that are pretty standard amongst wargames communities across the globe.

Running alongside this you will encounter numerous national characteristics for France, Russia, Austria and Prussia to name a few, that will give your gaming experience more of a Napoleonic feel.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Herstoricas Pioneras
description:
Herstoricas Pioneras is game dedicated to historical female figures in Spain. The game contains 60 cards depicting 30 different female pioneers (each card is duplicated). With them, you can play 3 different games: a memory game, a speed game, and a guessing game.
Each card is illustrated by a different female artist from the Autoras de Comic collective.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Memory
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Recognition

name: Emmerlaüs: Alliés
description: Sometimes even magicians need Allies in life. So be it, by magic, now! This expansion (25 cards) of Emmerlaüs : Duel of Mages add powerful character cards that join you to fight your opponents, as well as different basic cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Emmerlaüs: Compagnons
description: Sometimes even magicians need Compagnons in life. So be it, by magic, now! This expansion (25 cards) of Emmerlaüs : Duel of Mages add useful familiar characters cards that join you to fight your opponents, as well as different basic cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle – Pact with Nephandi
description:
The Tremere antitribu are exiles from Kindred society for their treason against their Camarilla brethren and their embrace of forbidden arts. They are skilled in the ways of Blood Sorcery and use their powers to upend the order of the world itself.

Your strategy for this deck is to form an infernal pact with those known as the Nephandi — fallen mages who seek to end creation. With your combined forces and common goals, even elder vampires need to think twice before getting in your way.

This is a deck with 77 library cards and 12 crypt cards, ready for play out of the box or customizable with other Vampire: The Eternal Struggle cards. Each player needs a deck to play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Horror, Political
mechanics: Hand Management, Voting

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Odo Kuro XXL Enemy
description:
Formed from the amassed bones of the unburied dead that litter the battlefields across the land, the Odokuro is a massive skeletal creature that erupts from beneath the blood-soaked soil to attack unwary travelers, feasting on their flesh to feed its unquenchable hunger! Bursting out of the ground, it lashes out with its gigantic arms to claw and smash the Heroes, biting off the heads of its most unlucky victims and feeding on the spray of blood that erupts from their necks. The Odokuro is a terrifying beast to behold and the Heroes will need all of their courage to battle their way close enough to the creature to get past its bony defenses. This monstrous XXL Enemy Pack is themed for the Forest of the Dead OtherWorld (as well as the Forbidden Fortress World) and includes the giant-sized Odokuro miniature, Enemy Record Sheet, 1 Mission, and all of the cards needed to add this frightening fiend to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Feudal Endeavor
description:
Take on the role of the lords and ladies of the noble families in 18th Century Imperial Russia. Compete against your neighbors to earn prestige and the favor of the Empress, Catherine the Great.

Acquire new lands, perform tasks at the bidding of the Empress and contribute tithing towards the construction of the Empresses Palace.

Catherine the Great was the Empress of Russia from 1762 until 1796, the countries longest ruling female leader. She came to power following a coup d’etat that she organised, resulting in Peter III, her husband, being overthrown. Under her reign Russia was revitalized, growing larger and stronger than ever, recognized as one of the great powers of Europe.

Clandestinely bid on new lands as you manage your fiefdom’s economy behind its great walls. After the big reveal see if you’ve built the best engine, won glorious battles, fulfilled the Empress's graceful command and provided the greatest contributions to the Catherine Palace!

Most actions are taken simultaneously, as such the game moves quickly at approximately 10 minutes per player!

Each round consists of 5 phases;

Bidding and Land Management
Income
Auction
Fulfilling the Empress's Bidding or Tithing to the Palace
Restock

The majority of decisions are made during the first phase, pre-determining much of the actions you may take in the following phases, with a dose of subterfuge and press your luck.

The game ends following the Empress's Bidding phase of the round in which any player has filled all open land deed slots within their fiefdom (player board) OR the Land Deeds deck has been fully depleted, leaving no deeds available for the restock phase. At this point you will calculate your total prestige (Victory points) and the player with the most prestige wins.

Prestige (Victory Points) is earned through the placement of a variety of Land Deeds within your fiefdom, Empress's Bidding’s you have fulfilled, palace tithing and remaining resources.

Prestige is lost for land deed slots that have not been filled in your fiefdom at the end of the game. Prestige may also be stolen by players during the game through Special Use Act of War cards.

MECHANISMS:

- Hidden Bidding/Auction
- Resource Management
- Set Collection
- Tableau Building
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Grid Coverage, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Invasión celta
description:
Invasión celta is about the Celtic invasions of ancient Greece. It is a card game with option to play with 4 players, but perfect with 2. It is played in about 25 minutes and its rules try to be simple.

In this game you have two card types, units for reduce the moral of your opponent and events for change the normal rules (inspired in historical events). The first player without moral, loose the game. Celts also need to win before the deck is finished.

—description from the designer

Invasión celta trata sobre las poco conocidas invasiones celtas de la antigua Grecia. Es un juego de cartas con opción a 4 jugadores, pero pefecto para 2. Se juega en unos 25 minutos y sus reglas intentan ser sencillas.

En este juego tienes dos tipos de cartas, unidades para reducir la moral de tu oponente y eventos para cambiar las reglas normales (inspirados en eventos históricos). El primer jugador sin moral, pierde el juego. Los celtas también necesitan ganar antes de que se termine el mazo.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Adeptus Titanicus: Doom of Molech
description:
This Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy expansion introduces the background of the Molech campaign. It also provides a wealth of new rules and missions to use in your games, including new maniples, Legion rules and everything you need to use entire armies of Knights, including rules for seven different Knight Households.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Republia
description:
To lie or not to lie...but the power must be yours!

Republia is a role playing game about politics, where you have to create your own discourse based on words highlighted in law cards and try to pass them to achieve your ideology's objective.

You'll play as a Libertarian, a Monarchist, as the Neo Liberal, Fascist, Communist, Totalitarian, Anarchist or Socialist. Organize Coups, Rallies and much more in this 3 to 8 player game.

To win, you must move the Population Token to your ideology's Point on the board, or gather Corruption points and Political Power to achieve its Objective.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Voting

name: Whoa Nellie College Football Game
description:
Whoa Nellie College Football Game is a new opportunity to recreate a realistic college football game! Based on real statistics, you can pit teams from the past 50 years against each other in both solo and 2-player game play.

Take control of a team and run the ball with the top 4 rushers or throw the ball to the top 6 pass-catchers. Their yards per carry/reception are used, as are their contribution to the offense. Call any of 7 different defenses to stop your opponent. Interceptions, sacks, and strategic use of the "Whoa Nellie" big play card to come out on top!

Whoa Nellie College Football provides appealing team cards, dice, and the components needed to enjoy exploring a recent team vs one from yesteryear or even pit co-national champions against each other to reveal who was truly better!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution

name: Welcome to New Las Vegas: Vegas Goodies Cards
description:
This is a small set of 6 promo cards for the game Welcome to New Las Vegas.

Each casino card has a star instead of the number and is aimed to be played like a joker: the player can enter the number he wants in a casino of his choice. The back of the cards has the usual symbols (one card of each type: Inauguration, Construction, Limo, Show, and 2 Improvements).

The casino side of these cards has a gloss finish.
mechanics: Bingo, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Planet 28: Narrative Skirmish Gaming in a Baroque Future
description:
Planet 28 is a simple set of sci fi skirmish rules for quick narrative games between warbands of warriors, mutants, and outcasts.

Inspired by the amazing work of kitbashers and converters the world over, planet 28 is intended as a pick up and play rule system for quick games when a longer rule system isn't viable.

Rules include:

customer character creation.
basic weapons and custom weapon creation.
a story generator for setting up and adding narrative to your games.
a campaign system that lets you build and develop your warband between games.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: 散樱乱舞《祭扎》
description:
Sakura Arms has received large amounts of praise, and to thank everyone, a special expansion has been introduced for this celebration. Sakura Arms is not a serious high competitive dueling game! This expansion adds 4 new relaxing and interesting rules, but of course also added more interesting cards needed for the new rules! So, just relax and start the carnival celebration!

Contents included:
Cards: 33
Rule book: 1

About this expansion
This is an expansion for the Sakura Arms board game. Must be used with the base game of Sakura Arms to enjoy the content inside.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

散櫻亂武遊戲大受好評，為了感謝大家，特此推出慶典專用擴展《祭紮》。散櫻亂武並不是嚴肅的高對抗性遊戲哦！本擴展中追加了多達4種更為輕松有趣的遊戲規則，當然也壹並加入了特殊規則所需的更多有趣卡牌！那麽，放輕松開始狂歡的慶典吧！

內容物一覽：
卡牌：33張
規則書：1份

註意：關於本擴展
本擴展為《散櫻亂武》桌面遊戲的擴展包。進行遊戲時需要與《散櫻亂武》遊戲本體同時使用。
—description from the back of the box (traditional Chinese)

散樱乱武游戏大受好评，为了感谢大家，特此推出庆典专用扩展《祭扎》。散樱乱武并不是严肃的高对抗性游戏哦！本扩展中追加了多达4种更为轻松有趣的游戏规则，当然也一并加入了特殊规则所需的更多有趣卡牌！那么，放轻松开始狂欢的庆典吧！

内容物一览：
卡牌：33张
规则书：1份

注意：关于本扩展
本扩展为《散樱乱武》桌面游戏的扩展包。进行游戏时需要与《散樱乱武》游戏本体同时使用。

—description from the back of the box (translated to simplified Chinese)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Slingshot Maneuver
description:
The core mechanic of Slingshot Maneuver is based on a real technique used by NASA to save on fuel when sending unmanned spacecraft into the outer solar system. They will use the gravity of planets as a “slingshot” to get a boost in speed and reduce fuel consumption.

Two military forces fight for control of the solar system, and slingshot maneuvers are very important to their strategies. Ships equipped with advanced stealth technology are only visible when they fire their boosters. Therefore, firing your rockets out of site of the enemy, and using slingshot maneuvers to conduct attacks on unsuspecting enemies can be absolutely devastating.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Valley of the Serpent Kings – Children of the Mountain Enemy Pack
description:
The Children of the Mountain are nightmarish creatures spoken of in legend, but few actually encounter them and live to talk about it! They were once human, but were mummified and then re-animated by dark magik! They possess powerful Grave Goods, items that they were entombed with, that now give them terrifying abilities in their life beyond death.

Includes 6 Enemies, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Harvester Drill Team Enemy Pack
description:
Not much is known of the void-spanning Harvesters. Encased in massive powered suits, these drill teams wield an array of heavy machinery and weapons to mine the resources of worlds the explore.

Includes 3 Large Harvester Drill Team Enemies, Cards and Rules.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Word Colony
description:
An exciting common knowledge & word game for smart people.

Choose the correct answer to the general culture questions;
Collect Letter Cards
Build Word Colonies using the Letter Cards
Collect 40, 70 or 100 Points (it depends on the type of game chosen) & Win!


Discover new things about the world around you in an interactive way, with your group of friends or family!

The game can be played by 2 to 4 people, and the playing time varies depending on the type of game chosen (between 30 minutes and 3 hours). Have fun by getting smarter!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Command Cards, Matching, Modular Board, Ownership, Resource to Move, Spelling, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Deception: Undercover Allies – Kickstarter Edition
description:
This Kickstarter exclusive edition comes in a larger-sized box which is big enough to hold all content from the base game, expansion, promos and accessories. It contains:


Deception: Undercover Allies expansion
Deception: Undercover Allies – Kickstarter Pack (1 new Role card, 13 new Clue cards and 10 Means cards)
Moulded plastic insert
All stretch goals


This KS exclusive version of Deception: Undercover Allies brings more Means cards, Clue cards, Scene tiles, Events, and Roles to your investigation. All of these new cards were designed with the goal in mind of bringing more balance to the Murderer’s chosen weapons. The expansion adds many more cards to make the less chosen causes of death (like Illness/Disease) more viable options, adding more uncertainty to the game and creating more interesting end game narratives.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Communication Limits, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Grey Fox Games, IELLO Games, Jolly Thinkers, Lucrum Games, sternenschimmermeer

name: Kingdom Come
description:
Africa is the cradle of civilization and home to the greatest kingdoms in the world. Throughout various periods of history, empires rise and fall. Kingdoms come and go. But only the most victorious are remembered! You are a leader of a mighty African kingdom. Lead your kingdom to supremacy through your prowess in tactical movement, the market, kingdom management, and military might. However, rival kingdoms threaten your reign. To make matters worse, there are monsters invading from the Realm! But if you are mighty enough to defeat a monster, then you can capture it and use it in future battles. History is in the making! Time is short. There are multiple paths to victory but only one kingdom may be victorious. How will your kingdom be remembered?

The goal of Kingdom Come is to have the most victorious kingdom in Africa! You will lead your kingdom to victory by set collection and accumulating victory points over the course of 3 periods. During each period, you will position your military across Africa, go to the market to buy upgrades, manage your kingdom, and engage in epic battles against monsters and other players' kingdoms. The player with the most victory points at the end of all periods wins the game!

Kingdom Come is a celebration of the history, diversity, and cultures of Africa. It is driven by ubuntu philosophy and features a strong emphasis on empathic user-centered design. Thus, in Kingdom Come, you will feel welcomed, victorious, and motivated to win to the very end.

—description from the designer
categories: Fantasy, Mythology, Negotiation, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction: Sealed Bid, Betting and Bluffing, Catch the Leader, Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Force Commitment, Hand Management, Income, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Bagged & Boarded
description:
In Bagged & Boarded, you're a kid who loves comics. You can't merely focus on collecting your favorite issues, though. You also need to make enough money to afford them!

By savvy investment of your time, allowance, and chores money, you'll amass an impressive collection in no time! But wait—then what? Do you sell your expensive issues to buy others? Or do you put them on display, banking points for the end of the game while also increasing that series's value for everyone else?

Each morning, you'll plan your day, then resolve everyone's plans in order. Will you search online? Preorder from the comic store or dig through the bargain bin? Wait in line at the convention for autographs and swag? Or, maybe you'll spend your time at home doing chores, bagging and boarding old issues, and putting them on display.

Collecting and displaying a large series is worth a lot, but keep an eye on your clever friends. They might be hanging on to that issue you're looking for, eagerly waiting for you to drive up its value!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Economic
mechanics: Market, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Turn Order: Auction, Worker Placement

name: BattleTech: MapPack – Deserts
description: Created using the same brilliant aesthetics of the new box sets and Grasslands and Battle of Tukayyid mapsets, these maps include a variety of terrain elements that deliver interesting battlefields for players of every skill level. Each map is 17” x 22”, paper, and may be placed side-on or edge-on with other maps for expanded battlefields.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Challenge Pack #1 – Bound by Darkness
description:
Holy preachers are renowned for their devotion and faith, leading the charge to keep evil at bay. When one of these men of the cloth is corrupted by the ruinous powers, his fall from grace plummets to depths far deeper and more twisted than could be imagined. Heretic Preachers fight with a fanatical zeal, wielding Dark Sermons to unleash hellfire and damnation on any that cross their hellbound path to becoming one with the Darkness.
Challenge Pack #1 - Bound by Darkness is themed for facing off against a corrupted Heretic Preacher and his legions of demonic and beastly minions that all use the Bound by Darkness Enemy Trait card. Casting powerful Dark Sermons at the Heroes, and wielding a devastating Hellfire Shotgun, the Heretic Preacher and his hordes will put your Heroes to the test!

A Challenge Pack is a new themed set of cards with a terrifying new Enemy and a nightmarish new Mission designed to give the Heroes an extra challenge. These cards are all used together for the included Mission; but can also be added to your card decks to increase the challenge across your normal games of Shadows of Brimstone as well. Many of these new cards are marked with a Challenge Icon, to be easily identified as extra dangerous.

Challenge Packs reward players for having a robust collection of Enemies and Expansions; and contain several Threat cards that include a mix of various Enemies from across the game. Some of these Threat cards even add new bonus ability to the Enemies on the card for thematic ways that they can work together to crush the Heroes.

The following Expansions are highly recommended to get the most out of this Challenge Pack (though these sets are not required to use this Supplement, most of the Threat cards included in this Challenge Pack do use various Enemies from these other Expansions):


Swamps of Death core set
Hellfire Succubi mission pack
Hell Vermin enemy pack
Scourge Rats and Rats Nest enemy pack
Forest of the Dead OtherWorld deluxe expansion


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #87 – Gurkhas
description:
Serving as part of the British Army for nearly 200 years, the Gurkhas have fought in almost every major conflict and theatre of war, including in World War II where they were comprised of 40 battalions. These fearsome Nepalese fighters have deservedly earned a near-legendary reputation of being some of the fiercest and bravest warriors in battle: esteemed by their allies and dreaded by their enemies, and respected by all alike. They are easily recognized by their signature weapon - the long, curved knife known as the kukri - and their motto is "Better to die than to be a coward."

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, although the Gurkhas historically fought in every theatre of war and can be played with any Warfighter WWII setting. This set offers:

5 Gurkha Player Soldiers
4 Gurkha Non-Player Soldiers
5 Gurkha Squad Soldiers
1 Gurkha Squad Light Vehicle
3 Specialist Skills
1 Skill
2 National Skills
5 Weapons
28 Gurkha Hostiles
2 Events

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rome:  Rising Empires
description:
"Rome: Rising Empires" This is a Roman themed board game with fun combat and an extensive variety of units to choose from, both on land and sea. There are Coins, Forts, Roads, Unit Tokens, Empire Boards, Trackers, Info Boards, Empire Markers, Generals, Commanders, Engineers, Inventions, Battle Boards and a huge Map with 45 sea zones and 127 land territories for you to wage war on.

The scenario in the game is set before Rome grew into the dominant force (circa 219 BC) and it will be up to you as a Player, to become the largest and most powerful empire in the Mediterranean. The rising empires of Rome, Carthage, Ptolemaic, Seleucid, Antigonid and Germania will go to war and determine who will conquer or fall.

The game can be found on "combatminiatures.org"

Enjoy!
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Nautical, Negotiation, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Advantage Token, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Delayed Purchase, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Income, Investment, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ownership, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Darkridge Reunion
description:
It’s Jocks vs. Geeks vs. Rebels in this live action game that’s part murder mystery, part survival game and entirely devious.

Darkridge Reunion is a dynamic whodunnit party game played over three rounds. Each player is given a role (jock, geek, or rebel) and are attending a high school reunion.

Players will use social deduction and clues to find who is on which team but more importantly who is the slasher.

Each player is given a secret mission and an artifact.
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Role Playing

name: Soul of Ankiril
description:
Soul of Ankiril is a Strategic Card Game where players will compete using thematic decks of 25 cards, one of each element or Temen (Fire, Air, Water, Earth, Wood and Metal), with the aim of deactivating the Emanation Portals on the opponent’s field. To do this, players will move their creatures on a board made up of hexagons, then it will be up to them to make the most of the map to achieve victory.

Each player will be able to construct their deck and choose a specific Board that represents their half of the battlefield, once the two players connects their halves the game can start! Both players will then place their Emanation portals and Leaders.

During their turn, players will be be able to:

- Play a card from their hand (Creature or Spell) for 1 Energy Point.
- Move a creature on the board.
- Attack or Activate a Special Ability.
- Draw a Card for 1 Energy Point.

Most of the Creatures will attack and move by the adjacent hexagon but this range can be increased thanks to spells and Special Ability like Throw or Overfly.

First Player that deactivates the 3 Emanation Portals of the opponent wins the game!

Each Creature is unique so during the Deck Construction phase before a match it will be crucial to choose the best combination of Creatures and Spells even of different Temen.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: From The Shadows
description:
In From the Shadows, a Villain has sent their minions out unto the land to corrupt all living souls leaving the townsfolk of Forest Vale with the choice to either join or die. Players choose one of four heroes to venture out and kill these monsters, bringing back the trophies of their victories as proof for their bounties. Each player takes a turn performing their chosen action to ultimately gain the most victory points (VP). VP can be acquired by gaining Treasure, using Opportunities, and mainly by killing monsters. There are four classic villains that players may choose to go up against: Master Vampire, Alpha Werewolf, Zombie Horde, and Pharoah Mummy. Each villain’s deck is comprised of their minions to help drive the story.

From the Shadows is a turn based, light deck builder. Heroes begin the game with a deck of 15 cards, tailored to their abilities. During the game players can loot more cards from monsters they vanquish, building their deck and making their hero stronger. The final Villain is more difficult than his minions and basic monsters. Once a player kills the Villain the game is over and points are tallied.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Wonky Wheels
description:
Wonky Wheels is a racing game (our interpretation of Mario Kart), where players race around the track collecting Power-Ups, with which to disrupt their opponents, modify their vehicle and gain advantages.

The track is a modular design, which allows players to create a range of circuits and incorporates octagon spaces which enable players to steer their vehicles.

Each player has an identical deck of Movement Cards and choose 1 of the 3 from their hand to move their vehicle each turn, drawing a 3rd card from their deck at the end of their turn. In addition, players manage the condition of the vehicles brakes, mechanics and tires using their Player Mat.

The game has many additional features and actions a player can take during their turn, such as driving over other vehicles, using free boosts and springs to advance. The Pits are an area they can repair damage to their vehicle and Super Power-Ups can be played 'out of turn'. The winner is the player who completes the designated number of laps the fastest.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Asgardians Affiliation Pack
description:
The forces of Asgard unite in this squad pack for Marvel: Crisis Protocol!
Bringing together Thor, Valkyrie, Hela, and Loki, this pack is the perfect way for your players to quickly begin collecting the elite warriors of Asgard.

In addition to highly detailed miniatures, this pack also includes a stat cards for each of these characters updated with new graphic design as well as copies of the all the cards and tokens found in the CP11 - Thor & Valkyrie and CP12 - Loki & Hela packs, ensuring your players have everything they need to field these characters.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kampf gegen das Spiessertum: Family Edition
description:
"A party game for horrible German families"

Play begins with a judge, known as the "Round Boss", choosing a red fill-in-the-blank card from the top of the deck and showing it to all players. Each player holds a hand of eight white answer cards at the beginning of each round, and passes a card (sometimes more) to the round boss, face-down, representing their answer to the question on the card. The round boss determines which answer card(s) are funniest in the context of the fill-in-the-blank card. The player who submitted the chosen card(s) is given the question card to represent a point, and then the player to the left of the Round Boss becomes the new Boss for the next round. Play continues until the players agree to stop, or until they are thrown out of the pub, at which point the player with the most Points is the winner.

Kampf gegen das Spießertum – Family Edition is the family friendly version of Kampf gegen das Spiessertum. It contains 600 new cards. All the answer cards are illustrated.
mechanics: Storytelling

name: 1793: Patriots & Traitors
description:
It's the year 1792. For three years now the banner of revolution has been fluttering over France. Sure, the old structure has fallen but still the people clamor for change. There is a shortage of bread and on the borders the Austrians and Prussians are ready to invade. The press has become mighty popular, publicly denouncing traitors and calling the populace to arms. There are some that believe that the Revolution has gone far enough, but for others it has yet to begin. As a radical, a moderate or conservative, you’re going to attempt to lead the revolution…or at least make sure you’re alive when it’s over. If you fail, Mme. guillotine awaits…and she is becoming thirsty!

Patriots & Traitors recreates the chaos that tore up France from the fall of the monarchy in August 1792 until July 1794 (Thermidor Year II). Each of the players belong to a different political faction, each with their own agenda. Although they are rivals, they will have to work together to prevent the armies of Austria, Prussia and Sardinia-Piedmont from reaching Paris, thereby crushing the Revolution and ending the game prematurely!

With the help of the multi-functional action cards, the players will be able to influence a number of areas in Paris (National Convention, Palais-Egalité, the Paris streets…) or the provinces. Each controlled area offers certain benefits…or will help them to perform a Coup d’Etat or Civil War. Activated leader cards (Robespierre, Marat, Dumouriez) belonging to their faction will help them in achieving their goals IF they are not arrested or assassinated!

1793:Patriots & Traitors is fresh, assymetrical, high in replayability and very, very thematic.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Napoleonic, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Ownership, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Voting, Worker Placement

name: [kosmopoli:t] Deuxième service
description:
The most cosmopolitan restaurant in the world is still (no longer) open with now 100 languages ​​and dialects and 3 new menus:

- Little chefs: Kids want to cook? A hat on each head!
This new mode makes it possible to entrust the role of Cook to children from 7 years old.

- Great chefs: More elaborate dishes? It now takes several cooks to prepare them... In this mode, we add difficulty to the Cooks to find the ingredient AND the language of the dish and we force them to do the washing up and the restocking in addition!

- Drink included: Which drink for which dish? All the roles are heckled by a simple drink, the level gets even more complicated. Some dishes are associated with a drink, the Cooks will have to keep an eye out to send a complete order to the Waitress.

You will also discover new dialects, there are now a hundred in all.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: T.D.O.: Titan Defense Organisation
description:
Humanity is at its end.

Threatened by extraterrestrial Titans, it faces unpleasant but certain extinction. There is only one last (albeit tiny) hope: the TDO! In the battle against the first Titan Gaia, the Titans Defense Organisation went all out back then, and with difficulty was able to achieve a victory. Now that Titans are appearing again, most of the heroes from back then are dead, retired, or simply have better things to do than risk their lives once again. So now it’s up to you to determine the fate of humanity and defend the Earth against Titans like the fearsome lava snail Worldshaper.

TDO (short for Titan Defense Organisation) is a fast-paced, cooperative boss battler for 2-5 players. There are nine unique, likeable heroines and heroes to choose from, which can be roughly divided into the three categories of damage, defense and support. Their goal is to save the Earth from destruction by extraterrestrial Titans. Each of the four Titans has its own agenda and requires a specific strategy to be overcome.

Each round, one heroine or hero is the leader, and the remaining heroines and heroes are sidekicks. The leader rolls three dice, and each sidekick rolls one die. This allows everyone to be part of the action at all times and prevents downtime. The dice rolled then trigger the specific actions of the heroines and heroes such as movement, attack or healing. A Titan card is then drawn, which represents the Titan's actions and sinister plans, and brings new challenges for the TDO's heroines and heroes. For example, the Titan can inflict damage directly, or assert its influence on the world through markers. This sequence continues until one side wins the game.

The heroines and heroes win the game when they have destroyed the Titan. The Titan wins when it has either destroyed all three TDO bases, or when a total of three heroines and heroes have been defeated.

TDO lives from the colorful combination of Titans like the lava snail Worldshaper and the diverse heroines and heroes like the chameleon panda duo Barry & Nala, the invisible DJ Kamo Flash, or the awakened demolition robot RAM32. This mix makes each game unique and good teamwork is mandatory to prevail against the super-powerful Titans. The accessible rules make it easy to get started in the game and the heroines and heroes can be individually specialized by upgrades.

TDO is a very varied, entertaining game with witty heroines and heroes who cunningly combine their actions to save the Earth from extinction by the Titans.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Market, Point to Point Movement, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Space Hoppers: Singko Academy
description:
Sinkgo Academy is a turn-based, competitive card game that throws you into a non-stop adventure around the universe!

Welcome to Singko Academy, the coolest school in the universe. You and your crew go on space hops around the galaxy to collect souvenirs. You’ll meet new people, discover new foods, hit the beach, and maybe even fend off a few pirate attacks.

Players are dealt 1 Souvenir to start, 4 Crew Members whose skills determine your success in Encounters, and two Monkey Wrenches which bring strategy and chaos.

Encounter Cards drive the gameplay and determine if you collect a souvenir. Players pick Encounters in turn and use their Monkey Wrenches to thwart other players, steal their Crew and Souvenirs and occasionally reverse the direction of play.

The first player to collect five souvenirs wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Magic: The Gathering – March of the Machine
description:
March of the Machine is an expansion for Magic: The Gathering that focuses on New Phyrexia's invasion of the multiverse. It introduces Battles to the game, a brand new card type—the first new card type since Planeswalkers were introduced in Lorwyn. Additionally, one card per pack is pulled from a bonus sheet of Multiverse Legends consisting of reprinted legendary creatures from all across the different planes, with new art showing them fighting in the war.

Five Commander decks were released alongside the main set as tie-ins, featuring the return of the popular Planechase format. Each deck contains 10 Plane cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Cruxy
description:
Meet Cruxy the Penguin and his polar friends! Their favorite game is to carve words on the ice floes. Come and join them!

In this game you will be filling the crossword grid with made-up words of the indicated length and required letters in them. The more set conditions you fulfill, the sooner you win! To make the game even more fun and exciting, use the powers of Cruxy and other animals ― their special effects may influence other players and bring you closer to success at the same time.

Four different game modes, fifty double-sided boards of increasing complexity and a unique combination of literacy and strategy make Cruxy a new word in the world of board games!

How to play?

The game is played by turns so players have some time to think over their options and come up with the word of the needed length, with the required letters, or a symbol occupied by the word. All the objections are marked on the playing board. Remember that you can only add a word to the grid using one or more letters already placed in the grid. Also the words to fill in should meet the criteria: a) a word cannot be used twice, b) proper nouns are prohibited, etc. Check the full list in the rules!

Once a player wrote down a word and crossed the things they used out from their box, it's the player's from their left turn.

To make the game even more fun, reach Cruxy's friends, different animals of the South Pole for the special effects they create! These effects may boost your own success or influence other players.
For example, there is a Seagul that allows a player to use shorter or longer words for a moment, or a Kraken that pulls out an extra letter for your opponents, and many other creatures with their own power.

The player who fulfilled all the tasks but any 2 of any kind becomes the winner.


Add new words to the grid and fulfil different conditions.
Apply animals’ effects at the right moment to influence the game play.
Be the first to cross out the most conditions in your player area and win the game!


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Pillars of Heracles
description:
Join us on an epic journey through the world of Archaic Period Greece, where heroes are born, city-states clash in bitter rivalries, and the gods themselves shape the destiny of mortals. Prepare to immerse yourself in a strategic and immersive board game experience.

In this game, you will embark on a quest to build and shape your own city-state, compete against formidable adversaries, and navigate the intricacies of ancient Greek society.

Against its rich historical and mythological backdrop, the game offers a unique blend of area control, rondel mechanics, and deckbuilding, tableau building, set collection and resource management. As you expand your city-state and manage your resources, you'll need to strategize your moves on the rondel, carefully planning your actions. Building and managing your deck allows you to customize your strategy and prepare for exciting challenges.

Will you channel the wisdom of the mighty Olympian gods to lead your city-state to greatness? Or will you rely on cunning tactics and military might to conquer your rivals?

As you explore the game's intricately designed world, you will encounter iconic figures from Greek history and mythology, engage in trade and diplomacy, and face the challenges and rewards of city-building. Every decision you make will shape the fate of your city-state and determine your path to victory.

Are you ready to step into the world of legends and forge your own destiny? Join us and become part of the legacy of the ancient Greeks.

The cultural and historical aspects of the game have been closely checked by Jan Heinemann, a historian specializing in Archaic and Classical Greece.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rondel, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kneipenquiz: Nagelneue Fragen
description: Finally supplies for all pub quiz fans! The 250 brand new questions again require general knowledge and have something for everyone: We don't just look at the past, new and latest events, inventions and developments are also discussed here. The supplementary set can be used as a supplementary set of questions and, as always, can be combined with Kneipenquiz – Das Original, Kneipenquiz – Fußball-Spezial, as well as with all other supplementary sets. Alternatively, it can also be played separately, which makes it a good compact travel version.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Karak II: Victorius and Darius – Promo Characters
description:
Karak 2 promo pack.

The package contains two new heros (each with individual abilities):

Victorius – The Swordsman
Darius – The Scout


Victorius – The Swordsman
In the depths beneath Karak Castle, VICTORIUS learned just how selfish his motivation was to fight for the Dragon Ruby. In his quest to win the affections of a beautiful princess, he had almost forgotten his main mission in this world–to protect those who cannot defend themselves. So now he roams the villages around the castle, trying to prepare their inhabitants for the upcoming battle. Taste the swords, raise the shields, draw the bows! Each and every one of you is a hero at heart, and what we need today are heroic deeds! Let us stand together against the enemies and drive them back into the darkness!

Darius – The Scout
DARIUS is a young warrior, belonging to a fierce tribe from a distant jungle. He has journeyed to the depths of Karak Castle to take the tribe‘s coming-of-age test, which will prove if he is worthy to be called a warrior. Only if he succeeds in this test and proves that he can face tough challenges will he be able to stand
proudly alongside the most revered warriors.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Dungeon Pages: Overland Adventures
description:
Dungeon Pages: Overland Adventures takes the adventure above ground, introducing 12 more sheets for 2024, 12 more heroes combinable with original Dungeon Pages, and new additions like traveling merchants, side quests, and new tile types.

Get out of the dungeon and get some fresh air! In Year 2 of Dungeon Pages you'll find new heroes, items, monsters, relics, and weapons. Also an all new Merchant, Side Quests as well as some seriously tricky boss fights!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Market Mayhem: The Action Packed Stock Trading Game
description:
Introducing Market Mayhem – The Action Packed Stock Trading Board Game that mixes finance basics with fun gameplay. Strategy, luck, and savvy trading skills collide in this epic quest for stock market domination! With game rounds lasting 90 minutes, diverse investment strategies, thrilling Market Mover Spaces and Market Mayhem Cards that shift stock prices, it's a race to the top!

Our dynamic gameplay also comes alive with its unique Market Mayhem Investor Interaction Spaces! These spaces elevate the game, adding layers of unpredictability and strategic decision-making. From System Hack disruptions to Tax Day fees and Short Squeeze manipulations, each space brings a unique challenge.

Market Mayhem is a game where finance meets fun! Immerse yourself in the thrill of strategic investments, calculated risks, and unpredictable market moves.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Math, Memory, Number
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Income, Investment, Lose a Turn, Market, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Acts: Letters from Rome
description:
The Acts returns with the all new Letters from Rome expansion. Compatible with both the first edition and deluxe edition copies of the base game, Letters from Rome offers new strategies for adding believers as you can now travel all the way to Italia on your mission. Along with a sideboard depicting Italia as a seventh accessible region, there are epistles that can be delivered, tithes generated by churches, and more to take into account as you spread the word.

Letters from Rome remains a tight, worker placement game with multiple paths to victory. In addition to the actions from the base game, players can now gain coins as tithes from their churches, and collect epistles for both immediate rewards and set collection end game bonuses. Coins can be used to book passage to Rome, enlarge your churches, and to feed and care for the crowds while preaching. Beware, hording coins can lead to corruption, costing you believers over time.

Take on the added challenges as you spread from Judea throughout the Roman Empire to share the gospel message. Although true to the Bible, no Biblical knowledge is required to play and enjoy.

-description from designer
mechanics: Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Neko Syndicate
description:
The sushi production and distribution in the city of Mininogata is controlled by several feline clans. Leading those clans is the Kumichō, supreme leader of the syndicate, but he is now an old cat and soon will have to decide who will succeed him.

In Neko Syndicate you will lead one of those clans and you will prove the Kumichō who deserves to inherit his position, building an efficient chain of command and fulfilling the great amount of sushi demanded by the population. In addition, you will be rewarded if you are the fastest to achieve the missions by the Kumichō.

During the game you will build and walk down a card’s pyramidal structure which represents both a city district under your control and your chain of command. This pyramidal structure will be used as a board and action tree which will allow you to cook sushi and transport it into different delivery zones, trying to achieve the missions by the supreme leader. You will have 15 turns to obtain as many prestige points as possible to please the supreme leader Kumichō and, therefore, win the game.

Neko Syndicate is a "Thinky-filler" by Dani García, featuring an innovative tableau building mechanic where cards are both the actions and the goals to achieve: fast set-up, simultaneous play, low interaction and brain burner in a 30 minutes easy to play hard to master beautiful game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Seguro o Ambicioso
description:
This is a dice game that comes with 6 dice in a cup that can be used to throw the dice.

At the beginning of your turn you must throw all dice. Then you have to set aside at least one winning combination. If you have 350 points or more you can retire, if not you must continue with the rest of the dice. If after a throw you are unable to set aside at least one die you lose the points of the round.

There are only 10 winning combinations that let you win between 50 and 1000 points.

When a player reaches 5000 points the game will end after everyone has the same amounts of rounds.

This is a mix of several South America games like “El Ambicioso”, “Generala”, “El Juego de los Diez Mil" and “Farkle”
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Infinity: Operation Wildfire Battle Pack
description:
Operation: Wildfire Battle Pack is a box containing 14 miniatures belonging to two different armies, an introductory ruleset, cardboard scenery, dice... everything you need to start collecting Infinity or just to complete your collection!

In addition, Operation: Wildfire is the way to introduce yourself to the Infinity ruleset, as it includes a full color 84-page rulebook(English/Spanish) with 5 tutorial missions to learn to play, making it easy to understand the Infinity core mechanics.

In this booklet you will also find the background and troop profiles ofall the troops in the Battle Pack. There is also a brief guide to the Infinity universe and advice on exploring it in more depth.

Operation: Wildfire contains 2 totally new Starter Packs of two different factions: O-12, which is a new addition to the Infinity universe, and the Shasvastii from the Combined Army. It also includes2 exclusive miniatures, one per faction, only available in this Battle Pack. A total of 14 highly detailed metal miniatures!

And to fulfill the game experience, the Battle Pack includes a new ready-to-play double-sided 3mm printed cardboard scenery (4 Buildings, 4 Holoads, 2 Public Consoles and 9 Blast Barriers), a Game Mat, 6 twenty-sided dices (3 for O-12 and 3 for the Shasvastii), and also cardboard Markers, Templates and a measurement ruler.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Meltscape
description:
A Head2Head boardgame.
In a century hence, as the polar ice caps melt, and great civilizations falter, local clans clash as they vie for what precious little dry land remains above the flooded MELTSCAPE. Your clan must build floating bridges through a sunken city to seize the opposing clans land before they can seize yours. To do so, Chieftain must mind-meld with a SNAIRG-Rattler, and your clan must dispose of as many opposing clansmen as possible.

Clans start set up along two strips of land, on either side of the game board. Using Floating Bridge Hexes, both clans build floating bridges to the Gravity Wave Corporation building so the Chieftains can mind-meld with a prototype weapon, the Rattler, which gives the Chieftains the power to win. When she is ready, Chieftain will then cross over the flooded city to seize the opposing clan's land, and win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Death Ride Kursk: 3rd Panzer
description:
This game is an Expansion for Death Ride Kursk - Gross Deutschland. Ownership of DRK-GD is required in order to play this game. This will be the second in the series of games that simulate the battle to eliminate the Kursk Salient. This game is an expansion game and players must own DRK-GD in order to play this game. The 3rd Panzer Division held the left flank of XLVIII Panzer Korps and plays a major role in the crossing of the Pena River and keeping the pressure off the Gross Deutschland Divisions left flank so they can push north to Oboyan and Kursk. This game expands the order of battle by 1 Panzer and 1 Infantry Division, 1 Tank Corps, and a Rifle Division. Most of the maps from DRK-GD are reused in this game and an additional (4) 11" x 17" map sections are added along with about 500 additional unit counters and markers.

Death Ride Kursk - 3rd Panzer is GSI's second offering on the Eastern Front. The game focuses on tactical level combat and maneuver during the German attack at Kursk in July 1943.

The game features the 3rd Panzer Division and some supporting XLVIII Panzer Corps units at mostly Platoon and some Company/Battery level and the Red Army (10th Tank Corps, and other rifle and supporting elements) at Company/Battery level. The combat system utilizes combat multipliers that players must use correctly to have the best effect. Each hex is 330 meters. Turns are 2 hours long during the day and 4 hours at night. The rules are modeled around the seven battlefield operating systems which make them easily understood and easy to learn. Unlike other games at this level the rules are not massive. This system features extensive use of obstacles (mines, wire, improved positions, and fortifications), a patrol rule, overwatch fire, air and artillery support, and reserve movement. These obstacles help channel the attack and force the Germans into kill sacks and forcing them to push through the heavy resistance to take ground. Overwatch is a type of fire that allows the player to move a short distance and then setup to fire suppressive fire at enemy units that might otherwise use opportunity fire. Reserve movement will allow a player to respond to enemy movement and move more units into a hex to strengthen it before an assault. Units are modeled to represent the 2 major types of weapons that most units have. Secondary (usually small arms) and a primary (main gun, machine guns, etc...). These weapons may fire at different targets if they want. They also effect targets differently. Suppression is also handled uniquely in this game. Units that are suppressed get a defense bonus since they take better advantage of the terrain in the hex, while at the same time they have their other factors reduced. Units are also modeled as needing transports and get the benefits of movement from them with the vulnerability that goes with it. The battle follows the divisions actions during the 10 days of the battle. The division operated on the left flank of the Gross Deutschland Division. The additional armor in this game makes play extremely fun and intense and they include Panzer Regiment 6 (90 MkIII and IV tanks) and 10th Tank Corps 3 Tank Brigades (120 T34 and 60 T70 tanks). 3rd Panzer has its 2 Infantry Regiments and supporting elements. The game will also force players to account for Command and Control and Supply. Maintenance and repair are critical to both sides as this determines most of the replacements that arrive every morning. Troop replacements are generated by returning casualties to the battle. Lots of these casualties are minor in nature and both sides worked hard to get these wounded back to the front quickly. Air-Ground Attack can have a significant effect on the battle and both sides have a capability in the air to affect the battle. The Germans were eventually bled white and forced to suspend Citadel.
